Another tip: Go at an odd hour to avoid the lines, this place isnt too much of a secret anymore. 

Enjoy!

Secret Pizza lives up to its name. It has no sign and I have no idea how I found myself to this restaurant.

Each slice is about $5 and the slices are decently large. I thought this was pretty expensive. The pizza is just normal pizza to me as nothing was really special about its construction or toppings. I thought that the slices were very flimsy and it would have been better to eat it with a knife and fork.

There are not many seats for this place so prepare to stand and eat (there is nowhere outside either).

As an Italian from NY, this place is really a 2.5 for the pizza, but it gets an extra half-star for two reasons:

1. It's probably the best pizza in the area, and certainly convenient if you're at the Cosmopolitan.

2. They have oregano, red pepper, and the other condiments usually only found in pizza places with true NY roots. 

If you're from NY, this pizza will be substandard.   Decent, yes.  Cheap?  For Vegas, sure.   But that being said, it's very good for what it is.  A tad oily, as others have mentioned, but not a show stopper.  

The line was long when I went there; fortunately, there were cool people in line with me to chat with.    Took around 15 minutes to order, and a whole pie would have taken an additional 30 minutes - and this was at 3pm.   I opted for a few slices instead, which were ready after a quick warm-up.   

There's better food in Vegas - and certainly in the Cosmopolitan.  But for quick, cheap, and acceptable pizza, look no further.

Hidden gem inside the Cosmo Hotel!!

Its actually called Pizzeria.

Super cheap pizza and the quality was amazing. I love thin crust pizza, it's my FAVE! They close at 4am so it's a perfect spot to hit up after the club for some yummy greasy food! I ordered the pepperoni with sausage. The sausage is different from other types of pizza. It's sliced up in bigger pieces plus the cheese just melts in your mouth!

Really small and seating can be a problem. Seems like its more of a grab and go kinda thang. Make sure to come here for some bomb pizza!! Might be kinda hard to find so ask around. If you find a tunnel you went to the right spot! :]

This place isn't really a secret anymore, as you can tell by the lines and wait. It should be re-named "Hard-To-Find Pizza." Go to the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan and look for the drunk, hungry people. You'll be able to smell this place before you see it.

This is one of my favorite post-clubbing places to eat on the Strip and the best pizza, hands down. The NY style manages to pull off the combo of a crispy crust and loads of wonderfully cheesy toppings with quality ingredients. I like the White Pizza because I love cheese, and with the piles of ricotta, it doesn't disappoint. 

As delicious and hangover-preventing as it may be, the lines can be frustrating, especially if there is a wait and you're hungry. They do have video games, or you can take a nap on the chairs outside (and people do), but the best time to go is not midnight-3AM when the club-goers are released, if you can help it. 

Slices are around $5 each, pricey but worth it in my opinion.

I was looking up pizza restaurants for my bf in Vegas and happened upon this place in Cosmopolitan. It had great ratings so we decided to give it a try and loved it. It is a hole in the wall place that is very casual and reasonably priced. We had to stand bc there are very few places to sit but it was still worth it.

The line looked so long when we arrived but it went by quickly and was well worth the wait. In addition to the line wait if you want a pie expect to wait another 25 minutes. 1 topping pie was about $30.00.

Ahh Secret Pizza, how I adore my alcohol induced memories of you...

At $5.50 for a decent at best, cheese pizza slice and 50 cents extra per additional topping, my cheap self would not purchase this if it were located anywhere else. But alas it's Vegas and when you're craving pizza at 3 in the morning you kind of just dgaf. That being said I come here over and over again. 4 STARS!!

Secret pizza is the talk of Las Vegas. Most people have heard of it and it's for good reason. The pizza is delicious. I had cheese and later the white pizza. They were both very good. I would definitely recommend it to others visiting. Plus there is nothing like eating pizza after a night of drinking!!

With over 250 reviews on here already, this place isn't much of a"secret" anymore, but when you're drunk and hungry at 4am after spending several hours on the dance floor of Marquee and you stumble in following the directions of another drunk reveler munching on what looks like a tasty slice of NY Style pizza, you FEEL like you've found a hidden gem.

So maybe it isn't "hidden" anymore, but it is still a gem. We ordered a whole pizza to go (pepperoni and green pepper), waited about 20 minutes, then took our whole pizza over to the Chandelier Bar and enjoyed. I have to say, even if I hadn't been tipsy, this pizza is legit. Thin crust, but not too "floppy," flavorful crust (hard to find on thin crust pizzas), and the toppings were fresh and tasty. I was certainly pleased enough to write this review and give the pizza 4 stars, so there you go.
5 bucks a slice, and better quality than the pizzeria at MGM and Ceasars. Best cheap pizza on the strip. And it's open until 4.30
Hidden gem at the Cosmo! Whether it's after a late night of drinking or just a mid day snack this place does not disappoint! Some of the best tasting pizza I have ever had.

As close to a NY style pizza in the west coast.  As a native New Jersey\/New Yorker I had this place on my bucket list. My wife and I tried to enjoy the mystery in finding the location. Hint: Find a hallway with a wall of vinyl albums. Is it the 1st floor or 3rd? I don't know, guessing is part of the fun. The two guys in front of me looked liked they were fellow New Yorkers so overheard their pick of slices and I trusted their choice and decided to try a slice of sausage and peperocini myself. Wow the cheese, the crust, the tomato sauce all the way to the dripping oil off the pizza screamed NY pizza. The sausage and peperocini were such a great compliment that from now on I will put peperocini on all my pizzas! Note the dining experience is more of a quick grab, eat standing up and go. So if you want to savor the moment I recommend ordering a pie to take out to the hotel rooom. Is it inconvenient to wait in line and pay premium price for a pizza yes, but it will be the best NY pizza you will have in the west coast.

YUMMMMOOOO. After clubbing at Marquee at 2am, you will be so tired and hungry! but luckily there is this random pizzeria down some random hallway! There is a long line, but its worth the wait because the pizza is sooo damn good! The pizza reminds me a of a new york pizza. Its big, thing and the crust is super crispy. Its about 3-4 dollars a slice and my oh my it is totally worth EVERY Penny! I got the pepperoni and meatball pizza, and a peppericni, bell pepper, and turkey?? slice. They were all delicious! And on top of that, I was short 50 cents on cash and the guy was nice enough to just give me the two slices for 9 dollars. THat is really good customer service :)

Fantastic pizza. Hard to find, but don't hesitate to ask around. Employees at the Cosmopolitan were happy to point us in the right direction. Or look for a stream of giddy people exiting from a random hallway.
If you come to Las Vegas Strip you gotta have this pizza! It's so goooood! It's about $4-$5.50 per slice but it's totally worth it. It's inside The Cosmopolitan hotel, 3rd floor. Cheesy and crunchy

They keep up to their name by being hard to find. We spent half an out find the eatery but it was worth the effort. :) loved the fm ricotta cheese pizza! Comes loaded with cheese. Stay away from it if you are weak hearted for cheese! Veggie pizza slice is $5.5+tax, pretty big serving and good deal for the location. 

Tip- it is located  2 floors above the entrance to Casino in Cosmopolitan. Thank you

I REALLY love this place! The white pizza is to die for...it's so tasty! Yum! The prices are pretty expensive at $5.50 a slice and about $30 for a whole pie. It is in the Cosmopolitan however, so I expected those prices. I really like the location too! It's hidden in a corner, down a hallway.....hence the "secret." Give it a try!

Um I'm pretty sure all the good reviews are from people who are drunk. We waited 15 minutes for two slices of cheese pizza. It was cheap for the strip at $4.50 a slice but not even worth that. It was greasy and burned. Skip it.
I am mystified by the glowing reviews for this place.  So-so, overpriced pizza that is no secret at all.  Just because no one named this place doesn't make it a secret.

I mean, it could be the time of night and all the alcohol consumed leading up to a visit to Secret PIzza...but I guess it doesn't matter because what sober person is out looking for late night treats at 3-4am?

The biggest knock against SP is the wait, but aren't all good things worth a wait?  I will say that expectations can tend to get high when you wait 30-45-60 minutes in line for something, but SP certainly delivered.  The pie was so delicious and I'm pretty sure I woke up with a burnt mouth because I didn't even want to wait for it to cool down.  I guess I should have rated SP a 1\/5 and said it's the worst thing out there so less people would show up...

Can't wait to go back - Vegas needs more late night food spots like this one.

SOOOO I was sufficiently drunk by the time I got here. NY style is the ONLY style for pizza if you ask me. And secret pizza does a GREAT job of it.

We just had a simple cheese slice but to my hazy memory, it was one perfect slice.

Thank god for this place.  This is the "damnit, I-just-lost-money-gambling,-so-I-don't-want-to-drop-coin-on food" place to go" or the "how-are-we-all-on-completely-different-meal-schedules" place.  The pizza is above average and it's quick.  Really easy to miss when your walking on that floor of the cosmo.

Thin crust, sausage, cheese.. Just what you need.. They have a variety of different and specialty pizzas that don't show up on the board. Out of nowhere they bring up a deep dish Chicago style pizza with a generous helping of pepperoni.  It's kind of hard to find as it's a unmarked hallway with retro rock band posters.

It is by no means the best pizza I have ever had, nor is it the best pizza by the slice, but I personally love the idea that they don't advertise, and you have to walk down a little hallway to get it. 

The novelty of this place is what earns it four stars. Knowing about this little place makes me feel like I'm part of an exclusive club (or at least a club that 187 other yelpers know about). 

I tried the mushroom and white pizza. Both were delicious thin crust style pizza. The mushrooms on top my pizza were particularly delicious. And at $3-$4 a slice this is probably one of the best deals in Vegas, and definitely the cheapest meal that I saw in the Cosmopolitan.

Pizza that reminds my of new york.  They have the Sicilian style sliced sausage and crispy crust. The place is hard to find if it is your first time coming. But it is worth it. There is nothing on the directory in the Cosmo the leads you to it. You may have to ask. It is on the 3rd floor

It's actually quite good thin crust pizza. Flavorful. Not too floppy. Pepper flakes and cheese available. Lines can be long but they're usually full of pretty friendly people so the wait goes quickly. Grab a slice of two and a stack of napkins to sop up the grease and you've got a tasty (and pretty cheap) snack on the go. A rare thing in Vegas on the strip unless you hit a found court. This is a far better choice in my opinion!

Amazing pizza and I am extremely picky! High quality ingredients, and the most important they have good cheese.. I mean, what is a pizza if 90% of the places use the cheapest hardest worst cheese possible on them.. this place blows 99% of Pizza places out of the water my only gripe is the lines, sometimes taking 30 minutes standing in a long tunnel with drunk people waiting to get a slice and there's always no room to sit.. However it's an amazing post party location and once you get your slice it makes everything better.

The pizza is good; I think their gimmick of being hidden away goes a long way for them though--it's not so hard to find if you just wander around the third floor of the Cosmopolitan. I was actually a bit disappointed with the overall breadth of selection, but it is a nicely cooked pizza with good quality ingredients.

My cousin told me to check out this secret pizza spot since I was staying at the Cosmopolitan. If you want to explore and find it yourself, stop reading lol. I will be revealing the exact location in the next sentence. It's on the 3rd floor in between Blue Ribbon and like this round, clear elevator. My bf and I got there right when it opened so the crowd wasn't bad. We asked the guy behind the counter what he would recommend.

We ended up ordering 3 slices; they were $6 each. Think one was the meat lover, one had sausage & ricotta and the other was sausage & pepperoncini. They all tasted okay; expected more since there's a lot of hype about this place. Nothing special about the crust, toppings or flavor. The meat lover was actually a bit salty to me. Small place, a few stools inside and some old school gaming machines like pinball. Overall, it was just average greasy pizza.

This place is located on the third floor of cosmopolitan.  There was a line when I went around 11pm on a weekday and it took about 30 minutes to get to the counter from almost the end of the hallway.  I ordered a slice of combo which had pepperoni, sausage, and cheese.  It was a bit greasy but still nonetheless delicious.  We were able to sit there and eat since not many people were sitting there to eat.  Mostly, I saw people getting their pizza and leaving the pizza place.

I think this is definitely a thing to cross off the "to-do" list when in Vegas. It's a cool little secret tunnel that you have to look around for to get to on the 3rd floor of the Cosmo. I must have come at the perfect time because there was NO line. The girl working the register was super sweet & helpful. The pizza is definitely good for Vegas standards, I got the White. The crust is thin and crispy, and the pizza itself is not too oily, just right. There's nowhere to sit so you'll be lucky to grab some counter space. I think the only downside in my opinion is the price. $5.50 for a slice. I mean I know it's Vegas but dang, it isn't AMAZING in my opinion to spend all that much on it. I think trying this place once just for the one time experience is enough for me. Oh and if your thirsty for some water, they won't give you any lol. That sucked...

This place is great after a night of heavy drinking!

The white pizza is my personal favorite.  The offer a white deep dish pizza on occasion that is absolutely heavenly!

There is sometimes a line but there are pin ball and arcade games to keep you entertained while you wait.  The restaurant is small but very retro feeling.  I go here every time I'm in Cosmo.

i am so excited that i finally finally got to go the secret pizza place!!!!! it was completely worth the wait! omg it was so much fun and so good. the place was a little hard to find, as it wasnt marked and is in a teeny hallway but the vibe in there was really cool. super small with arcade games like galaga and pinball machines. the people were really friendly and accomodating.

the pizza was amazing. i got hte white pizza that everyone is talking about. perfectly sauced. not too much. tasted fresh and not cardboard-y. fresh veggies on the pizza. they also serve alcohol wc is so smart and such a big plus.

these guys will definitely make sooooo much money serving pizza to drunk club goers on the weekends. and pizza taste even better when u just got out of the club all sweaty and tired and drunk and hungry. i also saw people who worked at cosmo getting pizza here after their shifts.

overall an amazing time at a really fresh "off the beaten path"  pizza joint.

The secret pizza place down a hidden hallway on the THIRD FLOOR of the cosmopolitan. I've been here plenty of times when in Vegas. The pizza is delicious, although we ordered a whole pie, that took forever to make. The way it is set up in there is very unorganized and you can't tell who is in line to order or who already paid. There are barely any seats inside, so you'd have to bring the pizza outside which also has barely any seats. Pizza is good, especially after a drunken pool party ;) or night after the club but the wait is terrible if theirs a lot of people.

Best Pizza in Vegas!!! Came here at like 4am after the clubs, got the mozzarella pizza. It was about 8 bucks but it was a huge square piece. Delicious!!! Lines can get long. I saw the massive amount of people coming back from EDC to get into line and they just barely made it. It's not open 24\/7 so I would recommend coming here if you went to the clubs. The white pizza pie is about $28. On the pricier side but it's vegas.

Located in Cosmo- Upstairs!

If you're looking for cheap, quick, and easy pizza, look no further. Hidden on he third floor of the cosmopolitan, you'll find a nondescript pizzeria. Just a warning: bringing your pizza into the second floor chandelier lounge is highly discouraged. Sorry. 

The line can really gather as the evening progresses but stand your ground because there's no other place like it in the hotel. You can get a whole pie or a slice to go. 

Slices of cheese are $5 and it's $.50 extra per topping. Seating is limited and remember you can't eat your pizza in *~certain places~* so plan to stand my friend.
Good pizza. Ok staff. Hard to find. Very expensive for what it is. just go when you are drunk and want something to munch on.

Fun, tasty, (Expensive) pizza hidden somewhere in the Cosmo. Took a little long to get, but that was our own fault in not calling in the order. A $36 deluxe pizza gets you three toppings. Couldn't agree, so we got half white and half pepperoni, sausage and onion. The white was excellent, dripping with just the right amount of grease, the different cheeses mixing perfectly to offer a sensational taste. Slices are large, so we nibbled at it over the next couple days. Great for sitting on a Cosmopolitan balcony while watching the fountains!

We Found Sbarro's Cool Cousin at the Cosmopolitan!

For us, it was part of our Las Vegas bucket list. So this place is not so secret, it's a matter of fact pretty easy to find, tucked away in a corner, third floor at the Cosmopolitan. Both my husband and I ordered the pepperoni pizza. The pizza was just ok and that's not saying much since we were sort of hungry. After leaving there we went to In and Out to complete our late night dining experience.

Best way to describe the pizza, just think Sbarro's when you were 13 years old and your mom dropped you off at the mall. You and your friends having a Sbarro's pepperoni pizza was a fun experience and tasted pretty good. However, here are some differences, Secret Pizza is a bit more greasy, more expensive, your old friends aren't there, and less sitting space than at the mall.

They really do try their best to offer the "cool" factor, and what could be cooler than a pinball machine and old record covers on the wall as you walk in. For this place, once you have done it, the odds are you won't be back. But a fun thing to do anyhow if you happen to be at the Cosmopolitan. It will set you back about $10.00 for two slices of pepperoni pizza, and they have a water cooler, so no need to buy a soda. Also it is an interesting place to people watch. Both the clientele and staff offer free entertainment. Enjoy!

Really good pizza, my fiance and I were in Vegas, and wanted Pizza, it was an adventure to find this "secret pizza" and it so worth it, it's usually really poppin' but worth it! Not many places to sit, so you may want to be prepared to stand and eat! So yummy!!!
Perfect slice of white pizza--tons of garlic, crust perfectly crisp, not too thin and not too thick. Just right. Highly recommend. I'm a bit of a pizza snob and this was all I wanted and more.

The best I've found in Las Vegas yet. If you're from the East Coast & looking for a real slice,head to the 3rd floor & duck into the hallway of Secret Pizza. Most Vegas places I've found that say "NY" aren't, but this is the most comparable I've found. Haven't had a bad slice or experience here yet.

Oh how I love thee WHITE PIZZA!

Doesn't get any better, and that is ALWAYS what I order, along w\/ a Stone IPA.

There is not much else to say about this place, other than it is a hidden gem on the LV strip.

Now this is a solid piece of pizza.  The secret is out on this place.  Everybody knows about it and raves about.  Come to Cosmo to try it.  They even have a brick and mortar now off the strip if the Cosmo location doesn't suit you.

The pizza is expensive but they give you a good portion and the smell and taste is actually very close to the New York-esque pizza I'm continually searching for in Vegas.  There is not much space to eat (only a few counter and stools) so you might want to order a slice or pie to go and eat in the lobby of all the restaurants on the second floor of Cosmo.

Pretty much everyone who stays on the strip and digs pizza has heard about this place.  It's worth a visit in my opinion just to say you went and experienced the walk down the hallway to find the secret pizza place in Cosmo.
Pizza was good but a bit on the oily side. Expensive for what it is, don't see what the hype is all about.

If you can't find it, just look for the line!

It's worth the wait for a delicious piece of 'za.  I recommend the Sicilian, it had a light, crunch and delicate crust with the perfect amount off sauce and pepperoni toppings. 

While they do not have more than a few bar stools around counter, you can easily carry you treat out into the hall and their is a seating pit in a perfect location to enjoy your food.
Pizza wasn't all that, on the salty side.  $25+ per pie.  I guess its a tourist trap.  Locals i would recommend not making the effort.

3.5 stars    I just can't commit to 4 stars.  I feel it's a wee bit better than a-okay though.

We were wandering around Cosmo looking for a place to snack.  The ladies asked someone at the Concierge's desk, and then we were directed to what looked like a restroom hallway.  lol  When we got to the end, it was (from what i've been told) a typical NY style joint in that the pizza place didn't really focus too much on having much available seating.  

We weren't sure how to order at first since they were cooking a bunch of what appeared to be simple pizzas.  I don't recall seeing any kind of signs or food descriptions, or prices for that matter.  We witnessed someone customizing their pizza and decided to do the same.  We started with a naked veggie pizza, and then added on to it.  My wife added tomato slices and meatball slices.  I did the same, but also added some green peppers.  They added the items and threw the pizzas back into the oven to heat\/cook the newly added ingredients.  

Pricing was okay.  I probably would have enjoyed it more though had the price been $4 instead of $4.75 per slice.  Or I guess a bigger slice would have also made the $4.75 price feel better.  But hey, it was a nice snack to hold us over.  ;)

Looking for a cheap, amazing, and quick food! This is the place to be! I love this place the pizza taste like something you would get from the east coast. It was the cheapest dish I've ever eaten in Vegas, and one of the most fulfilling.
I ordered the sausage pepperoncini & ricotta pizza. The crust was so amazing, and the pizza toppings were awesome! I forgot what else I ordered on the ricotta pizza, because I was to busy eating away. 
This place is especially perfect after your partied your butt off and need a perfect pizza to hit the spot!

Don't quite see what all the hype is about. Maybe LV isn't used to good pizza...I don't know. It was a decent slice for $6, but I think the "hidden" location is what keeps business up, and not necessarily some ridiculously amazing pizza. Tried both the Mushroom and the White Pizza. Tasty, self-explanatory ingredients on both. Warmed up and served out of the oven similar to Sbarro's. Won't be going so far out of my way to grab a simple slice of NY-style pizza, but they've definitely earned a spot in the back of my mind should I stay at the Cosmo or wander through during the wee hours...

Mmmm. Reminds me of the pizza back in NYC, where I'm from. And I have high standards when it comes to pizza!

The first time we passed by, it was about 1am and the line was wrapped down the hallway and around the pool table. We went back the next day for a quick bite after some shopping and we were glad we did.  

I'll definitely be back for more, as most of the pizza in Vegas is inedible.
This place is hidden but located on the 3rd floor by the sushi place and pool tables. This will probably be the best pizza you'll find in Vegas.

Delicious! I went here not thinking I was hungry until I smelled the hot pizza down the hallway. Best spot to go after the clubs or bars etc.... pizza soaked up all the alcohol:)... best secret spot inside the Cosmo

Ordered a whole deluxe pie, had a conversation with the worker with the 5 toppings I requested. Was told the order would be ready in 45 minutes. 45 minutes later, they said there was no order under that name. Furious.

YUM. Yum. Yum. I wanted to go here every day but the beau said no. But YUM.

It was fun to go wandering and looking for it. The Cosmo is huge but super cool. The pizza was so good. 

Now I want another slice. Lol.
really neat little hole in the wall - literally.  Great for after the clubs.

Was really excited to try here after looking at all these positive reviews. I was shocked when I walked in and found pretty much no place to sit (4\/5 bar stools total) and the smallest place ever. I guess its pretty much only to go. The menu is actually very basics and hardly any choices. We ended up getting 4 slices and sitting in the Cosmo lounge area. Pizza was very mediocre. Pieces were big and flimsy and toppings fell right off. It was just not good and strictly ate it since I was hungry. Okay at best. Won't go back, not worth 30$. Had much much better.

First thing we went in search for after checking in to the Cosmopolitan. It is on the 3rd floor in the East Tower. 

After waiting in line for about 40 min, we ordered: 
2 litter of soda: $8
2 topping pizza (sliced sausage and pepperoni): $31 

They said our wait time was going to be 25min. It took about 15 min so we were very pleased with that. 

We took it back to our hotel room to eat it. Pizza was still hot. Getting the sliced sausage was definitely worth it. It added some zest to a basic pepperoni pizza. 

Definitely recommend getting a whole pizza over slices. More bang for your buck.

With so many places to eat in Vegas, I'm always looking for suggestions.  My coworkers unanimously sent me here, and they weren't wrong.  The pizza was great - thin, crispy and cheesy!  The prices were fine for what you got, and we didn't have any problems finding a seat during lunch hours.  I'll definitely be back when I'm in town again.

When I went during the week, there were no lines but just great pizza to had! The staff was friendly and fast. I got the "white" pizza and regular pepperoni. The pizza is flavorful with thin crust. It's not that hard to find at the Cosmo as you see everyone with pizza outside the place and you smell it! 

If you haven't tried it, please do! There is limited seating inside but there are chairs outside of the place. Me and my friend got 3 slices and two cokes, that came out to $22...it's Vegas! ;-)

What can I say that hasn't already been said? 

This place is pretty cool. 

Pizza is the perfect drunk food. 

Whenever we're in Vegas, my husband insists we come here every night. 

The pizza has a great sauce and crust. Though I am a meat lover, I prefer a plain cheese slice here. The pepperoni makes it too salty.
Not sure what all the hype is all about but taste like regular pizza that you can pretty much get from anywhere...
Seriously the best pizza place in Vegas, if you're in town you need to go there. We had the white pizza and a regular one with meat toppings and everything was amazing!! 6 stars!!

After reading some of the reviews before I ate the pizza here, I was expecting like really awesome pizza.  I had the white pizza, it was ok, a little on the salty side.  I think that that is one of the reasons why people who go there like it- drinking lots of alcohol makes salty foods taste better.  To be fair though, pizza is not my favorite.  My fianc said that it was good pizza and worth the walk through the hotel to find it.
When it first opened, it was the best pizza in town. Now that the "secret's out", the quality hasn't been the same. Still amazing pizza, but I feel like it is missing that special something.
probably didn't taste as good as it could have cause i wasn't intoxicated. haha maybe i'll try it again another time.

Thanks to Yelp, I was able to find this place on my trip to Vegas! While it's not really a secret, I still felt cool locating the unassuming (who am I kidding, it's covered with album covers) hallway and emerging in a cozy little pizza parlor on the other side.  Kind of like Alice in Wonderland.

Usually I can finish 2 slices of pizza without a problem, so I ordered 2 this time.  They were huge! I was stuffed halfway through the second one.  The pizza was very good, not mind-blowingly good but still crisp and fresh (don't let them give you a reheated slice, there were pizzas that were pre-made and just waiting to be reheated), very welcome especially in the AM.  

Slight Cons: 
Workers were not very enthusiastic while taking my order, and there is nowhere to sit, you'll just have to take it to the couches outside or elsewhere.  

Whether you're drunk and exhausted from going clubbing, or you've been shopping and want some lunch, give Secret Pizza a visit!

I'll admit it.  I found this place, but I had to cheat by reading Yelp reviews (thanks guys).  Also, it's between Blue Ribbon and Jaleo. :p

The NY look definitely brought back memories of my trip to New York from last year.  The prices for the pizza are rather expensive for a New York style pizza, but I figured it had to be adjusted for Las Vegas, so that's understandable.  With that said, I was fine with it, really.

I grabbed a slice of the White Pizza, and it was delicious.  Oily, but still great.  Luckily there was a small line, so the wait wasn't as long as I thought it was going to be on a week night.  Overall though, it's perfectly acceptable for late night pizza, especially when under the influence of alcohol.

By far the most delicious pizza I've ever had in my life.  I still need to try NY pizza, but until then this is the most flavorful yummy pizza everrrrr.  We arrived in Vegas around midnight and started getting ready to go meet some friends that were over at Marquee.  Unfortunately they ended up leaving after we were all ready to head out, but they ended up bringing back this huge pizza for both of our suites.  We had the combination pizza and normally I will pick off green peppers and mushrooms, but I gobbled that whole thing up with no hesitations.  Most pizza places will get stingy about toppings too, but they lather that baby up just the right amount.  

I wouldn't mind eating this pizza every day if I lived in Vegas.
I love the pizza. All I can say it was hard to find even with directions haha. We had to use are noses to smell the amazing pizza. So good......yummy must try

Pretty good pizza tucked back down a hall is the cosmopolitan. We ordered a pepperoni pizza with peppers and onions. The pepperonis were delicious - thicker cut, large, and covered the pizza nicely. Green peppers and onions were an ok addition but not necessary. The dough was soft and tasty. I'd go back if I was crazing a slice and was in the vicinity. Eat it!

If you can find it, you're #WINNING.  

Highly enjoyable NY style pizza.  Nice and crispy crust and gooey cheese.  The only thing they need is bleu cheese and ranch dressing.  I'll add a star when I hear they add those items haha.

I guess I haven't reviewed this fine establishment yet, and I visit almost every time I'm in Vegas!

Sometimes the line can suck, but it's so worth it.  You can get a big slice for under $5, I believe it's NY style (thin crust).  Service has almost always been with a smile, and it's so convenient either before or after visiting Marquee.

Hmm... I wish I could speak more of its awesomeness, but I guess I've said it all.  My yelp buddy Rod U said it well, it's not the best pizza in Vegas, but it's an experience.  Hip and trendy, you'll spot a lot of other clubgoers hitting it up.  For its convenience, and quality, I am definitely a fan.

Pizza time! :)

Location: In the Cosmopolitan Hotel, it's on the 3rd floor right above Marquee. Take the escalators\/elevator, make a slight left and the location is on the right hand side. If you see a big sitting area, you are at the right place. You just gotta go down that mini hallway and you are there. 

As for the wait, I think I got lucky both times (Saturday night 6PM-ish before XS & Saturday 11AM-ish before Marquee Dayclub), I barely had to wait 10 minutes for my food. The only waiting I had to do was when they had to heat up my pizza. 

As for the food it self, it's pretty good. It's big enough to satisfied my hunger before the club. They have a lot of different topping pizzas, and they make the pizza fresh every half an hour or when they run out of pizza. Although the last time I went, my pizza had so much oil I had to use some napkins to soak it up. 

As for the price, it's cheap! Under 10 bucks for a slice! The only thing that sucks was the price went up a dollar within a couple of months (January 2015  $5, April 2015 $6), but hey! It's still under $10 :)

Came here after I finished work and after I picked my cousins up from the casino! The line was pretty long when we got there but it moved quickly! The prices were also very reasonable! I ordered a mushroom and a combination pizza and it was BOMB.COM ! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!
Good but not great we've had it a couple times and it is consistent but I would put 5-50 ahead of it 3.5 it's good not great

I saw my friend post about this "secret pizza" place on his facebook wall a few months ago, so when I went to vegas I knew I had to try it. We waited in line for more than 40 mins. Their pizza must be THAT good... when I got my slice - Meh! I guess I was expecting more from the good reviews. It was alright (too salty actually!)... not amazing and not worth the 40 mins wait time. I should have gotten something from white castle outside Harrah's instead... yep there's white castle in Las Vegas!

Hype hype hype hype hype..more hype..

That's what I thought about Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan. Maybe, I'm spoiled by many great pizza places in Portland, so this one just doesn't do anything for me. We had one slice of the White pizza. It was just ok. It was soooooo greasy. 

Yes, this place is cheap for Vegas standard and especially for Cosmopolitan standard. Does it worth it to try it? Sure. Does it worth to come back again for it? Probably not.

If this place is a secret, it's the most well known secret I've ever heard of. 

After a late night of partying at Marquee, this place was a lifesaving (literally, I think for some members of my group) late night eating haven. 

Talk to me when its not 4am and I haven't been drinking vodka cranberries for hours on end, and I'd probably give the pizza a 2. However, as a late night bite is concerned, the cheesy goodness on the pizza along with the sausage I had on mine, definitely hit the spot and was worth whatever price I paid for a slice. They were really nice and gave me a cup of water for free, because let's be honest, that was needed. My first and only free water in Vegas! 

If I find myself in the Cosmopolitan next time I'm in Vegas, I'll head here for a nightcap.

I love pizza by the slice, especially after drinking!  This little secret (not really so secret) place has a pretty good selection and tastes great after drinking!  Its open til 4 AM!  Late night eating at its finest!

Had the white pizza slice...it was delicious! The staff was nice and welcoming. There's not a lot of seating--so be prepared to grab it to-go and eat it elsewhere. This was the most inexpensive place i've eaten on the strip and it doesn't disappoint!

Not bad, but not at all worth the ridiculous wait to grab a slice from this 'secret' hideway that everyone & their mama already knows about. Was great regardless having this option after partying all night @ Marquee though would've saved a good hour+ grabbing a bite at some other option at or around the casino. I would've been satisfied with the hot dog stand that we MISSED on the way in (though I heard so many great things about this place). Had he been in a more visible location (as opposed to the seating area where everyone gathered after grabbing a slice), he probably would've made out like a bandit. Anyway, been there now & done that so onto the next culinary quest...

3.5 stars

Location: third floor of Cosmo (floor dedicated to food at the top). When you go up the escalator you should see a lounge-ish area to your left (some chairs, etc.). Walk over there. Then look to your right. You should see a short walkway where the walls are lined with old records and the like. Bam! Secret Pizza entrance. 

Pizza: Pizza was a-ok. We got one piece of pepperoni and some sort of sausage and another piece with pepperoni and mushroom. Tasty and thin without being burnt. I can't say this is the best pizza ever (not even close) but a good and (relatively) cheap bite to eat. ("relatively" because it still seemed pricey to me for what it was). 

Oh! And they have a Galaga arcade game you can play for 50 cents. Warning! The controller has some serious jamming issues, though!

At $34 you get a decent sized pie. I waited less than 20 minutes for it but got a slice while I waited. Great food to soak up the day's worth of drinks. The crust is thin, flattened crisp dough, plenty cheese and the sausage is think and has a kick. You won't get this flavor anywhere else. This place isn't hard to find, the workers will tell you exactly where, Jaleos is nearby and you see pool tables and a hallway.

At first i was intrigued why it's called "secret pizza" and now i know why  its for you guys to find out! You absolutely should come if you're visiting las vegas! One of the best pizzas I've eaten! There's so much goodness for a cheap price.
It's fine, my pizza was still cold but I imagine it would taste better had it been warmed properly...
Must go, awesome pizza...if you can find it lol!  All the pizzas were awesome.  We go here every time we are in Las Vegas.  Ask the employees at the cosmopolitan where it is at!

Great new york style pizza. Some of the toppings are not what you expect. The sausage and meatball are actually shaved which gives it a nice consistency. Before they serve your pizza, they give it a toast which makes the thin crust crispy. Real nice.
Sausage\/Peperoncini Pizza. Hands down the best.
The pizza is good fresh, but it's not mind blowing--I think there's too much hype about the location being "secretive." The pizza is no good reheated or cold--definitely only eat there.

Not worth it.  Here's why: 
1. It's no longer a secret.  If there's a line in the entrance, expect a 30 minute standing wait.
2. The pizza is not good.  It could be good if you're drunk and hungry, but as for pizza goes, it's pretty disappointing.  Thin oily crust and coagulated cheese, uneven slices.  One piece I had was about 50% larger than another, but cost the same price.
3.  The place is a mess.  Garbage is laying all over the place, with grease covered condiment shakers and empty napkin holders and virtually nowhere to sit because they have about 4 barstools up against the wall.
4.  Very limited drink selection.  Soda, wine, or choice of 3 beers.

If you want some real good pizza, don't go here.  If you just want some drunk filler food in a place that attracts the young (20-some) crowd, you may like it.
My favorite pizza in Vegas! The bad thing is I never stay at The Cosmo. So accessibility is a downer. It's kinda a hike to get to this joint, but if you've never been... It's worth it.

Really scrummy pizza. I played Ms Pacman for the first time in decades...I am still rubbish at it, but what fun! There isn't much else to say about this hidden gem. Would you go here for a candlelight dinner for two? Nope. Could it be the best slice in Vegas? Quite possibly.

(Later edit: I have been back when I was the designated driver and had to up it to 5 stars! Not only is it the best slice in Vegas...it could be the best slice in the WORLD! Seriously!! It's THAT good)

I am a fan of Secret Pizza. The prices here are extremely affordable and their pizza is delicious. It's so hard to find good food at a good price in Vegas. I will definitely be coming back. This place is tucked at the end of a small alley on the third floor. There's no signs for it. 

Come for the white pizza. It's delicious. It's about $5-$6 for a slice. The water bottles are ridiculously priced. You should bring your own.

Main attraction to Cosmopolitan's "secret pizza" is the fact that it may or may not be an insider only type of place.  

For those that know, it is a good place to get a fast couple slices of pie, or even a whole pie if your wallet can still muster it.  

Got a house special sausage slice, a pepperoni, pepperoncinni and extra cheese red sauce slice, a slice of white pie with ricotta, sun dried tomatoes, garlic and artichoke hearts and the last slice I got was whatever they had readily available, do not remember exactly what it was.  

Good pie, NYC style but not the best in the world, had better in LA for that matter.  

and yes I said better in LA, we do have good pizza if you out of towners care to look around for it.  For truely epic pizza, try either D.O.G.C. which is also inside Cosmo or Grimaldi's in Henderson for that true, down home Brooklyn Pie.

stalked this place after eating at Henry's being 70.00 in the whole and still hungry! We tried to stalk it before but it wasnt open yet.  Had to ask 2 different people where it was located.  no signs and down a hallway.   pizza was pretty good but i wouldnt give 4 stars. slice of plain and slice of pepperoni with homemade meatballs.  definately go for the topping.  The plain wasnt good enough to eat plain.  but meatball was homemade and delicious!  Very garlicy which is a plus in my book!
A hidden gem in the Vegas chaos. I felt like I teleported back to New York when we walked down the hallway. $5 a slice was worth it for a taste of home. Go on adventure and scope out Secret Pizza!

The absolute best pizza I have ever had!!! The crust is thin, and crispy, they double bake it. The cheeses are flavorful and delicious, but not too greasy. I love that it is by the slice, so you can try without getting the whole pizza. It's affordable and hip. LOVE IT!!!!

Sure it's busy, but that only means it's good. After a night out it's worth the stop. If Jazmin and Christo happen to be working then expect exceptional service! Quality pizza before hitting the bed always makes you feel better in the morning. ..or a few hours later. ;)
Pretty good pizza. Hard to find, but the name is secret pizza. Cheap and quick mid night fix after drinking too much.

The pizza here was awesome! We were in and out within 10 minutes. You basically walk in then order at the counter. For two ginormous slices of pizza we paid $11. This is more than enough to keep you satisfied. I got the sausage pepperoncini and it was delicious. My husband got a Mediterranean slice and his was even better. Right outside the restaurant there is a cute sitting area with domino shaped tables. If you go up the escalator there is a skating rink too. Enjoy your pizza while people watching or watching a movie up on the big screen. They were playing Gremlins when we were there.
THE BEST CHEESE PIZZA ON EARTH!!!! Tucked away... Great price on a whole pizza at 4 am to scarf after dancing at Marquee...drinks served in red keg cups...love it

Great pizza! Nice laid back vibe to place.  Hard to find but not as hard as some reviews make it seem.  Third floor next to a sushi place.  Good size slices and friendly staff.  Small eating space so might have to stand but part of experience.  Worth it!

people call this is a secret pizza place at cosmopolitan because you can't find it if you don't ask people. there is no sign for this place....but this is a cool place! they have very good pizza there!!! and cheap too. we ordered 3 pcs which cost about $12. it is a very small place in between restaurants. there is a hall way to go in but no sign and no name at all.
The flavor on the pizza is pretty good but I honestly didn't like the crust.  And pizza here is pretty pricey. But it is cool how it's a secret joint. They always have a line as well.

More like not-so-secret pizza...my friends and I stopped by to grab a quick lunch after skating at the Cosmo ice rink to see what the fuss is all about. The line extended out the end of the hallway and we waited ~45 minutes. 

I got a white pizza with added dried tomatoes and I LOVED it. It's NY style thin crust pizza and the tomatoes added the perfect kick of tanginess to the slice! After finishing my slice I even grabbed the leftovers off my friend's plate to finish hers....heh. 

I really wanted to try their Sicilian pizza but unfortunately it wasn't available that day. 

Definitely wish it was more secret so the wait wouldn't be so long but until then...ill see u in my dreams :-) until next time
Love how its in a hidden hallway with no signage. Great pizza both red and white sauce. Must try!
So secret and so good! Best prices for good pizza especially in Vegas. Def a must try when staying at the Cosmo

I order a Sicilian with only tomato and veggies over the phone they told me it will take 1 hour so I drove into traffic for 45 minutes to get there abd found out they put cheese on my pizza! When I  ask for my order to be place correctly they disclosed the fact they actually put cheese inside the crust and the tomatoes souce!!! They have to write this on a wall they cost me time and time Is money for everyone. I Will never raccomend this place again to my Friends And family.

Best pizza on the strip! It is definitely a small hidden treasure located at the Cosmopolitan on the 3rd floor. Yes, I agree with the other reviewers this place is super tiny and no place to sit. There's a lounging area outside the restaurant with very limited couches & chairs. If your lucky you may be able to find sitting there. 
At the end, all that matters is the PIZZA. There's several choices to choose from..you can either buy by the slice or buy the whole pizza (pie). Whatever you choose you will love it. This will definitely be on my list to visit when I'm in Vegas.

When a friend told me about a secret pizza place we should check out in Cosmopolitan, my first inclination was to Yelp it.  Not so secret with 3200 Yelp Reviews, I thought.  Whether its for pure marketing strategy or for a nobler cause of filtering the unworthy from pure pizza aficionados, we didn't really care.  We just wanted a good pizza.

So off we went to the overly modern, sparkling Cosmopolitan Hotel on a Friday night with the street roaming masses in search of their famed New York style pizza.  Despite having looked it up, it still took two asks on two floors to find the spot.  Both staff members seemed well prepared for the question and soon we were walking down a narrow hallway decorated with records I'm pretty sure even my parents were too hip to listen to.  

The first thing I saw entering was the video game Galaga from the 80s and a couple of pinball machines in a very small square room with no tables and chairs and a busy counter to order from.  Gratification was quick as we moved with the line.  They had four different pizzas ready to serve: cheese, pepperoni, mushroom, sausage and peppers. And basically if you want more topping, they just grab one of these and add whatever topping you want to add.  So it makes it quick.  

The pizza.  Oh the pizza was quite good.  So good that despite my low carb obsession of late, rules had to be broken and I asked for more.  More. More.  Ingredients were quality despite the low price.  As the noise, decor, and the visual overload of a very diverse group of customers nearly tested my sanity- the gooey, greasy, meaty goodness of this pizza blocked it all out for me.   

I was in my happy place.

So I'm very late writing this review but I feel weird saying I didn't like this place because of all the hype! I went here and the pizza and the service were about the same...blah! The girl that worked here seemed more interested in chatting with her coworker than taking our order and helping us. The pizza was kinda salty, in my opinion, nice concept of a hidden pizza spot but I will not be returning.

Heard of this spot from my cousin and my friends and I got a whole pie with red sauce, cheese and pepperoni topping. I really like how big the pepperoni were and and how thin and crispy the crust was, however this place is pretty average to me. Nothing too special, its just hyped up. 

I would say the wait is pretty long. 30 mins for our pie but its fresh so I cant complain.

I don't know how long they've had deep dish slices, but I've never seen them until this recent visit.  

We grabbed up a pepperoni deep dish which was pretty decent, but not close to my favorite. The plus is that its nicely crispy and not doughy, lots of pepperoni  and sauce and cheese in it. Its much more filling than the thin slice so I suppose you get more bang for your buck with that.  

We got a slice of white pizza as well. This is one of my favorites here and the BF liked it a lot too. Its also good with their sliced sausage on it. I think if you wan't something besides a basic pepperoni, I think this is the best one they have to offer. Slices start at $4.50 for a already made slice or you can order in a whole pizza as well (I believe the last time I ordered one it was about $20ish for a 1 topping). Of course, having it fresh made is slightly better than getting a slice that's been sitting. They serve a few beers on tap or soda, and there is a water dispenser out with water cups. Other than that, they serve nothing else - just 'za! 

I think the "secret pizza" is not so secret, but if you aren't sure where it is, it's on the same floor as most of their restaurants. It's right next to Blue Ribbon Sushi, you'll just see a random corridor of albums and you'll see a arcade machine visible at the end. Theres some stools or standing bar. You can walk your slice out into lobby of this area as there's plenty of seating and a pool table even. 

Good quick bite when here in Cosmo, a good idea to order a pizza instead of room service, not something I would venture to the strip just to get though. Still, I am a fan and manage to end up here every time I'm on the property!

Let's keep this in context and say this is the best fast food, drunk Pizza in the world. It's not Tom Colicchio pooping gold eggs here, folks. I'm sure Grimaldi's, which is in New York and fantastic I might add, would be less than happy if I, or let's just say someone I knew, stumbled in and wished to settle my debt for the food ordered with a fistful of one dollar casino chips. Secret Pizza, on the other hand, is properly trained and equipped to deal with these "free-spirited" individuals.

Here's some questions one might have, that I will in part answer with questions:
1. Would I take my sons and daughters here for pizza night? 
Do you think it's still safe to leave your kids alone at Circus Circus with a sackful of quarters like your parents did when you were young? Do you live in Vegas? Why are your kids here?
2. Should I bring Meemaw for a nice casual sit down dinner? Did Meemaw have mommy when she was 15? Is her sunrise tattoo on her lower back, now a sunset? Is she currently stumbling in her high heels after having spent the last 5 hrs inside Marquee living her missed youth?

White Pizza; That's all.

This place actually wasn't as hard to find as I thought it would have been! It was straight down an alley on the third floor!

My friends and I decided to stop by here to try out the secret pizza spot. The place itself is fairly small so there's very little seating. If you come at a busy time there will be a very long wait for you. Luckily we got there before the rush. It's not to disappoint! I got the white slice with pepperoni. The white slice is one of their famous pizzas where they don't use any tomato sauce and it tastes kind of garlicky (: I enjoyed it a lot. The only thing is that it get pretty oily and the crust is pretty dry. The pizza was pretty cheap too considering how expensive other pizza places around here are. For mine it was only $5.50. I'd consider that cheap!

Good pizza by the slice - just ask what's fresh.

It's sort of hidden in that there's no sign, but on the third floor, you follow your nose down the record-filled hallway between Blue Ribbin and Jaleo.  It's labeled "Pizza" on some hotel maps.

Like most stuff in the glitzy part of Las Vegas, it's not exactly cheap, but it is good.  It's also a really small space, and you'll probably want to take your plate back outside ... or up to your room.  The guys behind the counter told us that the crowds tend to come in waves; it'll be perfectly quiet for a while and then suddenly, bam!

Don't think you'll be blown away by it or anything, but hey - it's kind of cool.

Because this place is somewhat of a secret it makes the pizza even more special.

This pizza is really impossible not to love, if you like pizza. This is that greasy NY style, big slice, perfect cust pizza that you crave. 

If you're cool enough to find this place, welcome to the cool club but keep it a secret.

great place to get pizza late night. all of their pizza is very good. they're overpriced, but it's at the cosmo and you don't have to leave the strip so it's an understandable price to pay...and the lines get very very long.

Heard about this place from a co-worker and decided to track it down during a trip to Vegas. You'll find the unmarked hallway in the back of the restaurant area on the third floor. Check down the hall and you'll see it's lined with old record album covers, finished with a pinball machine. Make your way down and the smell starts to put a smile on your face.

Great recipe creations, I love pepperonis but decided to go for a sausage and pepperchinis slice, what an excellent decision. If I wasn't so lactose intolerant (thank you lactaid pills for allowing me to eat this slice of pizza) then I would have had another two or three pieces. I happened to run into my cousin on my Vegas trip and showed him the restaurant after he'd told me he'd never heard of it. 

If you're looking for a quick lunch or delicious late-night snack, look no further than Secret Pizza, you'll be thrilled to have an inexpensive, delicious meal

Went to Vegas for my 21st and my buddy from work would not stop talking about going to this secret pizza joint. By how much he was talking about it, I was getting pretty excited to go try it out. I waited til' our last day in Vegas as a sort of farewell meal. Well, as soon as that pizza touched my tongue, I was absolutely disappointed. The pepperoni was extremely salty and the pizza itself had a literal puddle of grease... No part of being in that little back room shack was enjoyable. Honestly would've rather had a Little Cesar's pizza.
Delicious - 30 minute wait for a whole pie forced us to grab by the slice ... Not optimal, but all slices were delicious and great, fresh ingredients.

After days of buffets, I was done and looking for some yummy comfort food.  I had been itching to go to Secret Pizza since I heard about it months ago, and I'm so happy that I found it!! This is thin crust pizza at its best.  Perfectly crispy and cheesy.  I had the white pizza and mushroom, both the BEST pizza I've had outside of New York (seriously)!  For $5 a slice, it was totally worth it.  The place really wasn't hard to find if you know where to go.  It's on the third floor between Blue Ribbon Sushi and Jaleo.  I know it's supposed to be "secret pizza," but I'm not saying anything that people at the hotel wouldn't know or you can't find through a Google search anyhow.

Not so secret, Secret Pizza!

Took us a good 360 spin around when we got to the 3rd floor of Cosmopolitan, but we found it! It's literally down the hallway in between 2 restaurants and it was a lot smaller than I expected. Luckily, there was no wait when we got there and was able order right away.

My friend and I ended up getting a slice of their White, Margherita, and a Sausage w\/ ricotta cheese. My personal favorite was the white pizza, but the sausage one definitely had more flavor to it. They fire it up in the oven for a minute or two so it comes out nice and crispy which is pretty awesome. When I asked for some banana peppers, they guy said they didn't carry that and ended up giving me some peperoncino instead (similar, but a little sweeter imo).

Each slice is $5.50 and with a drink our total came out to a little over $20. The slices are a pretty decent size - although they're more on the thinner side. Honestly, the price is pretty steep for a slice but if you're in Vegas...it's sort of a given. Might be back for more, but not if it's out of the way or if the line's crazy long.

Only hard to find if you're on the wrong floor like I was. No wait when I went, and probably one of the top 5 pizzas I've ever had. Get the white with sausage, and spring for a beer- basically the same price as a soda.

SO GOOD IT HURTS.

I got the white pizza and it hit the spot! I love the thin crust and how cheesy it was. I was a little drunk so I can't really describe it. But it was so good that I ignored the random guy that hugged me and told me happy birthday. All I cared about was my pizza.

My friends and I hit up Secret Pizza on our last trip to Vegas, and it surely didn't disappoint!
We had heard so much about it from friends, and on our last night out we stopped by around 2 am for a slice. The line wasn't real long when we got there, but it was out past the hallway by the time we left!
The whole experience is pretty awesome. You can't smell the pizza outside of the hallway, and there is no sign, so it feels like you've made a quirky little discovery when you pop in.
I am a pizza purist, so I stuck with a regular pepperoni. It wasn't the best pizza I've had, but it was pretty great! Not too much cheese or sauce, and it was so hot and fresh. We waited a couple minutes for a fresh pizza because they had just run out of the pepperoni, and it was so worth it.
I definitely recommend Secret Pizza to anyone, whether you're looking for a bite after walking the strip, or you've got the munchies after a few hours of partying. It's cheap, fast, and delish!

Secret Pizza is home to my favorite white pie in the entire world.  I recall that first 1.5 hour wait, the disheveled monstrosity that we received at the end of the wait (could THAT possibly be worth it??) and then the first sweet, sweet bites...  That was the moment when my entire pizza paradigm shifted and tomato sauce and parmesan were toppled in favor of garlic butter and ricotta.  Even though a single slice of this modern day wonder costs $5, I literally cannot leave Las Vegas without savoring a slice (or two).

Keep going past the pool table and turn right into the tunnel decorated with album covers.  Inside you'll find some possibilities for eating.  The night we went, there was a three-cheese pizza, combination, pepperoni\/ pepperoncini, and meatball slices to choose from.  Prices are about what you would expect for a good slice of pizza, making me feel that the $12 we paid for three slices was the best $12 we could have spent for a dinner on The Strip.  Open until 3:00, so you can stop by after spending time in the clubs or at a nearby bar.

Mmm... My first meal in Vegas was a $5 slice of pizza. I got the White Pizza, which had a strong garlic flavor and various cheeses with different textures. If the pizza doesn't have enough garlic flavor for you, they even have garlic powder on the tables and counters for you to add to your heart's desire. The best part of this place is that you can add toppings to your pizza even if you're just ordering by the slice!!
Solid, but not life changing. Good quality, but probably not worth the six\/seven bucks. Short lines when it's not drink-o-clock.

This is the best pizza I've ever tasted. I know my East Coast friends are a little skeptic about this assertion. I don't even know how to describe it or why it's so good. It just is. Go try it for yourself. If you can find it.... 

It's on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel. Just go up the escalators by the Liberace Rhinestone Rolls Royce on the first level or the escalators by the All Saints store on the second level. Look for the pool tables and there will be a hallway lined with vintage record album covers. It's next to a sushi restaurant. 

The service is always quick and friendly. The prices are a little steep for pizza and a drink. Almost $20 for 2 slices and 2 sodas. 

Please try this please and tell me if I'm wrong! If this is not the best pizza you've ever tasted...let me know where I can find better pizza!!

I tried the white pizza with mozzarella, mushrooms, and sausage. Overall, a very good pizza; the white sauce is creamy and has a lighter flavor than traditional red sauce and let the cheese and toppings shine through. Nothing bad to say about this place
One of the best secrets on the strip, pizza is good nice chewy crust but not like rubber heat lamp pizza. Any local that doesn't know about this place doesn't know the strip

The pizza here is pretty good but I just don't feel like it's anything special.  However, you can't beat a hot and cheap meal after a night at Marquee or somewhere else on the strip.  The service here is great and friendly but it's not like this was the best pizza I ever had.

You can order individual slices or a whole pie and you can even get 2L bottles of soda.  I had the veggie which was pretty good and the white pizza which was tasty but it was a huge greasy mess since its basically garlic oil and ricotta cheese.  The oil was literally dripping off the pizza and while its garlic flavored its also not very appetizing when it cools down from pipping hot.

This place is pretty darn popular so I think they should change the name to "was secret' pizza (I kid).  This is an experience you can't skip if you're visiting Cosmopolitan :)

Secret Pizza? More like Not-So-Secret Pizza... this place is most definitely the worst kept secret in Vegas.

My friends and I left Drai's Nightclub to take a cab to the Cosmopolitan and seek out this hidden gem. We waited ~40 minutes in line.

I don't really even know what I ordered, but it was a slice with red sauce, pepperoni, mushrooms, and some other toppings. It was really good. But I might just think so because I had a good amount of alcohol in my system. As soon as I finished my slice, I grabbed the crust off of my friend's plate and finished that as well. Heh...

$6 per slice. Not much seating. Take your precious pizza and go.

By the way, it's located on the 3rd floor somewhere in between two restaurants... not sure. I was intoxicated. Just follow the drunk people!

The pizza was pretty darn good. I don't know how high quality it was considering I was usually drunk as F and just trying to get some food before passing out.  This is new york style big ass slice pizza type.  I remember it not having any signs throughout the hotel how to get here.  It was just a long hallway with some guys behind the counter with a variety of pizzas ready for the hungry masses.  

They didn't have many fresh type pizzas but simply reheated what was pre made and might make a new one if they run low on a certain style.  They had a few places to sit and scarf down your pizza.  I'd say this had to be one or your cheapest late night options late night in LV.  This was especially great and convenient since I was staying in the hotel.  It allowed me to have drinks, pizza and stumble back to my hotel room.

The only thing secret about this place is how to get the damn water dispenser to work.

Every time I've been here, I end up looking like a retard sideshow pressing buttons on the dispenser while cursing, but nothing coming out. You think that's funny, try doing it drunk.........Yes, I was that girl. And every time, one of the guys behind the counter simply reaches over, press the same buttons I was fiddling with and *viola*.......H2O! ::derp::

Pleeeeease! Tell me how you did it!!

Judging from the 1300+ reviews, the cat's out of the bag so the lines are loooong after the club. Call ahead if you want a whole pizza, or just go at odd hours of the day. It's not the best pizza I've ever had -- though still pretty damn good -- but you can't beat the convenience and price when you want something to sop up the alcohol before Kaskade comes on. 

And if you STILL don't know where the place is, just follow the drunk folks up the escalators after you exit Marquee and you're gold.

I am amazed I found this place upon leaving Marquee one night last summer after a heavy night of partying. 

I've made several trips to Vegas since then and always make it a point to drop by for a slice and cup of PBR. 

Crusty crust and tasty toppings. Simple slice of tasty za. 
One of the amazing spots inside the Cosmopolitan.

Secret Pizza was hopping with clubgoers at midnight. I guess it's the place to be seen chowing down on greasy pizza. It's great that there's a good late night option like this, but the pizza was just so-so. I thought the pizza at Five50 (in Aria) was a lot better.

I've been to this place a few times now and always enjoyed it.  For me, it is the best place to go grab a quick snack at the Cosmo.  Yes, it is $5 a slice.  Yes, it is "just" above average pizza (it's Vegas!).  Yes, it is not a secret anymore and there are often lines, and yes, it still is hard to find even after coming here several times (maybe it's just me).  

With all that said, I keep coming back and there is something to be said for that.  What? I don't know.  I kind of expect to pay higher than average when in Vegas so I'm ok with it.  I also kind of expect to wait in line from time to time.  Maybe my coping skills are better than some other reviewers.  But, back to the food.  It's just above or slightly above average pizza.  But after a few drinks or a big win at the tables, and it is a slice from the gods.  After a loss at the tables, its the only thing to eat because there isn't much around cheaper or more convenient.  I would say they have a great business model!

Pros: convenient (if you are in Cosmo), relatively inexpensive, not bad quality, can feed you on your last $5 after taking a beating at the tables. 

Cons: kind of overpriced for what it is. I hate trying to find this place. 

Overall.  It doesn't matter what I say, or whether I like it or not.  If I'm staying at the Cosmo again, I'll be back.  If not, maybe not.  Love their concept though, and the guys working there have always been cool as heck.

came back to the cosmo for another weekend getaway
and were famished after our flight
ordered a pie and brought it back to our room to eat
mushroom, ricotta, sausage on one side and pepperoni on the other
delicious, but definitely not as good than eating it by slice
because the crust isn't as crispy

went back the day after for a slice
perfection

I've gone here maybe 3 times now. I love the pizza! Especially the sausage and pepperoni! The cheese pizza is also very good. 
I like to buy a whole pie and have it for breakfast too! It's even better the next day. A whole pie can easily feed 4-5 people. I know this because 5 dudes from New York came in and ate the whole thing! Yes, it totally reminded them of pizzerias from their home town of NYC! That says a lot! 
Yeah, you can have the high end stuff outside of this place, but the satisfaction will be the same and the pizza will be cheaper! You'll love it! Trust me! If they added more seating, 5 stars easy!

This pizza was great. Worth the "Secrecy". I totally wish they had seating inside (or more seating than 1 bar stool). I probably would have gotten another slice. But by the time I found somewhere to sit, I was too far to go back for more!

This is, quite frankly, the best pizza you'll find in Vegas, especially at these prices. The slices are large, filling NY style slices. I had the white and the meat slices, and each was great. The crust was nice and crisp, the cheese was good and warm. My wife actually asked to go back two more times just because it's one of the best, quickest, cheapest meals you'll find there at the heart of the strip. Plus, the place makes you feel like you've found some secret pizza parlor that was magically transported from Brooklyn to Vegas.

A good pizza to me is all about the crust.  It was really pricey for a whole pizza ($36) but the crust was really good! I love that they're open late so my friends and I were able to come after the club.  We phoned in our order and took the pizza back upstairs to our room.  With the phone in order, we waited for about 30 minutes.

CHEAP AND GOOD PIZZA

(drunk OR sober). 3rd floor of the cosmo. Gotta walk down this long hall and BAM a pizza place? yep. I feel like the definition of a hole in the wall. I had a slice of the mushroom pizza and it was delicious. My BF works at a pizza place so I get way too much pizza all the time, but this place was really good and I was really happy. They also serve Pabst beer in a red solo cup. Classy! Next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely come by again and try some of the other types of pizza.

Went back and tried the white slice. I am pretty sure it was crushed up angels, unicorns, and full on magic in my mouth.....so freaking good!!

I no longer care that this pizza is $5-$6 a slice..it's worth it!

This is really good pizza. I went twice while at my stay in the cosmopolitan, once in the day with no line and once at night when I had to wait close to an hour. The white pizza is by far my favorite. I feel a little weird paying $5 for a slice of pizza, but it's Vegas so everything is expensive. Also the slices are huge. Taking off a star for the price and the wait (thought the wait isn't really their fault)

Pizza was great (had the Margherita)!  The calamari was EXCELLENT!!!!!  Best calamari EVER!  Everytime I go to vegas I am getting the calamari!  EVERYTIME!!  

The only thing I hated was the seating arrangement.  I like a place with a lot of booths.

Service was great and drinks were nice and strong ;)

So good! $5 a slice and they are huge slices. Located on the 3rd floor of cosmopolitan. There aren't any signs, just look for a long colorful hallway that will lead you to secret pizza.

The sausage on the pizza is bursting with flavor. This is probably the best pizza I have ever eaten. The crust of the pizza is just perfect. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.

A definite must try!

Its definitely a neat little place to grab pizza. Located on the third floor near the sushi restaurant. Just remember its on the THIRD floor, I got lost the first time walking around on the second floor, but thankfully, people were kind enough to guide me there. 

The pizza crew here are friendly and seem pretty laid back. They greet you and help you quickly to get things moving. The atmosphere is pretty awesome. I enjoy the album covers lining the walls of the entrance way. There is seating inside the little pizza shop but its very limited. The pizza it self is okay, Its a big slice but thin...even with all the cheese and toppings. I highly suggest getting a whole pizza if you have enough people to share with or you can definitely try to eat it all yourself, you can do anything if you put your mind to it. 

Overall, neat little spot to try pizza and check out if you are ever in the area and remember, THIRD FLOOR!

Shhhhhhhhhhhhhhh....it's a secret. 

Great pizza! We got a few cheese and pepperoni slices to-go and they didn't make it very far. As soon as we got to the car...down the hatch. Thin NY Style Pizza done RIGHT! Not to greasy, not to dry, perfect size for the "fold-in-hand" style eating. Price was good, the counter staff was super nice. Excellent. We will certainly be back. Come hungry, don't expect to sit, if you do; eat then get out so others can sit - no lollygagging!

Pretty overhyped but the pizza does taste quite good! I don't think it's the best pizza I've tasted though. But they are open late so that's always a plus. The times I've been, there's never been a line. Great to go to for late night munching before or after clubbing at Marquee!

This place is hard to find, but you'll spot it because of the long line at night. We waited an hour and each ordered two slices of pizza. 

This was some of the best pizza ever! Crunchy, chewy, cheesy, hot, tasty, not greasy.  This is why pizza exists. I could have eaten an entire 18" pie myself. Secret Pizza needs to share their secret recipe. 

If the line wasn't so long, we would have snacked here every night. It was so good, we spent an hour talking about it.

There's just something great about an unpretentious hidden pizza counter deep within the Cosmo that serves absolutely delicious, mouth-watering, crusty slices of some of the best pizza I've ever had.  One slice with a Blue Moon filled me up.

I swear the guy behind the counter is related to Andy Samberg...I can't be the only one to think that.  Very nice guy who seemed to love his job or at least serving people this low-key, fantastic pizza.

The place opens at 11am and stays open till 4am - probably mostly for the Marquee club crowd.  I heard lines get out the door so if you want to come to this place - if you can FIND it - come early.

The allure of knowing something that only the "in the know" know has played into human behavior in seeking out food and drink since the time "Joe sent me" got people through the speakeasy door. Given the pizza joint at The Cosmopolitan is not listed in any of the hotel's customer collateral nor is it advertised on property and one has to both know it is there and how to get to it, my hubby and I figured this would be more the myth of "secret place" hype than good pizza. Happily, we were wrong.

Finding ourselves at the Cosmopolitan about 1:30 in the afternoon one day last week and hungry for just a little something, we went to the Pizzeria. What we discovered is this teeny place makes really good pizza. In fact, my Brooklyn born and reared hubby thought it a good rendition of New York style pizza and coming from him that is high praise. It was the chewy, foldable crust, he said, and just the right amount of sauce and cheese. 

A generous slice was about $3.50 so a good value for Las Vegas eats. Pies are sold whole too. 

The VERY little pizza shop has standing at counter space for maybe eight - and another two spaces that are low enough to be used by both people in wheelchairs and shorter people...love universal access like that. 

But you could not get my claustrophobic self to stay in that little space to eat, so we walked to the lobby outside the Pizzeria and enjoyed our slice in that "game room" setting with a pool table, board games, low tables, chairs and sofas scattered about and multicolored glass lit ceiling above. 

And here goes a nod to the very nice Security guy who walked over to talk to us. "Oh oh" I thought, "we're probably not supposed to be eating pizza here." But as it turns out, he wanted to simply ask how we liked the pizza and being from New York himself, he agreed with my hubby that it was very good indeed. He introduced himself as Chris (Cosmopolitan staff do not wear name tags - a tactic that is part of a service strategy to get the employees to introduce themselves to guests) and asked if he could answer any questions about The Cosmopolitan for us. That kind of friendly approach from customer facing employees was consistent with every one of our experiences at the hotel, by with way, with the exception of the staff at the Chandelier Bar on the second floor.  ( But that's another review.)  We made sure to leave the lobby table as clean as we found it. 

Pizzeria opens at 11a.m. and stays open until sometime in the wee hours of the morning. 

Here's how to get there (see photos included to illustrate): 

a) Take the elevator near the Chandelier Bar to the third floor. When the doors open you'll see the lounge with the pool table in front of you. 

b) Make a hard right hairpin turn as you exit the elevator and you'll be in the short hallway that leads to the tiny Pizzeria.  You'll see a pinball machine at the end of the hallway. ( If you make only a right turn as you exit the elevator, you'll end up at the hallway that dead-ends in a concourse of meeting rooms. Ask me how I know that. :-)  A hairpin right is the thing. )

c) The pinball machine you'll see in front of you as you make the hairpin turn is actually at the entry to the pizza place.

So there you go!  Mangia!
The best kept secret on the strip. The pizza is delicious and simple. The staff are friendly and quick, so the long line goes quickly. A must-go after a night out.

Secret Pizza, you sneaky little devil. This pizza joint, if I recall, is located on the 3rd floor of The Cosmopolitan. Once you step off the escalator, look for a nondescript hallway, no signs, no nothing but  quite possibly a looong line of people. Congratulations, you've unlocked their "secret" venue, now prepare yourself for a good 30 minute wait. I won't lie. It's pretty much torture, especially if you've found yourself here after club hours like myself. You can try your best to entertain yourself with the semi-neato-skeeto album covers but who are we kidding, anytime you get a whiff of that delicious pizza or someone exits the venue and walks past you in that narrow hallway, you're reminded how you're STILL in line and STILL not stuffing your piehole with, well, pie.

After you've managed to snake yourself to the end of the hallway, you can start eyeballing which pie is destined to be yours, individual slices or a whole pie? I opted for the latter and had to wait longer but it was worth it. I got half mushroom & pepperoni and the other half was ricotta and garlic. I enjoyed both types immensely but favored the white pizza and would gladly bathe in slices of this pizza - so good! Uber good!!

Pizza had a nice chewiness and the cheese was cheesy goodness. Definitely hit the spot! I ordered a large pizza and ducked out to one of the open tables just to the left upon exiting the hallway and inhaled my little slice of heaven.

Oh, by the way. You might see some unusual happenings while in line. For instance, one girl got to the cashier, turned around, lifted her dress and shook what her mama gave her.
