The pepperoni, sausage and banana peppers, and the ricotta were our faves, but you can't go wrong. Not too bad on pricing, especially for vegas. Also it's open 24 hours.  Brooklyn style and the crust has just the right amount if crunch. Staff us friendly. Clean.

Came back the following night and this time it was even better! Maybe this pizza just tastes better after a night out!
This time, I got the white pizza slice ($5.50). It was delicious. The sauce had a garlicky yet light flavor and the clumps of cheese was spread throughout the slice so evenly. I appreciate the fact that every pizza is so fresh but they also run out so quick that they have to keep making them.
The line was ridiculously long around 3am on a Friday, so expect your wait time to be close to an hour. The white slice was amazing and really hit the spot on a late Friday night.
That was an awesome slice of pie. I am very satisfied. I will be coming here every time I come to Las Vegas. It is always amazing when you find a special gem like this one.

Secrets don't make friends, so that's why I'm here to tell you allllll about it.

In my world, guys are natural-born pizza connoisseurs.  Therefore, any pizza rants from my guy friends are treated like the word of God.  When my friend told me that him and his bros were able to demolish a whole box of pizza from here, AFTER COMING FROM A BUFFET, I knew this place was legit.

Just order the white pizza with ricotta cheese and mozzarella, and you're golden.  It was greasy. It was cheesy. It was simple. It was one of the most delicious things I have ever put in my mouth.

Every pizzeria I go to now, I check to see if they have the white pizza, but sadly I haven't found an alternative in SF or Socal yet.

$5 for a slice of white pizza but it was a generous slice.  I did get lost trying to look for Secret Pizza, guess if it was easier to find, it wouldn't be such a secret.  Third floor, literally through an alley way.  Yummy cheesy garlicky pizza.  I think half the appeal is looking for it.
Their white pizza is amazing. Don't look up where this is- explore the Cosmo and stumble upon it!!! Tastes delicious after a night in vegas. The employees are also super nice.

I love this place and try to get there every time I'm in Vegas. It's also in one of the swankiest hotels, Cosmopolitan! I've waited in a long line and it is worth it. My only regret is when I get one slice and should have gotten two!

3rd floor of the Cosmo. The line was long. My expectations was even higher. I went and grab a slice of pepperoni. It was okay. The crust was good. Not greasy. The pizza itself was thin. I could eat 2 of these if I was drunk. 

To sum everything up, this place is good for post clubbing\/drunk food.

By far one of the best tasting pizzas ever!! If you are in Las Vegas and are hungry during the day or just simply stumbling out of the club\/casino in the late hours of the night, COME HERE! small hidden lil spot.
Crust is perfect, Cheese is perfect, toppings are perfect, Sauce is perfect, Garlic flavor is perfect, its all just perfect here! I love pizza, and this PIZZA is definitely in my top three!

Call ahead it's a trick to skip the ridiculous line.

Secret's kind of out this shop has been on the travel channel and food network. Doesn't beat pizza in manhattan, but beats any other pizza you could have in Las Vegas. Keep it simple just go with cheese.

Awesome pizza but long lines.

 My friend and I waited around 1pm and it took about 15-20 minutes to get our pizza with 3 people in front of us. The guy was also busy making pizza for a large group order. It was cool to see the guy making pizza. He didn't toss the dough. He just flatten and pushed out. 

The pizza was really good. Crisp pepperoni surrounded by oozing cheese and perfectly seasoned sauce on a crispy crust. Delicious! 

Another friend went at 1am and it took almost an hour for him to get a slice of pizza. He didn't care for the pizza too much. 

It's about $3\/slice for cheese and $3.50\/slice for one topping.  Great price for dining. Limited seats inside but a lot more outside.

Where else can you get the best tasting pizza in the world at 5am?! Of course, it's Vegas.

Secret Pizza has been there for me too many Vegas trips in a row. And every time, I have to end my night at Marquee with a giant white slice.

But please.. stop raising your prices :( 
$4+ for a slice!

Came here around 3am and the pepperoni slice ($3.75) I had was delicious. 
Some guy ahead of me asked the pizza guy: What's name of the place? 
"Didn't you see the sign outside?" 
No.
"Exactly."

I like the no frills atmosphere, and how they don't care anything but serving some good slices of pizza. Outside the shop, Cosmo has a billiards table set up and some comfy chairs and sofas for you to sit and relax. Neat.
Better than Pin Up Pizza, but nothing spectacular, just an average slice, especially when compared to New York pizza. The atmosphere is nice though with the music and the posters on the wall.

What a great hidden gem!  The pizza slices are large hot and delicious!   I tried the classic pepperoni and a three meat .  The place is small with no real tables just standing counter .  But you can step out into a lobby area where there are chairs and couches to relax in.  It is my favorite pizza place in vegas!

Our mission at the Cosmo was eggslut for brunch then pizza. I was so full after my egg sandwich I almost passed on a slice of pizza. So glad I didn't. I ended up sharing a pepperoni & pepper slice with my friends and it was so worth it. The slice was a little thin but perfectly toasted and crisp on the bottom. Next time I plan on getting an entire pie for myself.

I found this gem late one evening. It was hard to fine at first because no one in the hotel knew where it was located. Once we found it we enjoyed every bite. This was the closest to NYC pizza that I've found in Vegas. Wow this place was packed at 11 PM. The pepperoni and a cheese pizza was great and the workers were all very friendly. I will definitely return to this gem of a pizza shop.

Amazing pizza. White is the bomb and can't ever go wrong with pepperoni. This was my first visit during the day and walked right in.  Normally I go after clubbing and line is crazy long- but worth the wait.

Pretty good place for a slice of pizza! I enjoyed the Meatball ricotta but loved the sausage and yellow peppers! It had the perfect crust! Slightly crunchy and soft! I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas!

I know Vegas is a city that never sleeps but to find good food when you really cant drive anywhere after the club then Secret Pizza is the place to go to...if you can find it..But its not that hard when the line sticks out of this dark hallway.  The pizza was great.  Besides the drunk annoying people everywhere their pizza was great!!  The crust was perfect not to thick or dry.  The toppings were lay down thick and the cheese and sauce was amazing.  We ordered a whole pizza brought it out to one of the tables and just wen to town.  I must say that's the best pizza I have ever had after a long night in the club.  Try it out guys its worth the wait.

Eh, kind of maybe somewhat overrated. It's great late night drunk food but costs at least $4.50 per slice. Errr.... However, it's in the Cosmo so this doesn't surprise me.

Still, the product is a super greasy slice, not a gourmet pie. If they're going to play the "hidden gem" game, keep it cheap and gritty. This is not.

PIZZA PIPING! People call it "secret pizza." The receipt just reads, "Pizzeria." I'd visit Vegas just for this pizza. It'll set you back $5 dollars American for a slice of pepperoni pie. I got mine freshly baked. I honestly think it is a steal at its price. The service was very good. Haters gonna hate.

Ever since I heard about this place I couldn't wait to find it and try it!  It was worth the wait and the effort! We ordered two slices of White Pizza which was great! Thin, crisp crust that I could still fold slightly to eat like a taco.   

This Pizza was Garlicky and Cheesy! My two favorite things on Pizza, so I was in Heaven!  The only reason I can't give it 5 Stars is that my girlfriends PBR tasted horrible, like they need to clean their lines.  The place is very small, but there are a few Wheelchair  height spots at the counter.

Secret Pizza will be a must stop on my Vegas trips!

Nice pizza place in the cosmopolitan on the third floor hidden down a hallway.  Great service too. So I have to give them kudos for location and service and how its open late night after a night of partying it up at Marquee. 

I got two slices one plain cheese and the other garlic and cheese.  The slices were not that good for NY style pizza. The crusts were burnt and on top of that oil was dripping off both slices. I would only go back if I really had a craving for late night pizza and couldn't find another place open. I really wanted to like the pizza but I have to be honest to my fellow yelpers.
This place was so cool! The service was fast, the food was good, and everyone was nice. It was a little hard to find but I only knew because I looked at other yelp reviews before going here.

This pizza is OK  at best.

$3.50 for a "New York" slice that tastes nothing like what I got in all my time in NYC
$3.50 for a fountain-drink

-Save money, walk around the cosmo casino floor, get your drink and pop up and grab a slice, out of a group of 8, I was the only one that did not do that, the fountain drink comes in a red-dixie cup with no lid.


I understand for some, this is better than the chain food, but seriously, not the best pizza in the world.

The entrance can be hard to find, I was on the right floor but just confused with all the resto's, lucky for me, a security worker pointed out the entry. 

I am glad I can say I tired this place for the sake of all the people that go to Vegas and wish they could. But on my next trip, I will skip the Pizza.

I love this pizza joint! I love that it's hidden away. This place is simply "cool" and not because it's trying hard to be cool like so many places, there is some amazing album art on the walls, there are pinball machines, good music and the pizza is great (and cheap). It's great for adults and kids!

I guess it's not so secret anymore.  The line wasn't that bad when we went, and the pizza smelled pretty good from the hallway.  Inside, there are some arcade game machines, and the set up is similar to NY style pizza where you pick a slice (or you can order a pie), and they will heat it up for you.  

My mushroom pizza had been sitting out for a while, and they didn't heat our pizzas up adequately. The supreme and white pizzas my friends got were pretty underwhelming, as well.

It's nice that they're basically open all night, and it probably tastes better when you're more drunk, but this was definitely not what it was hyped up to be.

Great place for quick pizza places.
Very nice Italian taste and crust!

The pizza here is pretty good.  Price is high, but what you would expect from fancy-dancy pizza places nowadays.  

The slices were good.  They filled me up. They made me happy.  I was less grumpy.

Find it.  Play pinball if you can stand all the morons around you.  Be drunk.  You wont notice.

Pizza was yummy... 

I had the White Pizza which I really enjoyed!!  It had a garlicky taste and no red sauce!
My daughter had a silce of Cheese Pizza.  She said it was crispy and cheesy.

Their drinks are expensive but served in a Red Solo Cup!!

Secret pizza place located on 3rd floor at Cosmo. 

Premade slice place, with decent options.  NYC style. 

TIP: if you're looking for 3+ slices, just buy a whole pizza as the price will be the same.  ALSO be weary of weekend nights as lines will wrap long around the hallway.  It's a tight hallway to the place, so claustrophobic patrons may want to stay away as well. 

Flavor was good, but we were disappointed that we didn't order a whole pizza as the few slices we got weren't really filling enough.

Bruh. Secret pizza is some good ass pizza. 

No sign points you to it except for the giant line. The hallway is stacked with Italian album covers. Who cares about all this?

The pizza. Just get whatever piece of pie you want, you won't regret it. The mushroom pizza, sausage and peppercini and the cheese were all freakin tasty as hell. The cheese pizza was probably the best.

It's worth the line. That's all you need to know.

I often see huge lines coming from this place, so I decided to try it myself.  Here's what I observed: - Precooked pizza slices.
- Cold
- Reheated in an oven.
- Served to the customer on a plate.
- Charge: $6.

I'm used to paying 6 dollars for a whole medium pizza, so the same price for just one slice should have been the most-amazing pizza ever to grace my mouth.  But no.  I took one bite & it tasted a lot like Little Caesars pizza (chewy bread, barely-seasoned sauce, and congealed, stiff cheese).  I handed the pizza back to the clerk & walked-away.

All hype; 
No quality.
The next day I went to Mario Batali's Otto Enoteca to acquire some real pizza.
Pizza was just so-so but a great escape from all the casino and Vegas strip craziness.
Fun atmosphere, hidden hole-in-the-wall. Friendly employees. Pepperoni and meatball pizza was awesome.

The place is hidden down a small hallway in the Cosmopolitan and considering the rest of the decor in the hotel, this place doesn't seem to fit in, which is probably why it's not listed on any of the maps. The most important thing is that the pizza is so delicious. I'm so glad we went and grabbed a slice (or two in my husband's case) for lunch. Just don't expect to sit and eat because there are maybe 5 bar stools and you're lucky if you snag one.

You've gotta find this place! It's some solid pizza! Came here my first night in Vegas after playing some Sigma Derby (side note: if you don't know what that is, you need to find it in the MGM Grand... it's a really fun quarter game that those of us youngsters who visit Tahoe always love to play for hours at Montbleau... old school horse racing at its simplest!) I ordered the white pizza because of all of the reviews I read about it on Yelp and bf ordered pepperoni and sausage. Both are really great! Of course it's fun that it's kind of a secret although the line would say that it was not that secret at all!

Very good pizza!

The menu is limited, no ranch dressing.

We tried the pepperoni and peppers, white pizza, and cheese pizza.

The cheese pizza is solid. Not too much sauce and good flavor. Semi soggy first bites lead to a crispy outer crust. 

The white pizza was good, but not great. I was hoping for more flavor and it was good but not very flavorful.

(We have a by-the-slice pizza place back home that I'm partial to- they do a pesto pizza that is out of this world! I think all pizza joints need to have one "special" pizza that is stellar...)

We only had to wait 15 minutes in the long line to order and the guys working were very nice. Definitely check it out if you haven't!

They offer fountain soda in red cups, or a liter for $8 to go.

This place is A-OK, especially for drunken hungries. This place is "hidden" inside Cosmo but it's pretty obvious when people are constantly walking in and out some hallway with slices of boxes of pizza. 

The decor is pretty cool and there's a pinball machine in the corner. The seating is pretty limited but none of that matters because you're here for one and one thing only, their pizza. It's pretty good pizza, NY style thin crust that's reasonably large. It's quite expensive (like most things in vegas, also you're in Cosmo) for each slice and a whole pie. I've done it both ways multiple times and just get what you need. If you're going to feed a large group and can agree on flavors, just spring for the whole pizza instead of getting slice by slice which will definitely be more expensive. 

The reason why it's only 3 stars because it's A-OK for what it's supposed to be, quick pizza. One star is off for the price, and the other because of the RIDICULOUS wait sometimes. I've had them quote 2.5 hours for a whole pie, or you're waiting for like 30 minutes in line in heels after clubbing for pizza because surprise! everyone is drunk and hungry and need carbs ASAP just like you and had the same bright idea. My advice, plan ahead and better.

I thought this place was over-hyped and overrated. I think that it may be good for late night snacking or something, but I came here for dinner. I thought the pizza slices were good, but not better than good local places in LA or elsewhere. The real deal breaker for me was the pricing. Slices with toppings were $5-$6, fountain drinks were $4, and whole pizzas, while fairly large, were over $30. I'd recommend it if you're wandering by, but not worth a special trip. Also, don't forget to use your Identity card here (Cosmo's player card) to earn some points. I should also mention that this restaurant is not owned by a celebrity chef or anything, it is a one-of-a-kind store owned and operated by Cosmopolitan (itself owned by Deutsche Bank as of 9\/6\/2013).

I wasn't impressed.

During the start of a girls weekend in Vegas, we set our sights on Secret Pizza early on.  Once we "found it" (super easy to find), we walked down the album covered hallway to discover minimal seating and zero ambiance.  The pizza is about as good as an average NY pizzeria (which is to say, it's better than most places =P), so if you're looking for a slice of home, that is what you'll get.  Nothing too special, definitely solid, but this stop was definitely made for post Marquee fuel.  If you want better pizza spot with more ambiance, head over to the Aria and hit up Five50.

I was so HANGRY waiting in line after 20 minutes that I went to the "bathroom"  while wifey kept our place in line. Even though there was no wait at Scarpetta,  she insisted I hold off. 

The verdict: worth it having not been here before. Better than a nice quality plate of spaghetti? Maybe not.  But still worth it. 

White pizza check  
Sicilian   (great but too heavy for me) 
Sausage with peppers  
Complimentary pepperoni  (free is always delicious)

A tiny place hidden away at the end of a short hallway on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan just off a public seating area.  I didn't see a sign.  If you look down the hallway and see a vintage arcade game machine at the end, then you've found it.  

It's thin crust at $4.50 per slice of cheese pizza with $$ for extra toppings.  I thought it was awfully good....certainly better than the chain pizza you can get around where I live. Nothing fancy at all.....just good pizza.  It will be a regular stop for me from now on.

Came here again and ordered a whole pie to take up to the balcony this time. Not sure if it was because it was fresh or just slower but the mushroom pepperoni was so friggin good. Maybe it was the fake champagne bottle of sailor jerry n coke i was carrying around and getting plastered off or if they just made it way better. It made for great leftovers when we got back that night so it must have that the pizza was that good. Best pizza in Vegas.

Hole in the wall pizza place. Line was not long tonight and got my pizza right away. Got the cheese, pepperoni and white sauce slices. It is a little pricey, $5.50 for one topping slice but I think it's worth it. Not greasy and the dough is really good. Would come back.

I'm here now having some of the best pizza I've ever had in my life. Yes, depending on when you come there can be a little drama. Meaning a long line to get in the later it is in the night. I waltzed in at 11:30, didn't wait, and I'm having two amazing pieces of pizza.  I'm sure they're all good but I can't imagine getting anything but the sausage and pepperoncini or the pepperoni. #%*} amazing.
love this place! cheap and open nearly 24 hours. perfect place to stop by for a snack or quick meal.

Dammmmm GOOD!
Cons: strip prices, 7 chairs-grab one or stand up eating
Pros: crust, in the cool cosmopolitan , drink refills,

So taking our son to game works we decided to park @ Cosmo & eat-was $100 for wicked spoon buffet for 2 adults & child- so saved that for another time & had read about this spot on yelp-
Tiny hole in the wall-literally
Get it by the slice or order whole pie
Was 30+ min wait for whole pie so we ordered 6 slices + salad+ bottle of water + 1 coke=55$ish 
Like I said your on the strip so to be expected. Anyway..
Omg amazing crust on white pie- I can still taste it - ordered w sliced meatballs SOOO GOOD.
Bf & son had pep & mushroom they loved it & after "ciao ciao apizza " closed its been a hard sell for them to find decent pizza
The spot right outside is so chill w a pool table - great for a date or chill w friends

Secret because you won't find signs for it and it's difficult to find...it's hidden down a long hallway. I'm not going into detail though, because I don't want the lines to get even longer!! ;) which takes me to, not so secret because of the long line you have to wait in most of the time...
It's a grab and go kind of place. Buy, by the premade slice or wait 25 minutes for a full custom pizza.
No tables and chairs to sit at, only standing shelves to eat at if you're going to eat there. A couple pinball\/video games take even more space away from the standing area.
Great pizza! Great crust and dough. I had a supreme and a Sicilian slice...both Excellent! I don't eat a lot of pizza, though I love it. Pizza can leave my stomach bloated and intestines crazy the next day due to all the grease and oil. This place didn't do that to me. Despite having full flavor you'd and expect from a good pizza, and it didn't seem to lack on the cheese and grease, it also didn't leave me the next morning regretting my bad eating choices. Lol.

This place really is a secret. My friends and I tried looking for it while running into a security guy we asked if he knew where it was and he DIDN'T. He also mentioned we were the second group that asked him that. What the? Don't you work here? 

This "secret pizza" place is located on the THIRD floor of the Cosmo on the east tower. It is toward the end, next to a cafe\/bar? I can't remember what it was exactly since I was super excited to see the hallway! Walk down the long hallway with ads\/posters on both sides of the wall. It will look like an arcade inside. 

The pizza is really good. Of course not as good as the real NYC pizza but I love how crispy the dough is! The homemade sausage is pretty good as well! Can't complain about the sauce either! :) you should definitely give it a try if you're staying at the Cosmo or nearby!

Definitely a good place to go if you're just escaping Marquee. And I know you just got out from the horrendous stairway, so now you're suddenly starving. The sweet smell of cheese and tomato sauce isn't helping, just follow your nose and it will lead you to the secret hallway to the place they call Secret Pizza.

If you found the secret because the line is a mile long, sorry it's going to feel like a century to get in. I would avoid it between 12-2am, but they close at 5, so get your timing right! You can always call for a whole pie. The prices are pretty cheap for Vegas.

For those not staying at Cosmo, it's great because there is plenty of seating outside.

Delicious Pizza! Having the munchies after a night of clubbing at Marquee or just plain hungry? drop by this little hidden place. Find the doorway and walk through that corridor, you'll see and smell the pizza! 

It isn't too expensive for a slice, $4. Definitely worth getting a pie if you're sharing with a group, its cheaper that way.

SOOOOOOO GOOOD....even when you are drunk or sober!  

The wait can be very long after the party.  So just go there before 3am!

White Cheese is the best!

Secret Pizza is delicious.  I had the White pizza, I think it had goat cheese on it, so lots of flavor.  Not a lot of seating, line can get pretty long too.  There are some great living room set-ups near by for sitting.

THIRD FLOOR. Every. Single. Time. I walk around the second floor not understanding why I am so lost. This place is amazing though - a little hidden oasis (that it seems everyone knows about but it is still never packed). The only time I've ever seen a line (nearly out the door!!!) was at 3 am one day and I'm not quite sure why. It was a sad day indeed, though.

It is the perfect stop on the way back to the hotel after a long night out, for sure. Usually plenty of space to stand at the counter and shove some pizza in your face so you can go to bed full and happy. Plus, $6 for a giant slice of pizza in Cosmo is NOT a bad thing!

Over rated is what comes to mind when I think of this place.  It may be because there is no real good pizza places here in vegas so people rate this place higher than normal the pizza is average at best. The sauce is bland and the cheese seems to be way to greece and takes away from the the taste of the pizza

I love this place! When you're wandering through the Cosmo, feeling broke as a joke after a night of gambling and\/or partying, what a sight for sore eyes this place will be... once you find it, of course! Once you make your way through the narrow corridor lined with record covers, you'll approach what may be the most deliciously crispy pizza crust in all of Las Vegas!

The prices are dirt cheap, the people are friendly, and they're open til 4am. How can I keep something so wondrous a secret???

It really is a secret. It's not listed on any maps or directories at the Cosmopolitan and casino staff won't tell you where it is. "It's a secret," they say with a wink. It's fun to look for it. 

Once you find it -- down a hallway lined with records -- you feel as if you've been transported to a different place. It's a typical hole-in-the-wall pizza-by-the-slice joint. Minimal seating, loud music, arcade games, people folding slices of pizza and stuffing it unceremoniously into their mouths. There's nothing really special about it, yet there is -- because it's hidden inside a swanky casino. It has a magical quality in that it doesn't feel like you're in Vegas at all. It's noisy & crowded -- but it's the quietest place on the strip. Worth checking out, for sure. 

Three stars because the pizza is just okay.

Ok, I've eaten here 3 times and it has pros and cons. I would give it 4 stars but can't do so with a straight face cause of the prices. 

Pros about this place is the pizza is very good. I don't even usually eat crust but I do here. It is thin, and delicious. Nice Variety of toppings offered. 

Cons are way, way, way over priced. A slice of cheese is $4, I usually get a 2 topping slice and it is $5.50, good pizza, but not that damn good. I have eaten here 3 times cause late nite when at cosmo and you are hungry, it's good eats and I make myself forget I am getting ripped off for a slice of pizza. A 2 litter bottle of soda here is $6.50. I never buy the 2 litter soda, but had to note the price to show how absurd the pricing is. A whole pizza with 3 toppings is $30. Yup, so much for trying to get the whole pizza to save some dough, no pun intended. I would eat here more, but the prices are ridiculous.

Honestly, nothing special. First thing that popped in my head... the pizza from Costco tastes better. It's very over priced. My husband and I bought 3 slices total and one soda. That was $22. Honestly would not go back. 

If you're looking to buy a whole pizza, expect to pay anywhere from $27-35. Sodas are $4 each (a red solo cup full).

Born and bred in NYC! ok....not really, lived there for about 5 years, but hey, one thing I did gain was a decent level of pizza knowledge, and one thing I can say is this place does NYC pizza. Soooo good, went there both nights we were there. Late night joint, definitely a lot of the nightlife crowd filling this place up, but I will say, the pizza with the italian sausage was sooooo good. Highly recommend, Secret pizza, not so SECRET anymore, especially when you see a line coming out of a small hallway

I was so excited to try this pizza place after my friend told me about it because it was hidden and it had amazing yelp reviews! But I was disappointed. It was a lot of fun to find and I love the concept of the the best kept secret, but this really is not what it is.

The service to start with was pretty shitty and probably discriminatory. My friend and I are in the service industry so we would never be one of those rude or extremely picky guests so I know it had nothing to do with our personalities. We witnessed guests in front of us receive friendly service from the cashier lady's good side. With us, she rolled her eyes and rushed us. I was prepared to let that go, given extremely good pizza.

Annnnd the pizza was okay. It was nothing to rave about. I might be bias because I favorite NY style pizza and this was just not close at all. The crust was plain, not enough sauce or cheese and the topping was okay. 

It was a fun little hunt inside the Cosmo though, just wish the treasure tasted better.

After a long night of clubbing at Marquee, nothing beat the secret pizza place at 5am.  The wait is long and it will take hour(s) to get a slice of pizza but it's worth it.

Better yet, if you have a room at Cosmo, just order the pizza for delivery to your room.  It will take an hour or so but at least you can relax in your room while you wait for pizza.

Yes, it's secret and it's hard to find but once you find it...PIZZA!!!

Some of the best pizza we have ever had from one of the best pizza shops in one of the best cities in the world!

After seeing Secret Pizza on Travel Channel's 'Secret Eats' with Adam Richman, we were on the hunt! Taking a look at hints on Yelp, we quickly found the spot! It really isn't that hidden, but for unsuspecting and not-so-curious guests, it is easily missed. Take a hallway filled with records and old band photos down to a New York style pizzeria with arcade games, a simple menu, and plenty of options!

We ordered the best of course: a slice of White and a slice of Ricotta-Sausage! 
Let me start off by saying the crust on these pizzas is superb. fantastic. amazing! So thin yet so crispy, nicely charred, and great flavor!
The white pizza was oh so cheesy, oh so garlicky, and oh so fantastically amazingly delicious!
The ricotta-sausage was oh so cheesy as well, and the sausage was magnificent! The best sausage on a pizza I have had yet! Nice spice, juicy, and paired well with the ricotta!

This is an absolute must for any pizza lover!

We probably got in line around 10pm on a Saturday night. Line actually moved fairly quickly. And the location, not very secret due to the line. Thanks to Yelper's photos, I found all the landmarks to follow and found our way through the Cosmo.

Within 15-20 minutes we were at the counter to order. Crap. They ran outta White Pizza. Another 20 minutes wait. Shoot me. So, my hubs orders the pepperoni and I get the Sicilian. Big mistake on the Sicilian. Thick, bready pizza crust with just a bit of the "white" pizza part - which is mozzarella and ricotta I think. However, the pepperoni was super crunchy and chewy and it totally did not say in the middle (hate that). We liked the thin crust pizza we went back for another slice of cheese. Delicious as well and piping hot. Each slice is about $5 after tax.

This place is like an easter egg you'd find in a videogame. It took a while to find but was so worth it.

We ordered one large pepperoni and one large cheese pizza. The wait was average, at about 20 minutes, but we were very hungry so it seemed like forever. Each pizza was 10 slices, and since there were five of us, we each got four slices.  Not eating the crusts, I was barely able to finish my four slices and felt extremely full afterward, which is uncommon for me. Most of my friends were not able to finish their slices as well. The pizzas were not too expensive either, so the price to portion ratio was great.

I absolutely recommend checking this place out. Besides the good food, the place itself is an experience. I won't spoil too much (although I'm sure the pictures online will), but just for the environment this place was worth it.

Dear West Coaster,

You judge the tacos. We judge the pizza.

Sincerely,

East Coaster

PS--Crust was good....but the oil slick is still fresh in my mouth.
It's open until 4am and it serves greasy, hearty, delicious pizza - That's all you need to know goodnight.

Best pizza I have ever had besides homemade pizza. I crave this pizza and wish they would open one up in Los Angeles. I would be there at least once a month (I would say once a week.. But I'm not tryin to get all chubbers... No body got time for that) IF YOU ARE IN VEGAS GO HERE!!! don't even question it. JUST GO!

Don't really think its a secret anymore. Everyone I think knows about this place. if you are at the cosmo, you should try it if you are on budget. 
Good thin crust pizza. long lines after peek club hours. would I wait in the long lines?? probably not after having it so many times.
If you have a big group, save money and call ahead a whole pie. you can do half and half of different toppings\/sauce. I really love their white pizza. my brothers like the simple pepperoni.
Secret pizza was delicious! Ate the mushroom slice and it was comparable to any NYC slice. The line was a bit long, but worth the wait for a late night snack.

Venturing out on the strip after the New Years Eve countdown, we searched for Secret Pizza. We searched all over and probably over searched for it. After the drawn out hunt for Secret Pizza, we ran into your typical drunk New Years d-bag who clearly drank way too much with a side of praying the d-bag doesnt refund his drinks (If you know what I mean), you start to think is it worth it? It wasn't only us, the couple behind us was saying "this better be the best damn pizza in the world". Yea... The d-bag was smashing his head into the wall and after getting out of an unfortunate situation in the making, we each get a pepperoni and veggy slice and it's a very very good thin crust pizza; probably the best I have had in a long time. The pepperoni was definitely better than the veggie but overall pretty good. 4 stars!

The pizza is delicious! Especially the white one. Perfect spot for a quick bite to end a night of fun in Vegas... But I am leaving 3 stars because of the service. 
The guys there tought they could over charge us and that we would not notice it. Also, we asked if they had any spicy sauce and their reply was very rude... But the pizza is really, really good!

There is a reason why people all over the US open New York style pizzerias. There's few things more delicious than some cheese, tomato sauce and bread put together. And secret pizza combines all of these items traditionally and beautifully. New York style Pizza should mix fresh ingredients, a nice crunchy and doughy crust with tasty cheese, and this spot is definitely the best New York style I've had west of the Mississippi. If I close my eyes, I'm transported to a more innocent time, of accents, train rides and being back home. This pizza is worth the trip to vegas even if it's super expensive for a slice.

Oh by the way, it's located on the third floor of the cosmo near the shops and restaurants side, not the convention side. If you see a Japanese restaurant there should be a half right next to it with records lining the walls!

Tried this place for the first time about a week ago. It's not much of a secret, seeing as though I've heard about it a long time ago, but I guess the "secret" comes from no signage and it being down a long hallway on the 3rd flor of the Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas. The pizza was very good. I had a slice of white pizza and a slice of sausage and peppercini. Now, the pizza was very good, but this is in a city full of horrible pizza. Also, the pizza is pricey, about $6 a slice, and $30.00 for a 16inch pie... Worth checking out if you're a Vegas local or a tourist in the area. There is no seating in the shop but plenty of seating in front of the art gallery\/showcase common area a few feet away from Secret Pizza's entrance.

While stumbling out of Marquee like a hungry zombieeee moaning "I neeeeeeed fooooooooood," a friendly (intoxicated) man directed me and my girls to SECRET PIZZA. The walk there is always a little hazy so I can't really help much on any specific direction towards the place, BUT it's on the 3rd floor at the Cosmo if that helps! New york style thin crust pizzas that surpass all expectations. The wait is always excruciating because once that scent of that damn pizza hits your damn nose you just want to gobble a slice whole right then and there, BUT BE PATIENT you'll get to the front of the line eventually :)

Thanks to Yelp for suggesting this pizza spot in Las Vegas. As others have said it is a little hard to find, but worth it. Very flavorful thin pizza for a decent price.  

The spot is located on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel\/Casino. It is to the right of the Japanese restaurant and has no signs. Best to order well in advance if you want carry out. 

The line for walk in guests could take a while.

The best pizza in Las Vegas hands down. DO yourself a favor and call and order a whole pie. Give them 30 min to make it and go pick it up. You will want more that one slice and you will want the rest for breakfast. Beware it is addicting!

This was our best food find in Vegas to date! My friend and I were starving at 2am and not up for a mediocre buffet. Yelp recommended  this place. The directions were confusing so we called and  the friendly staff told us they were in The Cosmopolitan on the 3rd floor.  Upon reaching the 3rd floor no signs could be found at all. A nice dressed hotel attendant recognized we were lost and flagged us over. We said Pizza? He directed us to a small hallway and said "it's a secret" with a smile,  The line was long filled with lots of young dressed to Party.  We were tired  and debating if we wanted to wait the 30 min. The young couple in front of us said we should as it was there 2nd time back and it was worth it. So glad we stayed. The white pizza was amazing and the crust perfect. We came back again today and are taking a whole pie home. The price is reasonable, the  staff is super friendly at all hours of the day and the quality is superb! Thank you Yelp

Believe the hypeee!! This place is soooo good.  My friends have been telling me that this place is amazing.  And usually when that happens I build up this high expectation that restaurants tend to not meet.  But this place did!!! Actually it was even better than I anticipated.  MUST GO!!  Especially if you're just leaving Marquee, it's a must :)

Aside from the Wicked Spoon, the Cosmo doesn't have many places I want to eat. My family wasn't in the mood for an overpriced meal, so we just wandered around the hotel looking for places to eat.

Then we saw a weird little hallway that kind of looked like it led to a bathroom, and I needed to pee so we checked it out. But luckily we found secret pizza!!

The white pizza is delicious, and all the others are as well. It's cheap for Las Vegas, and at night you just want some greasy pizza. My family ordered a couple of slices and just ate while standing in the store, but we decided to get a whole one to take back to the room, so we got the deluxe (or supreme, forgot which) pizza. It was really good! Crisp crust, even delicious the next day when it was cold.

As a few Yelpers have noted in previous posts, the actual name of the pizzeria is Nico's, but I will always remember it as "Secret Pizza".When you walk by, it's easy to miss. But take the time and enjoy the many record album covers that adorn the walls. I busted a gut, for sure. That hallway will lead you to a pinball machine and voil!, you've found your pot of gold. 

Staying at the Cosmo, my husband and I decided to take full use of our amazing room and bask in the glory of pizza on our balcony overlooking the Bellagio water show. In about twenty minutes, our pizza was ready and we were on that elevator so fast. The pizza was very good and a nice break from formal dining on the Strip. Highly recommended for those general hankerings for pizza in Vegas.
Great thin crust pizza.  open late night... the lines do get really long.
Pizza is great, service is a joke.  Was there at 5pm and took way too long.  Need a staff overhaul
Pizza's pretty greasy, but the slices are large and could definitely satisfy those drunken munchies.

Never order a whole pizza. It takes the clowns working here about an hour to make.

We watched pizza after pizza be handed out to people who ordered after us.

Terrible customer service.

This place is a little hard to find even when you're given directions.  There are No physical signs.  It kind of cool though when you do find the trail.  I noticed some red pepper, powdered garlic, and cheese jars on a fancy table and then smelled the pizza in the air.  I followed my nose down a long corridor that opened up to this little pizza shop.  The pizza was ok.  I have had better.  Nonetheless, I bet it tastes great at 3 am after a long night at the clubs!

So SALTY, it's inedible.

I wanted so badly to like this pizza. I ordered a whole pie with pepperoni and sausage (in good faith that Yelp couldn't possibly steer me wrong)--huge mistake. It tastes like the top came off of a salt shaker and dumped all over the pizza. Tried picking off the toppings, but still horrible.

We managed to choke down one slice each. We threw out the other 80% of the pizza. Literally inedible. Cant believe we blew 35 bucks on this massive salt lick. My tongue still burns from the salt.

Do yourself (and the Yelp community) a favor and keep this place a secret!

Down a dark and dank corridor hides a pretty yummy slice of pizza.  Luckily we went during the day at around 2pm...so we missed the lunch rush and didn't have to contend with the after club drunkos.  At first I had no idea where I was going because as you walk down the corridor all you see are pinball machines---so at first I thought I was going to a game room, but then just as I turn the corner---I am greeted by a happy go lucky pizza dude.

I tried the white pizza and hubby had the meat lovers---they were both very good and surprising not super greasy.  We both finished our slices---completely.  The white pizza has 3 or 4 different cheeses including ricotta, mozzarella, and some other cheeses that elude me right now--but drizzled on top if some sort of garlic oil.  Yum!  The meat lovers had sausage and pepperoni.  I didn't want to wash it down with any lively libations or pop, so just asked for water---which was surprising right next to the register at a cold water cooler.  The pizza dude was very nice and offered us up cups of ice.

I will definitely stop by here again on my next visit.  Quick, yummy, and fun to know we found the secret pizza in the fancy schmancy hotel.

Call ahead and order a pizza! 

Secret is a solid pizza place and probably isn't much of a secret anymore but you will find that it's a hole in the wall with a long line leading through it. The pizza is pretty darn amazing after a long night. 

How it works is you wait in line and when you get to the front you can either create your own and order a whole pizza or you can choose from the slices they have out. Somewhat greasy but when it's 4AM, who gives a damn! Honestly you can't go wrong with any of the precut slices. The line also moves at a decent pace so don't be scared, it really isn't bad.

Definitely slightly pricey for pizza but it's the strip and basically one of the few places for cheap eats on the strip. Only warning is if you don't like ricotta, make sure to order a slice without ricotta.

Got to check this place out. I found it a few years ago while out here on vacation. Being a pizza guy I'm always looking for a decent pizza. This is NY style big slices. It's going good stuff. Hidden away in the cosmo on the third floor. Depending on times the can be a wait or not. Strictly take out or eat standing along the walls. A little pricey being in he hotel but still best around for the buck.

We stumbled out of Marquee at about 4am...

We heard about the secret pizza place earlier on in the day and we were on a mad pizza hound hunt after partying all night.

We FOUND the hidden pizza grotto but it was CLOSED. The cashier was closing up shop and the LAST 9 VIP pizzas were being made for some celeb staying at the hotel. The pizza maker was NOT a happy camper.

All we could hustle was a piece of cheese cake from the freezer...until somehow by the grace of God and our (more my sisters) charm we managed to pull it off. The pizza maker wanted us out so he gave in. haha!

He let us have the first pizza that was ready and we got cheesecake, too! HEAVENLY!! Gooey Cheese pizza hot off the oven and right into my BELLY! 

The cashier and the pizza maker were total darlings and I commend them for being such good sports. They have to deal with drunk chicks, drunk guys, late night celeb requests and so much more in Vegas. 

We took their pictures and will pay them a visit next time BEFORE 4am. 

Viva Las VEGGGGASS!
Pie was done perfect hot, crispy crust and just the right amount of grease. I'll be back

This place would be awesome if you had only had Pizza Hut. 

I HONESTLY don't understand this hype. 

Ultra long lines.

No seating.

Always out of things.

And truly mediocre pizza.

Go somewhere off strip if you want late night food, this is a waste of time

We went to the Secret Pizza for a quick lunch. It's actually not that hard to find. It is located on the third floor near the other restaurants. The entrance, a long unmarked hallway decorated with records, is next to the glass elevator.
The restaurant is very small. There are not a whole lot of seats. The decor is a throwback to the 1980s and 90s. Including the music, an arcade video game machine, and two pinball machines. It was not busy when we went, around 2 PM on a weekday.
You can order pizza by the slice, which costs around 5 to 6 dollars, or a whole pie. The friendly workers will pop your slice of pizza in the oven to crisp it up. This is a very nice touch. The pizza is New York style, with a super thin crust, and high-quality toppings. The sauce was flavorful, the cheese was delicious, and the toppings extremely tasty. The crust was chewy, but super crisp on the bottom. It really hit the spot! Tastes exactly what NY pizza should taste like, in my mind.
We tried three flavors: the combination pizza, the sliced meat ball and ricotta cheese, and pepperoni and mushroom. The combo pizza had the most flavor, but the other two were also outstanding. They also have a vegetarian combo pizza and cheese pizza for vegetarians out there.
Drinks are kind of expensive at four dollars for a soda. But hey, this Vegas. Definitely recommend this place if you are a fan of New York style pizza and want a quick and relatively inexpensive bite to eat.

Best damn pizza I've ever had!!! It's s legit secret as there is no sign advertising it and is tucked away down a small hallway. The pizza ks phenomenal, reminds me of home, greasy New York style slices. Been to Vegas twice now and have had it multiple times. Can't go wrong!

Maybe I wasn't in the clearest state of mind, but I know that when I started eating the pizza it was delicious. 

We tried going to this place one night and the line was crazy crowded. Luckily in the same trip we decided to check it out again and this time there was almost no line. I didn't see a menu so I just looked at what pizzas they had available. I opted for the pepperoni\/sausage slice. From what others said, they usually pop it back in the oven for a quick reheat, but I think with the turnover and how quickly people were coming, the pizza was still fresh out of the oven and didn't need a reheat. 
This place makes no sense. There is no sign and the hallway is super long. They even have like a pinball machine? Totally doesn't fit the lavishness of cosmo either. It was like 3-4 dollars a slice and served on weak paper plates. 

Although a bit greasy, it was really good. Totally hit the spot and even though I wasn't hungry, I really wanted to get another slice. We ate right outside the pizza joint because it was too small and crowded inside.

This place was a life saver after walking around the huge hotel trying to find Rose. Rabbit. Lie only to find out it was closed for the night. Someone pointed us towards Secret Pizza and it wasn't bad. I wouldn't say you have to have this when you come to Vegas, but definitely good pizza. A tad bit greasy for my liking. The line took about 20 minutes around midnight and they only have soda and a couple beer choices. Everything is handmade right in front of you while your waiting which is cool.

After a long night out and a few drinks at The Chandelier (also in Cosmo), Secret Pizza hits the spot. I had the deep dish while my friends got the pepperoni and were still raving about it the next day. All in all, a solid pizza place for those early morning noms.
The pizza is mediocre and the line is usually ridiculous!!!! But if you're looking for something cheap and good this is the place to be!

i'm gonna be flat out honest..I was piss drunk when I had this pizza but luckily I remembered to check - in on yelp or else I wouldn't have even remembered coming here. This was after the Jermiah Dayclub so you can't blame me :P But from what I remember, it hits the spot when you have the drunchies or for a late night snack! The grease and savory-ness will satisfy your late night cravings!

Our group decided to order a whole pizza and it ended up taking foreverrrrr before it was done. I don't blame them though since they're always floooded with tons of customers. 

The cool thing about the box they put it in is that it can be disassembled so you can use it as plates!
Expensive like everything else in Vegas but great pizza. The secret is out because the line is always long.. but worth it great pizza..

I felt like I HAD to go here when everyone was mentioning the "secret" pizza place.  Following my fellow Yelp-ers directions, we stumbled upon this place and the smells were amazing!

I kept it simple and we got a slice of the white pizza and the regular pepperoni pizza (we had just eaten at Pink's so we were a bit full).  Brought the slices back to the hotel (mistake, btw.  I should've eaten it right away.  They're best when hot from the oven!) and devoured it.  

The food was soooooooo awesome and easy on the wallet.  I definitely wanna go back!

Right to the point: One of the best pizza joints in Vegas. The crust? Perfect. The flavor: UNREAL. This is that pizza that you don't feel guilty after eating because every calorie is worth it. The staff is a no BS quick NY style (how it should be). Everyone in Vegas should experience "Secret" pizza!

I am in no way a pizza connoisseur.  You can probably compare my palate for pizza to pure vanilla; I'll eat any toppings, eat any style crust, order delivery or sit in a restaurant...in the end, most of it is just pizza to me.  So in my book, you've created something special when you stand out above the rest.

Now just because I'll eat anything on a pizza doesn't mean I don't have some preference.  I'm always happy with sausage and mushroom on my pie.  During my first visit my buddy and I ordered a sausage, mushroom and ricotta pizza.  This...was...divine (to quote a fellow yelper).  It is a New York styled pizza, a bit light on the sauce, thin and droopy if not folded in half, and has this magical crust that remains soft on the inside and has a bit of crunch on the outside.  Note that I said New York styled; I've never been to New York or had their pizza, so I can't say if it's real or not!  What I do know is that my taste buds screamed for more pizza after that scalding first bite (guys never learn, do they?).  

On my second visit I placed two orders, a sausage, ricotta and garlic pizza; and a slice of mushroom and cheese to hold me over until our personalized pie was done.  I will say this: if you order one of the premade slices that is already sitting out, you're in for a lot more crunch than if you order a whole new fresh pie.  So bring a friend or two and go for fresh, if want that easy foldable pizza.

Another thing to note is that on my first visit, the chefs were cutting up actual sausage links for our pizza (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=ZT3AiU5KP2xY-mJsXmNZnQ).  Not so on the second visit  (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=NBkD80-Yb6ykjKGuQctSoA).

All in all this has become my favorite pizza place in Vegas, one that I perpetually crave for (What?  Can't you go for some pizza at any given moment?)  No doubt about it, this is a repeat eat!
Great pizza after Fat Tuesday & Haze. I ordered the combination - very tasty & crust was perfect. I should've eaten there again before I left Vegas! Will definitely get a whole one next time...

Love the New York style pizza. It's on the third floor with some other restaurants. No signage. Just look for a hallway of records. Very casual spot. Pizza was good. Around $5-6 slice, which is decent. $4 for soda in a red solo cup, not cheap but it's vegas.
yay best place to get some awesome tasty pizza and cheap ! while gambling in the cosmopolitan  ! love this place!

Yummmm!  The Cosmo is our favorite hotel in Vegas...  Has the best pizza...  The best Tapa's restaurant...  The best concert venue...  

We love the white pizza and sausage with ricotta but even the plain cheese is excellent. 

I won't lie...  It's a bit pricey but worth it!

It's a must every time we go Vegas!!

Wish there was one in So. Cal!!

This pizza is amazing! Everything about it is right. The crust is absolutely fantastic! Just enough crunch, but still soft. I had a slice of the white and it was to die for! I will be heading back for another slice before my trip is over! Oh and it is really not that hard to find lol

Vegas just wouldn't be the same for me without multiple visits to Secret Pizza! It's been a good two years since my last trip to Sin City and I'm proud to say that it's still the real deal! I took a girlfriend here with me on our first night and at 3am it was still open and still in the same spot on the 4th floor of the Cosmo. She marveled at how there's no signage, no listing, and I replied "That's why it's a SECRET! Lol" Even at 3am there's a long line but thankfully everything moves pretty quickly. True to Vegas party scene everyone in line with us was pretty much wasted and the folks behind us were obnoxiously drunk. 

We finally got to the front and the pizza guy chit chatted with us about what slices they were offering at that time. I honestly marvel at how nice everyone is at Secret Pizza because if I had to deal with all the tomfoolery I don't think I'd be nearly as patient. We each got two slices and a Coke to go. The prices have gone up from $3.50 to $4.75 per slice with an additional $.50 per topping. Still not so bad when you consider that you're in a very touristy area and it is 3am. 

Overall still a really great experience and literally a "hidden" gem on the Las Vegas Strip. We came back the next night again for Secret Pizza as we were hanging out at the bar and my girlfriend came back a third time the next night because she wanted to make sure she got another slice before we headed back home! Now THAT is some gooooood pizza folks! May you be very lucky during your trip to Vegas and may your stomach be blessed with the deliciousness of Secret Pizza!!!
Great pizza. Reasonable. Get the meatball. Rather hidden.

It didn't take long to find this "Secret Pizza'' establishment in my drunken state. But yea it was good pizza. The service was friendly and its a cool little spot to chill and have a nice slice of pizza and get out of the Vegas heat.. 

I shall return to this place.. Most likely drunk again lol..

Typically a short line and the cheapest good food left on the strip. $5 for a slice of white pizza and their draft beer is cheer than anywhere else I've found on the e strip with food. Overall good food and good experience

In a town where things stay a secret, it was nice to find something worth sharing. I'm that snobby NYer. I judge every slice of pizza that isn't up to the NY standard.

Can you imagine the elation when I not only discovered this "secret"...shhh! But, pizza outside NY that is so good it tamed my snob.

Look for the long hallway strewn with vintage pictures and faint peek-a-boo of a pinball machine. Those context clues will lead you the best pizza Vegas has to offer.

All I ask is you get the Sicilian slice and don't use knives or forks please!

This is very secret place, they have no sign, its very difficult to find them.  It's on the 3 rd floor right around the corner.  I tried two different slices of pizza.  It's ok, nothing wow wow .....and is expensive.  $5.5 per slice and $4 for soda.  It took me 20mins waiting on the queue for slice of pizza and very salty.

Having read about Secret Pizza in a few blogs, I was interested in trying it.  We were staggering around the strip in 115 degree heat, shopping and looking for a place to eat.  We hadn't seen anything that appealed in Planet Hollywood.  I suggested we step into the Cosmopolitan to see what we could find.  

All the restaurants here were more upscale than we were looking for.  We were just about to give up, when I noticed a hall way lined with album covers, and remembered reading about a hidden pizza joint, so I headed down the hall.  Her Majesty thought I was headed to the restroom again.  At the end of the hall you are greeted by a small, brightly lit space lined with white subway tiles. There is a menu board on the wall.  Pizza by the slice, or by the whole pie, sounds like lunch to me!

The pizza is NY style; thin and floppy with a puffy edge.  Very tasty, and reasonably priced considering it's Las Vegas.

It is not a secret anymore!!! So sad!! This place is open until 5am, and that is a beautiful thing! The pizza is reasonably priced considering that it's Las Vegas, and it's a NY size slice. It is PERFECT for a late night snack after Marquee.  Go find it! Good luck! There is no signage!

I seriously dream about this pizza. 

On my last few trips to Vegas, Secret Pizza has been one of my first stops every time. One slice is never enough (even though they are HUGE.)

As a pizza connoisseur, I vote that this is the best of the best. You will not be disappointed I promise. And if you are, then we can't be friends.

Great food! Doesn't actually have a name and a few staffers in the Cosmo didn't know where it was but after a little searching found it! Very reasonably priced food and beer (Served in red solo cups)! 
Located on the same floor as Chelsey auditorium.

The wifey and I heart this place like no other. This was the first time I ordered a full pie that was freshly made (we usually go by the slice). 1st pie was half cheese half pepperoni, 2nd pie was sausage and peperoncini. Give yourself 25\/30 minutes if you order in person for a whole pie. Definitely worth the wait and they use good quality ingredients. The prices have gone up over the years and is not as great a deal as it was before. If you get by the slice, its about 5 bucks a slice.
Long lines, good pizza, not really worth the wait in my opinion. I've definitely had better pizza elsewhere and didn't have to wait an hour and a half for it.

Ahhh...the Secret Pizza place. The best place to go for drunken munchies, or even left overs the next day. I typically always stay at the Cosmopolitan when I'm in Vegas so it's an easy trek for me, but even if you're not, if you're in the Cosmo and you're looking for an affordable place to grab a bite, come check it out.

It's cheap, open after your Marquee nightclub adventures, and has lots of options for your liking. Yes, it's a bit difficult to find, and the line will most likely be out the door once you get there, but it is worth the wait, especially with how expensive everywhere else is! 

But in actuality, it is good pizza and I'd say give it a go. I've had it sober and drunk, and I'll recommend regardless.

SECRET PIZZA FOR DAYS! No need to say more than - YOU NEED TO GO GET SOME.

Also, my other suggestion - call it in then pick it up. Perfect if you are taking a cab to the place, just call while waiting for the cab then by the time you get to the hotel and up the escalators it is ready!

4 stars for the interesting no name 24 hour pizza join hidden in the Cosmopolitan for their yummy pizza!

Came here back in June after reading about it on Yelp.  My one problem was that I really wasn't that good at finding anything that's "hidden".  

Well, lucky for me my boyfriend was around and it really wasn't that hidden.  Just follow the smell of pizza and the trail of people with paper plates. 

So it's pizza by the slice any way you want it and it is by no means cheap but it's Vegas and it's in the Cosmopolitan, are you really surprised?  The pizza is really good, not top notch but pretty damn good.  It's got that nice crispy crust with the ooey gooey cheese and whatever the heck you want on top.  The toppings are fresh and delicious!

Seating isn't great and depending on how busy it is it could be a hot mess.  They've got counter seating and it's extremely limited.  You can always walk it out to the couches down the hall and have a seat there.  Boyfriend and I managed to score seats next to a couple of drunk idiots, but hey it's Vegas.

Pizza is good... 
GREAT Marketing.
I think it is a bit pricy.... but what do expect from the strip... If I am nearby and hungry.. sure I would maybe think about it again...
but lack luster service.. red solo cups for drinks.. no seating.. and at best "ok pizza"
its memorable.. but not for the way you would expect...
it is probably the best value at the cosmo.... Not bashing it.. just not impressed either.

I wouldn't say this pizza spot is the best but it'll get the job done if you want something quick. Secret Pizza is located on the 3rd level of The Cosmopolitan. 

Note: Each slice is $5.25 each. You might as well ask your friends if you guys would like to purchase a pie and just split it.

I am not sure what the hype is about. The white pizza was probably one of the worse I have eaten. I ate 1 and a half slices before I had to give it up.
It may be a requirement to be drunk to enjoy (or not care) this pizza. Surely hunger cannot persuade one to say this is good pizza.
At $28 for a single pie, I am very displeased. I'm adding a photo.

Awesome NY-style pizza. I highly recommend the mushroom pizza.  The pepper and ricotta pizza is also good, but it lacks the delicious red sauce of the other pizza.  Great post-bar food.  Yes, you'll have to wait an hour if it's 3 AM, but...it's 3 AM and you know you want it.
It's definitely hidden but imo it's decent at best and that's while being overpriced for a single slice. Not sure I would come back.

New York style pizza is by far my favorite type of pizza and this place took me back to NYC. The only thing I can complain about is the smell off booze coming from the drunks that are in line. But that's not really their fault. It's definitely a must for pizza lovers in Las Vegas.

Located inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel.  First try to find it, its like looking for a pot of gold without the rainbow.  5 stars because its the bomb pizza and affordable considering everything else in this hotel is expensive.  I am told that this place has no real name but if you can find it you should try it especially after a night of gambling and drinking.
Pizza was quite good.  Nice crust.  It's a little hidden and hard to find.  I think price is a little much for a pizza slice.

FOOD =GREAT

STAFF= Friendly \/ new Yorker vibe

PRICE= Good for Vegas casino 


Great secret spot for delicious pizza.
Staff is great & pizza might be close to the best in Vegas! Get there before a line starts forming this place gets packed quick. Definitely check this place out while you are in Vegas.

Was more than I'd hoped.   It should have been simple enough to find but I got sidetracked on the 2nd floor thinking it was the third.  

It's great Brooklyn style pizza honestly wish I'd had another slice by the time I got to where I was staying I was hoping they delivered but being a "secret" I assumed not.

When we got here there was a line, and we immediately thought... "LOL SECRET... Fail" but... low and behold, 15 minutes later, at 2:30AM, I one of the best pizza slices (if not the best) I've ever had! 

What is said about the WHITE PIZZA is right... the cheese was flavorful and bold, the dough was perfectly crisp and the crust, my favorite part, was extraordinary.

I also purchased a slice of pepperoni and although the dough and crust were just as good as the white, the pepperoni and cheese was very normal on this slice.  If I did it again, it'd be an entire WHITE PIE... which FYI is $27.00 dollars.... lol, I know it's good but still that's a PRICEY pizza.  When your'e in Vegas though, who cares! $4.50 a slice is relative :)

Service was exceptional as well, the servers behind the counter handle the slices w\/ care and are extremely accommodating and fast despite the acknowledged stress that comes with a large line.

Get to know the people who are in line w\/ you as you guys are about to embark on one modern Vegas Landmarks!!!
I love this place! My favorite late night eatery in Vegas! Always end up here after a long fun night! Definitely a must if you're nearby! Enjoy!

Great pizza for anytime of the day. 

Quick tip: 
Get the pizza and hangout outside of the secret pizza spot, people will constantly ask you where the place is and you'll feel like a boss.

This pizza was awesome!  It's not so "secret" anymore but it's worth seeking out for a slice. I had the white pizza after reading other reviews and it's was delish!  A little heavy on the garlic if that bothers you. It was perfect though for something greasy to help soak up the booze. 

You don't sit down here- you grab a slice, eat at the counter and go. You also don't go here for beverages- there selection is limited. You go here for the pizza and that's it. It took about 4 minutes to get our slices. Well worth the trip down to the Cosmopolitan for this pizza!!
A hidden gem on the Cosmo's 3rd floor. Just spent a week in NYC, and Secret Pizza's slices were even better than the Big Apple's IMHO.
This pizza is one of the best that I have ever tried! The cheese is awesome and gooey, the service is nice. It's a pick up and go type of place. They're not kidding, this place is hidden! #secret

Half the fun is trying to find this place. Not listed in any signs in the hotel. We got to the floor where it was located and walked down a long hallway. We were like, we don't see any people or smell any pizza. We go back out the main lobby and see a bunch of people eating pizza. We asked them where it was and finally, we made it to Secret Pizza or just pizza as listed on the receipt. 

Got the cheese pizza. It's really good. Big slice and very fresh and flavorful. Bit pricey. 

It's a good experience. Go check it out.

i got a slice of the white pizza while really hungry and tired late at night.
It was nice to find a place that served casual, cheap food on the strip. On the downside, there weren't a lot of places to sit inside, and the pizza was just kind of greasy and flat. It was okay tasting, that's it.
I might go again if I'm flat broke and starving but I'm sure there are much better places nearby.

OMG!!!!
This place is amazing! The girl who took my order was so awesome. There was some Irish dude and he was all "I already ordered right! Why is this taking so long???" And she was like "You ordered 3 pizzas! It's not Pizza Hut!" That pretty much shut him up! It was hilarious! My pizza was so good! It was hot too! The crust was super moist and flavorful. I would eat three pizzas if I could!

The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the very very very very very long wait. I think we waited 90 minutes for a slice of pizza just to say that we went to the secret pizza place! Other than that, I thought the photos and memorabilia on the walls was pretty cool and the waiting space was plentiful. Once you get into the kitchen area it's still a long wait. The pizza ended up being pretty delicious and a great way to cap off our late night. I'd visit again if the line was a little shorter but that's a tough feat in heels. Love the secret little finds in Vegas, this one included! :)

Found this on Yelp and said, "What the heck we should give it a try." Boy, was I happy I did! The most amazing pizza in the world! The crust is thin and crispy... Pepperoni has so much flavor... A little spice in it. We asked the concierge where this place was located and they would say because it's a secret! Loved going on a hunt for this place. Overall I totally understand why this place has amazing ratings! Tip- there isn't really much space to sit down so we lounged right outside the restaurant! Thank you Yelpers for this awesome find!

Very Overpriced! - Poor Value - Are you kidding me? - The Pizza was OK - Even by "New York Standards" - It took forever for me to walk over there. This place is hidden away. Don't bother traveling over there. Way to expensive! - OMG - Something like $5.00 a slice. I'm serious! This place is frequented by many Young Late Nighters who have a lot of money to spend.

Amazing pizza. Super friendly staff and a hige selection. It aint cheap but it is well worth the 6 bucks a slice. The deal is 31 bucks for a 10 slice large pizza. Highly reccomend. Enrique dod a great job on ours. 3rd floor in the cosmopolitan oh and dont be in a rush as they are busy.

Hidden but not enough because the line was long! Luckily the line went fast and the staff was nice and pleasant. I had a slice of sausage and ricotta. Mmmmmm. Thin crust, fresh toppings. So good!!! I forgot to order a cannoli so I will definately be back!

Secret Worth Keeping +'s:
+ Need something to eat and relatively cheap? Go to 3rd floor of Cosmopolitan and head down a hallway to wait in line for $5 slices or $30 whole pies
.+ Dough is fresh and hot. Thin crust with good ratio of sauce but cheese is generous.
+ Toppings are not skimpy.
+ Friendly service.
+ Play Galaga or pinball while you wait.

Tell All -'s:
- No seating. Take the whole pie and find a seat in the open area of the third floor. You get eight slices.
- Get charged for two toppings on a whole pie when it's one-half mushroom and one-half meatball. Annoying.

Good and decent pizza when you need something quick and cheap.

Had the Pepperoni & Sausage Pizza, it was delicious!!
I would definitely recommend coming here for a slice!
A tad over priced!  But fresh as hell and yummy!  NO WHERE to sit but gnarly hipster style and old school vibe!  I need to get two slices after a night of boozing at Vesper or BOND BAR!

It's a hidden little walk up pizza counter, if you didn't hear about it or accidentally stumble down the long hallway lined with photos of Italian and Rat pack-esque celebs, it's order a slice or a full pizza. 
I ordered a slice of cheese for my hungry daughter after ice skating upstairs. Pretty oily, it was thin and floppy, but she liked it.

I am in love with pizza and this quite possibly is one of my favourite pizza places. It's located on the 3rd floor of the cosmo hotel. It's "secret" primarily because there's no signage but just follow the pizza eating pizza. You go down a hallway covered in rock album decor and then you get to the small pizza parlour. 

My absolutely favorite pizza there is the white pizza and the mushroom pizza. We (my boyfriend and I) typically get half white pizza half mushroom pizza. You can call ahead if you're going to order a whole pizza and just go pick it up to avoid the wait. They also have a la carte slices but I'm a fat ass and I need the whole pizza. Sometimes we just get the whole pizza and save the leftovers for post clubbing, or breakfast the next day. It always still tastes amazing.

3.5 stars
good pizza but not hard to find a pizza that tastes good fresh out the oven but this place didnt live up to the hype or worth waiting in the line out the door.  My guess since this would be a convenient place to hit up after a night of partying at the Cosmo, its rating is inflated by a bunch of people who were drunk and hungry after dancing through the night.  (what pizza doesnt taste bomb when you are drunk and starving?)

This is classic NY style pizza in Vegas. Had this pie when very drunk one afternoon, and it totally satisfied. Slices are quick, no waiting. For a whole pizza, you might wait 30-45 minutes. 

Slices are big, and beer is available!
Best pizza in Vegas and best secret spot... This place is a hidden gem in the fancy Cosmopolitan. Stop here if you want to get a tasty and casual snack. Hopefully we will be back soon

What's the big deal? It's just thin-crust pizza. The pizza is pre-made if you order by the slice. It's $3 for cheese and a little more for toppings. In Vegas pricing its a great deal but then they get you on the soda - also $3. There is nothing original and the sauce comes from a can. If I'm in the area, and I'm looking for a quick bite, I might come back. But I am not trekking all the way over here from the Venetian again.

Came here after day clubbing at Marquee Dome in December haha. It's right up the glass elevator in front of the club and in the hallway to the right on the 3rd level. That's about as secretive as it gets. The pizza was pretty decent and good for drunchies! Stop by here if you're near but I wouldn't go out of my way to try this.

WOW ..... stayed at the W Las Vegas took an Uber to try the famous secret pizza spot to see what was the hype about....ordered an entire pie spent 37$ ... very excited to get back to the hotel and have a slice...... ate my first slice ...... had to drink an entire bottle of water..... the pizza was so salty I could not eat it..... very sad ... oh well will never go back

Three can keep a secret if two of them are dead.

Okay, I would only maim someone over this pizza... not actually kill.

To tell the truth, I wasn't expecting much when I laid eyes on boxes and boxes of this pizza floating down to the first floor of the Cosmopolitan, feeding hungry oafs watching the Super Bore game. Yes, I was one of the oafs trying to stay awake and hoping the game would pick up - shit, I was hoping that Elway (sitting in attendance) would jump in and take over for Manning.

Anyway, the pizza looked a little "blah" and the pepperoni\/sausage looked a little grey. Although, I now think it was just the lighting in the Chandelier Bar, where we were posted up. 
After the friend and I shared a burrito from the mall across the street, and some very pricey "street tacos" from China Poblano (on the 2nd floor) - 3 dinky tacos for $16, I volunteered to go in search of this secret pizza place... why not? All the other oafs seemed to really enjoy this pizza. 

I will give you exact coordinates to find this pizza joint: 36.1100 N, 115.1753 W.... or just take the escalator, near the Chandelier Bar, up to the 3rd floor, make an immediate left off the escalator, stroll a few paces past the other restaurant, and veer to the right down the non-descript hallway which appears to be designated for employees only, or passage to purgatory. Tucked away is a little door to some pretty damn tasty and reasonably priced pizza. It's a tiny little spot, smaller than a Kardashian closet - no sitting area, just a couple of small bar tops where you can stand and scarf down.

They sell pizza by the slice, whole pizza, and some kind of obscenely delicious looking fat\/chicago-style pizza (but, you have to get your timing right to get your hands on one of these slices - may even be a special order thing). You can also add more toppings to whatever slice you choose. I nabbed a couple of pepperoni\/sausage with bell peppers for myself and friend. Damn, I wished we knew about this spot earlier in the day - would have ordered a whole pizza. It was very, very tasty. Can't believe I wasted good $ on sub-par Chinese\/Mexican tacos. 

I highly recommend this spot not only because the price is right, but this pizza is actually worth maiming someone over.

White pizza was incredible.  The place was fun to find..ok we did have to ask and where" 25 steps away " the slices are pretty large and we didnt need to order 2 slices each..but it was so good we ate it all
Horrible. Fucking. Experience. No level of deliciousness would justify how rude these guys were.

SECRETS OUT GUYS!

This place is seriously a gem. Came here because of Yelp and because of friends who highly recommended this place and I am very glad I did. All I can say for location is to follow the pizza. You will see people coming from the same direction and just head their way and you will reach the magic kingdom! The hallway you walk through is super cool too with records all over the walls and once you get in there are retro arcade games as well! When it was my turn, I wanted to try the white pizza but didn't know if I'd like ricotta cheese so while I was discussing my decision with my cousin, the guy cut me a sliver to try - so nice! I ended up loving that sliver and getting a slice myself while my cousins got the pepperoni and the one with everything.

Let me tell you, this pizza is not for the health-conscious. It is super super oily and cheesy but hey, what good pizza isn't? The pizza is literally one of the best thin-crust pizzas I've had! It is definitely better  than Lombardi's in NY in my opinion but tied with Artichoke Pizza in NY for my favorite pizza ever. & super affordable!

Definitely a must-try in my opinion! I tried all 3 and the white pizza was my favorite! DO IT GUYS.

Yup like the 4 stars says, I'm a fan. This not to secret pizza joint in the Cosmo is an absolute great place to get pizza late night on the strip. Nothing else to add other than you might get stuck in line and have to wait but it's convenient late night pizza. 
You Marquee club goers need to hit this place up when you get out.

I don't really get this place. It's not that great. Go to the Cosmopolitan, go to the third floor, find the hallway with the records on the wall. You can get a slice of pizza that you can get anywhere else there.
Great Pizza!!! I like that it's tucked away in The Cosmopolitan. The atmosphere was awesome. Will most definitely be back!
No signs to direct you.  Not even in the directory.  Burn your mouth good NY style pizza.  Cheesecake is a slice of heaven too.

NY style pizza!!!! A perfect meal after a night of partying at marquee. It's hidden in a long hallway and you'll probably miss it if you're too drunk. 

The pizza is perfectly greasy and thin and cheesy!

Not much else to say. It's delicious!

This place is a secret and you must look closely to find it but it is worth it.
You back in New York having a slice , same flavor , same smell, same everything.

If I could give more stars, I would! We were looking for a place to eat in Vegas, friends were craving pizza, so we Googled best pizza on Vegas strip. And we found Secret Pizza so we hurried our butts over to The Cosmo. The narrow hallway (Vegas narrow) in between 2 big restaurants was the dead give away. There were a lot of people in there but the line went super quick. I got the pepperoni, sausage and meatball pizza. I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! No wonder people say it's the best pizza!!! It REALLY is the best pizza in Vegas. It's worth any amount of time you have to wait for it. If you get there right when they open, THATS the best time to go!
