The NY style pizza slices are big and floppy, but the dough is crisp and chewy in the best possible way. These pizza slices are one of the best in Vegas! 

Once here you will forget you are at the Cosmo until you see the prices, $27.50 for 5 slices. Ohhhhh that's right. We're still at the nicest casino in Las Vegas. 

If you have a hankering for a quick slice, forget about it! This is the spot.

This is the best New York style pizza I've ever had. I've never been to New York so I'm not sure how much of a hit or how far of a miss this place is. Two things I know about this place is its a pain in the but to find and the pizza is spot on! The title Secret Pizza is definitely true. We had to ask two people where this place was located because there is no sign and no big window. It literally looks like a janitor hallway with a PAC MAN machine at the end. Once you walk to the end of the hallway it opens up into what seems like the smallest pizza kitchen ever. But what this place lacks in size it sure makes up for in pizza and the size of the slices. It seems you may need to custom order your pizza if you don't want pepperoni or just cheese. But I assure you it'll be worth it. I got two slices of pizza and although I was satisfied I probably could have crushed another one in no time. A bonus that I found is that they serve beer and have oregano and Parmesan shakers all around. So not only did I powder my pizza but I got two brews to go. At 9am. Don't judge. It's Vegas.

Secret pizza is delicious. Definitely a hidden gem... Although I don't know if it is really a secret anymore, as any time I go there there's a line around the block. 
I'll admit waiting in line can be fun. The late night line (the only kind I've been in) is usually filled with drunken out of Towners and club goers. Everyone is usually is fun spirits, don't expect to make laying friendships, but definitely a enjoyable way to wait for your turn. 
Staff is fun & friendly, major respect to them for that. I'd hate dealing with all the drunks, if I weren't drunk myself that is. The pizza speaks for itself, simply delicious. 
If you are at the Cosmo, hungry and have some time, this is the place for you.
Very nice Pizza, try to find it! ;-)

Very pleased with this place.  

We were bummed after the Super Bowl and our loss of money.   Later in the evening after the all you can eat buffet from Rhumbar wore off, we headed here.  About 11:00, place was not that busy.

We ordered a whole pie (more economical that way).  

Good ingredients, crispy crust and PBR on tap!

I won't tell you how to get there.  That is half the fun.
The best pizza I've had in any country, in any US state, at any time of day. That is all. Just go.

Hands down best pizza place in Vegas. The location is sorta hard to find and it is not well advertised but it is the germ of the Cosmo. It on the the third floor, next to the pool table waiting area. Follow your nose and empty pizza boxes!

They have been raising the price. The best way that we found out about doing this is just to order a whole pie. Call in and order.
DELICIOUS, but goodness gracious the line is next level and they don't ever answer their phone so you can't place an order ahead of time. Can you guys get like online ordering or something???

This place is like a hole in the wall. The lines are LONGGGGGG and to order a whole pizza can take about 30 minutes or so. Is it worth it? Yes of course! Who doesn't like pizza at 2 or 3 in the morning!  However  we all know everything in Vegas is expensive. One large pizza is almost 50 bucks! Damn! Lol 

Pepperoni is huge! Sausage is huge! You can't go wrong! Would definitely come back!

This is a very cool hidden gem in the new Cosmopolitan Casino.  You won't find this small pizzeria unless you know exactly where to look.  Next to the Blue Ribbon Sushi restaurant on the 3rd floor, there is a hallway decorated with old album covers.  Walking down this hallway will lead you to the pizzeria.  You can order an entire pizza or get a previously prepared pizza by the slice.  You can also add toppings to a slice of cheese pizza and they'll warm it up and blend in the extra toppings.  They have PBR and Dogfish 90 beer on tap.  The restaurant is inexpensive and the pizza is delicious.  The pizzeria is sparsely decorated with a few chairs, a pinball machine and some stand up bar tables to eat your pie.  This is the best place I've been to on the strip to order a quick inexpensive slice of pizza.  The employees are very helpful with good advice on what to order.  Pizzeria ambiance-3 stars, Food-4 stars, Strip Value-5 stars, Service-5 stars.

Oh lord have mercy. 

This is the best pizza I've ever had, and I've had some of the best rated pizza in NYC. I cannot wait to go back. No pizza will live up to this pizza. 

The cheese was gooey and a bit salty. The crust was was fluffy yet flaky with a crisp. The pepperoni was incredible, almost as if it were made fresh and not overly processed. The sauce was traditional but had a lot of flavor. 

Secret Pizza is not so secret. It's directly above Holsteins on the third floor, easy to find once you spot the record hallway.
Great pizza, a little pricey, great service a definite place to stop and try for a quick bite .

Great little hidden gem for when you are in Vegas, drunk (or other) and have the munchies.  Beware that Secret Pizza is hard to find with pretty much no signage at all.  The pizza here is very good.  It's New York style and of course they sell it by the slice.  I had their white and it was pretty darn good.  The white sauce was creamy with a nice hint of garlic.  Another note, the lines do get long and you tend to be surrounded by some real party people so it can get interesting.  There is no place to sit and eat inside the pizza shop but there are benches and chairs in front by the pool tables where they have strategically put parmesan cheese and other toppings.

The pizza was pretty good and for a meal in Vegas it wasn't badly priced.   I had the white pizza due to my addiction to garlic and I can't remember what my husband had, but I would guess two slices of the cheese.  I will admit the pizza was slightly greasy but you don't eat pizza when you are trying to be healthy.   The guys behind the counter were very friendly.  We chatted with them for a bit while we were eating.   We didn't go after clubbing so they weren't too busy, but I would call it a steady stream of people though for a tucked away location.

Worth the scavenger hunt to find this place tucked away in the cosmopolitan. This place was MADE for late night recovery snacks. The pizza is absolutely delicious (bonus- they have white pizzas and will even make you a custom pizza if you can wait 20 minutes). Followed the trend in Vegas which seems to be pricey but delicious!

Love the texture of the crust and the constantly different kind of pizza popping out of there oven. W were the first one to get there.  Ordered a slice of pepperoni and a slice of sausage and peppercino. Then went back after that a split a slice of a different kind of sausage and ricotta pizza. Big groups I recommend maybe getting a whole pie and customizing it.

It passes the eye-test. Crispy bottom. Large slice. Quality cheese and toppings. The only thing I couldn't get over was the flavor of the crust and sauce. As someone who is picky about their pizza, the hype let me down. While I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, it's still good enough that I would grab one if I was at the Cosmo or Bellagio and wanted a slice ASAP.

The not so "secret," pizza bar at the Cosmopolitan Las Vegas. Open until 5AM, this is the must stop place for a big slice of late night pizza. Prices are EXCELLENT for a large slice of heaven. Great pizzas by the slice, the perfect food after partying it up late night Las Vegas style. Careful, there can be a big line depending on what time you go. Check out the album art on the walls. Very cool. This will be my late night food stop whenever I am staying at the Cosmopolitan.

Me and my two dining companions were just wanting some fairly normal stuff for a glorified snack, so we got a slice of mushroom and a slice of pepperoni. They also have Coke Zero on tap (served in plain red Solo cups, a nice touch), which delighted one of my friends. We took our haul up to the room and dined there. 

The slices were both quite nice. Big, satisfying slices, with good quality cheese, the right quantity of sauce, and plentiful toppings. The pepperoni was meaty and delicious, and the mushrooms were great, if chopped a little small. 

Sure, it's a bit of a gimmick, but it's fun. Check it out. If you can find it. :)
The pizza here is really good. I went twice and I wasn't drunk either time in the pizza tasted great

This place is a HIDDEN gem.  Its so secret its not even on any of the maps or signs in the hotel.  The pizza is really good and made fresh if you want a whole pie and warmed up if you want by the slice, even warmed up it taste fresh.  They don't really serve drinks soda by the red cup, red bull , and a couple of bottled beer selections.  They have water which is serve yourself by the cup.  No tables all standing bar type set up.  The white slice is delicious and garlic tasting not overly but great flavor.  The pepperoni is also very tasty...next time going to try the sausage and pepperoni.

S.S.A.P =  Secret Soggy Ass Pizza.  Albeit the ingredients were all fresh and great quality the execution of the pizza fell apart...literally.  The crust could not support the fats from the cheese and meats which made the crust completely marry in with the cheese to create this flimsy, greasy slice.  I understand that who makes the pizza makes the difference in the outcome so maybe the cooks had an off day.  I went in at around 1 pm on Saturday on 1\/25\/2014 and had the white pizza and meat lovers.  There was no line but was told by some that the line is usually off the hook.  There is so much more to experience foodie wise in Vegas, especially off the strip.  If you are looking for a cheap eat in a pizza form Bonnanos on the strip does the job and a much better tasting slice or if you want similar to east coast style pizza  Grimaldis at the Venetian is amazing...pricey but worth it.  Foodies leave this place behind to the drunkards coming off that club high and let the grease soaks up all their sins cuz lord knows this place has enough greasy pizza to purify everyone in Vegas!

One of the worst-kept secrets anywhere, Secret Pizza is still a great place to grab a slice of completely legit New York Style pizza.

Next time I'm in Sin City, I'm going back!
This place is a trip to find since there are no signs but just a hallway of pictures and is totally worth looking for. White pizza, order, NOW.

I am reluctant to write a review on this place because pretty soon, this place won't be so secret... but it is the bomb! Thank you to all the other yelpers who recommended this place. 

This is a MUST GO if you like authentic NY style pizza.  Get either the regular slice or the "white" pizza. Both are my favorite. The other ones with toppings are just okay... The slices are huge and are 2 are more than enough to fill you up. 

I love the fact that this place is small, not overly crowded and the guys behind the counter heat up your slice and hand it to you to eat. It really is that good.

The prices are decent... $5\/slice is not horrible.

Just remember... it's on the 3rd Floor fo

Dion is true man!! This pizza is the best secret on the strip. Here with a group? Head in and grab a standard pepperoni and a white pizza and you're good to go. Grab a bud light while you wait and watch Dion throw the most amazingly tasty dough!

Secret?  Not anymore!  Lines of people down the hallway may give it away and if that doesn't , then follow your nose.   Every visit to Vegas I'm ready for this delicious slice, served piping hot with the toppings I love!  Go!  Enjoy! Yum!!!
This is 100% Secret! We really had to go on a witch hunt but we did find it, and the pizza is delicious! The only downside is the lack of seating. But hey.

After reading good reviews, we stepped Cosmopolitan and went searching for this pizza place. Walked up and down a couple of times, one end to another, but couldn't find it. We were almost about to give up, when we asked one of the folks who works there and found the way. A narrow passage leads to Secret Pizza.

We got two slices of pizza, one is white pizza with different varieties of cheese and another one was with veggies and pepperoni. I liked the white pizza, although I thought both were too oily. I liked the pizzas, but nothing extraordinary about them. Also thought they were on the pricey side.

For 5 bucks a slice I thought it would be better. They told me they don't serve ranch cause the pizza was soooo good I wouldn't need it, but I definitely needed it. Gave 2 stars just because they are pretty comparable to chain pizza places like Anthony's pizza, domino's or pizza hut. If you are hungry for pizza skip the high prices and buy a slice from a street vendor on the strip.

The New York in me loves Secret Pizza. It really does. It's probably the closest I'll get to having a NY slice (that doesn't mean that their pizza is spot on though!)

Why 3 stars then? Well, I went on a Tuesday at around 1:45 in the morning and stood in line for 30minutes. Not too shabby. I wouldn't say that they were extremely busy and they seemed to be well staffed too. Thing is, it was DIRTY. The parmesan, oregano, chili flakes and garlic powder was scattered all over their counter tops as if they were having a party. I don't mind dirty when you're slammed and short staffed but there was absolutely no excuse for dirtiness that night. Especially since there was an employee stuck to her phone in the corner. She didn't even TRY to crouch down so that no one could see her. 

Not to mention the fact that the guys there didn't seem too enthusiastic about being there. I know that I wouldn't want to be at work at that time in the morning but, come on. At least be a little pleasant? Anyway, if I didn't have to consider their employees they would've been a solid 4 and a half stars.

Don't let my review scare you though. Pizza dough was crisp and the small burns that it had was still enjoyable. There was a good amount of cheese and, was perfectly melted. Pepperoni had that juicy yet still crispy feel. Their Blanca slice was OK. Nothing too special but you definitely see and taste the ricotta. 

I would definitely go back since the pizza's great. I just hope they step up their customer service.

This place is hard to find to that's the first drawback. When you walk in you notice that seating is virtually nonexistent which makes eating and enjoying the pizza less than memorable. The pizza was good but nothing I'd rave about especially considering the high price. It is vegas though so to be fair overpaying is the norm.

On the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan down a long hallway. It's not a secret based on the crowd. All of the pizzas are good, but the White pizza is a favorite. Always a good place for a late night meal.

GREAT HANGOVER OPTION! Fast and delicious!

"Not so secret pizza" haha although there are no signs for this place, there's always a line out the door. They have this nice hallway into the shop which accommodates the long lines.

The pizza here is so good and you know it because they refuse to serve ranch or even carry any in store! The slices are big and heavy that after eating two slices I end up not feeling so good but I always end up eating more than I should because it's so delicious. I always get the white slice and a side of pepperoncinis. They also serve pitchers of beer!

Came here for lunch on a Sunday and there was no line, I've been here before after the club before and the line is usually pretty long. After eating the pizza sober I can say that it is just okay, it's nothing special. The menu is pretty simple a regular cheese is $5 and each topping is .50 extra. We ordered the pepperoni sausage and a meatball with ricotta cheese. The pepperoni sausage was more flavorful than the meat ball. Again, the pizza was ok and nothing special. Overall I probably wouldn't return unless I'm trying to find food after a night of drinking.

I first tried this place a couple weeks ago after a late night in Vegas. It's hidden away down a hallway with no sign or advertisement to tell you it's there. The place has a old school feel to it. In the hallway, the walls are covered with old album covers. They also have arcade games and pinball machines. It's really small, so don't count on eating in there unless it's not too busy. 

The line was pretty long when I went especially considering it was 2:00 am, but the pizza was worth the 15 minute wait.  I got 2 slices of pizza ($5.50 each). One had pepperoni and banana peppers and the other had white cheese. The pepperoni and banana peppers slice was good, but the white cheese pizza I think is the one everyone should try if they come here.

Overall, it's easy to see why people love this place: it's open basically all night, there's mystery surrounding it being "secret", and its old school theme is really cool. In my opinion, the pizza itself is above average, but not amazing. If this review was strictly about the pizza and the price, then I'd probably give them 3 stars. This is a place I do look forward to showing some friends and returning too next time I'm out late in Vegas. Try them out!

Whatever pizza, very long wait, definitely don't recommend this place, unfriendly staff, ask them how long shall we wait maybe I can come back later, he says just wait and we'll tell you when is ready
I am from NYC where we have the best pizza. I must say I was in for a surprise when I had secret pizza! I was amazed by how good it tastes and the feature was lite and crispy! I am hooked!

This place is the bomb!! I've never had a slice of pizza that made me feel so happy. It's really hidden and if you don't know your way around the Cosmo it's easy to get lost. When you walk in you really expect more to this place but you really feel like it's straight to the point and they're not over doing it. For around $30-40 depending on topping you can have a whole pie here next time I will be ordering one instead of getting 4 slices for $27. But their product is FIRE! So freaking good I will be back for sure. Looking forward to trying the white slice next time.

The best nights in life are usually the ones that aren't planned. Starting off on one of those nights, my three friends Jerry J., Matt B. and Gracie C. and I hit this place up last night (6\/29\/11) after we all got off of work. The plan - get dinner and bring it back to Gracie's place at the Veer Towers to play pool. 

After a short little walk from Caesar's, Gracie and I walked right on over  - it's right by the pool table on the third story. Jerry offered to buy dinner - buying a whole pizza is definitely the way to go at this joint - $18 for a huge cheese pizza and an extra ridiculous $2.25 per topping. We opted for 1\/2 cheese, 1\/2 pepperoni which came with 12 slices for $20 plus some change. It's so much cheaper than buying by the slice, but you'd never know because there's no menu. 

We sat around for a bit until one of our coworkers showed up with some people while giving them a tour of the place. There definitely isn't enough seating here whatsoever. After about a 15-20 minute wait, we had our pizza. The four of us then made the trek to CVS to pick up some pop and water.

After our trek to CVS and battling the wind, we headed up to the 37th floor of the Veer Tower chow down on the pizza. It had been at least a good half hour since we got our pizza and it was still relatively hot when we opened the box

I've definitely had better pizza. Metro, for one, is super delicious and this doesn't hold a candle to Round Table. Yes, going to a "secret" pizza place might be "cool" but their pizza is not even remotely close to the "I'm a fan" 4 stars or "As good as it gets" 5 stars that so many people are giving this place. Novel concept but again, the pizza is meh. The crust is hard. Not chewy, not crispy, but break your teeth hard. That automatically disqualifies it from getting higher than a 3 star. The cheese was okay, but again, not the best any of us had ever had. We all agreed there was definitely better pizza in Vegas.
Awesome, awesome, awesome pizza!  Very cool hidden counter on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan.

Came here for post club night to grab a bite to eat.  This is a well known place, so maybe not so secret.  The line was super long and we waited probably a good 30-45minutes for a slice of pizza.  The menu is pretty simple, which is basically the pizzas are displayed and you pick whats available.  The sell slices and whole pies.  The price was decent, roughly $5\/slice.  It was super yummy, lots of cheese and flavor!

There's no seating inside, thus you'll have to take your pizza and enjoy outside or elsewhere.  Though the pizza was amazingly delicious, not sure if it was worth the almost 1hr wait.  Definitely a must have getting out of the club!

IF you find this place (and you'll probably have to ask someone in the hotel), you'll be pleasantly surprised by the understated, throw-back vibe of what feels like your local pizzeria.  You have to get the white pizza, no matter what.  It is amazingly tasty and full of garlic, cheesy goodness.  There are no tables, so be prepared to stand and eat or to take-and-go.
Classic NY pizza. Great crust. Hard to find, but worth it!  Second floor of Cosmopolitan on The Strip.
Love the pizza but gave it a one star for the customer service lady at the register was rude
Had the white pizza and it was heaven! super thin and floppy just how I like it....yum!
The star is for the service. The pizza. Is lousy. I know it is convenient to city center but not worth the money.
The pizza here after a night out partying is THE BOMB!!!!!!!! closest you will get to a NY slice on the West coast. SOOOOOOO FREAKKING GOODD!!!!! Take me back!

Love this little hole in the wall. The restaurant is not listed on the directory. The pizza was amazing! The hall was decorated cute as well. 

We will definitely be return patrons!

Your pizza is so good that the deodorant, Secret, had to tell everyone about it!!

My cousin and I needed a night cap before we headed to our hotel. After a night\/early morning of binge drinking, we needed some carbs to soak up some alcohol. The "Secret" location wasn't hard for me to find since I vowed to be back. The simplest way to get there is get on the third floor and look for a pool table. And boom! Right across from that is the small corridor to the "Secret" location!  

I guess we caught a break from the line being very long. 3am and it was smooth sailing. My cousin place two slices of the combination. I wanted  to try the cheese one only, but at this point my stomach could handle one slice. The service was so quick that we were in and out.

The crust was soft and crispy. The toppings of meats and veggies were covering the pizza slices. The cheese was stringy and gooey. A great sized piece to satisfy a drunken appetite.

If this was "Fight Club", a lot of people would be in trouble. As everyone should know the first rule of  "Fight Club". You don't speak of "Fight Club"! But, oh well! Be prepared to be punched in the mouth with flavorful and filling pizza!

By "secret" they really mean secret. There are no signs anywhere and it's literally hidden at the end of a dark hall. 

As for the pizza itself it was afford (rare around here) and amazing. 5\/5 if you can find the place.

My wife and I heard about this place so we definitely wanted to try it out the next time we went to Cosmo. We've eaten at the other restaurants and never knew that this pizza place was always there. This place is located on the 3rd floor next to the sushi restaurant. It's close by the pool table and lounge chair they have setup. You walk down a hallway with pictures on the wall to get to this place. They have a few old school video games and pinball machines to play while you wait for your food.

They have pizza by the slice and you can order a whole pie as well. We ended up getting a cheese pie to share. The boxes they used were from Shark Tank too! It's the one you can tear apart to use as plates and to make a smaller box to pack up the leftover pizza in. The pizza was pretty good. I think the next time we go back, we're going to try out the other toppings.

This place is a good find and is open pretty late. If you're in the Cosmopolitan and are looking for a quick bite to eat, definitely try this place out! Just don't get lost...

OMGAWWWWWWWD! Where is this place?!! No signs, nothing. Had to call twice! Lol!! Thanks for the friendly service. we're hereeeeee and the pizzas are awesome. We got the white, mushroom and veg one. Crispy, light, expensive and delish!

This is one of those places where once you find it, you never want to leave it and if you do have to leave you'll keep coming back for more. The wine and white pizza are the best combo any time of night. The prices are affordable, and the fact that it's somewhat hidden makes it even more fun to encounter! It may take a while to get your food depending on when you go but its soooo soooo good! I wish they had more locations!

- The Skinny:

Food Quality: 5 Stars
-  Great pizza! Get the Meatball, Pepperoni, or their most popular slice, "The White".  

Meatball - Large slices of Meatball and globs of ricotta cheese.

Pepperoni - Large slices of real pepperoni, makes pizza chains seem like they are using intimidation pepperoni?   

"The White" - its all cheese, fresh ricotta, and garlic sauce. There is no pizza sauce on that one but trust me, its good! My wife loves Chicago Deep Dish Pizza and dislikes NY style, but this was the best pizza she ever had. 

Pricing: 5 Stars
- $5 a slice, if you're hungry, get 2 slices as they are large, but thin (NY style). It costs more than other pizza joints but factor in that it's located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. 

Service: 3 Stars
- Nothing incredible but it is just a pizza counter and they are just mashing out pizzas. The workers were friendly and helped me choose some good slices. There is a little bit of a wait but its worth it!

Atmosphere: 5 Stars
- Has a real NY pizza place feel. A couple pinball machines and some TV's playing sports. Hallway is decorated with vintage vinyl records and adds some class but once its opens up to the pizza counter, its straight NY style! 

Place is really a secret, I had to ask 3 different hotel employees to find it. Its a hallway that is missed in a blink. Its to the left of glass elevator and across from the "game lounge" (pool table, scrabble coffee tables, wooden dice seats). 

Comfort: 3 Stars
- It's a narrow hallway any little counter space to eat, but you will be there just to buy and run so no worries there. 

Location: 3 Stars trying to find it but as far as theme goes (being a secret, 5 Stars)
- Place is really a secret, I had to ask 3 different hotel employees to find it. Its a hallway that is missed in a blink. Its to the left of glass elevator and across from the "game lounge" (pool table, scrabble coffee tables, wooden dice seats). With a name like "Secret Pizza", mission accomplished! 

- The Fat: 

My in-laws were in town and of course we needed to take them out to the Vegas Strip. There was 25 of us so no need for a sit down dinner, especially with many small children. I found "Secret Pizza" on Yelp and opt'ed to go there as we made our way to the Bellagio fountain show. 

It was tricky to find, had to use my GPS and ask 3 hotel employees to get there but it really is a hidden treat. You will have to wait a little bit, I was there on a Sat night around 11pm and we waited about 20-30 mins?

The pizza is delicious! hot, fresh, and kills any other pizza I had, only rivaled by Grimaldi's Pizza in NY under the Brooklyn bridge. I would go out of my way to go here again. If you are on the strip and want fast, inexpensive, but quality food, go to Secret Pizza!!!

meh it was OK. had 2 slices of pepperoni and a salad. im just not a fan of these pizza by the slice, buffet style pizzerias.  cool place though, and the guys working seemed pretty cool my buddy spilt his beer and one of the workers was given him shit, it was funny and it was all in good fun.
Fabulous. Had the white pizza and spicy peperoncini with something I cannot remember. Both were some of the best pizza I have ever eaten.

I don't know what's the hype with this place. Yes, it's a cool concept where you have to find this place through word of mouth and there are no signs anywhere that tells you where to go. However, the quality of the pizza and selection is subpar. (BTW in case you are wandering, this is located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel)

The first time I went, I had to wait in line for almost half an hour and there's almost no seating inside the place and minimal seating outside as well. This makes eating pizza while holding your water cup extremely difficult. This time when i went, at least there was no line. The choices of pizza were whatever and it wasn't that clear you could add toppings onto the pizza. Each slice was about costco but it cost around 6 dollars without toppings and probably more with each topping. The plates they gave us were very flimsy and the oil leaked through. The pizza flavor wasn't very rich and and crust was not good at all. I have had way better pizza and I don't understand the hype here.

Not much of a secret but let me tell you why...

Saw this place on the TV show, Man Finds Food. He endorsed the white pizza which in my opinion is the best pizza they have! There was quite a line when we got there hence, my reason for stating that it's not much of a secret.

I ordered the supreme combo while the hubby ordered a slice of white pizza and their sausage pepperoni. 

Their supreme combo is comparable to Costco's combo pizza and to be honest ( as I should be on yelp), I prefer the Costco combo pizza. 
As for their famous white pizza, it definitely deserves its fame! This pizza has one topping and that topping is cheese!!! Why is it so delicious?! I think its the garlic and whatever combination ingredients they used to make the white sauce. Also, this pizza is made out of sour dough which adds to its delicious flavor. Their sausage pepperoni had some good flavor to it as well.

The place is small. Only a few bar seating on the perimeter. The line typically stretches out to the small hallway and ends at the counter where you can order and pay. 

They have a small variety of fountain drinks and alcohol. There's also a water dispenser. 

Staff are friendly and work very fast. 

We ended up sitting on one of the Cosmo hotel loungy areas which wasn't bad at all...

Overall, don't even bother with the other pizza's. Just go for the white one and have your friends save a seat either inside or outside.

This is one of my wife and I's go-to late night spots when we come to Vegas.  It's cheap ($4-5 a slice), classic floppy New York style pie, and some scrumptious options are available.  The white sauce pizza has a heavenly bite, it's the slice I'd recommend above all else if you're being skimpy and only eating one.  But this pizza is great and life is short, so you should definitely have two.  The peperoncino and sausage is my backup, and also wonderful to the taste buds.

There's not much to say about the restaurant itself, it's basically just a pizza stand tucked down an alleyway on the third floor of the Cosmo.  They have pictures lining the walls with celebs who've visited, and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The Cosmo is also quickly becoming my favorite hotel in Vegas, because even though I haven't stayed there yet I seem to find myself there on every trip whether it's to gamble, take in the young nightlife, or drink at one of their nice bars\/clubs.  

so stop on in, have a few drinks at The Chandelier, and fill that belly

After a long day\/ night on the strip, this is the best place where you can get your greasy fix at :-)
The pizza tastes great! And the Slices are huge
Straight up frat boy pizza that is absolutely delicious. Nothing beats amazing pizza and coke in a red solo cup. Not fine dining, but definitely great pizza tucked away in the cosmo.

Love how there's a pizza place inside the Cosmo! It's open late so it's a good place to go when you've been spent dancing or at the casinos.

You can buy it by the slice or get a whole pizza. Mind you, it'll cost $30 or so to order a whole pizza, buy you get it hot and fresh out of the oven. The slices are huge and it's made like NY style (thin that you can fold over)

You can eat your pizza there and play on the pinball machines or eat it outside the hallway where the Cosmo has comfy seats.

Someone told us (my boyfriend and I) to find the Secret Pizza joint at the Cosmopolitan, and that we would LOVE it. And, after 30 minutes of searching for this place, we feel in LOVE with this place! (the alcohol might have helped) 

I encourage everyone to adventure\/trek\/ search for this place. And when you find the place, order the White Pie Pizza - it's to die for!! Yummy yummy in my tummy. We also suggested this "pizza place" to our friend's parents who are of Sicilian decent, and they stated that the white pie pizza reminds them of their family made pizza from Sicily.

Absolutely incredible! Food and service was on point! The single slices are huge and a great price. The owner is laid back and very friendly it was an awesome atmosphere and even better food. The crust was crunchy and the sauce was a tad bit sweet, will be back every time I'm in Vegas.   The place in on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel down an unmarked hall that's lined with record covers.  Go getchu some.

Walking through the Cosmo we saw some people eating pizza so we knew we were close!  Found it near by. I won't say where though.  Love it!  Just a nice NY style pizza place. I can't imagine a better late night stop.

36.00 for a whole pizza.. the wait was about 30 mins.. did a phone order so i dont have to wait in line.. it's good but i wouldnt say i would wait for this.. the only reason i did it was because my friends wanted to eat this..

After taking a second look at most of the reviews almost all of them said "man the pizza was so good after marquee man!" Meaning you have to be smoshed to really love the pizza here. 

PSHH That's the secret!


I get the gimmick that it's a secret and I'm sure its a secret for a good reason. If they posted how much a slice cost (4-6 a slice), no one would ever come here. Yah I'm a sucker for always being in the know about secret menus and ninja spots but sadly this place didn't live up to the mystique.
Their pizza is so delicious!!!! It's kind of expensive, but what isn't in Vegas? I found this place on yelp and was so pleased :) I will be back here when I am in Vegas and am craving so good pizza.

I stayed at the Cosmopolitan and I hit up this place 2 of the 3 nights I was in Vegas.  My only regret is not going 3 for 3.  The pizza here is sooooo good!  I tried a classic slice of pepperoni and a slice of the pepperoni & sausage.  The pepperoni & sausage is the winner here.  Avoid this place past 2 am on Saturday night or you'll be in a long line with ratchets and haters.

We were headed to the Marquee for a pool party and had to get in by 2:00 if we didn't want to pay.  We were pressed for time and needed a quick bite.. we kept walking up the escalator and the info desk told us there's a pizza joint down the dark hallway... and then we all joked.. two guys telling us to go down a sketchy ally.. RIGHT we went anyways.. it's vegas why not?

Pizza was quick and fast, although the worker seemed like she was not happy that day.  They ran out of the combination pizza we saw and she was not about to make anymore so the only "vegetable" they had left was a plain mushroom one which is what I got.  It was greasy, but after  a few dabs it was good.
The worker also said she didn't have water on tap so we had to pay quite a bit for the water bottle. My friend who is a vegetarian wanted cheese pizza, but she said she was out of that as well and wasn't going to make anymore. She insisted we just buy the more expensive pepperoni and pick it off.  Well it's a good thing my friend isn't strict and that's what we ended up doing, but the girl definitely did not look like she wanted to be working there.

Other than that, it was good, fast, and relatively cheap for vegas. YUM!

This aint no secret when you see drunkass walk out the hallway of the 3rd floor Cosmopolitan with a white box (whole pizza). We followed the smell of fresh baked pizza and found this hidden gem. This would be the place to go after 1am. For the price, it's reasonable and good for hangover\/buzz. First night, I ordered a whole cheese pizza $26 and it took them 20minutes to baked it fresh. TOTALLy worth it, the cheese was bubbling, the crust was soft and yet crispy. It was perfect!! I downed 2 slices in silence....

On the second night, I speculated that the whole pizza with certain toppings are already made and will be reheated in the oven when you order. I dont think the quality will be the same.  Keep an eye on the fresh pizza as they bring it out and order that!! (hopefully you are sober enough). We ended up getting a slice of sausage cheese pizza and the cashier just handed to us (not a reheat slice.. score!!). I thought the sausage was too salty. I'm still craviing the fresh cheese plain pizzza....

Located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmo, this place is tucked away down a hall with records on the wall. There is usually a line but that's a good sign! The pizza was fresh and perfectly crisp. I definitively recommend this place for takeaway pizza! They can add toppings to a slice quickly too!

Holy hell. Delish. We walked in here for lunch. Hubby and I were trying to figure out what to eat. Tummies were grumbling. We then smell the place. Yes, standing outside you can smell it. We walk in to a simple, no frills pizza joint. Huge slices done right. It was yummy. Add a soda and you have yourself a yummy lunch that doesn't break the bank and hits the spot after a long night of gaming or partying. Try it out! Across the STK at the Cosmo. There is no sign. Love that part too.

Wow. Seriously good pizza. I don't often eat pizza but this place is legit.
Great thin crust, cripsy and full of toppings. Came here for a quick bite before heading out for the night during my last visit to Vegas. It's a small joint with great delicious selections of pizza.
I highly recommend giving this place a try!

Cosmopolitan second floor down hallway with pictures of records. Unlabeled. Two man staff. 

Came here for a dinner or day cap meal after drinking and enjoying the town. Line was quick to come go and order. 

Simple enough menu one or multiple topping pizzas. Calzone and a Sicilian pizza were also available. Most basic pizza ready. Custom or added topping only a few minutes for slice. All slices had to be reheated for variety of toppings on hand. Irregardless of pizza order, all slices reheated. Still good not great and not so heavy. Priced like the other small pizza places around. 

We ordered and shared a Sicilian deep dish enough for two persons. Pepperoni, sausage, olive among deep stack of melted cheese. Good flavor. Reheated correctly and good on a budget. 

Overall enjoyed the quick grub. Great on budget. Okay on flavor. Hearty are the slices. Would likely come back. Only three stars as the slice is already made and reheated. Not as fresh as can be and service was okay. Nothing too stellar.

The first time was good. I tried it again for the second time and it was just okay. It's definitely not worth waiting an hour for, but if it's your first time and your drunk friends hyped it up for you, then you should at least give it a shot.

What sucks is the wait. The line is atrocious, especially if you're starving from being drunk. People will cut and make their way to the front. The last time I went, it was as if there were 2 lines.

If you're confused on how to order, just pick the type of pizza you want (white pie, Sicilian, etc.) and then tell them you want to add some shit to it. It's 50 per topping.

It's a little hard to find, so keep your eyes peeled. Or just ask.

I'm originally from the East Coast and have been searching high and low for a great pizza joint since moving out West. Well, Secret Pizza is it! It is located on the 3rd floor in the Cosmopolitan, right next to Blue Ribbon Sushi. If you walk down the hallway with all of the albums you will run right into it. No signage, no advertising, nothing. But when you find it you will love it!

We ordered the cheese and pepperoni slices and it tasted amazing. The crust was thin, had just the right amount of grease, and tasted just like NY style pizza. They even serve the soda in a red solo cup. I would have loved to try the white pizza, but they didn't have any made at the time. But I will go back every single time I am in Vegas.

Had the thin crust meatball and sausage pizza. Delicious flavor and the crust is perfect. Big slices of meatballs with massive flavor.  Highly recommended to ask for parmesan to sprinkle on top. Solid slice for Vegas!

The only thing secretive about Secret Pizza is the location. A little hard to find but it's on the 3rd floor and across from the pool table. 

At 4.50 a slice, the price is decent being in Vegas but I don't think the pizza is that bomb as many reviewers rave about. Or maybe I was too sober when I ate the pizza? Maybe that's why I wasn't as impressed. 

Greasy pizza available until 5am in Vegas! Definitely a pro but I personally don't think the pizza is that amazing.

Ate here two nights in a row when I was in Vegas. On the last night, I bought a whole pizza but only ate half. Regret not bringing the remaining back home. I've been home for 3 nights now, and think about this darn pizza, every night! 

The pizza here is not oily at all! This is also hidden in a hallway on the 3rd floor inside the Cosmo.

Note: They do not have pineapple topping.

Such a good pizza place literally hidden in the Cosmopolitan. The choices are pretty good and a whole pie is pretty cheap.

The best thing about this place is that it's located above Marquee so after a night of drinking and dancing, this pizza hits the spot. The line is pretty damn long though so be prepared to be standing there but since there are so many people, you can just chat with everyone around you. There is only one cashier so they are literally ringing everyone up, one at a time.

What a cool secretive place! This pizza place is not listed on the information boards - I had to ask one of the staff members working at the hotel to find it. That explains the name of the shop, duh? It's in its own alley way between 2 restaurants. Pretty cool I'd say. 

Pizza slices were huge, but since I went with a group we decided to get a whole pie for $28 which was a better deal anyways. We had sausages as our topping. The pizza was freshly baked, served super hot which was nice. The crust was crispy  and thin, not super doughy which I liked. Quite oily though I must say - I had to use napkins to tap out some of the oil on top of the pizza. You can sprinkle some chili flakes and extra cheese on top, just bare in mind the chili flakes were actually quite spicy. Overall the pizza was tasty! A good pizza joint if you want to grab a quick bite.

We happened to come in around 5:30 and miraculously there was no line. The white pie is so simple yet so tasty. Not only is the cheese high quality, but the taste of the olive oil, basil, and garlic all come through. I even loved how flavorful and crunchy the crust was, and I'm usually not too much into crust.

Pizza is good but overpriced. 

Ask them to REHEAT your slice to get a good crust. If you have not tried NY's pizza you'll say that this is the best pizza but this pizza is still good. mUst try. Get it by the slice and eat it right away...

tip: order a slice .....REHEAT....EAT.

If you love New York style pizza, this is the place for you. Giant slices, thin and crispy crusts, a delicious tomato sauce, wonderfully oozy-gooey cheese. The best drunk food on the Las Vegas strip, hands down.

The best part? It's 100 times better when you're sober.

I'd go 4 stars on pizza, 4.5 stars on atmosphere, ingredients and selection.  I go 5 stars on hours and price for Vegas strip.  To round up to 5 stars.  I'd have to say the quality of the ingredients was the second most memorable to simple, functional and cool concept.  Staff was quite friendly both times!

Pretty decent pizza, but pretty sure the only reason why this place is "good" is because of how late its open. After the club, or a long night at the tables, people get the munchies, and come here because practically everywhere else is closed. 

Pizza isn't bad but I've had better, plus the long and slow-moving lines will probably make me avoid this place the next time I'm in Vegas.

Meatball, ricotta, & pepperonccino - get a whole pie. Its that good. 

3rd floor, between Blue Ribbon and Jaleo restaurants.
There really isn't any where to sit. No forks and no water.

Been here couple times since my parents always stay at the Cosmo hotel! Good decent place for a quick bite. There is only a couple seating in there. It is located on the 2nd floor in a little hallway with a bunch of records on the wall. Very easy to miss!!!! I've had the pepperoni and the white pizza! Both are ok , kind of oily .

Thankfully we were told about Secret Pizza, because It is actually hard to find, and very hidden. We were craving food, and I had the secret in.  Thankfully we were highly motivated at 4:30AM  to get food (aka, to sober up). Thankfully, we also were staying in the Cosmo... so basically everything was meant to be. The line for secret pizza was VERY long at 4:30, but it moved fast, and it is worth every second of the wait, drunk or not . It has a funky vibe with a long hallway lined with tons of records.  They have lots of fun pizzas, but I would suggest just going with the slices. THE BEST pizza I have had in a long time, and that isn't just saying it as a drunk pizza.

SUCH GOOD PIZZA!! The line was long since I went around 3:00am and the people were getting drunk food. The pizza was fresh and hot out of the oven. 
It's a little hard to find since it's a "secret," but well worth the adventure.

The pizza was Amazing. The shredded cheese was pure, everything was freshhh. If your in Vegas you have to go there. The customer service was really great even at 3 o'clock in the morning. I tried the white pizza was bomb af! The sausage pizza was really good

This place is not a secret! You'll see why when there's a long line coming out of this place. As you wait in the hallway, you can be enthralled with all the album covers surrounding you. You may even giggle here and there with some of the selections you may see. Once surpassing the hallway, you enter this white room which can probably fill up to 20 people max. It is pretty much cafeteria style where you choose what slices are laid out in front of you, will warm it up, and then serve it to you. I recommend their white pizza. OMNOMNOMz. I could just gobble the whole pie. What I don't recommend? The supreme pizza. It pretty much tastes like a Costco combo pizza, which I'm not hating. However I'd rather spend $1.99 on a slice of that in Costco than at Secret Pizza.
Lastly, you MUST order a slice of cheesecake. MUST. Their cheesecake is mind-blowingly amazing. I'm not a fan of cheesecake as it is very dense, but they brought it to another level. Very light, crumbly, sweet, melts in your mouth dessert. Every time I go to Vegas I will come back just for this slice of cheesecake.

Lots of bathrooms are tucked away down a hallway also, but that doesn't automatically make them special too.

Yes, Secret Pizza is better than going to Sbarro on the Strip or hitting up whatever other pizza chains are in the area, but that's about it.

I had a pepperoni slice and a mushroom slice, which came out to $10.  It would have been another $3.50 had I gotten a soda, or $5 for a cup of PBR or $6 for a cup of IPA.  The pizza is totally acceptable, but doesn't compare to a place like Hot Lips in Portland, or [insert random place in your neighborhood here].  To be clear, it is better than average, and I have no issues with the overall taste.  It just didn't blow me away.

If you're at the Cosmopolitan or in the area (especially late at night if you're hungry) I would say to stop by if you're in the mood for pizza, but I wouldn't go out of my way walking down the Strip to get here, or get lost inside the Cosmo looking for it.  It's a cool looking joint once you make it inside.  So, Secret Pizza may not be special, but it's definitely "A-OK.

I wouldn't say this place is cheap.... But their pepperoni is soooo good. but they were a little stinchy on their sauce though.  Not the best pizza I ever had but it's pretty good.  Maybe it was just over hyped for me.  

4 stars - Chances are I'm coming back.

I feel like we walked an eternity trying to find this place, and just barely made it around 4:45am before they closed. It's one of the few food places open that late into the morning. The pizza itself was average, but I found the "hunt" aspect interesting. Absolutely no signage and had to rely on review photos to find it.  They had about 6 pizzas out on the counter and heated you up a slice when you ordered.  Very limited seating inside, but the Cosmo hotel has seating outside of the non-descript hallway that is the entrance.

Pizzeria at The Cosmopolitan nails my very favorite kind of pizza. It's slices as big as your head in New York fashion but the crust is thin and crispy the way I lurve it instead of doughy and chewy. I had my own slice of white pie that I gobbled up so fast Sir Nicholas barely had time to ask if he could have a bite to try it. But, he managed to squeeze in his request. And since he sampled a bite of my slice it was only fair he gave me a bit of his pepperoni, which I enjoyed just as much as my own.

There are like 4 seats inside here so you're probably taking your pie somewhere else to eat it. But, you can play old school video games while you wait like Galaga so that's pretty sweet.

They also sell a few beers and wines next to the sodas, but we went with Orange Fanta all the way when we stopped in for sustenance. 

People working here are fast and friendly and this is a great place to stop in for quick, easy eats before you head off to the next run of good fortune, shopping, or general merrymaking in Vegas.

Finally found the secret pizza spot! The line gets long, especially after 3am when people are stumbling out of Marquee. The pizza is fresh and really good. I can eat 2 slices at most, and I'm a small girl. Get their white pizza or the sausage\/pepperoni pizza. Grab a seat outside on the 3rd floor. There's always seats.

This is a neat little not so secret spot in between the Jaleo and something else (can't remember the name) on the 2nd floor of the Cosmo. I guess it's considered a 'secret' because it's not listed on any of the directories or maps located in the resort? You'll actually see a brightly lit hallway lined with photos as you walk towards the restaurants. There's no sign as I recall but you'll definitely be able to tell there's a little something something back there as you walk closer. 

The place is small and only had a handful of bar stools, so not much room for sitting. The pizza itself is...eh...over hyped in my opinion. It's great for drunk munchies but I've had better at the New York New York and other places. But if you like thin,crispy pizzas then this may be the place for you.

You really should try out this secret pizza place called Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan. 

I admit it. While celebrating my 25th extravaganza in Vegas last week, I am guilty of being a repeat offender of Secret Pizza. For a bunch of girls (and boys) who revolves our schedules around eating and trying new places, I would say that is quite a compliment!

Here's how it all started. Before we decided to go bar crawling in the Cosmopolitan, a local friend of mine told me that I should get the white pizza at Secret Pizza. Intrigued by this mysterious pizza joint and white pizza, the gang and I headed over in our tight dresses to devour some deliciousness. Being greedy as ever, I decided to go for their famed white slice and a combo. Halfway through, I realized my stomach is much smaller than I thought and had a difficult time finishing. The unique taste of the white pizza (composed of 3 different types of cheeses) had my taste buds jumping for joy but the familiar taste of the combo had me equally impressed.

Secret Pizza makes me feel like I'm so "in the know". From the outside, no one would know what the hallway leads to. For those who rarely ventures off into random hallways, well that's their loss! I plan on coming back next time I'm in Vegas, so yelper's-- please keep the long lines as short as possible by keeping this place a secret!
this is a great case of reviews inflated by alcohol.  the late night crowd that lines up for pizza is incredibly annoying and not a bit discriminating.

Its no longer a Secret!
After a night of partying in Vegas you crave that greasy food!! Well lucky for us we were staying at the Cosmo hotel.  We tried to find it when we first arrived and no there isn't signs to help you find this place. So we asked and everyone knows where it is.  At 2am we came here and the line was loooong!! We waited a good 30-40 minutes in line but when you're in Vegas line ups are very entertaining, so time went by fast and soon enough we got our pizza.  They sale by the slice and whole pizzas.  I opted for a pepperoni pizza.  It was yummy crust is thin but not crunchy, topping was great!! Satisfied that craving.

There is no sign! Thankfully, you will notice it at night as the only place with a line protruding out near the elevator around the restaurants. (I just asked someone who worked at the Cosmopolitan. I'm lazy~) 

Most of these people are people dealing with a long night of party-going, drinking, money spending, or whatever Las Vegas-type shenanigans has to offer and ending it with a nice slice of pizza. The line moves pretty steadily, most of the time. If it's slow, it's probably the customer, not the workers. Just a wittle "for-your-information."

Pizza is about 5 dollars a slice, but slices are huge. You even see people walking out with boxes, and I mean BOXES of pizza here. (For 2-3AM, and to be willing to spend more money on this place, you know the food is good.) I, myself, enjoyed the slices, and I certainly shared it with my two friends. We were good with just two slices. Water is free there and they have a filter machine next to the counter.

Atmosphere is great, service is hardworking and diligent, and honestly, I don't feel so bad about what Las Vegas did to me that night once I look around at others. I'll be back again sure enough~ Thanks guys!

I honestly think this is my favorite pizza in Las Vegas. I mean I don't go out of my way to come here because driving on the strip is a bi...atch, but if I happen to be at Cosmo I will do ANYTHING within my power to stop by Secret Pizza. 

Their white pizza is the definite winner. The gobs of different cheeses that they use are just too delicious. Pepperoni and sausage is a close second! They use thick slices of sausage that just complement the rich tomato sauce perfectly. Their crust is chewy and crispy at the same damn time. 

If you come here you have to order an entire pizza regardless of how many people are in your party. Nothing beats a freshly baked pizza! Just be careful to wait a second so you don't burn the roof of your mouth. 

Now excuse me while I go reheat a leftover slice of white pizza in my kitchen.

First time trying this type of pizza. Order the white pizza, not a fan. It was bland and very oily. But I did enjoy the crust...thin, crispy and crunchy. I will be back to try the other types of pizza.

Reminds me of NY pizza but kind of overpriced.  $4 for a cup of soda pop and $5 for a slice of pizza...kind of expensive for a carry out type of food joint.  With that said, the pizza is pretty good.  If you are craving thin crust pizza and are on the Vegas strip, this will satisfy your craving.

Just the best pizza ever. Amazing. Wonderful. Thin crust. Large slices. 

Sure, it's a teeny bit pricey for a slice, and if you go at the wrong time, the line is ridiculous. Plus, there are very few places to sit; the place is a hole in the wall. But the pizza is so good that we once bought a whole pie and smuggled it on to the plane so we could eat it at home. And it was still great the next day.

Get a slice.. or the whole pizza. Not pricey at all (for Vegas). Definitely overhyped but it does satisfy with its oily and greasy goodness. Especially good at 4am after you drag your drunken and danced-out bum out of Marquee and are in dire need of some savory carbs. A custom-made, pizza takes about twenty minutes to make. I give this place props for staying open til 5am because they have to deal with some intolerable drunks. Kudos to you guys.

You know, this place is good, but....if one were to believe the reviews here, it would seem as though glorious slices of heaven were handed down from Mount Olympus by radiant angels making water from wine with flour, yeast and pepperoni as someone hands their money over the counter.

It's good....and it was fun to check in here...but it's not the BEST PIZZA EVER!!!

That said, if you're walking on the strip towards the city center and feeling a hankering for some very tasty pie, walk into this casino and look for that tube-style elevator near the back quarter of the casino floor.  It will, once one completes the journey to the 4th floor, deposit you mere feet from the unmarked entrance of this really nifty find.

I wonder, given the success the whole lets-make-it-a-treasure-hunt sort of thing, if other casinos will start to hide random businesses in the nooks of their properties?

Pretty cool spot if you curious to go on a adventure to find the place. Pizza was totally ny style even tho I've never been there kinda what Id picture it to taste like lol. The girl at the counter was super nice, check it out if you want a quick bite on your drunken journey thru las vegas!

Secret Pizza is fine but nothing special. It's probably worth going if you're staying at Cosmopolitan and rolling downstairs OR you're drunk and leaving the club and starving OR just wanting a quick bite before going to the club. Otherwise, for me, it wasn't worth walking over from Excalibur and waiting in line for 20 minutes.

Great Pizza.  Slices are large and 5$.  The line can get absurd at night when the club (Marquee) starts to let out between 1-4am.  When I mean absurd, I mean like an hour wait to get to the register and order pre-made pizza.

If you go during off hours (not lunch, dinner or after hours) you can go right up and get a slice.  This is probably the best quick pizza you can grab on the strip.

Stay and play a round of pinball. ;)

Average pizza. The "secret location" is nonexistent now. If you're around and hungry for pizza, go for it. The tipping scale goes.in their favor because the staff is friendly and quick and actually listens to your requests. Not a bad idea to tip them - they seemed appreciative.

The struggle is real...for locals. It's alllll the way inside the Cosmopolitan. So if you're visiting and staying on the strip, keep in mind there is a gem of a pizza place open until 5am. 

Go upstairs and find the long hallway (which is the nicest part of the venue) and prepare to wait in line. 

Thin crust, Boston & NY style pizza in the desert, that's what you're getting. I love a real thin crust over a deep dish cheesy, so this place speaks to me. I go for the "White Pizza." Always. 

Obviously order your Go To pizza and if you don't like it then you'll probably not like the others. 

There's so many pizza parlors to choose from so I'd say definitely go here if you want to be in a crowd and then eat your slice standing up, or teetering down the escalator. Seriously go after clubbing at Marquee. I'd say it's necessary then.
One of the best tasting pizza's I've ever had. Great late night snack!  If ever in Vegas you must try it. The lines are a bit lengthy, but oh so tasty and well worth the wait!

Great service. I mean for the amount of people at times that come through.....it's good. Pizza is great and if you have more than like 4-5 people....you might as well get a whole pizza. Overall good pizza

My fianc heard about this place when he was at a bachelor party about a year ago. He ate there twice and couldn't stop talking about it. Every once in a while, I love a good pizza. I usually won't indulge in the calories unless I know, for sure that it's gotten good reviews. Always a fan of anything hidden or secret, as long as it provides an adventure to get there - count me in. It was about 6:30 PM on a weekday. My fianc and I were on a work trip. After a long day at work, we grew increasingly hungry and were definitely in the mood to stuff our faces with good pizza. Luckily, because we got there early, we did not wait in line for long. We were able to get helped right away. My fianc got a slice of pepperoni and a slice  of sausage and bell peppers, I got a slice of the supreme-which included sausage, pepperoni, and veggies. They had charged us for three slices, a salad, and water. They served us four slices. I brought it back to the guy and he said "no worries, enjoy!" So, we did! The pizza was delicious and each one of them was well worth the calories. The salad we ordered was much better than a salad you would assume would come from a pizza place. Prices were OK. Altogether, I think we spent $30. Not bad at all. Especially, for Las Vegas. It's very casual, there was a lot of people there that you could tell came straight from the pool. After a long day of drinking and being in the sun I'm sure they were definitely ready for pizza. There is limited seating, we were lucky enough to get two seats. Overall, the place is very small. There's a few video games, and a TV that was playing the World Series. Otherwise, a lot of people get their slices to go! You enter down a hallway. There is no advertisement on the outside, it's almost impossible to miss if you don't know about it. It is right around the restaurants Beauty and Essex and Blue Ribbon. Manja, Manja!

It's really a 3 1\/2 stars. It was a definitely a secrect place. The place has no sign and not listed under directory. We realized that's because they cater to hotel first for room service. The take out counter comes second.

The cheese slice and white pizza slice was very good, but I really don't think It's worth $9.50 and a trip for locals to go fight the the traffic on the strip. While we were there, my girl friend and I both agree $22 for a whole pie and $2.50 for each topping is just way too much for a pizza without a sitting table.

We won't go back again.

Yummmmm.....Tasty pizza in the Cosmo and in a hidden area on the 3rd floor......Just look past the pool table!  The prices were a bit high, but it is Vegas.  The slices were delicious.  Will venture back on our next visit.  Thanks Yelp!

There's a reason it's called Secret Pizza; it's next to impossible to find. Don't go here expecting to sit and enjoy your pizza in peace because there are maybe three bar stools. Other than that, the place is pretty cool and the pizza is delicious!

3.5 stars but I'll round up to 4 because our first experience was good. 

Located on the 3rd floor down a discreet hallway inside the Cosmopolitan. 

My bf and I shared 3 slices. I wanted to come back here for their Sicilian pizza but they said there was a 20 minute wait for it. So we ordered a cheese pizza added with mushrooms and sausage, white pizza, and one they had on display, which was a cheese with meatball and ricotta. Out of the three, the white was our favorite, and the meatball and ricotta was delicious too. However, the mushrooms on the cheese pizza with sausage was way too undercooked. It was a disappointment. Maybe it was because we asked to add them as a custom order. 

Service was slightly rude. The guy taking our orders seemed grumpy. The tables were also very messy and we had to clean up the cheese and napkins scattered over the tables ourselves. 

I'd come back here for the Sicilian pizza if I'm around the strip.
Pizza so good it makes me throw my gluten allergy into the wind!

Good, fast and cheap late night pizza at $5 a slice. 3rd floor in unmarked hallway. 
Crisp and tasty but pretty greasy so blot away

This place was incredibly easy to find. Some spoiler coming if you don't want to know any info on the location. All I wanted to know was what floor it was on and what to be on the look out for. We went up the escalator and the hallway was literally right there in front of us. It took two seconds to spot. Knowing it was in the third floor and down a hallway. 


We ordered three slices of pepperoni with peppers and a beer. It came out to around 24$ kind of expensive but it's the cosmo in Vegas, you kind of expect that pricing. There are no tables so we took our pizza back to our hotel, Aria, to eat. It was still hot when we got back and the pizza was super delicious! A lot of reviewers said they thought their pizza was too salty, but I didn't think so. However I am a fan of salty foods. 

We came around 8 on a Sunday night and there was no line. It's a shame when people come during peak hours after clubs and complain about drunk people with long lines. What did you expect? The crowd doesn't affect the taste of the pizza, just the bitterness that is you. 

Overall I would return. If I wasn't so lazy, I would be walking myself over and to get another slice now. Maybe tomorrow night. ;)
Great pizza!  If you like New York style you'll love this. Any variation is delicious. Amazing crust and good sauce....2 things that matter most to me!  Oh I guess 3 things CHEESE rocks too.
Great pizza and friendly staff! Don't expect fanciness, just expect a great place for a quick delicious bite with a little Elvis music in the background and if you find a barstool-stay and enjoy:)
very good pizza and is really a secret place. so difficult to find but was funny . you must ask people how to get.

It can be kind of hard to find, but it's located next to Jose Andres' restaurant Jaleo. Don't even bother using those electronic maps around the casino for help, because you won't find it listed under restaurants or dining\/food. It's called Secret Pizza for a reason. 

If you want to come here to eat and not just to quell your drunchies, then come out lunch. The post-clubbing crowd always makes the line go out the door. Avoid that crowd and come during lunch. I like the white slice the best. Add some sausage and sundried tomatoes, and perfection! They have a new one called the sicilian slice which is similar to the white slice but a deep dish version loaded with what looks like 5lbs of cheese. Kind of pricey for a slice of pizza ($5.50 for white slice, $5 for red, $8 for sicilian), but they make up for it by giving you a good sizable slice.

TLDR: Clubbing at Marquee and got the drunchies? Go here! The line can get ridiculous, but come during lunch if you want to avoid it or suck it up and wait in that line to sober up and get your pizza. On the pricier side, but large slices!

Secret Pizza... wow. Probably better than any slice I've had in the US outside of NYC. Located on the third floor of the Cosmo and unmarked - this is totally worth seeking out to try. They have everything you need as far as toppings (adding ranch would be a sin) and serve beer as well to pair along. I can still taste the flavor as I type this.. Line or not - this is worth your time and at a fair value at that! Next time I come I'm  grabbing a whole pie to myself while the world judges me.

Seriously a gem in the heart of the Vegas strip. Perfectly crispy, thin New York style pizza for a way inexpensive, by Las Vegas standards, price. I thought the choices would be pepperoni or cheese, but there's actually a decent selection. Great choice when you don't want to wait for a table, pay a high price or get a snotty hostess attitude. (There's too much of all that in Vegas) And, they're open til the wee hours of the AM.
Good enough I suppose. Wasn't bad, wasn't great. Don't go out of your way to try it out.

So not such a well-kept secret, but there is no sign and it is not on the map, so it's not well known. Good slice, and for the price in Vegas, you can't beat it. I had the white pizza, which was really good for sure. We weren't drunk, but after a night of drinking I believe this would be just the place! Unpretentious, especially for Vegas...gotta love it!

Although the pizza might be good, the lines at 2am are nuts and last forever. It's only pizza, hard to think you'll spend over an hour in this line.


Good food, just need to serve customers faster.

We were in town and decided to have a little food adventure to find this place. We were a little disappointed because it wasn't as "hidden" as we thought it would be but that just may be because we hyped it up to ourselves so much. 

As far as the pizza, it was fine. A little too greasy for my taste but the pepperoni was tasty. So was it the best pizza I've ever eaten? Definitely not. Would it be very satisfying at 2am after some drinks? Absolutely.

I don't know why everyone says this place is SO SO great? I guess if you like super greasy, sop up 2 napkins pizza, with mediocre toppings and mediocre crust, this is the place!  Upon entering through a cool little 'alley way' you are greeted with a real mess of paper plates, rinds of crust on the floor, full trash can, etc.  They didn't even reheat the slices in the oven before handing it over. I assume most of these reviews are from the long line of intoxicated patrons in their best 'clubbin' gear eating greasy goodness to sober up.  I guess everything does taste better when you're drunk. Maybe this would be a 5 star review if I was s@*t wasted.

Okay this place is pretty good but it's obviously not a secret anymore -_-

The White Pizza or whatever is suuuper good. I love cheese and creamy pizza :3 yummyyy.


But I have one freaking problem... THEY. DON'T. HAVE. RANCH. -____-

i love my pizza crust with ranch and I was sho sad. They literally have it on their menu board. 
NO RANCH. 

:( sadness. 

But their sodas is unlimited refills FYI

It's like a speakeasy for pizza. Follow the crowd upstairs of the Cosmo and you can't miss it. Great for late night, great for breakfast, great for a snack, basically it's always great. Came here 3x the last time I was in Vegas cause I'm a fat monster and I don't regret a single greasy visit.

Hidden within the coolest hotel in Vegas, the Cosmo. This place is just plain cool. No signs, no advertising, just word of mouth. 5.50 for pizza in Vegas. And open until 5am.  


Spoiler alert.
3rd floor
Hard to find so ask around..the secret is that it is hidden w\/out signs to point you in the right direction so do ask..worth the time.

At 10pm last night the line was too long for us, but today for lunch there was no line at all. The staff is friendly and the food is great at a reasonable price. The location is on the third floor and it's right between the elevator and the sushi restaurant. We had  white, mushroom and pepperoni slices. The mushroom was good, pepperoni was better and the white was amazing. The seating outside the pizza joint is limited, but it is really comfortable and classy looking.

It took me a little while to find secret pizza.... no signs = tricky to find. The only thing that pointed me in the right direction was the dark hallway that the pictures on yelp showed. 

I can't say that this was the best pizza that I ever had but it was certainly not the worst. I can see why people would come here for the drunk munchies since its open late and when you're drunk anything would taste good. Even bad pizza would taste good.

I had the white pizza and it was a pretty decent NY style size pizza and very filling.

When the moon hits the sky like a big pizza pie, THAT'S AMORE!!! Now, this is my kind of pizza.  I always order the white pizza with the marinara sauce on the side.  All delicious goodness without the pretense or attitude.  Even the staff is funny.  Worth the hassle of finding parking at the Cosmo.

Yummy but waits are way too long. Love love love their white Pizza! Think it's stupid that they don't offer water in a place like this. They really should just put a filtered water station in the corner. Would go here every trip to Vegas but the trek to Cosmo (even though we were actually very close) and the wait time deterred us from going on our last trip. Love that you can pick your own ingredients and really like their dough, sauce and cheese preparations. Selection of toppings is reasonably good and of quality. Overall a must-try if you can tolerate the crazy lineups. Can order whole pies ahead and pick up as alternative.
This was honestly the best pizza I've ever had.  If you want to keep things simple or if you're sick of eating buffets all day, stop by here and give their pizza a try.

[Can You Keep A Secret]

Each time I visit The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas I find an excuse to grab a slice of the hotels best kept secret. If your a fan of white pizza it's a must order here. The slices are pretty big and the accents of some of the employees are even better. Will I return... Heck yes! 

(Directions you ask? 3rd Floor Boulevard Tower but you didn't hear that from this Elite! Capiche?)

A definite must after a long night of partying or a quick bite before;)  Every time we've gone has been delicious!!! We've gone at all hours of the day and the crowd is pretty unpredictable. They're soo good that they're worth the wait TRUST ME!
Awesome pizza by the slice!  Just wish they had an option to get a whole pie that wasn't so large.
Amazing pizza place hidden inside The Cosmopolitan Hotel, NYC style. Can compete with any place in the big apple. I think this is a must for pizza whenever in Vegas, I just loved it.

Secret Pizza is not so secret. We were out for a Vegas girls night and were wanting some late night dinner to soak up the drinks. I had heard about Secret Pizza from an episode of Man Finds Food and thought of this place. Secret Pizza is located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan through an unmarked hallway and had a loooong line. It was around 2:30am with not much else open, so we chose to wait. We waited in line down the long hallway for about 30min and were tortured by everyone walking by with their delicious looking pizza. It was finally time to order and I went with the Sicilian white pizza. I'm not usually a fan of Sicilian, but this slice looked so good I decided to take a risk. The pizza was delicious (as a former New Yorker I'm very picky about my pizza). The crust was cooked perfectly and was full of garlicky flavor and creamy ricotta. It was also huge, I could only eat half. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be sure to come back for some late night pizza.

My absolute favourite pizza place in the world. Well, I have not been to Italy to try real pizza. But this is so far the best pizza I have. 

I am actually not a big fan of pizza, more for weight watch reason. So I want it good when I have to spend my calories on it. And this worth every bite as much as every single calories on it. My favourite is their sausage jalapenos pizza. It's just simple, thin crust and so so so flavorful. I don't even understand what they put in there. I like that the crust are crispy and thin, yet the pizza is still very moist. With the pamasen and chilli flakes, I can eat half a pizza if I have burn it out in marquee dance floor before hand. 

Being said, it is in the comospolitan hotel, on the 3rd floor, above marquee. If you look for the escalator by all saints, you pretty much just walk straight once you are on the 3rd floor and look for an entrance that has lots of vinyl covers on the wall. Love how hidden and low key it is but yet it's such an popular place. So they close at 5 am, but the worker there says, don't come at 5 and count on it. It will be either super packed with people with ling out of the door because of the after clubbing hunger or it would be very slow that they decided to close early. So if you don't want to miss your late night pizza, come no later then 4 am. So hungry just thinking about it again.
Delicious pizza! What better place to go when you're hungry at 2 am? The line can get a bit long, but it's worth the wait.

Every once in a lifetime, dreams can come true."

That is how I felt when I took my first bite of Secret Pizza. This is one of the main reasons I came to Vegas.  Cheese drag, fat juicy chunks of sausages, and pepperoni that was to die for.

Secret Pizza really had it all. The mystique of not being formally mentioned anywhere inside of the hotel, a cool hallway of music records to give it a chic and classic kind of feel, sports playing on a TV in the corner, and the delicious pizza to go with it.

On the real, though, I don't think there's any way I would've been able to find this place on my own if The Empress hadn't been there before and led me there herself. But, that's Secret Pizza's whole thing, isn't it? I think it's pretty cool! It makes the place feel almost a little exclusive. 

Onto the food! The pizza was phenomenal. I mean, I'm by no means any pizza expert or anything, but I do know that that was the best pizza I've ever had; hands down (and I've been to Chicago, folks). The pizza that I had wasn't even a freshly baked one. It was from a hot plate and then put back into the oven for a few minutes. That's how good it was! The cheese, as mentioned above was oh so stringy. Legitimately the most stringy cheese that I have ever had on a pizza, and I loved it. The sausage on the pizza was also just amazing. They were the largest chunks of Italian sausage that I've had on a pizza before, and they were just as flavorful as they were large. Even the crust was nice and perfectly crisp, but soft at the same time. The pizza was spectacular.

To say that Secret Pizza lived up to my expectations would be an understatement. The only thing that bums me out about any of it is that I'm lactose intolerant and could only bring myself to go get pizza there once in the few days that we were in Vegas.

If you can manage to find Secret Pizza, then I absolutely suggest that you make a point of stopping by to get the same experience I did. You won't regret it!

Walking down the narrow record album lined corridor leading to this unmarked location, I was magically transported to the pizza places of my youth growing up in NYC. If I was not surrounded by a casino\/hotel I would swear I WAS at a NYC pizza joint. The dough was perfect! Crispy on the outside leading to a soft interior. The sauce hit all the right notes and the cheese was appropriately stringy. 
Reasonably priced for Las Vegas. I could eat here every day.

Secrets, secrets, are no fun. Secrets, secrets, hurt someone... Unless they involved pizza. 

Want some pro tips? At $5\/slice, that makes a pie $50, but guess what? Cheeze pie is $26! Want a consistent delicious pizza everytime you're at Secret? Get the pie!
