What a neat find thanks to Yelp! The area leading to the counter is a wonderful turn back in time with records on the walls and pinball machines once the hallway has been finished. Friendly and courteous staff greeted us and stated we got there at the right time, seems like half of the note decided to venture down that hallway right after we did! The pizza was reasonably priced, knocking one star off because the pizza was nothing more than comparable to a Sbarro, which may not be worth a long wait.

It's pizza. I hate it when people over-glamorize or over-complicate fundamentally simple foods: pizza, ramen, burgers, dumplings, etc. It's dough, sauce, and cheese.

The pizza is fine and it's a place to get a quick bite in the Cosmopolitan. You certainly wouldn't travel a long distance or even walk a long distance to get here, but if you are in the area and need a quick bite, it's fine. It's not memorable.

It's really no longer a secret and with so many reviews, there isn't much else to be said. Drunk or sober, this pizza really is something else. My only regret is that it is SO popular now, you really can't go without there being an extremely long line. Ahh, RIP the days when no one really knew about Secret Pizza or even how to find it.

I love this place.  I sat outside their door waiting for them to open this morning.  I. Got their first slice of the day.  Thin, crispy crust and great flavor.  James there was very sweet and reminded me to get my identity points.  

Fave is white pizza and pepperoni.

Amazing pizza!!! Great spot they have at the Cosmo, the decor on the walls are super cool as well. Definitely my top 3 pizza spots of Vegas when I went. Really want more know that I think of it haha. Wish Washington St. Had more pizza spots like this.

My only gripe is this isn't 24 hours!!!!

Great location - food in the mall for under $10. That's a steal! And they sell beer! And the pizza is good and offers various kinds and toppings.

The secret is that it's really just OK pizza. Typical greasy under-the-heat-lamp pizza that tastes delicious if you're drunk but just all-right if you're sober. The flavors are as-is for the most part but you can accessorize for a price. The best part about coming here is that it is a secret - no signs or special doors, just a hallway. You feel special just to find it, along with the other, yeap I'm gonna say it, hipsters. IPA and PBR are flowing as well as wine and soda. Pinball machines are in check.

Imagine: you are hungry, tired, and spent an hour trying to get your hands on some pizza. Suddenly, you find Secret Pizza. You run down the hall and your face lights up as you enter.

They recommend the White Pizza. You order it and start eating it shoving it into your face.

Words cannot describe how much I love this pizza. It was much better than the NY style pizza I had in NY this past winter. I can't wait to go back to Vegas just for this!!

My BF and I were so full..
Trying to fit in all the great restaurants in our busy schedule..
It was our last night in Vegas..
and after reading Anthony N., Michelle T., and Jessica Y.'s reviews about this pizza joint...
We HAD to fit this place in @ 1am... lol

It took us a while to find this place..
since they're sorta hidden.. http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=JXoETn8OGGd-u1jrTldyTQ
w\/ no sign or name on the directory (I didn't see any..).
And I didn't feel like reading all the Yelp reviews to get a clue on how to find this place!!!
They're on LEVEL 3 right by the escalators
and a pool table area...... :}
We saw a group of people in the lobby-like area chomping down big slices of pizza..
and THAT's when we knew we found it.. lol

1 slice of cheese pizza $4.50 http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=Aq-DmSdY-vcyovcZ6e06uA
+ 50cents\/topping
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=LWZIYCJb65OmuhypdFEDzw $6.00

We got one slice each to take back to our hotel..
And as soon as we bit into it.. 
We regretted getting only one slice!!
It got cold.. but it was STILL VERY GOOD.
BF: if pizza is good even when it's cold.. it's friggin good! :}

We'll probably be here every time we're in Vegas.

p.s. My BF loves it when I find great places like this on Yelp.. teehehe

MmMmm...
*burp*

After searching for this place for ten minutes, my buddies and I grew irritated. Once we finally found it, thanks to a group of drunk girls who kept yelling "pizzaaa" as they made their way to Secret, we couldn't have been more impressed. NY style pizza by the slice! So good. Keep in mind, it's in a hallway, near STK, on the 3rd floor.

The fact that it's "pricey" shouldn't deter people from visiting this spot. The pizza absolutely justifies it! It's almost routine now- Go to Marquee till 2am, then end up at Secret to enjoy the delicious pizza and sober up, Lol.
Wonderful secret hidden pizza place! Line is always really long but worth the wait! The pizza is extra large and yummy! Recommend especially after concerts at the Chelsea!

Long line for reheated pizza. 

Admittedly, it IS one of the more affordable and accessible food options at the Cosmopolitan. it used to be a hidden pizza bar, but with their increasing popularity, it's not so secret anymore (especially with the huge line congregating by the entrance). 

After the near 45 minute wait in the dimly lit hallway, we finally made it inside. You choose a slice, and they reheat it in the oven for you. The slices are a good size, but very salty. Seating inside is near nonexistent, so be prepared to eat your pizza standing up.

Aside from the price and location, there is nothing particularly special about this place. I'd eat it again in a pinch, but definitely not my first choice.

If you happen to be in or around the Cosmopolitan hotel and want a quick bite, this place might be worth checking out. It's located on the same floor as STK, almost directly across from it. It doesn't have a sign to tell you it's there and it's located through a small little hallway, so it may be a little bit tricky to find. 

This place has New York style pizza. You can order by the slice, and if you want extra toppings on it, just ask and they'll put it on before reheating it in their oven. Very simple pizza but tasty. It's a very small place, and basically standing room only. This place is more of a grab and eat on the go because you can't really dine in. Worth checking out if you're close by, and who doesn't love pizza when they are drunk?

Food quality: 5\/5
I think the New York style pizza is top notch! This pizza is especially amazing because its open really late. The cheese melts perfectly, the pepperoni are deliciously spiced, the crust is crispy but soft on the inside... Too many yum factors go into this pizza to describe!

Customer service: 5\/5
For the place being filled with a ton of overly drunk people, the staff is surprisingly patient and likes to describe the pizza if you ask. Also a shout out to the hotel staff for them helping my group and I find this place (it is really hidden with no sign). You have to be on the third floor near where marquee would be (by the center chandelier bar).

Ambiance: 5\/5
The place is hidden and down a long hallway but it opens up to a tiny 5 seater bar with a pizza bar where you watch them make the pizza and cut it up and serve it to you. Amazing! Also, it has an old arcade (I think it had two games, a pinball and an actual arcade game). Cool retro art littered the walls. I loved this place and it's definitely a new fave!

Overall experience: 5\/5

For this most recent Vegas trip, this was probably my favorite meal Trying to head out early Sunday morning to make it back to LA for Super Bowl.  My friend had never been to Cosmopolitan and the City Center area so we went there looking for food since it was early for Sin City standards, many restaurants weren't open yet and I completely forgot about Secret  Pizza. I've been wanting to finally check it out and I happened to remember on the whim. Luckily, trusty yelp and friends gave me the tips to find it (next to Blue Ribbon sushi, in a hallway with album art). We just got there around opening time and there was a line already. They had 4 types of pizza ready to go, so I got their white pizza and a pepperoni with spicy sausage. Both were solid and hit the spot. Yummy! And I ate it like a Californian, as my New York-born friend pointed out.
I'm from Chicago so my pizza standards are high but for the price and their hours, you can't beat it. Good food and good service.

An awesome late night snack at 1 am!  On the second floor by the pool table Secret Pizza is a hidden gem.   There is no signage to highlight this pizza joint's location so it can prove to be difficult to locate the first time you look. 

The individual pizza slices are proportionally generously.  The pizza dough is ultra thin, and the combination of cheesy goodness and tangy tomato sauce makes this pizza mouthwateringly great!  

I usually get the pepperoni.  It's a oldie but a classic!  If you can find this hidden treasure you'll discover this gem is well worth the tolls of the search!!!
Had the white pizza wife had the cheese no doubt one of the best in town

I love love love the secret pizza stop at Cosmopolitan. Nestled in a hallway at the Cosmoploitan reminds me of finding those little secret joints in New York.....so is this where they got their idea from.....cuz if so it's working....people lined up...the smell of the best darned pizza I've ever had, and the nicest staff a girl could ask for. I really did not think I would like it as I really have not found a good pizza joint in Las Vegas (well to my likeing anyway, and when it comes to food I'm a tough cookie). So off I go into this pizza culinary dream joint only to find that they have veggies...lots and lots of veggies (yup I'm a vegetarian). This is one reason I thought I may not like it.... The staff assured me that I can get almost any veggie known to man if I would wait a minute while they ran to room service to get the ones most people don't eat on a pizza. What a concept! Yes guys you can order pizza to your room after a long night at Marquee...just call room service and they will hook u up....Between the quaintness of the hidden pizza joint and being able to order it from room service I see a winner....now can we get a chain of these across the us PLZZZZZ??????

The pizza was super delish and greasy! Great for a night of drinking or helping with a hangover! The slices are huge, so it's like getting 2 slices :)
It cost about 20 bucks for 3 slices of pizza and a soda.. I can't complain!

I'm not sure how secret it is because the entrance is pretty obvious when you walk by, but who cares!  Despite the long lines, we went twice over the course of a weekend.  Was it the booze that made it taste so good?  Not sure, but it 100% hit the spot after a long day of cocktails by the pool!  On our second visit, we were actually in Beauty and Essex trying to order appetizers at the bar.  The bartender kept overlooking us and we decided screw it, let's save the money and have pizza. No regrets--it was delicious!  I'll be back for sure.

Not necessarily the best pizza I've ever had but decent & delicious :) Located on the 3rd floor right behind the elevators...

We ordered a 3-topping pizza, came out in 30 minutes, costs $33. Pepperoni , sausage & mushroom!

Kinda greasy, our line wasn't long at all at 7:00pm arrival.
Fun for the uniqueness factor but was sadly underwhelmed with the pizza, which wasn't served piping hot. Pricey ($5\/slice) but might be worth checking out just for the curiosity factor.

Delicious!! Once you find the place, you will not be disappointed. Take the escalators up to the third floor from the shops area of the cosmopolitan and walk down the non-descript hallway lined with frames on the walls. Well worth the hunt!

Secret pizza is a secret! It is definitely hidden and if I did not view it here on Yelp before I would have totally missed the entrance since there is no sign. They have a long hallway full of pictures that lead to the back where all the secrets are! The place is very small. No tables inside for seating besides a small standing area. They have a couple old school video games. 

They have slices ready to choose from or if you want a whole pizza it could take 15 minutes or more. We had just arrived to Vegas so we were starving. We each went with two slices. They place them in their oven for a few minutes to reheat them and then we took them up to our room.

I got one with everything on it and thought it was just okay. With so many ingredients I still found it lacking flavor and sauce. I also tried the feta cheese one. I again was not impressed and it was bland. My hubby got a sausage one and he loved it. He also tried mine and liked mine. So maybe it was just how I prefer my pizza, I personally just didn't like it.
Amazing pizza. Cheap pizza. Hidden gem in The Cosmopolitan.  Ahhhh.....this place is so great, it's so hard to keep it secret. A must when visiting Vegas!

The secret is out! How long has this place been open for? I never even knew until most recently. It's inside the Cosmopolitan hotel. You should be able to find it after leaving the Marquee nightclub. There's no signs for it. Only a weird walkway with vintage images on the wall. The great thing is the cool factor about asking around to find this place. The adventure and finding your treasure makes it awesome! 

The pizza here is okay. It looks similiar to a NY thin slice pizza.. Only it doesn't taste as good. If your drunk then this thing is amazing. I had the white pizza. It had a lot of garlic and a bold cheese taste. It was a little too greasy but hey it's pizza.. so why am I even complaining...I would definitely eat this again when I'm looking for a slice of pizza. It's not expensive and probably the cheapest thing to buy inside the Cosmopolitan.
I don't get all of the hype over this place other than it is hidden and has no signage. The pizza was average at best and greasy. There are way better pizza spots in Las Vegas.

This place is amazing. It truly is a secret. There isn't a single sign posted anywhere that tells you where it is or how to get there - which makes it even more fun.

I am definitely a crust girl when it comes to pizza. Crust can make or break a pizza for me and this crust was killer! My brother-in-law doesn't like crust and I ended up eating all of his (oops!). The crust is nice and doughy - super thick - so if you're not a fan of thick crust this is probably not your type of pizza place.

We went in the middle of the afternoon for lunch and waited about 20 minutes for two large pizzas - I consider this a typical wait time for a pizza and it was well worth it. Plus there are pool tables right outside of the place so we shot pool while waiting. 

It was a little crowded inside but this is definitely not a place that you are going to sit down and eat your pizza. You will definitely be taking it to go. There are plenty of places to sit right outside of the place but only a couple stools inside. 

Only one bummer - they don't have pineapple for pizza. My favorite pizza is easily pineapple with pepperoni and it was a slight disappointment that they didn't have it.

Sooo glad I visited Vegas with friends who knew about Secret Pizza and took us there several times! There's a ton of very good expensive food in that town but sometimes (or often, if you're me) you just want a good slice of pizza in the middle of the night. Secret Pizza did not disappoint!

Awesome pizza, whether sober or imbibed.  The only problem is, they have too many different slices and you want to try them all!

Every slice I've tried has been excellent, though the white pie is one of my favorites.

It's a bit hard to find, but well worth the visit.  If you visit during the wee hours, be prepared for a line (of often colorful characters).  But, it's worth the wait (and at least you'll probably have fun while waiting).

Pizza here was delicious even to a very hungover tummy! Price was super reasonable considering being in the land of over priced everything. It was definitely unmarked but like previous yelpers said its not very hard to find. It's right next to the sushi place and the elevator on the 3rd floor. This will definitely be a staple in our future Vegas adventures.

If you're going to the Cosmopolitan, or staying at the Cosmopolitan, you should get pizza here. If you're not going to Cosmopolitan, or staying at the Cosmopolitan, you should consider going to the Cosmopolitan so you can get pizza here. Unless, you don't like New York style pizza, then don't get pizza here.

SO GOOD!! Tried it for the first time. Got white pizza for $5 and it was simply CHEESEY GOODNESS! They reheat the pizza for you so when you it's nice and crispy when you eat! Though this place isn't very secret anymore since the line gets pretty long, it's worth the wait! Perfect place to go after clubbing at Marquee since it's open til 5 am. There's not that much room for you to sit and eat inside, but there's a seating area right outside with a pool table. Definitely a good place to stop by in Cosmo!

Secret pizza is  great for when the other restaurants in the Cosmopolitan hotel are really busy. The pizza is good, a bit greasy. The staff is fast and we got an entire pizza in about 10 minutes. It is an unmarked hallway near the restaurants in the Cosmopolitan hotel. There are small counters with bar stools if you're single or with one other person. No real tables to sit at, so we brought our entire pizza back to our room.

Simply the best NY slice you can find on the strip, secret pizza is the "no-so-secret" stop in The Cosmopolitan Hotel. Depending on time of day, you may find a long line snaking out of a nondescript hallway, but the wait is worth it. Always piping hot and fresh, the slices are thin, foldable but with the perfect hint of crisp that makes the crust divine. The prices are solid for the Vegas strip and frankly you could pay far more for far less at any of the terrible pizza spots on the strip. This is a can't miss stop for a quick bite on strip.

The whole concept of this pizza place is really cool and the pizza is not bad. It is although way over priced but that's expected given the location. This is a great place to go if your staying at the Cosmo and want something quick and easy.

I was lucky enough to find this place when there was no line. The pizza is crisp and delicious. I couldn't have thought of a better way to end my night. You'll find this place on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan at the end of a hallway that has old albums plastered on the wall. It's very close to the exit of the Marquee nightclub (genius, isn't it?).

Definitely a MUST-TRY if you are nearby cosmo and are: 1) hungry AF and\/or 2) drunk AF. You will not regret ordering the white pizza. The whole pizza, if you can. I'm not kidding. It's THAT good (plus you save a little $ per slice, too and that's always a good thing!) And another awesome thing about this place is how it's awesome late! Perfect to come straight here right after Marquee lol (no yacking pls) but expect a long line due to other drunkies with the munchies *nom*

After reading a lot of reviews of Secret Pizza, I made my trek to the Cosmopolitan, and checked this place out.    Yes, it tuck away in a hall way between a restaurant and non-operating glass elevator, and it was a side of a Pinball machine which guided me to the path  of their kitchen.

I'll give this place this much, the sauce and topping was very good, but my crust was very questionable at best for a East coast style Pizza.    The dough toward the middle of the pizza is too thin, and because of this..it was way too soggy from the grease of the cheese, and sausage..    It sagged when they put it back in the oven to reheat for minute, and still sagged when I tried to bite it..    I always felt the pizza dough is the heart of pizza, but for some reason, this didn't work for this slice.   Perhaps, I had a bad pie.

From the past reviews, they have jacked up their prices quite a bit, but If I was jonesing for a slice of Pizza on the strip; I might come back to this place, but remember this, it's a little pricey for what you get.

Secret Pizza is at the Cosmopolitan.

I was on a mission to check this hole in the wall pizza joint. Its hidden at the end of an unmarked hallway, on the 3rd floor.  Secret Pizza is a small place with no seats or tables. There are counters along the walls to post up at and get your eat on.  Fellow Yelper Ingrid R came along and we shared a slice of cheese pizza.

Either I came with super high expectations (based on all the rave Yelp reviews) or our particular slice was off because the pizza was just ok.  There really was nothing spectacular about it. I'm pretty sure had I been buzzed and starving from a night of clubbing at Marquee, a slice of pizza from here would be money.

As mediocre as my initial visit here was, I'm a sucker and will and go back to try the White Pizza everyone keeps mentioning in their reviews!

Almost as good as Lombardi's pizza in NY. The mushroom pizza in my opinion was by far the best.  It allows you to really enjoy the fresh sauce and cheese.  The customer service was great.  Not cheap but in Vegas the only things that are cheap are the women so it's expected and well worth it.

After years of clubbing at Marquee and having Secret Pizza bookmarked, I finally got the chance to eat here during my last Vegas trip in October. We'd gotten our stamps at Marquee and with re-entry privileges, we decided we didn't want to wait in the club for Porter Robinson to go on and should grab some food 'cause we were starving.

The entrance of Secret Pizza is through a tiny hallway on the 3rd level of Cosmopolitan, in between this restaurant and elevator outside the Marquee ticket holder entrance and re-entry line. There was a short line at 11:30 pm, which moved quickly. I got a slice of NY-style Cheese and Craig P. went with a slice of deep dish. Tasty and pretty standard in terms of what you'd expect. Way later in the evening (morning?), some of my friends brought back an entire Secret pizza to the hotel for some amazing drunchies. Cold, but still very good!

There's no seating, only standing room with counter tops along the wall for you to stuff your face. However, you can eat in the resting area right outside; there are plenty of sofas and chairs, as well as a free pool table.

Great option if you're clubbing and hungry during or after.

Because of your hours of operation and taste Pizzeria you get this rating.  Saved our bday party you did.  After a long night of partying or clubbing good luck battling the crowds from marquee.  The wait for the pizza and the long line = about an hour during semi prime time.

All that I am gonna say is that Secret Pizza is located is the Cosmopolitan somewhere.  I won't tell you where it's at, but with a little deductive reasoning you should be able to find it.

After a quick search of the property, I stumbled into this by the slice parlor.  It's a bit on the pricey side ($4.50 per slice, $20-$30 per pie) but the ingredients seem fresh and the slices are fairly large.  As for the overall, I've had better pizza elsewhere, but I think this is a nice quick, go to option if your not looking for sit down place or just need an easy meal late night.

Secret pizza place...not much of a secret anymore! Especially when you make your way there after going to the club in the wee hours of the morning and there is a line that looks so intimidating that you want to turn back. Then someone walks by with their fresh from the oven slice and you decide to wait it out..this place is worth the wait for sure!

Really good pizza. This is as close to the New York style experience as I've ever had, outside of NY.  My family went on New Year's Day. Wait was short, they had plenty of slice options available.  We had a slice of cheese, pepperoni, white, and combo. The combo pie was hidden below visible counter - I wonder what other pies were not visible.  I will definitely come back.

OVERRATED. The pizza itself is decent tasting...nothing wrong with it tastewise at all, but it definitely is not amazing and NOT worth the $8 for A slice and the long line. Cut the price by half and I would give this place another star. All the people who love this place must have been drunnkkkk because as good as the pizza is, it is not that special.

3rd Floor by STK.
Come here.
Chill outside and play pool or check out the rad art exhibit thing.
Or stay inside and enjoy the rad arcade games, TV and awesomeeee dudes that work here.

Bomb pizza.
Large slices.

Just get a whole pizza and split with friends. Worth the wait. Better deal price wise.

Oh, and did I say it yet? The dudes that work here are awesome.

Customers have given this place the name "Secret Pizza" but it has no name. It is just the pizza place in the Cosmopolitan. I love the fact that it has no name. It's modesty is a welcome contrast in bold Las Vegas. $5 for an excellent large slice of pizza. I was staying nearby for 2 nights and visited this place twice for a snack. Tried the vegetarian and the mushroom. My friend ordered the white pizza both times. I was told that there's up to an hour wait in line on weekends. I can understand why. It's delicious.

SECRET PIZZA! I'm glad my friend showed me this place, because for suuuure I would've have been able to find it. It's a cute little pizza shop down a hall way on the 2nd floor of the Cosmopolitan. They have a good selection of pizza, veggies, meats you name it. It's sooo good here. I think it's the best I've had since new york! I had the sundried tomatoes, pepperoncini, and green bell peppers. Their slices are huge, but with my HUGE appetite I had two slices and I was STUFFED! You need to visit this place! That is... if you can find it ;)

http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?selected=aUEiGRhpkJD9VCiVsCViNw#0s9OEpePpWnwofyt5Z_K4Q

We wanted to bring dinner back to our room at the Cosmo and remembered the "hidden" pizzeria. It's very small with just a few counter seats. A whole cheese pizza and one slice of white pizza came to around $32, not including tip. Pretty cheap dinner for 4 on the Strip. Pizza was done in 20 minutes. Once back in our room, we completely devoured that delicious cheese pie. So good. Everything you want in a foldable, cheesy, slice. My white slice was even better than the cheese pizza. Yummy, creamy ricotta and fresh garlic flavor. I wish I'd ordered 2 slices. We'll definitely return.

My school-aged kids got the biggest kick out of this place. They loved the idea of eating "secret" pizza and trying to keep the entrance a secret. They even enjoyed pinball for the first time while waiting for our food.

One note: They gave us paper plates with our whole pizza, but I noticed the pizza box itself was one of those perforated boxes meant to be torn into "plates". Neato.

Old lady and I got some slices here late one night.  Hella good. Surprised to find such good pizza in a hotel in Vegas. We are lucky enough to have North Beach in SF in our backyard ,so we've had our share of awesome pizza. We've had all kinds of styles and variations. I was not expecting to really enjoy Casino pizza but I fully admit I did enjoy it. Gotta go here when you're in town and tell them Scumbag sent you. Then when they look at you like you're an idiot, realize that you should'nt have told them that. Cuz they have no idea who I am, and even if they did know me, they would'nt give a flying f*ck that I sent you.

Easily the best pizza on the west coast and rivals the best from the east. environment is just really chill with the music playing, crowds of people, big screen tv's playing the Lakers game. they even got some old school pinball machines and an arcade game. its kind of a hard place to find if you know what to look for from all the clues that you get from anyone that's even been there but its worth it once you get there.
Definitely not so secret, but a good slice of pizza for a good price... Tucked down a hallway on the third floor.   Stiegel radler to help it go down.

Since the first time I found this place it is now Not so secret pizza , and for good reason!  My Vegas vacation is never complete without a slice or whole pie of their white pizza! Cannolis are pretty tasty too!

What. Da. Heq.

5 dollars for a slice of cheese? Has Yelp gone mad? 

Assuming a standard 8 slice pie, that's $40 bucks for  a pie. Is this pizza sprinkled with gold? Does it dispense napkins for your tears? 

Give me a break!! NY pizza is all about those dollar slices, not 5 dollars!! 

Yelpers have gone mad. The pizza is certainly not worth it.

Really cool sort of dive-y spot at the Cosmo. Was introduced here purely by word of mouth, hence how it's the secret pizza place. Cheap pizza that is just alright; nothing special but it did do the trick once I got done upstairs at Marquee after a night of clubbing & drinking! I believe it's popular for the fact that it's all secretive & it makes it exclusive, but for a real deal review? The pizza & food here is just like my rating.. A-OK.

Secret Pizza is really a secret. There's no mention of it on the signs when you're walking around Cosmo. It's not listed on their website. There's no sign outside the long hallway entrance, just a security guard in a suit. Seriously?? I guess it's all part of the allure of grabbing some "secret pizza."

People say the line can get backed up during peak hours after the club but we went around dinner time and the line was alright. We ended up waiting around 20-30 minutes which was fine. We decided to split a white pizza, which was plenty for a group of 4 guys. The pizza was thin, came straight out of the oven (piping hot) and the dough was chewy. Their slices are huge and I'm glad to know that our pizza was made to order! There's plenty of feta cheese sprinkled on top of the pizza and I love how the cheese was melted. It was a tad on the greasy side though.

I'd recommend checking out Secret Pizza if you're around Cosmo and looking for pizza. It's a pretty unique experience trying to find a "secret" pizza joint.

I'm probably going to be hated on, but I don't get what's so special about this place. First of all, it's busy! so secret no more LOL. They have a security guy\/bouncer...makes me wonder if people get in fights. There is a small hallway where everyone lines us to order. You pick your pre-made pizza slice, add any toppings and they reheat for you- exactly like pizza my heart. 
The taste- eh, not amazing, not horrible. If i was drunk, i'd give this place 10 stars for a relatively cheap eat. The sober me can't do this.

Some of the best pizza I've ever had!

We had a little bit of trouble finding it because my sister had been there before and we were walking around on the wrong floor too stubborn to ask for help but as soon as we asked someone for help we were pointed in the right direction. 

We were a little put off by the $5\/slice pricetag but my dad, sister, and I each ordered a piece. The crust came out perfectly and was so crisp without being burnt. I loved that they had shakers of oregano and garlic powder in addition to the usual red pepper and parmesan cheese. My mom decided not to order a piece but ended up taking multiple bites of all of our pizzas because it was so good! 

If you want a quick cheap snack, I would definitely recommend Secret Pizza!

I've had better pizza in downtown LA. I think the only reason this place gets such high ratings is because people are shitfaced, stumbling out of Marquee when they eat. Perhaps I just had really high standards for this place after seeing the great reviews. I ordered the mushroom and garlic, and I thought it was a bit dry and the crust too hard. 

Come during dinner hours and not after club if you don't want to line up!

OK I admit it. Adam Richman's "Man Finds Food" brought this place to my attention. However, I wish I paid better attention to the show because I forgot which floor it was on (hint: THIRD floor) but once we found it, we thought it was totally worth the trouble. Everything that everyone says about this place in point: You'll miss it if you blink, no frills food & service and the pizza is absolutely superb. We had the popular white pizza (at $5.50\/slice it seems inflation is hitting this place hard as the prices go up with each review) and it was delicious. With liberal toppings and an amazing crust I could have eaten a whole pie by myself. The lines DO get long but it moves pretty quick as you're there for a coke & a slice, not a steak dinner. Check it out!

The only good thing about Secret Pizza is the location and the name.  Pretty creative to called themselves secret and not have signs or direction to this place.

I was not impressed by the pizza at all.  It wasn't bad, just average.

We set out to find this place after hearing about it from others. We roamed around then went down a hallway (not far from STK) with old albums and then it appeared. It was was like we had stepped into a NYC pizza parlor. The pizza was fantastic!! It's pretty basic, pizza, beer, soda. I had the cheese and my fianc had the supreme. We each had two (very large) slices and loved it!

Cheap! Fast! Amazingly delicious! What more can you ask for?! This place is perfection! I love the white pizza the most and of course good 'ol pepperoni pizza. They even have Sicilian pizza which is yummy! They tend to have long lines at night so I normally go for lunch and its faster. 

Love this place and its now my go to place when I go to Vegas. Its a must! The closes thing to real NY pizza on the west coast.

Who hasn't heard about Secret Pizza at this point? Definitely lives up to the hype BUT I can't decide if inebriated me prefers pizza or the ever-so-comforting Earl's. However, if one is at Marquee, I don't see why not! 

Just look for the hallway! 

TIP: Just order a whole pizza in advance and pick it up. It's cheaper than buying individual slices &  you don't have to stand in line.
Gross! This place must have 4 stars because people get too drunk to taste. The 'pizza' is a slice of cardboard DRENCHED in grease. Gross! And over priced.

The not-so-secret Secret Pizza is a perfect place to grab a slice or two for lunch or late night. The lines can get long, so beware. This place is really effing good NY style pizza and it's located at the end of a hallway on the third floor near the pool tables. I've tried a variety of different topping slices here and each have been great.

Are you and your friends planning on getting four or more slices? I'd recommend ordering a whole pizza instead since it'll work out to be about the same price. I think our pepperoni and sausage pie was $24. Not bad really. You can play some pinball and other arcade games as you wait. Out of quarters? The people watching here is great too!

Secret Pizza (which is not as hard to find as the name would suggest) has probably some of the best pizza in the city. Its only real pitfall is that pizza is pretty much the only option on the menu, and nothing goes better than a slice of Za than some breadsticks or garlic knots? Pizza prices were good, drinks were overpriced for what you got. But other than that, this is totally worth going to if you're in the area!

Tried a slice after dinner wanted to a get another. Just that good. No it was better then good. Please don't tell anyone where it's at, so it doesn't get crowded. It was like being back in the big apple.

The pizza was well worth the wait. I highly recommend trying a pizza already created by the pizzaologists. 

There's always people in line and that's understandable because the kitchen is so small and there are only 4 workers. When I went everyone was working really hard except for the two managers just shooting the breeze with one another. Basically they were taking up room and air.

I would say call in the order but we tried calling in our order and the phone kept ringing and ringing. Going in person though is much better. While you're waiting in line u can strike up random conversations with people all standing in line for the same thing...PIZZA!!!!! Or check out the million of pictures they have along the walls as u wait:)

Worse pizza place I have been too.   A bunch of wanna be thugs \/ ghetto workers who don't listen to what you want and do what they want.   I will never go back.   If you listen to what I have to say please for the love of God do not go there.   If I was the Cosmo I would get rid of this place and never look back! Never eat here!

Went here sober and it was, FORGET ABOUT IT... 
Half of these reviews were written by drunken stoops of hunger. "FEED ME SEYMORE; FEED ME!!!

Pizza is not my go to food AT all. Pizza makes me paranoid...Why? Because I don't want that oily crap in my system! Yet I love desserts...like that's any better.

Anyway this place was pretty bomb. I love how it literally seems like a secret location. Top floor of the Cosmopolitan, and there is no sign indicating that it's a pizza place. I had to look at the yelp photos to make sure it was the right place and indeed it was! 

Get the Super Deluxe slice because you could add up to 6 toppings (I think) for $6 iish bucks. I only went with 4 toppings: mushroom, sliced sausage, dried tomatoes, and olives. YUM. They basically cook your pizza by the order. Their sliced sausage is so flavorful! It's pretty thick cut too. The pizza itself is delicious! 

Cool place to eat at!

My friend and I had some time to kill so we decided to brave the long line at Secret Pizza on a Saturday around 5pm. We tried 3 slices - mushroom, pepperoni, and the sausage with ricotta cheese. Each slice was satisfying, but not amazing enough for me to wait an hour in line again for. I thought the cost per slice was priced right considering that majority of the food in Vegas is expensive. So if you have the time to waste and don't want another cheap meal at Earls, Secret Pizza is a good alternative.

I heard such great things about this place, but man was I disappointed. After checking into my room I headed straight there. I live on the East Cost so that is a long day, I was starving. When I got there I got a pizza with pepperoni and jalapeo. I was told these slices were like 1\/4 of a 18" pizza, that is not the case. Now I don't hold Secret Pizza accountable for my expectations. The slice was more like an 1\/8th of an 18"pizza and it cost $6...for one slice!!! The pizza was good but good lord...its pizza.

Best pizza I've ever eat.
I read about the long waits but in my experience I didn't wait more than five minutes on a 4th of july for lunch.
There is not enough space for a group of five inside. If you don't see the pizza you like, ask for it, they will make it fast.
If you gonna eat more than 2 slices, buy the whole pizza instead.
My favorite : salami, sausage and tomatoes.

I went here with some friends.  It was really good!  As the name implies, the place is hidden away.  Someone has to tell you to go there or you would never know that it existed.  Reminiscent of the prohibition era speakeasy.  They were not fast, but they had pinball games to keep you busy while waiting.  There was almost no place to sit, so we ate in the lobby chairs near the entrance to Secret Pizza next to the pool tables.  This pizza was really good.  Better than Broadway Pizzeria, but not as good as Metro Pizza.  We had some kind of white pie.  I look forward to my next visit there.

This place is REALLY secret because I couldn't find it for the life of me until I saw a guy walk out with some pizza.

I was with a big group of people and Trina D recommended this place. So we went... with over 700 reviews... Secret? It's just hard to find :D

PIZZAS:
This is greasy stuff but also DELICIOUS.

Two whole pizzas - $50 (one white pizza and one half mushroom\/half pepperoni). 

Sooooo good! I loved the white pizza because of the flavors. The mushroom was also addicting tho. It was just really good!

SIZE: 
No room to sit but they did have video games. Fun stuff. Donkey Kong. 
But you sit in their waiting area

Why 4 stars?
The WAIT was killer. It took close to an hour to be done and we had hungry drunks and people sobering up. I was fine. I was just hungry :P

Overall... good stuff. :D

We finally got to try this place out the last time we were in Vegas. I'm sorry to say that I was sorely disappointed. Maybe it's best for drunk people? I tried it relatively sober; I had a couple of cocktails at NYNY then walked to Cosmo, so I kinda sobered up otw lol. My BF got a slice of pepperoni and I got a pepperoni and mushroom. It was way too greasy and salty for me. We walked in not knowing anything and they didn't really tell us if we had options. When we asked for different slices, we were told they didn't have them, so I guess you pick what's there? I'll probably try this again drunk, since a couple of my friends didn't go on this trip and they want to try it. Will update then.

Haha I saw this place on other yelpers profile and I had to try it.

First off this was kind of hard to locate. Why? Because heck I wasn't so sure where the location was to this place aside being in the Cosmopolitan hotel. I almost gave up on finding it. Then clever idea hit, read the reviews dork. 

I was still skeptical too after I read it since there was no sign for this place. Luckily, I found it. Great yummy pizza. Good thin crust pizza and delicious bread with a hint of a garlic taste to it. Not bad, but a bit pricey for a slice $4.50 plus additional 50cents for an extra topping that is kinda cutting it right there. 

Anyway will return one day again when I have more money to spend or maybe just get a whole pizza. 

Just remember 3rd floor lol.

one word: overrated 

my friends and i decided to buy a whole pizza with the works and i wasn't completely happy. it was simply JUST OKAY. it was a little too oily for my taste. not the mention the dough was difficult to chew. the portions are HUGE but i personally would rather choose costco pizza over this any day...

Awesome place. Pizza by the slice before or after you party. They have a variety of pizzas  you can pick and add anything on it. Takes a few minutes. Staff is super friendly. I love the white pizza. You can order a whole pizza if you have a group too. It's a hidden gem down a random hallway. Ask someone at Cosmo if you haven't been and check it out.
I love secret places...and the pizza was delicious! The staff was friendly and attentive!! I'll be in for a slice every time I'm here!!

This place was so hidden that some of the Cosmo staff couldn't direct us in the right direction. 

I thought it was good, very greasy, and full of cheese. Only downfall is that they don't have ham. I luv ham, so a pizza without ham is like rice without meat, water without ice, and a shower without soap to me. Basically, it's a necessity to me. The huge pepperoni slices and sliced meatballs was filling, but it would have tasted better with ham. 

Not very many seats and it gets crowded because of the small space inside. We ordered a fresh made whole pizza and took it outside to sit on the large couches inside Cosmo. It was much more comfier outside and less noisy. 

I liked it, but I wish they had ham.
Just OK. Just like any other random pizza joint on The Strip, or anywhere. Pretty good crust, but your otherwise basic by the slice affair. Definitely not worth the late night line post-Marquee.

Secret Pizza exemplifies what is good about the Cosmopolitan and why people love to stay there. It is simple, cheap, and tasty pizza hidden away down what one might assume at first glance to be a hallway to a restroom. When you are on the strip it is hard to find something reasonable, when you just want a snack, especially if you are young and on a budget. This was one of many good ideas the hotel had for their guests, or in fact anyone who comes through and finds it.

Secret Pizza has some SERIOUSLY good pizza. I'm not sure if it's because I was really hungry or what...but my friend and I really loved our pizzas. My only beef with Secret Pizza is that it cost us a whopping $23 for 4 slices of pizza... The fact that it is open late just ups their game.

Secret Pizza is truly secret...it is not listed on the Cosmopolitan website...and there are no signs around the hotel telling you where it is. You have to find the hallway of album covers...which will lead you down the path to the gloriousness that is PIZZA! (Hint: It's located on the 3rd floor of the Eastside tower.)

When the drunchines are real, Secret Pizza will fill that void.

Secret Pizza is the best tucked away place to grab a slice (or a full pie, or two, or three) of pizza on the strip. With no real sign, you walk into a hallway and find a simple kitchen and a few pinball machines, and the cure to your hangover the next morning. NOT for the health conscious. Only for the drunk, the hungry, the desperate.

I typically get the regular marinara pizza with hella meat: pepperoni and sausage. Best way to have it esp at 2 or 2 in the morning. For the veggies in the house, the white pie is best (ricotta cheese, not sauce), with just bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions. 

It is pricy considering how a slice of pizza the same size in NYC is $1. But it's Vegas, you're most likely intoxicated, and you just want something in your stomach.

Yes, you can enjoy this without having alcohol or other illicit things in your system. It's a solid pizza place. Buuuuut, it's much better after a night of debauchery with good company.

The pizza was very good and huge slices but a bit pricey for pizza. The staff was friendly and helpful. To say the least, it is truly a "secret" to find them!  We had to ask a few people and walked around lost for a bit but did finally find them. They had a lot of selections to choose from and our pizza was tasty.  My only problem was the lack of seating. We had to take our pizza out in the outside area to find a place to eat.  It is a tiny space at the end of a hallway and diners stand up to a counter to eat.  Those areas were occupied.  I would eat there again but hope there would be seating next time I get to Vegas.  We were there November 26, 2014

My guy and I try and make it a point to stop by Secret Pizza every time we visit Las Vegas. I can't say I'm a huge pizza connoisseur, but I have tried pizza from a lot of places in my life (most of them turn out to be just OK). And I have to say, this may be the best pizza I've ever had.

After hanging out at the Chandelier bar my friend Ashley was wanting a soda. Not knowing where to get one at almost 3am, she said to follow her, after going up a couple of escalators and down a narrow hallway the smell of pizza hit me in the face. OMG there is a hidden pizzeria in the hotel!!  Not only does this place have no name, you'll find no signage, and no menu. It's a very no nonsense New York-style pizza counter. To find it, look for the hallway wrapped in vintage records.There was a small line that was forming when we walked up. This place is super small and had limited seats (bar stools and a long counter). You can order a whole pie of just a couple of slices. Minh D decided to indulge in his pizza craving and get a slice which he ended up sharing with me. All i can say is wow this pizza tasted wonderful and full of cheesy goodness!! Ashley ordered a rootbeer (which has unlimited refilled as long as you are eating there). That rootbeer was the best i have had in a long time. Make sure you save your change because they have a classic pinball machine there too!!

There is always something thrilling in knowing secrets to which not everyone is privy. Secrets almost always make everything at least twice the fun.

I am still recovering from my pizza trauma, if I may call it that (I ate pizza, inferior quality at that, at least three times a week for about a year and a half). When my cousin suggested pizza for lunch, I tried to kill this idea until he said "it is a secret place that not even all locals know about, and the pizza is great. Las Vegas is number 2 in TripAdvisor's top 10 American cities for pizza, you know. "

Secret?? With a dash of fighting words?? Do count me in!

And yes, the pizza was great! It could get pretty crowded as they don't have a big space nor a lot of staff. But the pizza was indeed delicious. The crust is thin and flavorful, and every bite was quite tasty.

If you are in the vicinity of the Strip and want some delicious pizza, do try to find this "secret" spot.

No name, no phone, no directory. No tables, Amazing pizza from word of mouth. Run don't walk to the 3rd floor Cosmo. You have at least a half hour line wait @ prime time.  Once you get there Your slice won't be cheap but delicious.  We ordered a a whole fresh one, much cheaper to feed 4.  It will take a half hour after you order if you buy a whole pie.  They reheat (by the slice)but it gets crunchy and really good.  Nothing sits and gets old in this place, they clean out the slices with sales within 10 minutes.  

Don't even think about it just do it.  

It's not the best of all time but it's way way up there. This is our second visit in 3 days. Pictures attached.

For any drunk club-goer in the wee hours of the night, this place is a dream come true. I went to Vegas for work recently and arrived to the hotel at midnight after many delays and hadn't eaten dinner. I was able to run downstairs and get a piece of pizza in 15 minutes. This place is tucked away on the third floor across from Marquee - look for a long hallway with vintage record covers.

I got a piece of the white pizza ($5) - obviously, no tomato sauce, and lots of cheese (almost too much cheese). There was a ton of mozzarella cheese, ricotta cheese, and a garlic oil. There was a bit of a pool of garlicky oil on the top of my pizza, and I had to pick around some of the mozzarella cheese. I loved the NY crust - it was not soggy and was both crisp and chewy. If you're at the club and have found "someone special", you may want to avoid this white pizza since you'll have garlic breath for the rest of the night. The white pizza was great, and I was sober and hungry, so I'm sure if you're inebriated, it will taste even more delicious. 

I came back the next day after going out and drinking a lot and got the Supreme pizza. It was good, but not as good as the White pizza.

Great for a late night slice of pizza after drinking, or when you need a quick bite to eat. They have a cooler of free water & cups so you can hydrate after a long night out.

This place gets a lot of hype for it's gimmick of being 'secret', which is well overdone by now, and the cool hallway that leads to it. It's a great place to get pizza after everything else is closed (or even before) whole or just a slice, though getting a whole pie is cheaper than getting a few slices, and you get to look cool coming out with a pizza box. People will envy you.
The white pizza is really good, and so is the plain cheese. It gets pricey when you want to get drinks and dessert from them as well, and sometimes, depending on the time, you might have to wait for a while.
The staff has always been very nice; one time we ordered a whole pizza, and the guy ended up burning one half. He gave us the good half and made another one, so we got half a pizza for free, but had to wait a half hour extra (if you get a whole pie be prepared to wait a while).
Overall the pizza is pretty good for being right on the strip, and it's great for late night hungry pains.
For a pizza by the slice its ok however I went here because of the hype. Checked off the bucket list and moving on.

LOCATION: Go to the 3rd floor from the East Wing elevator and turn right.  When you see "Zuma" (not built yet as of 12\/2016), look directly across and you'll see a long hallway with photos hanging on either side.  You may even see a guy who looks like a bouncer with a blue suit on.  Go down the hallway and you are there!

COST: $5.00\/slice for cheese and $5.50\/slice for those with toppings.  I highly recommend getting the white pizza if you like garlic.

They serve NY style (thin) pizza so if you're into the regular or Chicago style pizza, this is not the place for you.  I thought the pizza here was REALLY good but I wish the prices were cheaper.  Regardless, definitely worth the visit if you're craving pizza.

As a side note, I'm not sure if "Secret Pizza" is really their true name as they bill credit cards under the name "Cosmo Pizzeria.
Epic. A can't miss during your next trip to Las Vegas. You'll stand most likely, but every drippy mess is worth it. Just snag extra napkins!!

I wouldn't say it's much of a secret anymore but regardless I always make a stop when in town.   The white pizza is incredible.  The sausage and meatballs are out of this world.  Great crust.  Great sauce.  Very friendly service.  I'm a huge fan.

This pizza was ok, it was thin crust, cheesy, and greasy;  just how I like it . I would not say it was fabulous. The wait was 25 minutes, and the price was a bit much. It cost $5 per slice of pizza. The workers behind the counter were working very hard to get people in and out. When you go to the pizza place its on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino. Just ask a worker how to get there and they'll let you know.

I loved this place! The pizza is yummy. You can take it to go...well tbh there isn't much room to sit so you might as well. This is a super tiny place.  It's a bit of an assembly line like one you would find at a mall. 

This was prob one of my favorite places in the Cosmo hotel, to eat.  

The staff is fast and friendly.  

 I'm definitely going back on my next visit.

I eat out 14 times a week, all over the U.S. I think it's time to start giving honest feedback; helping others make informed dining decisions. 

Takeout only:

+Pizza is great. NY style
+The white pizza is freaking awesome!
+Very casual
+I only stay at the Cosmopolitan and I have a slice every day I'm there. 

Overall Score: 96% out of 100%
I highly recommend this restaurant.
Definitely worth the adventure of finding this place!  Look for the wall of records in the Cosmopolitan hotel.

Worth the wait, which there likely will be. The meatball and ricatta slice was one of the best pieces of pizza I've ever had. Meat lovers very good to. No place to sit which does make it a little tough atmosphere wise. Free drink refills. Slices about $6-7 bucks, whole pies about $26.

The secret Pizza Kitchen...  the perfect spot after a hot mess of a night at Marquee.  I love their thin crust pizza.  Definitely a must try after a lot of drinking... and is probably just as good when you're sober too.

Cheap and really good pizza!
I had the pesto slice.. Thin, large, and flavorful.. I actually had a second slice. I don't live near Vegas and can't wait to visit again. This place will be my first stop. I want another slice!!

Will, Hector make a great pizza. Nice casual environment to enjoy a $5 pizza.  Buried on third floor of the Cosmo hotel surrounded by $$$ restaurant.  A definite "gotta go" for a excellent slice of real NY pizza

Secret pizza pizza pizza. 
Dear pizza you were good, not great or fabulous. 
Would I eat you again? definite YES but different toppings this time. 

Location: In the cosmopolitan, hint hint above casino next to chandelier elevator! No sign because remember IT IS SECRET! lol. 

Inside this secret pizza joint it's super tiny, they had maybe 4 chairs to eat at the Counter, but other then that it was filthy, counters were gross, beer spilled everywhere, looks as if they hadn't cleaned it since the night. We decided to eat outside on the couches which seemed a little more clean. 

Wait time for pizza wasn't too bad. They said about 30 min, came out in 15-20 so that's a plus. We had the plainest pizza ever lol, pepperoni and olives. Yeah next time Ima order something out of this world! But the pizza was good wasn't dry, it reminded me of bostons or something. Anywho, secret pizza I'll be back for you.

Everybody knows about this place by now so it's not all that secret. It's one of the best late night grub spots next to getting Earl of Sandwich or a steak dinner from Ellis Island. And if you are done partying at Marquee you are most likely to end up here.

The first time I had their pizza I just bought whatever slices were available and it was good. It was cheesy and salty and the oily just melted my paper plate. Exactly how I wanted it. My most recent venture to Secret Pizza we ordered 2 whole pizzas to go. The wait was almost an hour, but when we got it that pie was gone in less then 5 minutes. It is just that much better when you have it hot and fresh.

It's cheap and it's open late. What more can you ask for?

Like 4 years ago, this place was a "secret" - not so much anymore! Always my to-go when visiting Vegas. It gets crazy busy after club hours... So if you just want to try it (and you're not drunkenly craving it at 3am), I suggest going during the day - perhaps lunch =)
Great New York style pizza. The toppings were great. Crust is great. No ranch or bleu cheese, so 4 stars.

This is the best slice of White Pizza I've had in Vegas.

There are 2 things that seem to be lacking in Vegas, those are BBQ and NY Style Pizza. Now with the "Hidden" Pizza place I can scratch NY style pizza off that list.

The crust is perfect, the sauce and toppings are great, the service is usually pretty fast, and the prices are shockingly affordable for somewhere inside a high end property.

Have the white pizza you won't regret it!!!

White pizza was very good.  The staff was also super accommodating and funny. The only thing that lost a star is that I wish they had more variety.  They had only four pizzas and two of them had ingredients I couldn't eat. Definitely check it out if you're in Vegas though! I love the idea that its a "secret
Always amazing!!! One slice of veggie pizza really hits the spot for me! It was super delicious and the service here is always nice and fun!

Don't worry you'll find it. HINT: look for the 80's arcade games! 
Really good NY style slices...and a steal @ around 5$\/a slice-In *this place*??? WTF is everyone whining about the prices for? You're in the effin COSMO!?!?
Anyway, bk 2 Pizza...simple is better..Just get 2 slices of 'White' (TIP WELL) and politely ask for a water cup. TIP WELL. If you're not a drunk silk-shirted loudmouth, u may just get access to some free h2o!

These folks will be just as cool as *you* are being. Theyre bustin their arses to feed you, so please consider: best-cheap-wee-hour-NY-pizza in Vegas..inside the pricey-ass (but fly) Cosmo...What's my point? DON'T BE A DBAG! TIP WELL! Class dismissed. Now go shoot some pool..

I am no big fan of "New York" style pizza but this place was very good. Like it says it is a little hard to find but not if you know where to go. It is not fancy, it doesn't have a huge menu, there are no fancy tables but it is just darn good pizza. There are a few stools at a counter you either sit or stand at. We will definitely go back and I would also recommend this place.
Not so secret,  secret pizza... delicious pizza glad I tried it out. Was expensive especially with the exchange rate but still an all around success.

So yummy! Great for a night time snack after the club to even out that alcohol or for lunch during the day. It's a cool hidden little place. A slice will cost you $5-6. Favorites include cheese, pepperoni, and sausage. The line can get REALLY long. Like 20 people in front if you long, so be ready to deal with that. There are a few barstools and chairs to eat inside the place, but I like bringing it out and sitting in the lounge area the Cosmo hotels provide. If you have an extra dollar to spare you can add it to the wall where people leave messages on money and mark your trip.

Since according to Yelp, this was most reviewed pizza place in Vegas, I decided to go there and see how amazing this pizza place was. My expectation for this place was pretty high since it was well-hidden yet pretty packed, and this is why it was really a bummer when their pizza failed to meet my expectation; it was below average. I still recommend people to try out this place just because how popular it is and how so many people love this place. Nevertheless, based on my friends and my experience, sadly, this place's $6.00 pizza was not worth the money and our time to find this place.

DELICIOUS! This definitely is a hidden gem. The pizzas are well crafted. The slices are large and look flimsy, but the crust is pretty sturdy. The crust is crispy and it is slightly thicker than a thin crust pizza. 

Most people enjoy the white pizza (bechamel with ricotta), but I thought the pepperoni and sausage was packed with great spices. 

There is little to no seating at this place, however there is a small lounge area right outside. Think about buying a pie if you're with a large group.

LOVE me some NYC style pizza and and so called "secret" pizza spot is not going to keep me from eating it!  Especially when a hangover needs curing!

Not one person in this place on a Thursday afternoon, but that's OK, because seating is sparse.  Loved the pizza I tried and it was the perfect prep for a drink heavy night. 

Credit card machine wasn't working, so I'm not sure what would have happened had we done carry out. 

I love the fact that this place is easy and fast.  Not everything in Vegas needs to be over the top.

White slice with tomato. Do it now! $6\/slice may be a bit much, but I've been officially converted. The pepperoni is fine but the signature white pie is actually worth the hype: garlicky, cheesy, just a little bit gooey, and those tomatoes just make it extra special. Service is friendly, spot is bare-bones but in a good way, snag a stool if you see one available!

Note: Some people take the "secret" part a little too literally- it's not on any maps or even the Cosmopolitan website. Go to the 3rd floor with all the other restaurants, and find the hallway between Blue Ribbon Sushi  and Jaleo.
Tucked away on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan you'll find a great little pizza place. $5 gets you a big slice of the closest thing you'll find to a N.Y. style pie in Las Vegas. Highly recommended!

THE BEST SECRET IN vegas ;] . 

I had trouble finding it, but I knew it was open because it said so on yelp haha. my friends eileen, gaston and I were totally happy we found it. for 4.50 a slice, not bad, its pretty big NY style pizza. My fav was the pepperoncini and sausage.... YUMMMMM. 

definitely coming back here, and telling everyone about it. "did you know about the secret pizza place in the cosmo?" well now you do ;]
Everything we tried was excellent.  Really enjoyed the white pizza.  The crust, sauce to cheese ratio spot on.  It is hidden but worth the adventure to find.  Definitely recommend trying it out.

Outstanding tip, Yelpers! Found this place hiding (as described, Cosmopolitan Level 3, unmarked hall between Blue Ribbon Sushi & Jaleo). Friendly staff, good beer (they had switched to Stone IPA from the Dogfishhead that another Yelper said they used to carry; the PBR was still there). They also have wine by the glass. Ordered a custom pie for our group; it was ready in about 20 minutes. 

As remarked on by others, limited seating (& ambiance) in the venue itself, but we were able to go back out by the entrance where there are pool tables, dominoes, and other games, and put some of the small tables and chairs together for a nice meal. 

Pizza was hot and tasty; obviously not going to be better than the best pizza parlors of New York, but definitely solid). It was a great way to get a good meal and a nice price while still in one of the Strip's hottest hotels.

Eat here! 

The greasy pizza is perfect after drinking all night, its open late, and its CHEAP!!!


Do it!

The secret is really less of a novelty than we originally believed. We were expecting something slightly more unique than a little pizza kitchen shoved in a spare corner of the restaurant level in a hotel. Nevertheless, I would not visit this place for a unique experience. However, that doesn't make this place bad. The pizza was quite good and the service was incredible. The young guys running the show were extremely nice in a genuine way - a refreshing difference from the "las vegas stick my hand in your pocket and take as much as I can" nice. 

I would say if you're within a close stumble to the Cosmo, and you're looking for a quick and tasty snack, you'd be stupid not to pick up a slice here.

I was tempted to say where it is, but finding Secret Pizza is half the fun!  (Ok, real talk, it's more like 1\/8 of the fun.  Eating pizza is where the real fun is)

Great service and food. I've become such a plain pizza eater, so I got a cheese (my go to favorite pizza) and a white pizza.  Both hit the spot.  Yums.

It was worth the hunt to track this damn place down! No signage of any kind at this hotel. You just have to know where it's at. At $5 per slice, you get a huge slice that inevitably needs to be folded. This place is very to the point. Pick your slice and pick your toppings if necessary. It's $0.50 per topping. 

They typically have the cheese, pepperoni and white pizza (with different types of white cheese). I'd recommend the white pizza and have them sprinkle some of that mushroom on there! Freaking delicious and worth every penny. Walking in here took me back to NY. You order at the counter and wait for them to reheat it and then enjoy. Make no mistake, the pizza is reheated in their massive pizza oven. Not just some sad microwave. 

There are no tables in this joint. If you intend to eat there then you'll be eating at the counter that's outlined the entire place. They have a couple vintage arcade games in there to keep you entertained. You can watch whatever sports they have on TV. Otherwise, take the pizza and enjoy a nice game of pool just outside in the seating area of the hotel.

I make it a point to get a slice every time I've come to Vegas. Totally worth the trip!

Ok, like many others I saw this spot on Adam Richman's "Man Finds Food" Vegas episode.

It was a pain to find, but after Googling for a few minutes I was able to locate it.

Even after stuffing my face at Planet Hollywood's buffet, I had to grab a slice of the white pizza here. Luckily the white pie was the freshest one on the counter. It took no time at all to order and I only had to wait a few minutes for my slice to heat up in the oven.

As an east coaster I've eaten tons of NY pizza and its imitations... And this slice was up there with the best. If only the bottom of the crust were slightly more blackened and cracker-like would it be the real deal.

That being said this was awesome and hands down the beat slice I had in Vegas.

This place is one of my kids' favorite places in Vegas. I think they love the "secret" part about it, but the pizza is awesome too!
We always grab a slice on our way back after eating at the Wicked Spoon, since that's in the same hotel. I'm usually stuffed, but my kids can always find some room. 
I'd say it's probably better to eat when it's fresh in the place, but my kids also eat it after taking it back to the room and they still love it.
We love the pepperoni, but the white pie slices are also delicious.

I am going to give this a 5 only because of the food on The Strip, it is as good as it gets. FINALLY something that doesn't cost  your mortgage, rather just good, honest pizza for $5. One slice works, but get two just so you can try two things.

I had the meat lovers with meatballs and peppercionnis and it was the bomb. The mushroom was just that and sort of lacking flavor, but still damn good pizza.

The slices are huge, the ingredients are fresh, the grease factor is heavy, the crust is thin and crispy. Just good luck finding it, half the fun.

The major perk of this restaurant is that it is open late and good for late night drunchies.  Can't go wrong with ny style pizza. But it is just NY style pizza so don't go in with high expectations just because it is "secret" pizza.  Ordered the pepperoni pizza which I found to be really oily.  But nothing you can't blot off with a paper towel!  I like that the pepperoni are large and covet the slice.  Really close to marquee so get some pizza after going to the club!
Awesome pizza. I don't usually eat my crusts but I ate every bit of these. Try the white pizza even if you don't normally like white, it's so good.

The Secret Pizza Place is its real name, I swear.

I was so amped when I found it, thanks to you previous 21 yelpers. I LOVE pizza, and I think I might have found my favorite pizza place besides Grimaldi's. Then again, I came at 3 in the morning, was given a free slice of pizza AND a free slice of cheesecake, AND great conversation so I could be a little influenced but I'm pretty sure it's excellent.

Please try the white pizza with tomatoes. Your tastebuds will thank you.
Please make sure you have some gum with you. Your friends and other strangers will thank you.

Nico and Cristos are food artists. 'Artists' would have been italicized if that were allowed.

The slice of cheesecake is pretty clutch, too.

Bring tip money! You'll need it, i swear!

As a pizza-loving, born & raised New Yorker, this pizza definitely has my stamp of approval. Especially in the middle of the night when you are sufficiently wasted. That being said, it was quite pricey for pizza, but hey, it's Vegas.

Can you keep a secret? I know that there are so many out there, no but seriously this is ONE SECRET you must know about. The entrance is a sacred passageway into a heaven of musical albums illuminated by red lighting. Oooohhh! Then KABOOM, there is the magic machine of Pizza popping out the delicate doughy mess of cheese, sauce and toppings. You know the saying, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas. A must stop for a quick bite! Happy feastings!

Let's just be clear people, it's not cheap it's just the cheapest food in the Cosmopolitan. Plus when you've been at the pool all day with your tiny ass euro swim trunks, eating at places like Scarpetta or Blue Ribbon Sushi just isn't possible.

Pizza is ultra greasy and heartburn-inducing but it does the job of sopping all the overpriced fire-water you've been chugging. I pretty much live at the Cosmopolitan and this is about the only option you have if you need a quick fix.

The sausage and mushroom pizza is my personal favorite so it should also be yours, pretty darn good. If you plan on getting filled up I'd suggest getting at least 2 slices. The dough is thin and crispy and the service is simple and straight-forward, just a no-fuss option when you need to feed your face.
Pricy, but not so much compared to other things on the Strip, and it tasted pretty good.

incredible, best pizza on the westcoast. Definitely the hidden gem of Cosmopolitan. In a place filled with glitz and glamour the pizzeria is the perfect get away from it all with classic rock playing, old arcade machines and amazing slices of pizzas worth every penny. Going back for seconds without a doubt.

p.s. If you're looking for a healthy slice this aint no california bs, no spinach no artichokes, and no ranch. The only condiment you need is the grease on the slice.

Hard to find but worth the search!! Just don't come too hungry cuz you'll be frustrated if you get lost looking for this place. =)

NY style pizza with classic flavors - they really do it right here. $4 a slice of cheese, $5 a slice of pepperoni or 1 topping. Kinda pricey for a slice but well worth it!

I wish I experienced what the other 750 reviewers before me experienced. I don't know if this is how it normally is, but my friend and I waited an hour for pizza around 3am. The line was long, however it did NOT move quickly at all. I don't see how this is an issue. Make several pizzas. Sell pizzas, sell slices of pizzas. Get the line moving. When we got to the front of the line, it at least sounded apparent to me that someone didn't show up for work. However there were only two people working there.. so does that mean three was considered sufficient? Given the line, I'd say it was not, but maybe they just don't care. I want to give them some slack but my feet hurt, I was hungry and tired and they just straight up weren't making enough pizza anyways.

Anyways, the price was reasonable, but the menu was also unclear to me so I just ordered what I saw. Or maybe what I saw was all they had. I guess they don't have to staff more people because this is the only pizza place and food you can get until 5am. Awesome?

The pizza was so good I ended up going back the next day. 
Great price with quick and excellent service.

One of Cosmos best places to eat.  The pizza is one of the best pizzas I ever had and the best drunk food after Marquee.  The lines are long most of the time so if you are staying at the hotel it is best to just order the pizza to the room.  The pizza goes about 32 dollars a pie and worth it.

As a huge pizza fan I heard this was the place and bingo!  Rock star pizza no sign no name just killer pie.  Enjoys the meat lovers and pepperoni,  really big roni slices and cheese was excellent.  Crust authentic NY style and perfectly cooked and vet delicate.  This is 5 star all around don't come for the atmosphere just come to eat amazing pizza and be happy!

Cheap eats in a fantastic hotel on the Las Vegas strip. Long lines on the weekend evenings but worth it. Get your slice and a PBR draft then settle into the lounge area out front and watch some pool, foosball or just people watch.

The pizza tastes much better than it looks (the pictures and even the look of the pizza when you order it does not do it justice).  From the pictures on Yelp and even up to the moment where I was standing in line ordering the pizza, I thought to myself, "meh."  

Kristin C. raved about the pizza while we were eating lunch at the Cosmopolitan and my boyfriend and I were a bit skeptical that pizza could be THAT good.  Well, we ate our words later that night.

After catching a show at a neighboring casino, my boyfriend and I cabbed it to the Cosmopolitan to meet up with everyone who was at Marquee enjoying Kaskade.  Unfortunately, we never met up - but fortunately, I had a really good slice of pizza! The crust is chewy and the tomato sauce is flavorful. AND, the pizza is relatively cheap for Vegas\/Cosmopolitan prices (around $3\/slice of cheese).  While we were standing in line for pizza, a FIGHT broke out! That's how crazy good the pizza is.  Take my word for it.

The best part of enjoying the pizza? It's too small and cramped to eat inside the actual Pizzeria, so venture outside and people watch.  Not only was Kaskade djing at Marquee that night, but the Strokes had played a show at the Cosmopolitan.  My boyfriend and I played a fun game of "Marquee line reject or Strokes fan?"  Surprisingly not as easy as you think! Platinum blonde, short mini dress, stripper heels and CHEST TATTOO. Marquee line reject or Strokes fan??? YOU TELL ME!

If you got the munchies get the thick pepperoni slice!  It definitely lived up to its billing!!  Thin crust was good but definitely not better than the thick.  It is tucked in this hallway so the name fits!

THE best pizza EVER!

The pizza here was equally good sober or drunk! The crust is super thin while the ingredients were as fresh as they could be.  I know what you're thinking... its just pizza! But this has got to be the tastiest pizza on the west side!

I make sure I get some pizza at the Cosmo every Vegas trip!

Place was pretty good. If you're drunk & it's late AF, you def wanna pay this place a visit. But then again, if you're drunk, you might not even find the damn place. Lol. Pizza was too damn greasy but I really couldn't expect anything else. This place is a Brooklyn pizza spot NOT a Chicago spot, it needs to be reclassified under the search. All in all, if you wanna try an overpriced greasy slice of , check it out.

The name is unknown! It's literally a hidden pizza place in the Third level of the cosmopolitan by the pool tables before the sushi restaurant. The hallway is decorated with records and then you will see the pizza place! It's pricey about $5\/ slice and 26+ for one whole pizza. It was good New York style, a little too thin and crispy for me but it was still good! They are big slices.

I had been to Las Vegas plenty of times, but the last few times I decided to turn to social media travel sites to get some new ideas on things to do and places to eat. One place that I kept seeing mentioned was the "secret pizza place." At first I thought it was a joke since people were saying there was no sign for the actual place and were giving vague descriptions on how to get there. Once I found out this was an actual pizza place with great reviews I had to find it! I can't get enough of their pizza! I always get a slice of white and always make at least 2 trips to this place each time I visit Vegas. I did have a little problem finding this place during my last visit, even though I had been here quite a few times. My husband stayed in our room while I ventured to get pizza after several (or more) drinks. I got so lost that I just ended up going back to the room after an hour. The next day after my head was a little more clear I realized I was looking around on the wrong floor, but that was all on me LOL

I woke up the morning after this pepperoni pizza with a subtle hunt of garlic still lingering on my breath haha. Luckily my boyfriend had the same side effects! 

The pizza's solid, beer served in plastic cups, and VERY limited seating- perfect little hole in the wall pizza spot.

One of the best New York style pizzas I've ever had. This place really is a secret in that it's probably impossible to find unless you ask someone. It's down this remote corridor with no signage or anything. There was also a bit of a line, but boy the pizza was worth every minute of the wait.

The slices are a decent size and the flavor is awesome. the crust is beautifully crispy. I would eat the crust by itself as a loaf of bread. That's the secret to an awesome pizza in the first place. Add to that flavorful fresh ingredients and you have a winner.

Just an FYI - don't expect a restaurant type setting. There are a couple of bar stools, but basically it's a take it to go type of place. Again, the win is in the food itself. Really good.

I highly recommend Secret Pizza to anyone visiting the Vegas Strip.

Oh Secret Pizza how I love you.  I will get in the car and go to Cosmo just to get you.  

Best pizza in Vegas, perfect Brooklyn style, delicious crust, melty gooey cheese. I've been probably a dozen times since the Cosmo opened and only once has it not been the best thing ever.  Go ahead and bring a friend or two and order a whole pie because a slice only leaves you wanting more.  Plus the people watching is great, especially the nights Marquee is open and all the clubgoers  are standing in line getting pizza at 3 AM.  Also, I've seen Nelly and other celebs there before too so it's not just us little people that like the pizza hehehe
Best pizza I have ever had, I would of been so upset if I found out about this after I left or on my last day. I went there everyday I was there. I see why the keep it a secret, it's already busy.

By my fourth night in Vegas -yes I said fourth night I did not have the energy to rage all night long into the morning. After a long nap I woke up with a huge craving for something hearty. I opened up the Yelp app and the first place that popped up under my bookmarks was "Secret Pizza".
