Using the pics from other Yelpers, I was able to navigate up to the third floor and find the hallway that leads to this pizza joint. I ordered a whole pie with meatball, sausage, and mushrooms. After waiting for about 20 mins for the pizza to be done, I walked back to Vdara (where I was staying) and went HAM on this pizza. It was so good! First of all its thin crust, I love thin crust pizza. The toppings were well balanced because I know the meats were rich in flavor so I had to have mushrooms to balance that out. The best part was I was able to bring it home and enjoy this wonderful pie in the comfort of my home while recovering from the week long rage fest in Sin City!
I was so lucky to stumble across this little gem! The pizza is really really good, one of the best on the west coast.
Great pizza and service, i love that they are 24 hours. The service was great especially due to their patience with fairly intoxicated customers.

First stop when in Vegas. Great hidden place, pizza by the slice quick and easy. The white pizza alone is worth trying to find it. Pepperoni is great too. Prices are Vegas prices but at least they are really good.

This is my go to place for pizza on the strip.

About 6 years ago (early January 2011), I remember entering the brand new Cosmopolitan in search of the secret hallway (which was located in between the glass elevator and sushi place). Stumbling upon the vinyl album covered hallway for the first time was an "only in LAS Vegas" experience on its own. 
Looking past the line up of pinball machines against the left wall..you see your prize. 

WHITE PIZZA. The perfect combination of ricotta, mozzarella, garlic, and olive oil.
Pick up a slice (or two) if you're alone or live it up and buy the full pie to share.
Honorable mention: Slice of meatball & ricotta.
For the Sweet tooth: Try the cannoli!

Since that fateful day in January, my visits to Secret Pizza have been quite frequent. Whether its white pizza for lunch, dinner, or late night snack (somehow, despite whatever club I may have gone to..Secret pizza is always a "close enough" walk.)

As this place continues to grow in popularity, the line (especially for the night time crowd) gets longer and longer..but like many who stand in line with me, I will continue to wait in line as I know it'll be worth the wait.

Best NY style pizza in Vegas.  I know since I used to work in NYC for years and been to Vegas many times.  The place is very hard to find and I actually had to call them up to see where they're at.  Once there, it's a lot smaller than I thought it would be.  It suits much better for to go than to eat in.  I ordered plain cheese and a sausage.  Both are very good and comparable to NYC pizza.  

As for price, well, you are inside Cosmo and will pay the price for that.  If you want cheaper, you need to eat away from the strip.

This is the highest rated pizza place in Las Vegas.   I thought the pizza was good but not so amazing that I would wait in a huge line and then eat out in the middle of the 3rd floor.   

Still, the white pizza was excellent.   I'd pass on the usual red pepperoni (a bit too salty for me).   Also the pinball machine ate my money :-(

Tip: It's on the 3rd floor of Cosmo and look for the vinyl record entrance.
The place was not hard to find at all just follow the smell once on the third floor. The pizza quality was average at best. I would not go back there is average pizza on the strip.

Probably one of the best pizzas I've had so far. Had the ricotta and mazzo pizza. Thin and packed with flavor. Even though it's a bit on the pricey side, it's all worth it. The wait for a whole pie was around 15 to 20 minutes. No biggie.

Secret pizza is in a really hidden  no sign you barely see the entrance. Pizza it's self isn't that bad I prefer white pizza, supreme and pepperoni is kinda salty. 
Big tip: if you going with a group better call them and order otherwise you would  overpay for slices also when you try to reach them they don't pick up a phone so you definitely should wait until some one will answer the phone. Line after Marquee hours is getting insane so be aware of that but overall pretty tasty pizza when u really hungry!!!

Bookmarked this spot after checking out where my friends were cruising to in the area without really expecting to visit cause the last thing I thought I'd be doing w only 2 nights to spend on the Strip for a work trip would be looking for a damn Pizza place! 
So, did my Man and I just happen to eat $200 clams worth of Sushi at Blue Ribbon? (also in Cosmo, see my other review!)
Yes!
And as we were stumbling along back to our Hotel around Midnight on a glorious Thursday-to-be we saw the wall paper from the Yelp pictures w all the frames of neat stuff lining a hallway framing a long line of hungry patrons looking for a slice to soak up the eventuality of tomorrow's hangover...
Being that this felt like a certain privilege that we just accidentally happened upon some Pizza gold mine we waited in that line! 
We opted for a White Slice and a Meaty Slice from the line up of 4 semi-freshly cooked Pizzas sitting on the line and the staff was friendly enough...
Pizza was decent, albeit greasy but nothing to write home about other than I'm sure we woke up the next day in a better mood than we would of just trusting our night to Sushi!

Thank you Secret Pizza for saving so many club goers lives.  After drinking and dancing the night away, one needs greasy pizza to save themselves from making bad choices.  After clubbing at Marquee, there is a super long line, just be patient, you'll make it to the front.  My pizza slice was very good, ate it like I haven't eaten before.

What I like about this specific place, was the hallway of album covers.  Made the time pass by looking at them.  Great conversational pieces.

HAD TO try it because of all these great reviews! 

So my boyfriend and I were ecstatic! We go into the Cosmopolitan, look for "Pizza" or something like it on the directory, and NOTHING! No mention of anything regarding pizza. So we went to ask, and they said 3rd floor. We take the escalators, go through the Marquee stampede of people, and see nothing related to pizza! My boyfriend was pissed haha I asked a hostess from a restaurant and she took us right to the long hallway.

Lined on the walls with old vynil record art, a 20+ foot long hallway will lead you to a vintage arcade machine and VOILA! PIZZA! 

The slices are pretty big, BUT the prices could be better considering how thin they are! 

Seating areas are very limited! They have bars where you can just stand at and then about 4 stools (first come first serve!)

We had slices from pies already made which were of mushrooms and one of tomato with ricotta.  Also ordered a diet coke, which was $4 yet came in one of those red plastic cups you buy for parties.

They were good, yes, pretty good!  How do you really judge a pizza? Hmm... I guess I like mine thicker and saucier and cheesier, so these were just alright and I probably won't go again :-(

Womp womp wooooomp

Have the people who rave about this place never had pizza before or are they plain drunk? This place is about as standard as pizza gets. Sure, it is not bad, but there is nothing going on here that sets it apart from other competent pizza joints. In the same building, a couple dozen yards away, you find excellent Neapolitan pizza at DOCG. It is a more expensive, but on another realm when it comes to satisfying your taste buds. If you are drunk in the Cosmo and need nourishment, this is not a bad bet. If not, there are plenty of better options.

Located on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel, Secret Pizza has no sign or place on the hotel map. The concierge told my uncle about this place upon checking into the hotel, and I am so happy she did!! This is our second time here this weekend, and after trying several different slices, this was definitely the big winner. The White Pizza speaks true to its name, having only white sauce, cheese and a ricotta herb cheese dolloped on top. The herb ricotta adds the perfect flavor to this pizza and i would get it again and again! Best part is it's open almost 24 hours so it's perfect for drunchies after hitting Marquee at night! The next time I'm in Vegas I will definitely be coming back to this place.

You have to get the timing right on this place or you'll wait a long time. We got right in and we're lucky enough to get fresh pizza. Everything's was good, we got the cheese, sausages, white and a thick pan crust type pepperoni. Couldn't even finish it all.

Perfect after a late night at the casino! 

Order a pre made slice for quicker service... all good so you can't go wrong

This pizza is fantastic. I just had one slice of the supreme like pizza and the bite was amazing! 

Decor: there is no sign, it's literally just a hall way that leads through with two pin ball machines to the left and the kitchen to the right. It's not really a big area to be in, but don't let that fool you.

Pizza: I got the supreme pizza toppings for i think 6 bucks. Best pizza slice I had in all of 2016 foreals. If you are in the Cosmo, this is the place.

notes:
Just look for a long hall way with no sign right next to the escalators, or up the elevator.

Verdict: come get your bomb slice of pizza.
closest thing to a New York pizza! just the plain pepperoni was delicious!!
Their Sicilian is delish...ricotta cheese they use to die for!! Wouldn't know it is here in the cosmopolitan but well worth it

Review #700!  

I love NYC pizza with a deep, lustful passion.  It plagues my dreams, calls out to me through windows with its seductive aroma, and makes me yearn for the next cheesy slice.  Secret Pizza is a place in Las Vegas that serves it.  My friend Grace C. went last year when Cella R. told her about it.  Ever since then, I've been plotting my return to Vegas and partaking in this secretive pizza joint.  

My fellow elite Yelpers and I made our way over to the Cosmopolitan after a YEE at the Cathouse and ordered 2 pizzas ($50 total): one white pizza and one half pepporoni\/ half sausage & mushroom.  It came out to about $5 per person.  Secret Pizza is located up on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan food court next to the sushi restaurant down an unmarked hallway.  There are white tiles and picture frames welcoming you into this unremarkable looking pizza place.  We ordered our pizzas around midnight and got them about 30 minutes after.  It seemed like forever to a slightly inebriated and starving person such as myself.  I was hungry and watching others get their slices before I did, was excruciatingly painful.  Drew M. started to play Donkey Kong while waiting.  Watching his arcade game progression only made me hungrier.  

Where was this pizza anyway?!  Why didn't I just order a damn slice?!  Oh wait, there it is.  We brought it outside to the sofas & coffee table.  We dug in.  Silence.  Everyone is chewing and gulping their pizza in a very methodical fashion.  Delicious garlicky white pizza with greasy pepperoni pizza.  I was in heaven.  Was it the best pizza I've ever had?  No, nothing compares to real NYC pizza in NYC, but it comes close.  Too bad the crust wasn't as crispy as I would have liked but the flavor of the white pizza still makes me drool as I write this.  Pizza is the perfect food in the wee hours of the morning when all you want is carbs.  Thanks for making my pizza dreams come true, if only for the night!

My girlfriend and I went here when neither of us were hungry. She ordered the white pizza and has not stopped talking about it since (one week later). I ordered a pepperoni and added meatballs. I highly recommend adding meatballs if you're unsure of a topping. Hands down the best pizza I've ever had! Ninja turtles would approve!

Hmm... long and overdue... but here it goes:

I think if you have the drunchies (drunk + munchies), this is the perfect place for you.  Of course, if you can find it.  I think if you're drunk and hungry, it might be a bit hard to find. lol

Note: my friends and i were sober when we came here...

The four of us were looking forward on trying this place due to the high ratings on YELP.  Each of us ordered something different: white pizza with ricotta, pepperoni, sausage + pepperoni, and mushroom + sausage + garlic.   

- they reheat the pizza
- cardboard crust
- overly greased with oil 
- no flavor unless you add sauce on them
- slice of pizza definitely not worth $5

This is a must try in Vegas! Wanted good pizza so I yelped and this came us. So a group of us made it on over. Its labor day so the line was a bit long but worth it. Great toppings, great crust. I will definitely come here again

Pizza is not really my thing.  What I love about secret pizza is:  its a great late night, you get to chose your toppings, its thin crust, and it has one of my most favorites cheesecake!!!!!!  I'm not sure if the pricing is a little up there for a slice?  I love the white cheese with italian sausage yum!!!!!! 

Workers are friendly especially dealing with a whole lotta drunken monkeys rollin thru.  DRUNK + Pizza ? Surely a great combo!

Everytime I'm in Vegas and I want some pizza I try to come here. I really love the pizza here. Many people may say its just regular pizza but for me it was really good. Maybe because of the ricotta cheese? Not sure but it was really good. I ate this pizza when I was drunk and when I sober and both times it was good. Lines can get long so if you dont like to wait order by phone and go pick it up. I finally did that this time and bypassed the long line leading out towards the place with everyone looking at me like why is he going to the front and not waiting like us.

Not really a secret.... Everyone who works at the hotel knows about this place so just ask around and they will tell you how to get there!!

$5 slices, very little seating, and deeeelicious NY pizza!

We dance off all the calories at Marquee JUST so we can eat Secret Pizza after!!

We heard about this place from a local who said it might be fun to go, and we certainly found it entertaining to find. As the name suggests, this is a "secret" place; there are no signs to help you find it. 

The hallway to the place is lined with records, which gives it a cool vibe. The place itself is cozy; there is a raised bar along the walls with stools for you to sit and eat your pizza. The slices are generous in size and there are condiments (parmesan cheese, pepper flakes, garlic powder, etc). If you are in Vegas for a few days, this isn't a bad place to grab a quick bite to eat for lunch.

Cool little place on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan. Not labeled, if you're not looking for it you'd walk right by it. (Hence the secret).

Tried the white pizza, it wasn't good or bad (Not a big fan of white pizza but went for it). I could see how someone that likes white pizza would enjoy it. I also tried the pepperoni, it was good, but not great. 

For two slices (fairly big) and a 20oz bottle of smart water my total was $15. Rather cheap for food on the strip but not a great deal in general considering most pizzas are $15.

Secret Pizza was a challenge to find but that was the fun in coming here! There are no signs so you're gonna have to ask someone. 

We entered through this long hallway covered in album covers. Long story short, we ordered couple of slices of cheese pizza. At $5 a slice(cheese only), it was a deal! The thin slices came out in minutes. I think I ate it faster than it took for them to make it! 

The slices are thin, almost airy. The crust was tasty and not soggy. The sauce was good and not overloaded with it. I could easily eat two slices but had to visit another eatery located at the Cosmo, so I had to save room!

IMHO, nothing stood out like it should be worth more than three stars?! Heck, add meat? Extra veggies? From the taste of the sauce and crust, no matter what you add, the pizza would still be three stars for me?!

Drunk or sober, this pizza taste good any time of the day. 

Late night pizza in Vegas means long lines but it was worth the wait and money ($5\/slice). I bought meat lovers (pepperoni, ham, spicy sausage) and supreme (?) and both were delicious topping and crust wise. My only comment is that there's too much crust.

Awesome late night spot for food at the Cosmopolitan.  The line was horrific, but at 3 am or whenever it was, it proved to be good entertainment.  We got the white pizza and a couple bud lights.  It was so delicious we ate all of it but 2 slices!  Know what exactly what you want when it's your turn to order, they are nice enough but tired of drunk people and clearly trying to keep the line moving as fast as possible... it kind of reminded me of the soup nazi!

Updating this a mere week later because I found myself in Vegas yet again and this time...staying at the Cosmo where Secret Pizza is IN DA HOUSE. SO EXCITED. Apparently, my friends were able to have their pizza delivered to their room here once but we weren't able to do that this time. So a couple of tips...call in your order if you're getting a whole pizza so it'll be ready to go when you get there. Go during the day when lines are non-existent or expect at least an hour wait when you go after the clubs close. 

I'm bumping them up to five stars because the prices are fair, the pizzas are fresh....AND they hooked it up with free samples last time I was here. FREE SECRET PIZZA?! Are you friggin kidding me? That's like winning the jackpot!

Okay so I'm not a fanatic pizza connoisseur, and I'm from Baltimore, not New York, so I don't have a pizza superiority complex or anything, but come on with the rave reviews. Now if you're experiencing a free buzz compliments of the casino downstairs, I can see how you might mistake this place for great, but really it's pretty average. Trying to find the place while traversing through the hipster mind game that is the Cosmopolitan was better than the actual slice.

Thank you Yelp! After consuming a decent amount of libations at Bond on the first floor my buddy and I had a raging case of the munchies.  I quickly dispatched my handy Yelp app and searched for "late night food" (it was 2AM after all) and noticed the intriguing title of "Secret Pizza".  Not only were we already in the Cosmopolitan but it also was highly rated.

Finding this place was an adventure, partially because it's hidden\/not listed anywhere and also because I was already three sheets to the wind and would probably have a hard time finding it even if I didn't have anything to drink.  Alas, do not discount the determination of two twenty something males with a craving for some late night pizza.

The actual pizzeria wasn't terribly big and thankfully wasn't crowded when we went so ordering and paying for our slices was relatively fast.  I ordered a slice of the white pizza (effin delicious) and another equally delicious pizza (see photo) which name escapes me.  Both slices were amazing from the toppings right down to the crust...which I ate all of.  The cost of my fourth meal was $11 (verified by the credit card receipt in my wallet the next day) which was not only reasonable but totally worth it.

The pizza is good. But this is definitely a experience you should do if up late in Vegas and want pizza. It was just a cool experience.  But I can't give it five stars because I know there is better pizza. Don't let  the stars hold you back from an experience.

By far, one of the BEST pizza places I've ever had. I live in Akron, OH, home of Luigi's Famous Pizza, (well, famous to us) and it's hard to compare anything to that in my opinion, but if anywhere was going to pass up my Luigi's, it would be this place.
I found this place from a secret blog I found a couple months before our trip to Vegas, and we were bound and determined to find it. It's a long hallway with a couple guys at the end in this little room behind what looks similar to a deli counter, flipping pizzas back and forth the whole time. The "white" pizza is by far, THE BEST. Made from an assortment of cheese, ricotta, fresh herbs and well, I'm not really sure of what else, but it doesn't matter because it's AMAZING. It's the definition of a laid-back, pick-up-your-pizza-and-go, type of place. But it has a casual, authentic old-style-italian atmosphere. It looked like a couple of grandson's working for their old-school italian grandpa behind the counter and you can tell by the atmosphere in there, that they love it.

HIGHLY recommend finding this place, and keeping it on the down-low, so that it can remain a low-key (secret), special place, for the people that know about it!

Not so secret anymore, huh? 

3rd floor of the Cosmo, look for the hallway with the records lining the walls and people with drunchies standing outside. Bomb ass pizza: pepperoni and white are stand-out. May take a bit if you order a whole pie-- it'll be real fresh.

Water cooler by the register. Minimal seating inside; some couches in the lobby outside. Great spot to people watch.

Best post-game food in the classiest hotel-casino around. Plus, comes with a whole lot of character.

Came here after reading all the Yelp reviews. Ordered a full pie with pepperoni and mushrooms. Slices were big and overall a really great pie. Also like the "secretive" entrance....we missed it initially and then realized it was hidden in an alley of pics. Definitely a must do if you're in the mood for pizza !

We looked all over the place and still didn't see anything that looked like a pizza place.  We finally had to ask, and I still didn't believe it until I turned the corner and saw the pizza ovens.  

The long dark hall, framed on either side with old album covers was a bit nostalgic,  I could see a video game, one of those older arcade types, and a flat screen, but once inside and around the corner, a mall counter and several large pizza's laid before use  to choose our slice, pepperoni with meatball. 

It was reheated and not bad, it actually retained a good crust, not soggy at all.  We must have been there at just the right time because there wasn't a line, and only three other people around.  I had read there could be a long line and wait A definite must try kind of place.
Awful pizza. Comparable to Sbarro's. Save yourself the time, money, and calories and go somewhere good.

We stopped by to grab some late night pizza. It was a secret, because it took us a few minutes to find it. It's on the 3rd floor and down the vinyl hallway (very cool). There is a pinball machine and Galaga. The seating is very limited, but counters you can stand at. The pizza did not disappoint.....very yummy....glad we got there when we did because the line got long real quick. This is a must, especially if you are looking for something to eat late night.

Late night Vegas after attending three events for Nightclub Bar & Show Convention kickoff.  We found this hidden gem.  Long lines, because they are one of the few places opened late night. They have a lounge area just outside where we sat to enjoy our pie.  Thin pizza, large slices, not too greasy, and hit the hunger spot.  Yes, I would visit again.

The walk up and down the stairs of Marquee was so draining we decided to grab some pizza to gain back some energy. The pizza is somewhat expensive...about $7\/slide if ordered individual. The location is hard to find...no wonder it's a secret :) We ordered a whole pie - deluxe which gives you the option to add up to 5 toppings for $35 total. It took about 20 mins to get our pie and it was just perfect for our group of 7. The only downside is the limited seating area inside so we had to eat at one of the tables by the pool table.

The best part of this place is the scavenger hunt to find it. The location is ridiculously obscure. The hotel doesn't even have it listed on their website. The casino is 3 floors away, and unless you're LEAVING Marquee, you wouldn't have a reason to discover this pizza place.

We found a random hallway with albums all along the wall, and I knew from reading yelp that this was the place. There was a bouncer right at the mouth of the hall, and I was half expecting them to say something, but they just nodded and said, "Enjoy the pizza."

Then things started going downhill. The pizza was over-priced ($5 a slice for cheese) and mediocre at best. I had even been drinking, and it was just a let-down to be honest. The pizza was not a lot of food, and the crust was flimsy and a bit over-worked to have a nice chew\/mouth-feel.

The toppings were typical of any hole-in-the-wall pizza place, and the slices waiting to be served harkened a less than stellar Sbarro feeling. The place looked out of place in the otherwise impeccable Cosmopolitan, and the drinks were served in red plastic solo cups. I'm not in college anymore, and I'm not at Circus Circus... please just give it to me in the bottle, or better yet an actual glass.

The line wasn't too bad when we arrived. (Around 9:00pm) But apparently it gets ape-shit when the clubs start to close down. If that was the case, I'd definitely not wait in line for this. But the 10 minute line wasn't that bad.... too bad the food wasn't even worth it.

In conclusion, I'd say you're better off spending your Vegas money elsewhere. It's a unique idea, with a bad product. I'd highly recommend 800 Degrees Pizza in front of the Monte Carlo for a truly amazing pizza.

Not a sit down place, but definitely great for a super casual lunch.  Get two slices at least!
The pizza was yummy, the sauce wasn't too acidic.  The crust was how I like it, a little crispy but also toothy as well.
Definitely worth catching the escalators all the way up and away from the crowds.
The employees were no nonsense and doing their jobs well.
I got a salad too but I wouldn't recommend it.
Name speaks for itself. Took me like fucking 5 hours to find this joint but it was well worth it. The pizza reminds me of the pizza I would get at New York.

Secret pizza isn't such a secret no more. 
This place was packed with people when I came here due to the fact that nobody picked up the phone(fail). At least i get to see why this place was oh so secret haha since there are no signs or even a name to let you know it's here but I guess seeing a bunch of people lining up for no apparent reason is your sign of knowing where secret pizza is. 

Fairly decent price for how big the pizza is when you order the whole thing. I actually really like the pizza...my favorite toppings to go along with it right now is probably pepperoni, onions\/mushrooms, and garlic. Man the garlic makes the pizza absolutely delicious!!! I really like the thin layer crust even though it doesn't exactly get me full :p but as long as it taste delicious then there isn't much to complain about. I guess my real only complain to secret pizza is probably the amount of oil you see on it which i should of use my napkin to soak it up because i remember i had a stomachache the next day...you know the rest. #tmi 
BUT YEA make sure you use the napkin to lessen the oil and you'll be fine as it is a delicious pizza to enjoy. 

What i also love about secret pizza is that it closes at 4-5 am and that is just 2 major thumbs up for me. #nightlifeeating :)

I find it to be a place you should come every time you're in vegas. :)

i don't know if it was because it was 4 am or because i drank more than normal, but this pizza was so tasty!  yes, it took an hour to get the pizzas but it seemed freshly made and well, it was 4 am.  thanks for saving us from starvation, pizzeria @ cosmopolitan!
Great little hole in the wall pizza joint on level 3 of the Cosmopolitan.  New York style pizza was great and affordable compared to all the expensive restaurants.    Will definitely visit again!

Ate here again last night before a concert at the Chelsea....food was awesome again! Me and the hubby both got slices of pepperoni and sausage. It was so good! Plus, because it was a Thursday night, the line was nil...waited maybe 10 min to order, and the pizza was fresh and hot.

BEST white pizza ever!!!!  Definitely eat it fresh at the place because once you take it home and it gets cold, it's pretty nasty lol.  But when eaten hot and fresh, it's sooooooo goooooood.  I willingly burned the roof of my mouth for this.

#2 Best NY-style Pizza I have ever had. It was not after a night of clubbing, didn't even have anything to drink yet. Combination of crust, cheese and sauce is solid. I think they source the pepperoni from the angels up above, because it is really spicy but amazing flavor that compliments the other ingredients beautifully. This is a must try for anyone staying Mid-strip, or on the strip for that matter. Enjoy, I did!!

Awwwww, hell yes!

NYC, thin crust pizza in Vegas?

Shhhhhh.

No wonder this place is a secret.

And, no mark up.

Honest pricing.

IF (big if), you can find it, park your rig here. 

This is the well spring of cravings.

It can't be a trip to Vegas without grabbing a slice of pizza from the secret pizza place in the Cosmo hotel. Every slice is delicious down to the last bite. There's mainly standing room to eat your pizza but right outside there's plenty of seating in the hotel. You can see them making the pizza right as you walk in! It's a good place for a quick bite, they usually have a couple of different pizzas made where you can order by the slice, but don't fret, they also make whole pizzas for takeout.

First of all it was just fun to go try to find this place.  Even with the clues in the Yelp reviews it took a bit of time.  The pizza itself was pretty good, but for the size of the slice its one of the more expensive by the slice places on the strip.

The White Pizza hits the spot! One slice is good enough, but if you're with a big group then order a whole pie.

Plop your tired feet down on the couches outside and people watch as you gobble down the greasy goodness. If you walk down the hallway to the right, there's a big open area that you can relax at as well.



... and that, my friends, is 100!
secret is a bit of hype.  solid thin crust slice but $5, thus best to go late night.  otherwise, try an amazing late night meal at oyster bar palace station.

I feel super bad leaving this place such a negative review, because all my friends love this place, but this place is just too greasy and oily for me. After about three bites in, I felt very nauseous and sick. When you tilt the pizza, the amount of oil that drips from the pizza is so shocking. For me, I don't think I can go back to this place :(

First night in Vegas for a long weekend and after blowing through my personal daily limit at the Monte Carlo blackjack tables into the wee hours, some late night pizza here was just what I needed.  This place was a recommendation of some friends of mine who found it earlier this year when staying at the Cosmo.  With the help of Yelp reviews for this place, I was able to find the mystery hallway without much issue.  And lucky for us, at 3am this past Friday morning wasn't a busy time.  Waited 5 minutes to get our slices.

The pizza was piping hot, and went down fast.  Very good, possibly assisted by having  late-night munchies, but I'd come back again on another trip.

Hubby is always looking for good thin crust pizza.  This secret is now out of the bag!  This is as good as Grimaldis!  I had the white pizza with ricotta cheese, mushrooms and onions.  Best in town!
Went twice in 3 days...

One of the best kept secrets in Vegas. For some reason they don't have their business advertised in the hotel (Cosmo); you will have to look hard to find it and once you find as enter the dark hallway surrounded by classic Italian Vinyl covers, you know you are there. You can arguably say it is one of the best Pizza places in town but you can definitely find similar quality for a little less around the strip and Fremont (Pizza Rock). What makes it cool is that they do not have a name so the only way to find it is to ask around, and maybe that is why people try to find this "mysterious" location. Worth trying and expect a line before you order; if you want to skip the line and have a similar quality pizza (and better value), go across the street to Pin-Up Pizza at Planet Hollywood, right on the street...

So yummy and cheap and in Vegas!!!  We ate here every night we stayed in vegas.   It was damn good and the crust was amazing for thin crust.  This was some of the best pizza I have ever had and its only $5 per slice.

The first time I had the not-so-secret pizza was in 2011 or 2012 when Marquee first opened up. It is located next to STK inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel. The only reason to go here is after a night of drinking at Marquee, otherwise you can find better elsewhere. I've stayed at the Cosmo many times while in Vegas but I would usually eat at Secret Pizza for the late night munchies. If you ate it sober, you probably wouldn't think it is that good. I honestly think they could put more cheese on their pizza, and I mean double the amount of cheese. I remember I got a slice that almost had more sauce than cheese on it. And the reason I remember the lack of cheese was because we ate there for lunch one time when we were not drinking hehe. And yes it is true they do not have a ranch like some people say. That's too bad because pizza with ranch is so damn good. Also, since there is no seating, grab your pizza slice and head out to the area in between STK and Secret Pizza, there are a bunch of chairs in the middle to sit on if they aren't taken already. 
I don't think it is worth waiting in a long ass line just for Secret Pizza, considering you have to find some place to sit. But if the line is short, go for it!

You're in Vegas. Whether it's for work or pleasure, in my case, work. You're craving something delicious, something cheap, and something filling. Pizza sounds good. Maybe it's 3:00am and you're leaving a club, and need to eat. Or, in my case, maybe it's 10:00pm and you're starving for dinner, and you just really want pizza. Whatever the case may be, take my advice. Head to the Cosmopolitan. Go to the third floor. Find all the restaurants, and the pool table. Find Secret Pizza down the secret hallway lined with music records. Eat. Be happy!
I have to admit, I didn't find this place on my own, or even through Yelp. I was sitting next to a really nice guy on the plane ride in, who told me I just HAD to try the pizza here. Best pizza in Vegas, he said. Is it? I can't judge that, because it's the ONLY pizza I've had in Vegas. However, it's one of the best pizzas I've ever had. I went with the white pizza. Absolutely the most mouthwatering slice I've ever had. Gobs of ricotta, perfectly crisp\/chewy crust. Sprinkled with the (I think) garlic powder they have on the counter, and a little parmesan. I was in carb heaven and it was WORTH IT. Definitely will be back next time I'm in Vegas. Which will be next month. I'm already counting down the days till my next Secret Pizza visit.

Cool pizza place that's literally a hold in the wall at the Cosmopolitan Casino. Had two slices of cheese. Long line and hidden but tasty. Expensive at 4.50 a slice with 4 dollar bottles of water but placed strategically next to Marquee for a reason. Similar to good New York pizza and in fact better than a lot of the average new York pizza places there are. Long lines.
Life saver!  Tasty pizza and well priced.  One of the many perks of staying at The Cosmopolitan.  I don't think our group would have made it through the weekend without them!
This is a hidden gem. I'm not a huge fan of New York style pizza but absolutely love their food. Highly recommend.

Hidden little gem in Cosmopolitan hotel! This place has no signs, and they do not advertise it. It's one of those... if you know about it type of thing. Funny thing is, I learned about Secret Pizza in an airplane, and knew I just had to try it for myself.  It's tucked away in a little hallway, full of people who just got done clubbing. I guess some can easily say it's drunk people food. Absolutely not!! I believe they do not advertise it because it is "Secret Pizza" after all.. I think this place would appeal more to the young adults. There are no actual tables, and just a little bar counter with a few stools and chairs... maybe five? There wasn't really a place to eat, and it would have been pretty awkward to eat there while the line of people stare at you because of the way it was arranged. I recommend getting take-out! Long line, but they do try to get you out of there as quickly as possible. The crust is extremely thin I assume so it can cook much quicker, some of the veggies are pre-cooked in advance, and the mushroom is sliced paper thin to reduce cooking time.

I've eaten pizza from here at least 10 times, and I think it's safe to say it's my absolute favorite pizza joint! 

The pizza is delicious! I think it's one of the best one's I've ever had. I still crave it...... WHYYYY do you have to be sooo far away!?!? Well I think only in vegas will I be willing to cough up $40ish for my pizza. Worth every penny though!! The slices are very big, and they are pretty generous with their toppings. I ate at almost every eatery\/ restaurant in Cosmo, and I must say, this place was my favorite! I had to eat here twice, and still craved for more!! The menu is literately typed and printed on normal computer paper. The cover of the menu simply says "Pizza"

I ordered a Five Toppings "Pie"  $29.00 -18 inches, 10 slices. Each Additional topping was $2.25
Toppings
Pepperoni
Sliced Sausage - Yum!
Meatballs
Roasted Tomatoes
Fresh Garlic- Added a very nice touch
Green Peppers
Mushrooms-sliced so paper thin to reduce cook time..almost couldn't taste it! ):
Onions
Ricotta

Overall, I can't wait to go back!! I would highly recommend this place, enjoy!!!

Secret Pizza has been hyped up so I had to try this place when I visited Vegas again. The place is located on the third floor of Cosmopolitan, just locate a narrow hallway once you reach the third floor from the escalator. The slices are pretty big and priced at about $5-$6 each. It's a bit pricy for a slice of pizza, but it's expected since you're in Vegas and also cheaper compared to most places on the strip. 

I got two slices and they filled me up. The white pizza definitely lived up to its hype, I was skeptical since it had no toppings, but it was delicious! The sauce was flavorful and perfectly cheesy. The combo pizza was good too, but you can get it anywhere. They also have a self serve water machine to quench your thirst. The only con is that it's too oily, had to get rid of some of the grease with a napkin. 

Seating is limited inside, but there are a couple of lounge couches and tables outside to sit. Overall, I wouldn't mind coming back if I'm nearby or craving for some pizza.

Cheap eats

White pizza. Enough said.

Secret pizza! Secret pizza! Secret pizza! Secret pizza! 

HFS! Secret pizza is a must try when you're drunk. From what I remember this place is mother effing delicious. I've ordered a regular cheese pizza before and a pizza with pepperoni and sausage. Wow! My mouth was loving every bite of this pizzas greasy goodness. It's like I stepped into the twilight zone. The pizza is fucking delicious BUT I'm in hell because I'm so drunk. Nonetheless, this place is a must in the midst of being fucked the fuck up. Good job secret pizza! 

PS lines can get pretty long in the early AM hours but fuck it. Wait for secret pizza.

Looking for this place was a little tricky, it doesn't have any signs or anything! My dad found this place awhile back because he thought it was a bathroom but people were coming out with pizza boxes. 

Place is clean, fast and huge portions! 
About $5 a slice. 

I've been here twice and the second experience was definitely better. 
The first time we got the all white with ricotta and I felt it was too much, it was good but It didn't have a wow factor. It was seriously soaked in grease, I used a TON of napkins to soak it up. My siblings and I felt a little sick. 

2nd time, I brought my friend since she insisted she wanted pizza and this time I got the plain one with cheese . got it crispier and that one hit the spot! I've been looking for that NYC thin slice pizza and it was close enough.

I am not a pizza fan.. I prefer to make it at home myself, but I would have to say that this pizza is by far the best pizza i've ever had! We got a 3 topping pizza: pepperoni, meatball, and mushroom. $26. The pizza was delicious, the sauce was perfectly seasoned, if only they give you a side to dip your crust in! It is a thin crust pizza, but not too thin and crispy, very enjoyable to eat. The place is hard to find, it is on the 3rd floor I think down a hallway... when they say 'secret pizza' it really is secret, they don't even have their name on anything! If you have the chance and are craving pizza... this is definitely the place to go!!

HANDS DOWN the best pizza I've had since I've been on this side of the country. A fellow Yelper and I were certainly on the same wavelength as we seeked this place out (although I was the only first-timer). 

Normally not a pizza-bone (crust) eater, this was a wonderful way to introduce myself to a perfectly crisp one that I surely will be disappointed by when it comes to any other. I believe the reason I 8 it this time around is because I just simply didn't want it to end. 

I only enjoyed a slice of plain, but it was $4.50 well spent. Go ahead and eat at that $$$$ steakhouse or Asian\/fusion place. You'll come here 3 hours later and you can, since they're open until 4-5am, depending on the day of the week.

People, the line is worth it and it moves pretty fast. You can make friends with those around you in line, whether by normal conversation or if they're practically stumbling in or leaning onto you for support. And if you have no interest in talking, pretend like you don't speak a word of English. It worked for me!

This place isn't really 'secret', but Cosmo doesn't acknowledge the fact that it exists, so I guess that's what makes it a secret spot. The pizza here is really good, and reasonable priced for Vegas standards. The only reason I gave it a 4 is because of the ambience of having to stand in line next to obnoxious, drunk people. I think it could also be a little bigger inside, with more space to eat, there currently is only a countertop.

I've eaten here twice. I love eating here. The pizza is excellent. I've had a sausage pizza and they definitely do not skimp on the sausage. It's very tasty. I've also had a slice of white pizza which was probably one of the best slices of pizza I've ever had. The staff is quiet but actually pretty nice. Let me change pizza selection without any fuss.

The downside to the secret pizza is the location. It's got to be a secret because the place is tiny. It's hard to stand in there. It has a TV which is nice while you are waiting, but it sucks as it's an incentive to keep people in there as well. There's not much room for much. Plus, the cheese and pepper flakes were running dangerously low and there wasn't a napkin to be found. It's hard to bother the staff as well as there's just like two people there and there is always a line. Regardless, it's not too bad otherwise.

Secret pizza. Hard to find, worth the trouble.

This secret little hole in the wall is a little difficult to find, but it is located on the third floor in between a sushi restaurant and a blue\/purple neon lit glass elevator. Just follow the narrow hallway (full of tiles) and it's located at the end. 

Now to the pizza, the pizza slices are pretty big and they're pretty good. The pepperoni and sausage one was the best in my opinion. The pizza is a little overpriced as well as the pitchers of beers, but not enough to keep customers from coming back.

I can't believe this place has so many positive reviews.  I've been wanting to try this place out for months and heard so many positive things about it, so I was shocked at how awful my pizza was.  The worst pizza I've ever ate.  Worse than Sbarro.  Worse than Domino's.  Worse than Papa John's.  I got a simple pepperoni and cheese and the whole thing was weirdly bitter and near-rancid tasting.  And for just under $30, a serious disappointment.  I was really hungry too.  You could also tell all the staff hated being there and were borderline rude to everyone (not just me).  Never again.

This is definitely a new place to go to if you are tired of always getting Earls.  Especially after clubbing at Marquee, this is the perfect spot.  Although it is hidden, it's not too hard to find at all.  Located on the third floor through a hall way full of records.  If you look directly in the hall way you should see a TV and a pin ball machine.  

They serve pizza by the slice or whole pizzas.  My friends and I decided to get a whole pizza with 5 toppings.  We got pepperoni, meat ball, sausage, ricotta cheese, and banana peppers on the side.  Cost was $29.  We took it outside and devoured it shortly.  Sitting next to the pool table on the couch.  We added crushed red peppers, parmesan cheese, and garlic salt.  It was so tasty and good.  Yes it's thin crust, and after pulling the slice apart, the cheese stretches and the toppings at the tip falls off.  Greasy but tasty, if grease is a problem you can use a napkin to dab at it.   

This has now become a must come to spot every time we come to Vegas.

Love it.  The fact that there are no signs and u have to know what Ur looking for or u'll totally walk right past it adds to its charm. 

Pizza is delicious and will hit the spot after a long eventful night. I can say it's one of the best slices I've had in a while. 

Will recommend n will go back even if I don't stay at the cosmopolitan.

The pizza had too much cheese.  What this place has going for it is it is relatively inexpensive and casual in a city that is over the top.  I think if people were sober, they would not like the pizza as much.

Best pizza ever, still hit the spot .. years later! This is literally located secretly in Cosmopolitan on the 3rd floor next to the elevator! 

Came here for lunch and only takes 20 mins for a whole pizza. Ordered the white pizza with pepperoni, sausages, sun-dried tomatoes, bell peppers, and garlic for $36 (10 slices aka $3.60 a slice). We had half, save the other half for late night munchies after club.

Of course this place hidden. Is there a sign that says the name? Of course there isn't. What about a listing on the directory? You won't find any. Of course.

Open almost 24\/7, late night grubbers should trek up on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel to find this gem. A dark hallway of record covers adorning the walls can be found near the pool table that will lead you to this tiny and very casual joint. 

Serving NY-style pizza, the crust is crisp-thin (eaten folded) and is piping hot from the oven with a good sizzle from the cheese. A slice will cost you about $5 and some change. I say it's a bit steep but for each bite I took, nostalgia overtook me only proving that these were the closest I've had (from the west side) to eating a good ol' NYC pizza. I got their PEPPERONI, a classic that I couldn't resist, and WHITE PIZZA which I think was mighty fantastic. If you only have room for one, I highly recommend the latter. Trust.

I hear ordering a whole pizza can make you skip the line but lucky for us, there wasn't a crowd that one weekday afternoon we went. 

P.S. Secret Pizza, please refill your table napkin containers. All were empty when we went.

It was really really good pizza. I couldn't find the restaurant...it really is a secret but I asked a d there it was right behind me. I only tried this place because of Yelp and it was worth it. Great pizza but I went at a busy time so the choices were limited.

This place is not what I expected. It's literally a little whole in the wall joint. You can get pizza by the slice or as a whole. Don't try to order anything custom because it's wayyy too complicated for them. Nowhere to sit, besides a couple of bar stools, so you'll have to find a spot by the pool table outside.

I love unmarked places, especially secret pizza, which is on the 3rd floor across the escalators left of Jaleo. Pizzas are 5-6 dollars a slice, or 28-36 for a whole pizza. My favorite is the riocotta, sausage and onions pizza. That combination is heaven. SO GOOD. 

Crust came out a little brunt this pastime though. It's a fresh pizza if you buy whole, reheated if you buy a slice. Fresh whole pizza takes about 20 minutes to make. If you see the line from the escalators, line's about 40 minutes.

Amazing pizza just steps away from Marquee...open til super late and it's a great price for tasty food on the strip...my boyfriend and I happened to find this the last time we were strolling out of Marquee at 4am...had some pizza and relaxed on the couches to refuel before we continued the night into the early morning!
This place was perfect for a late night dinner run. The hole in the wall style has a real appeal. This is then backed up by amazing pizza! So full of flavour and fresh. Left me wanting more .

Finally tried Secret Pizza, and I loved it. I got a thick Sicilian slice, and it was great. It was so good that I got back in line and got another slice. And this was after already eating at Holstein's. Had my pizza and beer before seeing Neon Trees at the Boulevard pool. Only knock I have is that I have to get something like a Bud Light to drink with my pizza. Wish they had maybe one good local craft beer on draught, then it would be 5 stars.

Atmosphere, although small, is quite cool. I sat at an Arcade game and had my pizza and beer. Unfortunately the arcade game didn't work or I just couldn't figure out how to use it and so I wasted a dollar.

this place is so good. By accident, I stubmled upon this joint in the corner of the Cosmopolitian two years ago. (so hard to find). It's only worth it to buy the whole pie. (slices are too expensive).
I order a pepperoni mushroom sausage pie, take it up to the pool. lounge on one of those seats near the 8-tv screen area and watch football. life doesn't get much better than that. its NY style pizza. The cheese is soo gooey, the toppings are plentiful. not much to complain about this joint.

Taking into account location, comparable places nearby, pricing, and of course the quality of food, it is impossible to rate this place any lower than 5 stars. Really cool place that makes you feel as if you've stepped out of the Cosmopolitan and into any hole-in-the-wall pizza across America. The pizza was great, but the real winner for us was the cheesecake. $4.50 for a giant piece that easily feeds two hungry people. There was no line when we went (around noon on New Years Eve). The ONLY complaint was there being nowhere to sit, but even that isn't a big deal since there is seating everywhere in the Cosmo.

I almost didn't find this place. After not eating for an entire day, I went out searching for this place that an "insider" told me about. The pizza was very good; sauce ratio was excellent! I am a fan. I think since it's Vegas, they could get away with giving you a good deal on a couple of slices and a drink. If I had a big crowd with me, we could have devoured a whole pie. Next time, next time Secret Pizza!

Would I come back? Drunk, sober or however you are feeling, pizza is always good. Tucked away on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel is Secret Pizza. There is no sign but you will just have to find it. It will all be worth it. 

The Sicilian white deep dish pizza is delicious. The crust even has flavor! It is loaded with white sauce, mushrooms, cheese, and more cheese on top. It will definitely punch your taste buds. The slice came out to be $8 but it was worth it. 

The mushroom pizza was just a regular pizza. It was packed with garlic flavor and super thin. That slice came out to be about $5. 

They heat up the pizza when you order it so it is nice and crispy when you eat it. Only downside is that there were mounds of oil on the pizza. I was not that sober to be health conscious so I was in heaven eating those two slices.

Oh hey, dream drunk food! This place is interesting, affordable, and delish. They have a set-up similiar to a food court pizza place, order by the slice and it's reheated as you order. Good pizza and awesome pickled peppers! If you're eating in house, I mean - if you can fit, you'll get free refills on non-alcoholic drinks.

Yum yum yum!! On third level and down the hidden hallway. Slices were awesome! NY style, nice & greasy but great. 

Get em!

Very pricey pizza, but when you're tipsy, tired, and hungry, it hits THE spot.

The place isn't so hidden anymore and can easily be spotted by the lines and crowds of people. It's located by STK and Scarpetta. The wait can be long especially late night after clubbing. However, it gets pretty empty during lunch hour.

There are a few stools along the walls of the restaurant, but don't expect to sit. It's not what you call a dine-in restaurant. Moreso a grab and go type of establishment.

The pizza is thin, crispy, and pretty good. At times the toppings slides right off which is a little irritating, but I always end up folding it in half anyhow.

Suggestion: supreme. And for some reason ordering a whole pie tastes a whole lot better than ordering just a slice. We ordered a whole pizza and a drink which ended up costing 50-something. With those prices, I'd expect amazing, but it was just good. That is why Secret Pizza gets 4 stars instead of 5.

Actually some pretty good pizza especially the white pizza because of the ricotta cheese. It is not that of a secret place because once you get to the floor, the hall is pretty noticeable. But when you do get there, it all just looks random. Great food especially if you have been drinking!

Secret Pizza is a lovely hidden gem on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan. There is no sign outside the restaurant so your best bet is to ask someone where you can find it. Once you see a hallway filled with pictures of album covers follow your nose straight ahead to the scent of the pizza! We went at 6pm on a Saturday night and this place was super busy. They have a very limited selection of pizza and beer including Bud Light on draft. Cheese pizza starts at $5 a slice and you can add more toppings if you wish. You can also order a whole pizza. They have a small standing bar area with two stools so there is not an adequate seating area to sit down and eat. Pizza is NY style with big, foldable slices. The crust is chewy and delicious. Give it a try!!

The definition of secret. It is hidden far down a random corridor in the Cosmopolitan and completely unmarked, so I can see how it is so easy to miss. What is the best way to find it? Track down the nearest person with a huge pizza box and ask them to direct you to the secret pizza parlor they just picked it up at. Trust me, it works wonders!

The full pies are expensive, but definitely more economical than paying per slice. Also, when you are craving that chewy, gooey goodness at 3AM and all the pizza delivery boys have been asleep since 2AM, paying close to $30 for a pie is definitely worth every penny.

It may be a bit of a wait (20-30 minutes) if you are custom ordering a pizza, but when you are stumbling back to your hotel room with that piping-hot fresh-out-of-the-oven pizza in your hands and everyone else is staring at you in jealousy, you won't even be mad.  

The retro decor is tacky, but we're just there for the pizza right?

If heaven was a pizza then this is it. It is hidden up in the corner of the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan. They have no signage, but just some awesome records that lead down to this pizza oasis.  I honestly wish I would have eaten here one more time before I left. 

They have pizza's that are premade and you can add your topping. I got the Sicilian pizza and added tomatoes and mushrooms to it. They had a white, pepperoni, and cheese option while I was there. I ended up just ordering one pizza and added the magical spices they had on the side. Thankfully someone I was with didn't eat their second slice of pepperoni with green peppers on it, so I got to eat that too. The crust is perfect - not too thin and not too bready. The cheese and sauce were just the right amount and all the toppings were so fresh. The crush was amazing though. I could have eaten that all day.

Stop by this amazing pizza joint when your in Vegas. It is a midnight snack, post drunk dream.

Amazing!  I love how you feel like you've found a hidden gem, not to mention the best pizza I've had.  We both had two pieces: cheese, mozzarella, veggie, and mushroom...all were great, but the cheese is my favorite.  They have the perfect amount of cheese sauce and the thin crust is phenomenal!  Not a lot of seating, but lucky for us we went for an early dinner (around 6:30pm) on a Saturday night so we sat next to the pinball machine.

First time experience and it was ~meh for me... 

I got to try their white & meat pizza slices... Pizza itself was pretty good but nothing extraordinary or amazing... Just good slice of pizza if you are hungry. 

There were a few factors that made my first time experience at Secret Pizza whatevers...
1) Hard to find! I know I know it's in the name... But when you are hungry and tired at 12am you just want to find the damn place for some food... Eventually figured out where it was after asking hotel staffs and asking random people where they got their piece of pizza. 
2) Long line! We waited 1.5hrs in line to get 1-2 slices of pizza. Um... the pizza was not worth that wait... esp at 12am when you're hungry. By the time we got our food and started eating it was 1:30am!!! 
3) Price! It's around $5\/slice of pizza... Just decent pizza... Not worth it! We can get a whole pan of pizza at Costco for ~$10...

My first time experience was definitely ~meh and I've experienced better... But I'm willing to try it again to give it a fair shot...

Gem's Secret!

For my 20th review, I'm going to share with you a golden gem secret...The best place to eat in The Cosmopolitan won't cost you all of your night's winnings, and you won't be ready to go buffet again right away! But it's whereabouts are incognito, so I will yelp you out & share the secret! After a long night of committing sins in Sin City, you must find & dine at the clandestine "Secret Pizza."

Secret Pizza is a hidden gem located in The Cosmopolitan Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas, NV.It's a tiny, gemazing pizza joint located on the 3rd floor of The Cosmo next to the Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar & Grill. You will see an unmarked hallway that's lined with cool, vintage record album covers that is across from the pool table located in the middle of the room, go down it & enter secret pizza paradise!

Secret Pizza sells a variety ofbomb, thin\/foldable, NY-style pizzas sold by the slice that are pre-made & they warm up for you in the oven. The price for 1 slice is around $5-6, more if you get a specialty slice or add extra toppings. (Secret Pizza also has a "deep-dish looking" pizza slice option, but I didn't try it. This isn't Chicago, stick with the original, thin slices!) You can also order & carry-out a whole pie or customize a cheese slice like I did. My fave was cheese with mushrooms, green peppers & banana peppers, 5 gems!!

When I stayed at The Cosmo, I ended every night\/began each morning at Secret Pizza or ate there after an expensive app at Milos! The pizzas are cut into big, triangular slices & have the perfect ratio of thinness while still having some girth; softness for folding with a nice, crispy crust; and contains the perfect amount of grease to equalize the night's BAC! Definitely not the kind of 'Za I typically consume but what happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas!

FYI: Secret Pizza also has a free, self-serve\/purified water tank, sells beer & has limited seating, only countertops & some barstools, no tables. However, you can sit & eat at the couches by the pool table I mentioned above.


So if you're stayin' or playin' in The Cosmo, win,lose or draw, you will definitely wanna make Secret Pizza your last call! Cuz one thing is for sure, you can bet your ass, ya will friggin' eat it all!

$6 a slice post-tax! But it was yummy. We ordered the sausage with ricotta and it really hit the spot. It's hard to get good thin NY style thin crust like that in California so I may be biased. But the price is steep! You're better off ordering a whole pizza if you want more than a couple slices.

I like the old school aesthetic with the pinball machine and arcade games and the staff is extremely friendly. Pizza is handmade and they reheat it in their furnace when you order. You can request your pizza to be extra crispy too. What I found disappointing was that none of the napkin holders on any of the counters were refilled; I had to go to the cashier to request some more. And the counters were really dirty too. Maybe that too is part of the aesthetic?

Anyway, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if you're in the area and craving some pie this isn't a bad option for a splurge, especially if it's late night (they're open until 4AM).

Love this Place. 

Always worth a Trip.
Amazing! The white pizza took my breath away. Great hidden location in the Cosmo Hotel. Everything is fresh and made right in front of you.

Get the white pizza!!!!! Ricotta and garlic.....NOM!!!
I love this place...great pitstop after a night of fun and dancing!!!

To save some money: order a whole pie....A Whole White is $24....otherwise, spend $5 plus on each slice..=P

My husband and I found this place on yelp and because of the rating And hours, we gave it a shot. Secret Pizza is the BEST pizza we have ever had and my husband is pretty much a pizza critic. So delicious and next time we get to come in town, we will be back!!
What a great place if you have the time to wait it well worth it. Top 10 pizza places I have ate anywhere. A hole pie takes about 30 min so get a pice of siclan!!!!!!
PBR on TAP I am down!!!  Pizza is good.  Just make sure you have it there the crust gets to soft when you get it to go.

Seriously... This place is awesome! Every time I am in Vegas I have to come here. I can't stay away! There are so many other good restaurants around here but I just can't help it. My husband and I were in Vegas for only 2 days and we came here TWICE! What the hell do you guys put in this pizza!?!?? Crack? 
Hell... It's even good the next day when it is cold. Stupid crack pizza.

BEST PIZZA EVER! My boyfriend and I landed Thursday night and just knew we had to go there after reading amazing reviews. Everyone is right, yummy, yummy, and yummy. The sicilian is the best. Sadly, the second time we went didnt have it. Will recommend this secret pizza shop to everyone that is headed to Vegas!

When I hear the word Marquee it automatically means PIZZA. Although I cant tell you how this place is like sober, I can 100% vouch for this place as one of the best places to eat after a night at marquee. There is no such thing as a slice. I must have the whole box. The only thing that sucks is the wait!
I love the hallway and the decor of this place. It's really easy to miss this place if you don't really look into the doorway. They have good pizza and it's located inside the Cosmo!

If there was half stars I would prefer to give this place 3 and a half total rating.

This place is no longer a secret. It hasn't been for a while. Over 2000 reviews, come on. This ain't a secret. 

Try to find it without reading, it will add to the lore of this place. BUT, if you need help..

HINT ONE, it's in COSMO.

The above is super vague, if you can find it with just knowing it's in COSMO, then hooray for you.

HINT TWO, it's on the 3RD FLOOR

Knowing it's in the 3rd floor should shorten your hunt.

HINT THREE, it's in the 3RD FLOOR OF THE EAST TOWER.

Ok, at this point, that is all you should know and try to find it yourself.

There really is no name for this place. It literally is a hole in the wall. You walk through this hallway with ambient light shining out, that you think is part of the establishment next to it (but it's not), and then at the end, you see a small space, with a few bar seats, some arcades, and a place to order your pizza. The paper menu you can grab, simply says "PIZZA" in the front. 

The price is a bit high for pizza IMO. You will be paying $5-6 a slice. $30+ for a whole pie. Some have said this is reasonably priced in Vegas? I disagree. There are many affordable places. 

With the pricing out of the way, the pizza is legit though. Thin crust, good sauce, cheese, and ingredients. It definitely tastes of a quality pizza. A pretty authentic New York style as some others have said. OH, I WASN'T DRUNK OR IN ANOTHER STATE OF MIND, so nothing was altering my taste. I bet this place has such a high review from people who came right after drinking and partying. Don't remember the price, and anything you eat is automatically great. lol

Like I said,  in the beginning. A solid 3 and a half stars. The pizza is legit good, but the price is a bit high, even for Vegas. I would go again, but I wouldn't go out of my way to do so. I recommend you try and find it yourself with little help, and experience it.

Keep in mind, there is no dining area to sit, etc. BUT, there are plenty of tables and seats right outside in the Cosmo to enjoy your pizza and people watch.

It is tasty, convenient, and open late.... awesome if staying at or near the cosmo. It isn't great, but it is pretty damn tasty and hits the spot. Sure it is pricey, but not a total rip off like some places on the strip.

Everytime we come to Vegas, we stop by to have a slice of their thin crust pizza.  The line can get pretty long at this place.  I love how they're open late so if you're drunk and craving pizza after the club, this is a good place to go to.  

TIP: If you're staying at the Cosmo, they can deliver to your room.

The secret pizza shop is worth the search. I would give directions but I don't like getting people lost.   3rd floor of the cosmopolitan shopping center, then ask another restaurant for directions. 
   Great old school NY pizza. Good prices, slices, great staff, nice variety. A great escape from the craziness of vegas, although I was there at 11 am on a Tuesday in December.

(THANK YOU YELP FOR INFORMING ME OF THIS HIDDEN TREASURE!!)

Contrary to the typical Strip places, this place is NOT pretentious and NOT overpriced. 

FYI, this place is located on the 3rd flow of the Cosmopolitan.  The entrance looks like a narrow hallway to the restrooms.  Its opening is adjacent to the pool table.  There is no sign.

This is the best pizza I have had outside of nyc.  Whatever this place is called, it has a loyal follower for life.

A Stop For Pizza Aficionados 

What a fun Vegas suprise.
We stumbled upon this little restaurant thanks to Yelp, in search of dinner.  You have to ask for directions being that there are no signs advertising the location. It's located down a hallway that is uniquely decorated. 

These pies have all the right ingredients, the crust was perfectly thin, the spice in the sauce was full of flavor and covered the pizza perfectly for both types of pizzas I tried two of the different types of pizza both wonderful! It was the white pizza ricotta and mozzarella and a deluxe pizza with all of the meats (pepperoni, sausage, green and red bell pepper with mushroom and olives. Both were absolutely delicious and satisfying.  

The beer selection was slim but tasty. I was very happy that they had Shock Top. 

I highly recommend anyone to stop at this place.

It took me forever to find this place! 3rd floor, by the glass elevators. There is a pool table outside.  It is down a little hallway, there is no sign. The pizza was pretty good, not the best ive had but good. Then again, I wasn't  drunk when I had it, but I would recommend checking it out for the fun of it. There really is not a place to sit inside so plan accordingly. It is like $30 for a whole pizza, I'm not sure who considers that cheap, it seems like full price to me.

Went here for lunch on New Year's Day and it was amazing! The guys who work at the counter were so friendly and provided exceptional service! For our friend he was given a small slice (which really wasn't that small), but the guy at the counter threw in a free extra slice without us even a asking! Wow! Not only that, but the guy also made sure to give me a perfect slice! Seriously, the pizza was delicious, but what really won us over was how friendly and awesome the crew are! They also found out it was my boyfriends birthday and they made sure to all wish him well and gave him a yummy dessert on the house! We will definitely be sure to make secret pizza a vegas tradition from now on!! Wonderful experience!!!

Great place!!! Will definitely come back!
A slice for around $5-$6 but huge and delicious, can't complain. 

The sausage and pepperoni is where it's at! The sausage is better than the average little pieces of sausage you'd find at other places. I've tried pin up pizza and this place I'd have to say, tops it in taste.


They offer parm, red pepper, and garlic at the table!

Horrible customer service stay away!!...I waited in line for an hour bcuz of the hype from my friends...got to the front only to be told that I wouldn't be served bcuz I cut in line...the same line I patiently waited in for an hour...when it was finally made clear by all around I had not cut in line did I receive an apology?...nothing close...instead the rude lady who had told me I cut in line then said "look do you want to get served or not or get out of line!"...with a few choice words I told her no and left...asked to speak to a manager outside...got the head chef who sided with all of her actions based on previous people who had cut in line...moral of the story...you are just 3 bucks for what looked like an average piece of pizza to this place...and they will treat you like trash with no apologies if they feel like it...stay away!!!

You need a NY slice, in Vegas, at 2 am? No problem, fuhgeddaboutit, these guys have you covered! Slices are big and relatively cheap for Vegas. Not really any place to sit, but you can stand at the counter and wolf down your slice - just don't forget to sprinkle it liberally with hot pepper and Parmesan first! That's the authentic experience.

$5 a slice is a bit much but it's Vegas and it's at the Cosmopolitan so it is sort of expected. Otherwise this place is awesome! I love how simple it is, yet unique at the same time due to it's obscure setting within such a lavish and artistic hotel. Our pizza was the perfect ending to our trip to Vegas after countless complex meals at the restaurants or buffets on the strip. The pinball machines were a huge bonus, a refreshing change to the slot machines downstairs that eat up your money with the push of a button.

If you go on the third floor in cosmopolitan and go down the red corridor you will find this gem.
Such great pizza, we literally stopped on the way home to buy a box to take home. The white sauce one and the all veggies one are the best .

Perfect little hole in the wall pizzeria tucked in a corridor on the third floor of Cosmo. Pizza was delicious, served quickly and they do such a brisk business here that everything is always fresh rightout of the oven. No seating in the pizzeria itself but there's plenty of comfortable hipster loungers and couches around the pool table directly outside the shop. Great little find.

Im from California and I've never been a fan of the thin pizzas. But after having a slice of this heavenly goodness, i am obsessed with thin pizza. It definitely isn't filling but it is a must try and quick meal to have before drinking or going out. Its big enough to enjoy but small enough to keep u from getting bloated
Finally a solid NY slice on the Strip. Hidden away next to the pool table but so worth the trip. Great white pizza too.

The secret is obviously out.   Based on the amount of people waiting in line.   The original idea was probably exciting but is now a let down.  However,  the pizza is worth the excursion to get there.

Super good after night after clubbing and drinking the night away. Went here for dinner one night and after clubbing at Marquee the next night. Really need to keep your eyes on point to find this place. There are no signs anywhere and you will walk past it - i walked past it 3 times looking for it. haha. Great pizza, takes only 15 minutes to order a whole pie. There are awesome couches in front of the place to sit down and eat. Overall - highly recommend especially when your looking for a place to eat that's cheap after a good night out.

What a cool concept! My cousin said that this place is a word of mouth joint where there is no name and the boxes are unmarked. It's hidden in a hallway!

There is a long wait for a freshly made pizza and there isn't a huge selection of toppings but it was yummy. It was about $25 for a pizza.

I like hide and seek and here is a place I think I could hide forever without being found AND they have pizza! Perfect! 

My girlfriends had never been in here before so I took them to the secret location and they were already in a trance by all the vintage album covers lining the wall. Once inside we discover we are the only girls so that always helps. 

The guys working behind the counter were down to earth and super sweet. I ordered the slice of white pizza and they put a cold tomato on it once it comes out of the oven. The pizza guy was real cool so I think the slice was around $3 and I tipped him $7. As I am approaching cougar age I find I tip younger guys more.....First sign of a cougar, maybe? Shhh. Let's not talk about it. 

Back to the pie. Hot damn that was good. I could have pounded down four more slices easily. The garlic, the cheese and the contrast of the cold tomato worked wonders in my mouth. I also tried a bite of the cheese slice with red sauce. Also dynamite. 

I'm hooked on this place. I have spent big bucks on a couple of  Cosmo's fine dining restaurants and I have to say the best meal I have had came from the secret pizza place.... I will be back. Oh yes, I will be back.

My cousin kept hyping up about this place since the day we arrived in Vegas. I really wanted to know what the secret was about this pizza!! 

Appearance:  Sadly (or maybe fortunately?), I was unable to experience the long line and see the place myself. My group went to the Marquee club before and we promised each other that we had to eat here afterwards. Two of my friends actually left the club early. By the time I left the club 40 minutes later to my hotel, I actually ran into her on the strip! It was such a weird experience since I left so much later than her! She told me she was waiting in line for the pizza the entire time, and the line was LONG. I guess the lesson learn is that this place gets hella crowded so expect a long wait. And maybe get a friend to get the pizza for you?? Just kidding. I really wish I was able to see the place. 

Food: SO EFFING GOOD. I tried the sausage and pepperoni pizza. At first, I was thinking that the pizza didn't look anything special. It just had sausage....and pepperoni...what's so great about it? But when I took a bite...idk if it was because I was slightly tipsy, tired, and hungry,  but whatever the case, this pizza hit the spot! The pizza had loads of sausage and pepperoni in every bite, and you are able to taste the cheese and the sauce. You know it's a good pizza if you can taste e very component! Even the crust was good! 

Overall, it was bomb. This was my first time in Vegas, and I was very lucky to try one of the famous foods of Vegas. I recommend going here if you love  pizza!!

Not so secret place anymore. Their pepperoni pizza is super salty and nothing too special. However, their white pizza is pretty awesome. If you like garlic, definitely a must.  Price: $5.50\/slice and $28\/whole pizza.... on the pricey side but it's a Vegas experience.

Food: Its pizza. Its great!
Price: $4.50\/slice + 50 cents per topping
Service: You seat yourself. 6 or 7 people can sit at the place. It's very casual. Open Seating. The guys taking the order were nice. 
Location: Its hidden, but its on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan at the end of the hallway opposite the pool table
We waited in line for close to 45 minutes because they only have one cashier! The pepperoni pizza was good and a decent size but it was not worth that long of a wait standing in line!

Not worth the wait. 

What is "Secret Pizza?" A wood-fired pizza shop on 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel with a never ending line. Is the pizza good? Sure, but you'll end up waiting more than 30 minutes for it, and by that time, it's not worth it. There is nothing mind blowing about Secret Pizza- not the food, customer service, or beer selection. After waiting in line over 35 minutes, someone who looked like a manager came out and just stood there watch all of us wait. He didn't offer to help. It was simple pizza at best- but at 2am & after waiting in line 30+ minutes, not worth it. Go across the st & find other immediate (& cheaper!) options at Planet Hollywood

Best pizza in Vegas? Please. Let's get a grip. I can't think of a serious sit-down Italian place good enough to survive on or off the Strip that doesn't have pizza at least this good. Do you know how many top-shelf Italian options there are here in Vegas? Five\/50 is better. Grimaldi's is better. Etc. Etc.

The whole "secret \/ speakeasy aspect" of this place is also overhyped - almost a nonstarter with the huge queue that can form and late night eaters \/ party peoples dashing in and out of the corridor. 

Now that being said, give credit where it's due. This place is authentic NY style in that there are 1,000 joints like this on the East Coast for a quick and greasy pair of slices to pre-empt the hangover or begin\/end a quick date that blossomed late night at one of the nearby drink and or dance establishments. 

And they are open late, which is awesome. 

But being in Vegas and coming here explicitly for incredible world class pizza is silly.

Traveling down a hallway between two fancy restaurants at Cosmopolitan, who would've known that a simple little pizzeria existed.  The pizza was perfect with a light crisp and the perfect amount of drizzly cheese.  The folks at Pizzeria were welcoming and genuinely happy to see you.  I loved that!

After living in Chicagoland for over 35 years, I can say this is some tasty pizza. I've been here several times after moving to Las Vegas and I can not stray away from the white pizza. Garlicky and cheesy goodness. 

Their pan pizza is mislabeled as Chicago deep dish. A big chunk of dough with cheese on top. At $8 a slice, it's a joke. I recommend buying two thin slices instead. 

Service is spotty, but what can you expect after serving hordes of drunk tourists for hours on end. A great late night snack on the Strip. Savor the flavor.

Well worth the wait.

A friend who visits Vegas and Secret Pizza enough led me through the Bellagio, the Mandalay Bay hotel, and we eventually came by the Cosmopolitan to find Secret Pizza. (Yes, my friend forgot where it was!) There's no signage or anything. The placement of the hallway leading into the restaurant looks like it could've led into an exit or restroom, but the walls are decorated with jazz and big band albums from the 50s-70s.
