Although, like several other people have said, it is not necessarily a secret due to its location being easily accessible, I love the fact there is no advertisement for it, and finding it is kind of an adventure on its own. Besides all this, the pizza is honestly some of the best I've tasted. It really feels like I'm eating some authentic New York style pizza. Lastly, I love that it is open until i believe 4am, that way after I am done going out with friends we can always catch a slice before we head home!

Wooooow i can't believe I've been out of the loop... no kidding this place is a secret... i guess it's part of the intrigue but really the pizza is AMAZING!  I had the white pizza... i love me some pizza but this was really good... I'm a bit upset now that i see this joint isn't so new... I've been robbed... i feel like I've lost some years to my life... ugh... well i guess better late than never... till we meet again secret pizza... i love you

Oh I love Secret Pizza, especially after a long night of dancing at Club Marquee. Ironic that the place is called Secret Pizza, because if the line at 3am is any indication, someone just told everyone about this place. Luckily, both times I went we beat the rush... or should I say set the trend (since a huge line formed right behind us both times hehe). I've had two types of pizza here the White Pizza and two item combo of Sausage and Pepperoni. The White Pizza is my fave, its toppped with ricotta and mozzarella cheese, and we usually add sausage to it. I like how there is absolutely no advertisement of the place on the Cosmopolitan website. But I guess they try to keep it a secret for those who have yet to find it. I have to admit, it was quite an accomplishment when we stumbled upon secret pizza.

The not-so-secret, Secret Pizza!  If you're a Vegas veteran, then you know that this place gets PACKED during the peak hours, aka after club hours. Secret Pizza is located on the 3rd level of Cosmopolitan and it's not hard to find since there always seems to be a line of people in a small hallway.

Honestly, I don't even know what slices I've tried but I've enjoyed them all.  I have yet to try their popular White Pizza, but they're all really good.  1 huge slice will cost you about $5-$6. Not too bad considering it is Vegas... and the pizza is actually good! Its always served piping hot and I love how the cheese is all melted and stringy with each bite.  Yum.  No complaints here!

I would say definitely hit this spot up if you're staying at the Cosmo of if you're leaving Marquee !

I didn't believe the yelp reviews about the white pizza, but they proved me wrong!  

Thin crust pizza, large slices, love this cheap and easy food in Vegas! 
Find the pool tables on the third level of the Cosmopolitan, find this hidden gem down a hallway of records. 

I love a simple pepperoni pizza, but why is this white pizza so addicting?! 
Don't let me hype it up... gotta try it for yourself!  Come here for just an appetizer before a fun night ahead!  Can't wait to come back and purchase a whole pie!

Soooo yummy! Long line to wait though and it's definitely secret! There are no signs. But it was worth the wait and when we carried it back to our hotel room we had so many people asking us for a slice and where we got it. Delicious!!

The secret pizza place officially without a name. 

Located on the 3rd level.  There isn't a sign, so look past the pool table.  This pizza joint is located down a long hallway lined with album covers.  You might be able to spot the "Vegas" pinball machine from outside.

It's a very small place.  Once inside, you will notice:
-A few stools and a small counter to sit at.  
-Pinball machine, and an arcade game.  
-Couple of pizza ovens.
-Pizza counter with pre-made pizzas, and a handful of toppings to choose from.
-Pizza artist and a cashier.
-Great pizza!

It's not a full dining establishment.  Pretty much order and go. You wouldn't expect much more from a place with $3 pizza slices in a multi-billion dollar resort. 

You can have extra toppings added for a small charge.  If you order a slice, it is tossed into the oven for a couple minutes and you are good to go.  Full pizza's start at $17.  Guest's of the hotel can place an order through room service. 

Feeling thirsty?  They have PBR  and Dogfish Ale on tap.  

The people who work here are great.  Real pizza artist's with personality.  

Check this place out!  It's convenient, inexpensive and open late night until after Marquee Nightclub closes.

The location is really a secret. I mean its inside the Cosmopolitan tucked away that we had to ask a few people to get there. But its gem of a place. The Ricotta and Mozzarella Pie with Jalapeo topping was too good. The guys working over there were very friendly.

We love this place.

When you get to the Cosmo, go up a floor, and start sniffing.  While this place has no signage, all you need to do is follow the great smell down the corridor lined with album covers. 

The slices are huge (I only get one; my husband gets two), and the staff is friendly and willing to cater to your requests.  Try this place at least once!

We've been coming here every year since it opened for a midnight snack and the pizzas have never disappointed. Get a cheesy-melt-in-your-mouth white pie and savor each bite. We prefer to get a whole pie for a fresh pizza oozing in cheesiness.

Amazing new york style pizza restaurant.  I have no idea why they hide this in a alley between the sushi and mexican restauarent

Great taste!

My friend told me about this great spot and I am SO glad she did!  It was the perfect cure in the afternoon for our hangover & we loved it so much so that we drunkenly returned that evening for a slice.  Worth the wait in line!  Total NY style pizza and super yummy!

For a group of 4 people (or 2 really hungry people), ordering a whole pie was the way to go. For 2 toppings of pepperoni and mushroom, the total came out to $24 for 8 slices. It's a relative bargain compared to ordering by the slice, which can be up to $5 depending on how many toppings you want. 

Everything was just as good as before, except for the soggy middle. Since a whole pizza was made fresh to order, all the cheese and grease gravitated towards the center. Plus all the cheese and toppings just slid right off the mushy crust. It probably could've used a few more minutes in the oven to develop a better crust in the middle. But it was still damn GOOD, and burned the top roof of my mouth way too many times.

If you order per slice, they'll throw it back in the oven to reheat, so you won't have the soggy-crust-in-the-middle problem. So it all depends on your preference. Personally, I like thin and crispy crust versus the soggy version. I've been here well over 6+ times, and it seems like the prices just keep creeping up. "Secret Pizza" isn't really so secret anymore.

A must try! Pizza by the slice and they serve my favorite.... cannolis! 

As you come up the third floor escalators of the Cosmopolitan, this great pizza place is located just a lil to the left just down the hallway of vintage records... the pizza is always good and the workers are very efficient and friendly!

I also love that the drinks are served in red solo cups!
The pizza is ok! Nothing to write home about tho and really pricey!! $5 for a slice of cheese!

My husband and I went here while we were in Vegas! I heard the lines were long but we got up and ordered in a matter of minutes. The pizza is New York style and they offer a variety of different types of slices. The pizza was excellent!!! I also ordered a "veggie salad" really good !!!!! Pizza was very good, only con is the prices on sodas and such, kind of ridiculous. Like buying a drink at Disneyland! $4.50 for a solo cup of Coke. Also there is no seating so be prepared to stand! Very good for a quick bite !

Yes, yes and yes. Go up to the 3rd floor and walk forward from the escalators. You'll see an unmarked hallway and then you'll smell pizza... So good. Both their new York style crust and Sicilian are great. The white pie has garlic and cheeses. Ricotta to be specific!! So good. You won't regret this nice little break from the craziness of Vegas!

The only thing I ever get and will get from Secret Pizza is their white pizza. I don't know what the hell is in it and quite frankly, I don't want to know. The mystery to it is probably what makes it so damn good. Find the little alleyway to pick up a slice or give them a call in advance to place an order on a pie. The wait is worth it, especially after a night out!

A MUST IN VEGAS. This place comes in CLUTCH at all hours of the day. 

I found out about this place through my friend when we were looking for a pre-clubbing-at-Marquee meal. It's pretty simple - there are meat and vegetarian options. No, it's not the best pizza in the world, but where else can you get a slice of pizza for ~$5 between the hours of 2 to 5 AM after a night out? Like I said - it comes in clutch at any time. Drunk or sober, Secret Pizza is awesome. The line can get pretty bad, but it moves pretty quickly. It's not really a sit-down place, so you order, pay, and wait for your pizza to warm up in the oven. 

Go to the 3rd floor of The Cosmopolitan and head towards the back. Once you see a walkway into the wall to the left of the elevator and in front of the pool tables, you have made it to Secret Pizza. 

Trust me - everyone needs to come here because it'll probably be the cheapest and most bang-for-your-buck meal in Vegas.
Can't go wrong with this place.  Besides the wait, I would come here everyday for my daily dose of pizza.  It's an attraction to "post club munchies" but it's worth it.

One of my friends mentioned she was craving pizza as we were leaving Marquee, and to that, my roommate whispered "secret pizza." To be honest, I thought she was just drunk until she took us upstairs to this place. 

It's literally a hole in the wall with cool old school decor. There's a small area with bar seating for maybe less than 10 people, so it's really a grab-n-go kind of place. I saw people ordering whole pizzas to take back to their hotel room.  

The pizza is about $5-6 a slice. I thought it was a little step at first, but the slices are HUGE, probably about double your normal pizza slice. I got a regular cheese pizza slice, and my friends got white pizza. It was SO FREAKIN GOOD... probably the BEST pizza I've ever had at 1AM, tired, and coming out of a night club. Only pitfall was that it was a little oily, but I mean, what pizza isn't? That's what makes it so bomb. I would have gotten more slices if I didn't care about fitting into my dress the next night. 

AND WHY AREN'T MORE PEOPLE MENTIONING THE GARLIC POWDER? Holy canoli, that stuff's basically crack. The first time around I thought I accidentally poured too much on my slice, but then I tried it and got hooked. It ain't no accident the second and third time I went in for the powder; I covered my whole slice in a thick layer of that stuff. 

Terrific pizza, not only for the drunk and hungry but ESPECIALLY if you're drunk and hungry. Listen to me and douse that pizza in garlic powder. You won't regret it.

Yeah... I'm not seeing it. I love the idea of a speakeasy pizaa joint, and I'd heard such great things... it was pizza. It wasn't bad pizza, but it wasn't amazing, either. Crust was good; cheese and toppings were OK, but a bit bland. For $5.50 a slice, I'd expect better. And they were large slices, but not *enormous* - I had a slice, and I'm still a bit hungry.  Great in the middle of the night, I suppose, if it's this or nothing, but I really wasn't that impressed.

Sigh.  Another overrated place in Vegas.  I am starting to sense a pattern.  The places with 500+ reviews usually are just places that drunk college aged kids go because they think it's cool.  Then they give it a good review on Yelp because everybody else says it's good.

Well, I am going to say that this place is not deserving of its reviews.

First off, the line is pretty long regardless of when you go.

Secondly, the pie itself... is average.  The crust is thin, which I love, but it doesnt have the crispiness that normal NY style pizzas have.

We ordered the mushroom and sausage pie for $35.  The toppings were average if not subpar.

I don't think I would go back because of the line.  Again, it's good, but nothing amazing.  And that wait just makes it not worth it.

Delicious.   Thin crust and tasty toppings.  Great prices.  Want to go back to try the white pizza next time.  I'm craving it right now!  Oh yeah - and I LOVE that its a "secret".  I've been telling everyone about the secret when I hear they are going to Vegas.

Every time someone mentions to me they are going to Vegas, I tell them they have to stop at secret pizza. One of my must stops in Vegas and the white slice is amazing. I love that is reasonably priced, large slices that come on paper plates and beer in a red solo cup. 
If you're looking for a quick bite, this plate is great. Only a few chairs at the counter but I kinda think if you know about this place you're not too concerned with sitting.

This place gets so much hype that now every single hotel I feel is building a pizza place to compete.  

The pizza here is good, is it worth waiting in line with a bunch of drunk people who take forever to order and are yelling?  That I'm not to sure about.  The slices are a very good size for the price, kinda greasy and there isn't much sauce which is a negative for me since I love sauce.  I can name a few places in town I'd rather get a slice at above Secret Pizza, however if I'm in the area, I'm not going to object (unless the line is out of control).

Best pizza in town no doubt and goes toe to toe with some of New York's finest. Closer to 4.5 but since the only other competition in Vegas is Settebello, Secret Pizza gets a full on five as far as Vegas goes. The prices are a bit steep but the pie here is solid. Depending on whether you're looking for a New York style pizza or some light true Italian flair (which in that case go to Settebello) you won't find much to gripe about here.
Really cool that you can find some reasonably priced pizza tucked into this massive hotel. When you just get tired of paying for expensive meals, this is a nice change. I think the secret is out.
The late night-earrly morning adventure was half the fun! Loved the hunt for the location and pizza was good

Took a while to find...everyone you ask just says "well if I tell you it wouldn't be a secret anymore..." Lol. It's down a small hallway..very small area. Not much space to sit down and eat so we took ours to go. The pizza is definitely nothing I'll crave when I'm back home. But I really did like the garlic pizza a lot.

Found" this place while on a late night mission to find this place. First off, this is not your typical Vegas spot to eat, you get your pizza on a paper plate and drinks in a red solo cup, it feels hearty and like your back at a college house party with the best f***ING pizza you've had sober or drunk. I went with the white pizza and I still have dreams about it. The bad part, all other pizza seems blah after eating from this place... not even sure what it's really called?!?

Awesome pizza! 

Nothing fancy about the place or the pizza. It's just made fresh and damn good! It's the perfect thing to eat after a night of partying.

My favorite part is the crispy crust! So good!

Restrooms: None! The place isn't big enough to have a restroom. Haha!
- Don't waste time reading my review, just go there

***be aware if your buying a whole pizza*** 
The pizza is not bad but is it worth the wait of 35 minutes for a whole one? That will be up to you

I was trying to find this place and had to read through reviews to find it near the elevator above Holsteins. 

It's pretty cool that there are no signs and it's pretty "secret".

Food wise, I got the slice of sausage and pepperoni and it was pretty solid. My girlfriend thought her pizza was too salty. Overall, I think it's a pretty good meal and would come back again sometime.

Secret Pizza is so much fun to take people to!  They do pizza exceptionally well...nice crispy bottom, chewy crust, great sauce.  It is not my all-time-favorite or anything, but on taste alone I'd hand out 4.5 stars.  

Any two of the following puts it in a unique place that is well deserved of 5 stars for me:  It is called Secret Pizza for a reason, there are no signs; it is not located on the restaurant listing for the Cosmopolitan. Walking down the hall to a hidden gem is half the fun!  Then there is the fact that you can get a quality IPA on tap.  The wall of records is is incredibly cool, and the black & white tile fits so perfectly.

Pizza + secret + atmosphere + IPA = an easy 5 stars in my book.  I will take out-of-town friends here anytime, but i'd also stop in for a slice if I was anywhere near the cosmo!

SO GOOD after a night of drinking... Or anytime!! It's a little pricey but it's definitely worth it! The white pizza is so good!! There aren't any toppings on it but the sauce is so good and creamy!! The combo pizza is also really good! Has olives, pepperoni, sausage, onions, etc. You can get it by the slice or a whole pizza(to enjoy with your friends in the hotel room)! Sometimes the line can get long but you should wait!! You won't be disappointed.

Great pizza at The Cosmo!  It's on the third floor, around the corner from Holstein's... in sort of a hidden alleyway.  It's not so "secret" anymore because it seems like everyone knows about this place now.

I tried the white pizza, pepperoni, and the sausage\/banana pepper pizzas.  My favorite was definitely the white pizza.  Who can resist white sauce, ricotta cheese, and GARLIC on pizza?  It was also the one that was the least soggy and held up the best.  I love myself a thin-crust, firm NY-style pizza.  At $5 it's really pricey for just a slice of pizza though.

I will be back (again and again and again!).

Less than $10 for lunch in Vegas? Check.

Giant slice of New York style pizza? Check.

Pinball machine? Check.

Humorous cashier? Check.

One combo sliced pizza (sausage and pepperoni pizza, $6 - tax included): A bit greasy, but it was pretty good.

Excellent place for a quick and cheap (relative to other eateries on the Strip) lunch \/ dinner. Good luck on finding the "Secret" Pizza. 

Can't find or just too lazy to locate the pizza place? Get to 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan via escalator and you should see a hallway to the left of Jaleo and to the right of Blue Ribbon Sushi Bar and Grill.
Awesome service and tasty pizza! Wanted to try their white pizza but will save it for next time

You know a place is good if there is ALWAYS a line!! Haha  went there last night. We just got pepperoni pizza and it definitely hit the spot. 
I don't know if I agree with the pricing structure tho... Each slice is 5 bucks (okay, fine, we r on the strip) but if u want to order a full pizza (8 slices), you have to wait an additional 30-45 minutes (after already waiting in line). OR you can get 8 slices in one large pizza box, each slice for 5 bucks, right then. They charge you less if you wait the additional time, so I guess some people don't mind. But perhaps they should form a separate line for those who want a full pizza?

This was probably one of my favorite places to eat while in Vegas. The price was awesome for 1 slice of pizza. I absolutely fell in love with the Meatball and Ricotta pizza. Got it 3 separate times!! The line may look long, but it's well worth it and they put your ordered slices back into the oven to make it a fresh delicious slice. Definitely a must if in\/near the Cosmopolitan. 

Location: 3rd floor down the long hallway. There's no sign (hence: Secret) but have fun hunting! You won't regret it.

It's just so damn good!!! This is a must pit stop every time I go to Vegas. 
So necessary!!!

Its pretty decent, most the time.

Although it can be pricy, but hey its the cheepest option around, loosing stars for a non consistant menu as well.

Overall I will be back!

Late-nite munchies? Need some grub at 4 am to avoid a typical Vegas hangover? Look no further. This "not so secret" NY style pizzeria is located on the third floor of  Cosmopolitan down the narrow hallway by the pool tables.  The pizza is amazing, especially the white pizza and whatever sausage special they have. Prices are fair at about $4\/slice.  Go ahead and order 2 slices from the get go, you won't regret it.  They try to move the line along as quickly as possible. It's probably worth leaving the clubs a little early to beat the rush.  The pizza was so good, that we actually ended up there 2 nights in a row.  First night, we got the pizza to go and took it to our room.  My advice would be to just eat it there while it's hot and fresh.  They also serve a couple beers on tap, in case you didn't have enough vodka red-bulls at the club.  This is probably the best late night snack in Vegas.

This is my favorite place in Cosmopolitan. The white pizza is amazing and the PBR is affordable, especially given the touristy location. There are not signs indicating a pizzeria is even there, so when you do find the place it makes you feel like you discovered one of Las Vegas's hidden treasures. 

You can't beat unbelievable value coupled with great tasting food.
The pizza was very good , I think it was one the best pizza I've had. I'm from Los Angeles and there are some good pizza places out there but this one top them all.

I have been coming here for years... And finally reviewing it. 

I strongly suggest you try this pizza, try to do it during the day so you don't have to wait in the crazy line after the club. Also, it's going to be expensive--- it's Vegas, duh. 

Have the white pizza, but the pepperoni and the sausage pizza are good too.

This place was so worth the hype. 3am after hitting up the clubs, we found ourselves in desperate need of sustenance. Fortunately for us the line wasn't too bad but we ordered 2 full pies so it obviously was going to take a while. Two pies was something like $56. A little crazy but it's Vegas. We ordered a plain and a pepperoni. The plain was the best. I'm from jersey and this pizza definitely hit the mark. It's not such a secret anymore but totally worth any type of wait.

Amazing pizza! We went there several times during our trip, and every slice we had was awesome. I recommend to get whichever a slice of whatever is fresh out of their oven-- it makes it WAY better. There is usually a long line all the time, but it goes very quickly. Tables around the entire floor where you can enjoy the slice or the entire pizza.

If we are going to have a secret project called "Elrond", then I want my code name to be "Glorfindel". -- The Martian (2015)

When you need eats and it's late and you may have had too much to drink (it's Vegas, people)... Secret Pizza is the way to go! Tucked away in the Cosmo, you have to want it. Sniff your way there like a detective and you will find it. Hint: It's on the third floor down a long hallway decorated with albums covers. Depending on when you go, there may actually be a line, but I've been lucky to show up and there are only a couple of people inside.

Hot, cheesy, a bit greasy - big slices that are trying to be NY style. They have white pizza, margherita, pepperoni, mushroom, sausage... honestly, I feel like they make whatever they feel like. The place is small, but it's supposed to be a secret, right? The've got some stools and a long counter where you can plotz to eat. They keep it coming because they know there are tired, hungry, drunk people all around Vegas dying for some food at all hours.  

The pizza is not the best pizza you will ever eat in your life, however it is delicious and fills a need. It is reasonably priced (especially considering what you will pay for the rest of your meals while in Vegas). Hot pizza at 3am - yes, please.

Stayed at The Cosmopolitan this past week and amidst all of the fine dining options sits Secret Pizza. I had asked someone that worked at the casino where a good late breakfast early lunch option was, quick. He told me where to find this treasure because you really do need a map to find it. It is down a tempting long hallway where the smell of NY style pizza lures you into its grip. It has about 10-12 stools with a Galaga game and an old-school pizza oven. Pizza is available by the slice and it is really good. Being from Boston, I like thin, thin crust that bends when you pick it up. This pizza did not disappoint.

Pizza is average but definitely overhyped. Perfect place if your drunk and looking for a convenient place to get some food. Will not being going back EVER AGAIN. Pizza is greasy and the crust flavorless. For how nice of a casino the Cosmopolitan is this place does not deserve to be in it.  Oh and btw the only secret about this pizza is that it's worse than you expect.

This is the best kept secret, that's not really a secret, in Vegas. It might be more appropriate to call it the pizza place with no name, because the secret is not one anymore.

It is kind of hidden, but everyone knows about it. I am from NYC, so I consider myself a good judge of pizza. I have been to some of the best spots in NYC too. I never thought I would find a place in the states, outside of NYC, that I would put in my top 10. This place just cracked my list.

It was so good. The crust, sauce, and mozzarella were all perfect. For pizza lovers, this is a must stop while in Vegas.

Third floor of the Cosmo. Across from the pool table you'll see a discreet hallway. If you peer through the hallway and see a red pinball machine, you've found yourself some bomb ass pizza.

Don't worry about the toppings, it's not about the toppings here. It's about the crust and the sauce, both of which this little pizzeria knocks out of the park.

The sauce on this pizza is perfectly seasoned, and there's just the right amount. But the best part is the hand-tossed crust. People usually like thin crust because it's crispy. People usually like pan crust because it's doughy. THIS crust manages to be crispy AND doughy. We figured that one large (10 slices) was enough to feed 5 of us (3 girls, 2 guys), but this pizza was so good that we had to order another large to go.

The prices here are a bit steep ($4 for a 2-topping slice, $22 for a 3-topping large), but the premium price will definitely get you some premium pie.
Straight up, the best pizza ever. I didn't care for the generic stuff, but the meatball pizza was phenomenal! We went back twice. So good. Too good.

I'm a sucker for delicious pizza by the slice! This place is so fun, from discovering it down the unmarked hallway (3rd floor) to the fun decor in the small space. It really captures the pizza by the slice experience of other great cities! The hallway is lined in album covers, many of which are signed. It opens up a little bit into the shop that has counters along the walls and a pin ball machine. 
Pizza: they have NY style or Sicilian. I have always gone for classic NY. Pies are out on display and cost around $4-5 per slice. Once you select, they toss it in the oven to heat and crisp it then serve it on lined paper plates. Beer is on tap as well as sodas and water. It's no secret how delicious this pizza is!
This pizza is the best pizza ever ! Pricing is good, and so worth the wait even if it's an hour. If you're in Vegas at Marquee you have to go !

Great pizza being sold here. The pizza is thin crust and they have 4 or 5 tasty options. The only downside is that it only has two seats and you are pretty much on your own beyond those two seats.  The service was pretty good, no complaints there.

HELLOOOOO hung over food...vhere hve uuu beeeeen?? http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=18_2XSMyx0Lwl2RWNkLMpg

T.H.E. place to drag your post Marquee, hung over, puked out, makeup-less ass to stuff face....if you don't mind the walk of shame, that is.  Of course there are plenty of normal ppl (Meee) lining up for the delicious NY style pizza by the slice or box. http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/iCQpiavjjPzJ5_3gPD5Ebg?select=4NbyT2TlL2PdMyrG-0BLLA

$5 per slice or $22 per box, this baby is like the 2am diiiirty hot dog on Hollywood Blvd but better. http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/hollywood-blvd-hotdog-vendor-hollywood#hrid:HID2ZLJ9bBGibM5yP-NX3g Don't mind the wait, chat up the stranger standing in front of you or behind you and dont' judge if someone suddenly made a mad dash out to the restroom (comes standard when you are waiting with a bunch of equally boozed out crowd).

I'm actually craving for a slice right now...mmmm....pizzzaaaaa

I'm not sure why this place gets so many good reviews because they're pizzas are just Meh... Its just overly hyped up because its the "secret" pizza joint at the Cosmo and everyone gets so excited over it because now they get to go treasure hunting. But in the end you find out its not really a "secret" due to the long freakishly slow line and the pizzas don't taste like something I would treasure. 

I've had it three times already in three different occasions because we were staying at the Cosmo and it was late and we were hungry and I was not about to be on hold for 40 mins to order room service (I don't want to get into that cause that deserves whole another review all on its own). On all three occasions I was hungry and pretty inebriated and not once did I think it was best pizza I've ever tasted in my life. Cause everything taste pretty good when your drunk right? Not really... I just ate it and thought to myself "Okay, I'm hungry, and this will do". 

Just for the hell of it I will give it an extra star instead of one for being there for me when I needed to satisfy my late night hunger. But really guys and dolls, I promise it wont be the most exquisite pizza you've ever had. The end.
A little hard to find but definitely worth it. The white cheese was awesome! One of the best pizza ive had in vegas.

Best pizza in the world! 
...If you come here drunk and starving after partying all night at 3:00 am in the morning when everything else is closed and spend less than 10 dollars for a slice of pizza and a soda on the strip.
 My problem was that I was here around lunch time, no alcohol in my system but maybe some caffeine and I wasn't starving. I just wanted to try the pizza everyone else was raving about. 
 The place is very nice and clean, it wasn't busy at the time so I can't tell how log the pizza was sitting out there. I ordered a slice of the white pizza and the guy took the slice and put it in the oven to warm it up. The pizza came out good, the bread was a little too toasted almost like a cracker and the topping wasn't bad but a little bit too garlicky for my taste, it kept coming back, everything I ate after that had a garlic taste all through the day and conversations were kept short.
Although the pizza was good, that "special pizza" everyone talks about was not delivered, I can assure you that there are a lot of better pizza places in town. So here's "the secret"......the five star pizza that they serve here is actually a three star pizza. 
Now you know, and for the very first time I'll agree....the book is better.

I'm not really a huge fan of pizza. It's not the first thing I crave when I'm hungry. If it's not the Super Bowl, it's rare for me to have it. BUT, I had to try Secret Pizza since the Yelp reviews and my friends said so. After checking it out, this hidden spot at the Cosmo is the bomb-- BEST PIZZA I'VE EVER HAD!

If it's your first time, try the Great White. SOO GOOD! Secret Pizza's thin slice New York style pizzas use fresh ingredients and are made to order. And it's cheap for those of you who ball on a budget.

Secret Pizza's location is actually a secret for those of you first timers. The Cosmo don't have signs that will lead you to it. But all you need to do is go up to the 4th floor and go down a hallway that you can't miss. It's easy access for those leaving Marquee day\/night club.

So definitely check it out. Secret Pizza set the new standard for me.

Theres 4 of my yelp friends im their biggest fan for having such a good taste in food and knowing the good spots one of them its my dear friend Dora B .

We came to Secret pizza a few months ago so hard to find and i was in the mood to eat pizza that doesnt happen just like that if you know me you know i take care of myself :D but when i eat bad watch out .

This past months ive been having problems with some allergies reactions so when i told that to the crew of Secret pizza they inmediately contAct the person who knew more about the ingredients , i was blown away with such an amazing service i wish i could remember their names but this people work so hard to make you happy .

We shared like 4 or 5 slices and wishing i could remember the names of them but each one was great . Loveee going to restaurants with variety thats what Yelp its for :D

The white pizza here was sooo good! Not sure if it was because it was very early in the morning and i was a little sleepy (wink) but i will be back for sure....LOL! 

NOTE: NO RANCH

Highly overrated unless you are drunk individual with no life experience. Bad service and the pizza isn't as good as most people describe. Look at the people reviewing this place and when they are rating. Typically late at night after drinking the night away at Marquee since it's practically next door. Don't believe the New Pizza hype for this place cause if you have had real NY pizza IN NY then You'll understand

Pizza was delicious. Location of the unnamed pizza place was in the food and restaurant area of the cosmopolitan. The wait was about 40 mins on a Friday night but very much worth it. We got a cheese slice $5, two mushroom slices $5.5 each and a white slice $6. Everything was hot and crisp to perfection. Take it from a New Yorker and Chicagoan that this is good pizza. Great job guys will be coming back!

Hard to find but so worth the search.  Fantastic pizza, awesome customer service.  Only a couple bar stools so you'll eat standing or have to take it outside to sit somewhere in the casino.  The pizza is so good I don't even think about the fact I'm standing to eat it.

Great NY pizza! Reminds me of Ray's Pizza in NYC!  If you're tired of buffets and very rich food in Las Vegas, then definitely come find this little gem at The Cosmopolitan Hotel! It is well worth waiting for a fresh slice of pie straight out of the oven!

Love this place! If you can find it, you won't be disappointed. When staying at Cosmo we usually call and order ahead, because one piece won't be enough. 

We've been called in a larger pizza to take home and finish half of it while driving. Love the pizza! Perfect for after a day at the pool or a night after the club. YUM!!
I had a slice of the mushroom pizza.  Was just okay.  A bit pricey.  I've had better.

Good pizza place on the strip.  Prices are a little high, but you are inside Cosmo, so you should expect that ;)

Pizza is already made...but they toss it back into the oven when you order a slice.  I go with the white sauce, and add pepperoni or other mix into the equation.  I've tried the red sauce, but since white is so much better to me, I usually go with what I know lol.

No where really to sit when it is busy, and the line can get pretty crazy at times, but if you don't mind waiting a little while and standing while you eat, this is a decent slice of pizza.

Try it out :)

This pizza was amazing. 
I ordered it for room service last year when I was on a trip and didn't realize it was such a big deal. 

The pizza tastes great. It's even more exciting because it's a "secret". Must try!

I LOVE pizza, so when I heard that there was a "secret" pizza place at the Cosmopolitan- I had to try it.  Of course, it isn't so secret anymore, but it is hidden.  I knew what I was looking for, but still walked right past the hallway leading to the deliciousness. 

There is no menu, no prices listed.  You just look at the topping selection and create your pizza pie, or order by the slice from the selection laid out.  We ordered a whole pizza (half white with an amazing garlic spread and the other half  was pepperoni, mushroom, onion, and bell peppers).  We waited a while for it because there seemed to be only 1 worker at the time who was assisting other patrons at the same time he was building our pizza.  But, that was OK, because there was a pinball machine to keep me entertained while I waited.  And it was well worth the wait. It totally hit the spot.
Small joint in the Cosmo But.... Staff was so friendly. Pizza was good. Very good. I recommend this joint for a good piece of pizza. Lines are long after 5.  Shhhhhh. Its a secret

Much ado about nothing.

The pizza was thin and a little greasy.  
The taste wasn't unique.
Not saying this was bad, just average.
We visited this place based on the recommendation
of the person who checked us into the hotel.

This place is not worth visiting.
It might be "secret" pizza, but it's not great pizza.

Not really hard to find but you can't see it from outside and wouldn't notice normally.  3rd floor in the hallway playing loud music behind the pool table.  

It really is very simple.  Stools and bar counters, 3 pinball machines, no name, small menu on the wall with the moveable letters. Paper plates, red solo cups, pick your slice and they heat it up.  

When I was there they had plain, pepperoni, white, veggie, and sausage and peppers.  They also have PBR on tap and some IPA, and a few cans of other beers.  Red and white wines in boxes, and soda, of course.

Pizza wasn't overly warm and nothing amazing, but decent.  I don't know that I'd seek it out again, but if you are the curious type like me, check it out sometime!

I don't care how good yelpers think this pizza is.
As long as they have those dehumanizingly long lines to get food, they are odorus cow-dung to me.

If I had this business, I'd realize that the demand outstrips the supply, and following basic economics 101, (which obviously the owner did not take in college, if he even WENT to college), would lead me to open a second restaurant, somewhere else, to take care of the overflow.

Man, I hate stupidity!

This psuedo-hidden pizza joint is just one of the many reasons to LOVE The Cosmopolitan. Secret Pizza serves legit New York-style pies of all varieties, and their hours are every bit as legit as their pizza (open 'til 5am). It's the perfect compliment to a long night out - you'll impress the your friends with your secret-hidden-spot knowledge, and soak up the Vegas booze while you're at it!

The beer selection could be a bit better, with only two varieties on draft (Bud Light and Blue Moon when I was there), but that's being picky, isn't it?

Not much more I can say that hasn't already been said, except: GO HERE!  :)

Places like this are why I love Yelp.  Would never have known to look for it otherwise.  Cool little hole in the wall (literally).  We had a basic half cheese half pepperoni.  Took a while to make from scratch but it was worth it.  Nothing extremely different about it, but it was one of those very well executed thin crust pizza's that I love. On par with some of the best I've had.  

Not a lot of room to sit, so plan to grab a spot in the nearby lounge.

Aaaaah voil une adresse qu'elle est bonne sur le Strip de Las Vegas ! Une pizzeria comme  New York (en tout cas dans mon esprit) qui vous sert d'normes parts de pizza que vous mangez debout dans un coin ou perch sur une chaise haute. Vous regardez les pizzas, vous choisissez la part qui vous plait parmi 5\/6 slections, tout btement. 

L'endroit n'a rien de trs excitant mais c'est justement a qui fait son charme ! Parts de pizza normes  5 dollars (ok, un peu cher, mais c'est le Strip) et dlicieuses ! Staff serviable et souriant en prime.

En plus l'endroit est faussement secret, situ au bout d'un couloir au milieu du Cosmopolitan, ce qui veut dire que si vous avez de la chance, les hordes de touristes enivrs du Strip n'arriveront pas jusque l, yeah !

I always order two slices here even if I'm not hungry because it's that good! The crust is usually perfectly crispy and tasty. This last time I had the pizza with tomatoes and green peppers and it was the absolute best! The tomatoes were so flavorful. The second slice was the basic Pepperoni. What I've noticed about this place is their pizza is not always consistent. The second slice wasn't as WOW and the crust wasn't as crispy. Had this been the first visit and I ordered the Pepperoni, I would not have been impressed. One less star for lack of consistency.

Not the best but not the worst. Worth a try but make sure you get the slices fresh out of the oven. I'm a fan of the white style pizza; and this one is one of the best to try. I was fortunate that as soon as I got to the counter to order a whole fresh pizza just had come out of the oven. Although my fiance' was not so fortunate. The slices he chose to try looked liked they had been sitting there from the night before and then reheated for a short amount of time. I tried a bite from his slices but didn't even compare to the fresh slice I had. Slices are a hit or miss. Will come back if lines are shorter and to order a fresh whole pizza.

Don't  let people's reviews saying it ok or it's too pricey or gimmicky fool you. I was recommended this place by a chef who knows good food. Hands down the best pizza I have ever tasted. So good I went two days on a row and will go back. I've never been a fan of thin crust till now. The pizza has three cheeses giving it the right consistency and cheesy flavor. The cheeses are probably mozzarella, Parmesan and a softer cheese I could not figure out.They also drizzle a garlicky buttery dressing. The pepperoni does not taste average, you can taste the spices. The best part is the Italian sausage its sliced and the edges come out of the oven crispy on the edges. The crust is baked perfect crispy on the bottom not burnt raw or chewy.  It's not over hyped or over priced. Good quality ingredients attention to the small details is what counts. You get what you pay for and this is a bargain if you consider a flight to New York City just for pizza. Pizza Heaven for sure.
Amazing pizza. Some of the best crust. Reminds me of NYC style. Great energy and culture. Literally a hole in the wall!!

I had high expectations when I came here. I think this place is popular because it has no name and just known as secret pizza. The pizza is ok. Hardly any seating. It kind felt like I was getting pizza at the mall. The staff was friendly and it wasn't too expensive.

Pizza was ok to me.  But then again pizza is one of my favorite foods and I feel like you almost can't go wrong with it no matter where you get yours from.  My dining companion though wasn't impressed and went so far as to compare it to cafeteria pizza.  While I wasn't totally blown away I would have to disagree with that and I definitely think it's better than mall pizza like Sbarro's.  We paid $28 for four slices (two with sausage and mushroom, one white pizza, and one pepperoni and mushroom pizza) and two bottles of water.  Customer service was terrible and the place was super packed and cramped so I couldn't wait to get out of there.  Glad to say I can try it but I'm ready to try other pizza places like the Grimaldi's that are going to be opening on the Strip.
Great pizza found late at night. After a week of too much pizza this was the one I enjoyed the most. Highly recommended, it is of the slightly greasy New York style pizza. Exceptionally tasty.
This is a hidden place without a sign which adds a mystery to it which it true to its name. Pizza is wonderful. It is not fancy but good midnight spot.

I heard about this place after going to Battlefield Vegas! The guy told us about this 'Secret pizza' place and my husband and I had to find it. The only clue he gave us was this was located on the same floor as the pool table, which was perfect since this place is right there. It also helps that the people at the hotel will tell you as well. 

Anyways, it's really small place, sort of reminds me of places in NYC....each slice is $5, which is the only downside since I can get the same kinda pizza and same good taste for $1 in the city...but I'm in Vegas!

Pizzas here are all made fresh and the cheese melts right off. The slices aren't too thin and they're not too thick. Perfect for a good night after drinking! 

Definitely check this place out if you're a pizza lover!
30-something dollars for a pizza that is so heavy I feel sick after one slice? No thank you. Wayyyyyyy overrated. Also don't expect to find any place to sit.

Love, love this place! It is hidden, hence the name "secret". It is on the 3rd floor of The Cosmopolitan hotel, just to the right of Jaleo. Their pizza crust was sooo good and very cheesy. It is greasy but that just makes it that much better 

There are no seats available but maybe 2 stools and just a bar type table to stand and eat, which isn't very ideal when you've been walking the whole strip.

I've been wanting to try the pizza from here for the longest time but we don't come to the Cosmopolitan too often. On this particular night, we had time to spare so we decided to stop in for a slice. My boyfriend and I both got a slice of their veggie pizza and I thought it was ok. I honestly thought it was a little too thin and I'm a fan of thin crusted pizza. There was no line when we were there so we ordered, paid, ate our pizzas and were out of there in less than seven minutes. The place is very small so I can only imagine how crowded it can get on a busy night.
So good!! Be prepared to wait up to 45 min on the busy nights though!  Well worth the wait as its the best pizza on the Strip in my opinion!

Two coolest things about this place are actually finding it (and thinking other people don't know about it), and decent cheap pizza. Wouldn't say it was spectacular, but the staff was super friendly and the meal served its purpose.

It took me awhile to find this place.  People have all told me that it is located on the 3rd floor of the Cosmopolitan hotel so my husband and I Wonder around there (which was not many eateries) walking pass this long narrow hallway several times where it was located. He even thought I was pulling his leg dragging him to find it.  There is no sign anywhere and no one would ever think there was even a pizza place there unless you have known about it. My husband and I each ordered a slice (one mushroom and one pepperoni with sausage and mushroom.  The cheese melts in your mouth with a crispy crust.  The pizza is really good!  We paid about 12.00 in total.  We saw many people ordering the entire pie.  It there wasn't 50 ppl that came in after us, I would have went back to get another. Lucky for us, when we got on, there was only five people in line and then everyone came in after us
I LOVE SECRET PIZZA. Tip: it's located in the Cosmo. However, do note that it's not nearly as appetizing hung over.
This place is awesome, I love the wall covers, all very interesting and super old nostalgic covers.

While running around the Cosmo you will find tons of big named restaurants, but nothing quite beats it like a small hidden pizza shop. Its quite easy to find if you look at the photos and is definitely a great place to stop by for the night to grab some quick food. The pizza slices are big! I got the supreme pizza and a shock top beer on tap. Staff is also super friendly. Will definitely be making a trip back next time I'm in Vegas!
Standing here waiting for my white slice to cool is pure agony! This is truly the best pizza ever! The guys behind the counter, especially Ray, are amazing so don't forget the tip!

Uh...wow
 Totally unexpected and totally amazing. If better pizza exists on the strip, I would pay double. A 16 piece pie for 20 bucks and 3 toppings that tastes like heaven on a crust...again...again no Brainerd. Run to the cubby hole of a joint...trust me.

On my most recent trip to the Cosmopolitan (which was for a work conference) I had a free night for dinner and was totally on my own so I decided to grab some pizza and a beer for dinner. After a little wandering around I managed to find Secret Pizza's location. It was somewhat of a let down because I didn't really care for their pizza or beer selection. I guess I am not hipster enough for cheap beer in plastic cup. I don't remember exactly what the choices were but it was the mass produced watered down stuff like Bud, Miller, Coors, etc. The pizza itself was pretty greasy and tasted like most (if not all) of the ingredients had come out of a jar or can. Don't get me wrong, it probably would hit the spot after a night clubbing but for a dinner after a long work day it was a big disappointment. On top of that there is not much seating and there were some very loud children playing with the arcade games that are in there. I ended up taking my pizza and plastic cup back to my room and leaving half a slice in the mini fridge when I checked out the next day.

Came here at 4:35 AM and the guys at the front won't let us in . He Told us that they are closed.  On Yelp it states that they are closed at 5 . He said that they are not affiliated with yelp . I guess they won't care about this review either then . Maybe they have too much business and do not want anymore . Been here over 10 times and this will be he last time .

Had I not known about this place from friends, and had it not smelled so damn good, I would have walked by this place a million times while I was in the Cosmopolitan. 

This place, late night, is really a go to for Vegas. The pizza is really, really good. We ordered a whole pizza to go with veggies, the cheese is good, is not overly nauseating, and didn't leave me feeling overly disgusting.

Hidden in an alleyway in the Cosmopolitan is a tiny pizza kitchen that serves delicious New York Style Pizza. Part of what makes it so cool is discovering it, the other part is the damn good pizza. It's very high quality- the crust is thin and delightful and the cheese has the perfect oozey-ness that makes it delicious. A large pie with 6 slices will run $30- and each topping is $5. Good deal for Vegas if you split with friends or just buy your own slice!

All my friends know, after a long night out my first instinct is to go home and go to sleep. After hanging out at the Chandelier bar, my friend took me to the Secret Pizza next to Marquee. We were there slightly before the drunken crowd was about to get out, so we didn't have a long line. But it was pretty awesome going down dark hallway and seeing a tiny pizza kitchen! They really have a great business going on, they make the pizza's pretty fast and knowing their main clientele will be hungry drunks, they charge $4 for a slice! Not going to lie drunk or sober, it's pretty delicious. The New York style thin curst cheese pizza was worth it! I don't like eating after a certain time but the pizza hit the spot! Definitely going back to this place.

Not that secret, which is good because my hungover body desperately needed pizza and liquids--

Like, for how things go in Vegas, good value. Should have more places like it and fewer like FIRST at the Venetian

They raised prices since opening which is disappointing.  They are at $5 a slice now :( I think I would rather just eat earl of sandwhich across the street.  Also you pretty much have to get a slice that they have premade.  You cant really choose your toppings unless you order an entire pie.

Order a whole pie over the phone and pick it up.  it is the best deal.  TIP: Call a couple hours in advance cause they get super busy!!

Pepperoni pizza is hella greasy!

The secret may be out but this location really is hidden and you might need a sherpa guide to find it. Head down the hall full of famous Italians once you get to the third floor and you're on the right track. Once you finally find it, the pizza is quite tasty (my NY born and raised wife approved) and even better after all the effort you made to find it. There wasn't a line on a late night visit during the week and I was able to play a game of pinball while I waited.

Excellent pizza and worth the effort for a quick bite on the strip.

Authentic east coast style pizza joint? In Vegas? At the Cosmo? Open 24\/7? Only 4 bucks? HOLY CRAP

This is an amazing place on the strip.  The pizza (I have been here about 4 times) is always good with a perfect blend of cheese, delicious sauce, fresh topping all on a thin crust.  The pizza is good before, after and during clubbing (thank you in and outs!).

I was looking for places to get pizza in Vegas and this popped up with so many great reviews. I decided to hunt down the location and try it for myself.  I did not regret it. It was actually not busy at all when I arrived in the afternoon, I quickly ordered a slice of the white pizza and sprinkled it with red peppers then headed out to the pool table area to eat it.  The pizza was great!  The thin, crispy crust with the garlic and cheeses were absolutely perfect.  I wasn't even finished with my slice before the idea to order a whole pizza popped into my head.  If I wasn't headed to the airport, I so would have.  I can't wait to come back and enjoy another slice of perfection!
How lucky to find this hidden gem! This place was supposed to be a butlers kitchen, lucky for us it never happened.  One of the best pizza we ever had great salad too all under $11.
Find it, love it. shhh-please don't get it any more crowded... Nuthin' better to absorb\/build a base for a night on the town. Great slices. A Find!!

I'd just like to say that I was mildly disappointed that "Secret Pizza" ain't much of a f&%ing secret! I'd read heaps of articles about this place saying how sneakily hidden it was, how difficult it was to find, how only those "in the know" knew the location. Total BS. Aside from that, this place serves kick ass pizza for a reasonable price... which is why I had to stand in line for 45 minutes at 4.30am on Friday evening\/Saturday morning waiting for my chance to try it out.

I ended up being super boring and predictable and got one slice of their cheese, sausage pepperoni pizza. I didn't bother coming up with my own combo, I didn't bother mixing and matching- my feet were aching and I was so ready to be done with my evening.
Really liked the pizza, it was tasty and not crazy greasy. 10\/10 would wait in line for a slice again!

It was fun trying to find the place but what a disappointment  Over priced and over hyped.  If you're a tourist and want to do the Las Vegas thing...then this is your place.  Take it off your bucket list and don't come back. I still give it two stars because the servers are very attentive.

Monday, October 3, 2011Secret Pizzeria at Cosmopolitan, Las Vegas 

I will start this review with the following disclosure: The following Pizzeria does not exist. It has no menu, it has no website, it has no signs advertising a family meal deal. It is also not down a long hallway lined with old music album covers on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. It is not one of the best deals on the strip. It is also not the Best Pizza on the Strip. I HAVE KEPT THE SECRET.  Now onto the food review... for the best pizza and best pizza deals in Vegas you need to find the secret Pizzeria at Cosmo. The cost is almost two dollars less per slice then any other pizza joint on the strip ( including my other favorite at the Wynn) and the super thin crust , fresh taste and general New York ambiance just can't be beat. Although thin , the crust is still sturdy enough to bend without breaking and strong enough to hold any toppings. Speaking of toppings... unless you order ahead of time ( is there an actual number to the place?) then you will be having your pizza topped with whatever the chefs whim is. There is no formal menu.  On this day Simone and I had our choice of 5 different pizza pies. We both choose for our first slice portabello mushroom pizza with red sauce. With meaty fresh thin sliced mushroms, sweet fresh tasting marinara creamy mozzarella cheese and a crispy blistered crust this one was a winner. Savory till the last bite it leaves you wanting more... so I obliged. This time when I went back to the counter looking me in the face was a white pizza with fresh roasted garlic, Ricotta Cheese and Olive Oil. This one may have been better then the mushroom. The crust was sauce less and had even more crunch. The garlic was sweet, the Ricotta Creamy and slightly melted and the Olive Oil was the icing on my pizza experience.  
The Pizzeria does not seem to offer any sides and I didn't ask because none were needed. They do have fountain drinks and beer. Parmesan cheese and red pepper flakes can be found at the stand up bar that you can eat on. Without any other choices, The pizza definitely stands alone (although three days later we went back and tried a cannolli for dessert and that was delicious as well).
New York thin crust pizza is what its all about here at The Cosmopolitan, and these guys are the best at it.

Definitely a secret, this place is so well hidden in the Cosmopolitan Hotel. The door was closed when I went during the day and was kind of confused on how to even get in. Great place for a quick bite (individually sold slices). I didn't know this place was open late until walking back from Marquee one night. WIll definitely have to stop by late night during the next Vegas trip.

Pizza- 5 stars. Yesterday's attitude and up charge- 1 star.

This review is only based on yesterday's service\/experience. 

I have been to Secret Pizza numerous times, basically it's a must every time I go to Vegas. It's a combination of going after the club, mid-day snack, and even going the morning before heading back to LA. Yeah, it's great pizza, we all know that. However, last night around 11pm, I was so upset with Secret Pizza, I couldn't enjoy pizza because of the attitude and up charge! I went there ahead of my boyfriend as he told me to go first while he cashed out downstairs at the casino. Since it was only 11pm in Vegas, there was no line. Yes! The beauty of not getting Secret Pizza post-club. By the time I was about to order, 5-7 people started forming a line before me. My boyfriend got to me as soon as I was about to order and told me he wanted any sausage slice. The guy behind the counter rudely in a harsh voice told my boyfriend, "You, go to the back of the line". I mean, come on, I was going to order for my boyfriend either way. He's not cutting. He came to me to let me know what he wanted. We were not in any way behaving improperly or drunk or even doing anything wrong to be spoken to in that manner. Then when I went to pay for my two slices of pizza, the woman at the cashier said "what did you order?", I stated "one sausage with toppings...", she entered $6 on the register- understandable. I gave her my credit card and I then told her, "second slice is just sausage"...and again, she entered $6 on the register- not understandable. I asked why the $6 charge on the plain sausage and she didn't bother to explain and  charged my card and gave it back to me and moved on to the next customer. I didn't even get the chance to get an answer or reasoning behind her over charge. Thanks.

Overall, great pizza but when service isn't good, great pizza leaves a bad taste.

Nice "secret" location for a pizza joint. I like the fact that it's opened really late so it's great for a late night eat. 
We walked around several times looking for the entrance but kept walking by. I finally got tired of searching and asked an employee at the Cos which ended our search.

We ordered a large pizza and had it delivered by Postmates to the Palms Resort. Understandably there was a long line as it was a Saturday night. Once the delivery guy got to the counter to order for us they said it would be a 45 minute wait. 
Fine, most pizzas take about that long when you order them for delivery - no problem.

However, for some reason, it took 2 hours from the order being made to the handoff from Secret Pizza to the delivery guy.
When I opened the box, it was thin, greasy and ice cold. If the pizza had really taken 45 minutes (or whatever) to make, why was it not at least a little fresh or lukewarm and why did it take so long for Secret Pizza to give it to the delivery guy who sat there the whole time waiting? Clearly someone had forgotten about it. But that's just the delivery experience. 

The pizza itself, even if it had been hot and fresh, was nothing special. Certainly not worth the $30-odd. The only way this pizza would have been good is if I were drunk and hungry and happened to be passing by.

Yelpers are so wrong on this one. Because of all the positive reviews this has been on my "must try list" for quite some time. First this is NO WAY NEAR A NEW YORK STYLE PIZZA! It's so crunchy the crust fell apart in my hand and along the counter area you could see people left the crust (the best part if made right!). There was hardly any flavor to the slices because the cheese and sauce was extremely sparse! I basically ate pizza dough and it is way overpriced at $5.00 for a cheese slice and goes up from there....that's called rip off. The line was very long but reading the reviews this is the norm. There is very limited counter seating. This place is getting positive reviews from everyone coming out of the clubs and other late night partiers (or influenced by other reviewers) so if you are sober you might want to skip this one because your taste buds won't be fooled and you'll save a small fortune.

Only worth it if you don't mind waiting 45mins+!
Pizza is good, wait time is bad and not very regulated when picking up.

I am a local and until last weekend (halloween weekend) I had never been to this place. BOY WAS I MISSING OUT! 

Price is so cheap and the pizza is amazing! Each of us ordered a slice and I got the white pizza with some pepperoni on top. Greasy and delicious. Hits the spot and is a little bit hidden so just ask someone where it is and enjoy. 

Service was great and will definitely be coming back here again. Five BIG STARS!
Great frickin' pizza.

A perfect example of why Yelp sucks the soul out of me ... if this place can't get five stars then what can? It's cool because it's impossible to find in a city that outrageously promotes itself ... and much more importantly, the slice is great.  I got a pepperoni and mushroom ... it was fresh and tasty.  Plus I hadn't had a drop to drink, and it was great.  Just imagine what it would taste like after a night of drinking!

OMG! After coming here for the first time and having their sausage pizza, I can't enjoy any other pizzas lol. This place is crazy good! Big slices of sausage, oozing cheese.... when I took my first bite, the crispiness of the crust.. it was heaven. Got me and my sister wanting another slice. Next time we come here, definitely getting the whole pie cause its 5 dollars a slice and between me and my sister getting two slices each, it was already close to the price of a whole pie. Fountain drinks here are a tad overpriced especially when they serve it in those little red party cups.

The best slice of pizza in Vegas.  Lines vary wildly, so there is an element of luck beyond arriving at odd times.  Personally I don't like waiting for much of anything in Vegas (there is so many options, just keep walking and you'll find something else).  The usually have a lot of good options and note there are additional options hiding just below what is on display.  So if you don't see what you want, it's worth asking what else they have.  The charge by the slice and number of toppings, so it's not usual to see pizzas with lots of random toppings (hence higher price) on display while plan pepperoni is hiding underneath.

Ordered:
2 Slices of Pepperoni Pizza

Overall: Best slice of pizza in Vegas.  Finding the place is part of the fun.  In my picture, the entrance to the pizzeria is right in the background (third floor of Cosmo, walk straight ahead after getting off escalators from second floor)

After 700+ reviews in a year and a half of being here, is it really fair to call this "Secret" Pizza?

Okay okay, maybe the moniker is because the place is unmarked, tucked away down a hallway next to a sushi joint, and you really will miss it unless you're looking for it. But it's still the worst-kept secret in the Cosmopolitan.

It's thin-crust (but NOT crispy) pizza and for slices, you're limited to handful of choices - cheese, pepperoni, and white pizza. You have more flexibility for toppings if you order a whole pie, but beware the wait. It took us upwards of 35-40 minutes for two pizzas, and save for a half-and-half topping on one of them, we didn't really order anything complicated. I was, however, extremely grateful for the FREE WATER!

The white pizza is the standout here. So much garlic and olive oil that it will leave your paper plate soaked. It was a little on the soggy side because of all of the oil, but at 2am, it's exactly what the doctor ordered. If you're wearing insane heels and you've just finished a night of going big at one of the clubs, you will want to sit on the couches outside of the place to relax and eat.

There is also a Donkey Kong arcade game inside the place. It's a great way to pass the time, but beware the Kong. It will suck you in, beat you down, frustrate you, tease you, and leave you with a hole in your heart. Have fun.

Absurd pizza in Las Vegas. Furious at myself for having been to City Center 6 times in the last 5 years and only found Secret Pizza on this last trip. Secret Pizza is officially my mandatory stop when I'm in Vegas, like Takashi in SLC, El Tarasco (Rosecrans) in LA or Nando's in DC. 

Is this the best pizza I've ever had? No. Is this the best pizza in Vegas? No idea. Is this one of the best places I've eaten at in Vegas - ab-so-lutely

Excellent pizza! Delicious. Think, great crust, great flavor. We didn't have a wait which was perfect because we were hungry. The three of us all loved our slices. I would of takes a picture but I was hungry and it smelled too
Good to wait. There isn't a lot of room to eat in the restaurant but there is seating eight outside in the casino.

Pizza was excellent but not amazing.  The thin crust stays crunchy which I love.  Flavors were great.  No line when I went so it was a very fast process. 

Downside:
- small and crowded, which means personal space gets compromised
- few options for types of pizzas 
- condiments look like they aren't refilled often (no parm cheese?!??) 
- no small pizza to go box

I get it... It's supposed to be a small hole in the wall place, but at the rate they're charging for the slice of pizza... They can up their game.

We went up to the 3rd floor of Cosmopolitan and walked around for a little bit before asking a security guard for directions to this place, it's down an unmarked hall and you'd never guess there's a pizza place there (we were literally right in front of the hallway too). Came here around 1am and there was about a 20 minute line. We ordered a whole pizza with ricotta cheese and pepperoni. The pizza was good, although we were all so hungry we couldn't wait for it to cool down so we tried eating it with some toppings sloughing off the sides. That was no fun. Plus it was piping hot. Ahh, curse your lack in judgment after a night of drinking. And to top it all off, I mistakenly dashed my slice with tons of garlic powder thinking it was parmesan cheese. *Face palm* My friend made that mistake too though, which makes me think that they should really label those condiment dispensers. Hah. We had a good laugh about it though and I was able to blot some of it off. It's great that this place is open until 4am or 5am every day, definitely convenient for partygoers in Vegas. 

I would definitely give this place another chance (and wait until the pizza cools down next time). Good luck finding it though, 3rd floor of the Cosmo is the best I can do for ya!

Felt like I just grabbed a slice on the boardwalk. Yelp reviewers are right on with this spot. A tiny place tucked away on the third floor of the cosmopolitan. I'm not a huge pizza gal because I don't like a lot of bread and red sauce so this spot maybe me very happy. Crispy thin crust and the offer white slices. Great oil and garlic flavor. Two slices were too much but who knows when I'll be able to have a great slice like this again.  Perfect for lunch and in assuming amazing after drinking.

Ate here twice post partying. Pizza is terrible. People only like it because they're all drunk. I prefer that noodle place in the Venetian instead for preventative hangovers.
Pizza cheese was runny and parts of the pizza dough wasn't cooked. And it's not all secret. Everyone knows about this place. Lines are long.

is this place really still a secret after over 3000 reviews?? I think not. : ) after hearing so many good things about the East Coast style slices, I really needed to taste test this place for myself. as an avid fan of big, thin slices, it was cool to go search this popular joint out n c what the hype was all about!

Secret Pizza is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel & Casino in the city of Las Vegas. it's on the 3rd floor of the hotel where STK is. if u c a small, dark hallway with lots of old record covers on the walls. (what r "records?") 

the space inside is pretty small n dark. there's an area where u pick the slices n pay. there's maybe 3 stools to sit n eat at. thank god there wasn't a line when we were there so we found empty spaces to stand n eat by the wall. we got a slice of Meatball & Ricotta n a slice of White Pizza. for me, the amount of cheese on them was perfect cuz I'm lactose-intolerant. if there was more cheese, I'd probably b throwing it all up an hour later. yep, pretty gross. 

I'd definitely go back for another slice if I was on the Strip again. it's probably the cheapest n tastiest meal I've ever had in Vegas!

There's no where to sit it's crowded the pizza is just pizza good but not great probably won't go back the price was just not worth it.  I like the whole "secret" part it's cute and a good gimmick to get people in, but I don't think I'll be returning just for the pizza.

The white pizza is seriously so amazing!!!!!!! The line was super long and we waited a while but it was so worth it! And they're open late so it's great to hit up after a club! It's in a hidden hallway on the 3rd floor! I highly recommend it!
Best slice of pizza in Vegas!! The white pizza is amazing. It only gets better when they add sliced meatballs on there. $5.50 a slice you can't go wrong! Highly Recommended

Awesome pizza! I'll be coming back :) 

It's very hidden so just look for the hallway entrance.

Delicious pizza! If you are tired of getting Earl's for a quick but yummy bite, head over to Secret Pizza. The slices are large, hot, and filling. I must have eaten here three times in one day when I was in Vegas.

Got the sausage with peppers, cheese, and margherita. All of them were yummy but when I had the sausage with peppers one cold later that night, it was extremely salty so not sure what was going on there.

This joint is not trying to bring Grimaldi's, John's, Totonno's, or any of the other notable pizza restaurants in New York to Las Vegas.  Instead, it channels those "street slice" pizzerias you first stop at because you're hungry when you walk by, and then later because you know it's there.  You might not even know the name; it's just "That pizza place on Bleecker Street."  The unmarked entrance on the third floor of the Cosmopolitan echoes the phenomenon perfectly.  For many twenty-somethings, stopping for a slice after hitting the bars has also become a way of life, and this place brings that experience to Las Vegas.

Of course, it does so at Vegas prices, which means you're paying an outrageous $5 for a slice of pizza.  More problematic is a potential wait in excess of 15 minutes thanks to the raging popularity of this place.

The pizza is actually decent for what it's trying to ape.  It looked like a greasy mess when it was handed to me, but the crust is vaguely crispy without being crumbly, and the cheese actually adds some quality flavor instead of just adding weight and texture.  I've had far worse pizza-by-the-slice in New York itself.

Las Vegas has so many good eats that I can't really recommend making this a destination you go out of your way to check out.  However, if you're passing through the Cosmopolitan or you're stumbling around and get the urge to show off your hipness, you can grab a slice and then write a 5-star review on Yelp calling this place "Las Vegas's Best Kept Secret" too.

Fun little hidden place near the Marquee with solid pizza served by dudes in Yankees\/Giants gear. (For that authentic touch)

The pizza is solid but, damn, they are proud of it... $5 a slice isn't bad until you want two and a drink or two... a whole pie is in the $30 range. Ouch!

Then again, its the only spot in this part of the Cosmo  to grab a solid bite without sitting down so I guess you gotta pay to play.

Pepperoni was good, but the highlights were the white pizza and pepperoni\/sausage\/meatball combo. I will be back for a slice of those next time I return!
damn good pizza that hits the spot!!!

After reading numerous reviews about this pizza I knew I couldn't miss out on this gem. Once I got into the 3rd floor of restaurants at the Cosmopolitan, I knew I was close. I read it was close by to STK so we asked the hostess in STK where the hallway was. It was across from STK near the glass elevator. Yay! 

Once we got in the hallway it looked like the pictures. The hallway has music record covers on it. I knew I was getting closer. There was a short line (5 people) when I arrived at 3pm on a Thursday. The place is cozy inside. There were not many stools to sit down at and people stood up to eat. They have a few arcade games in here.

The pizza? So delicious. Big slices. It just melted in my mouth. The crust was just the right amount and the cheese was good. Warning: it is oily, but man oh man...it's so good. I had to ignore that fact.

I just love pizza, no matter from slmost anywhere, yes yhere are bad pizza I have had a few in my time. Secret Pizza is not one of them, their prices are a tad on the high side for slices so its better to buy a whole and share with the group. They weren't kidding this was a secret it took us almost 25 min to find it inside the Cosmopolitan. Pizza was a delight just enough tomato sauce , cheese , and pepperoni. So freshly made in front of everyone so you know there is no funny business. I will come back sgain for future pie cravings.

Best pizza, period!! Its a hidden gem. If you are not looking for it you will walk past it. If ever at The Cosmopolitan, make sure you ask about the Pizza place. Restaurant has no name but everyone knows what you are talking about. The crust makes that pizza amazing. Ask for the deluxe slice, the white slice and a sicilian. The guys working there are all great guys. Chef Jay is the best. We will definitely be back whenever in Vegas, even if its for a couple slices.

Five stars for the most amazing pizza in Vegas. I don't know why people cannot seem to make NY style pizza correctly in this city... but... they can't. Secret pizza does it right.

I take away one star, however, because as a local, it's kinda a hassle to find parking in the cosmo parking garage, then walk all the way into the hotel, then walk through the hotel to the pizza place. Oh yeah, and then the pizza costs $5 a slice. As a good east coast girl... I should never pay that much for pizza. Ever.

But it's sooo tasty...

Actually some of the best pizza in town.  The problem is that, unless you are already at the Cosmo, it's not worth the trouble of driving to the strip, parking, going to the third floor and waiting in line just for pizza (and there is no where to sit, only standing counters). However, if you are a hotel guest, you can order a pie by phone and just run down there to pick it up, and you'll make all the people standing in line jealous. Also good to grab a slice before the Dive-in movies.

3.5 stars. The best thing about this place is how accessible it is, how fast it is to get the pizza, and how it's unique to Cosmos without having to eat at one of the fast food franchises outside the hotel. 

You wait in line to order whatever slice of pizza they have left. The pizza is fresh, and the pieces are nice and large. It hit the spot since I had nothing to eat since I first arrived in Las Vegas. I was happy that I didn't just stop at Popeyes or Subway and decided to look for this place via yelp as I was pretty hungry and tired.

People were okay serving the pizzas. The person behind the cashier counter was friendly though. I can see how this place can be very nice to have when it's really late at night. It's surrounded by higher end restaurants and definitely a bit hidden, but worth checking out if you're at Cosmos or near the area.

Let's face it. You can get your descriptions and ratings of this place by taking a look at everyone else's Yelps here. Most are accurate in their love of this place. So, instead, I bring you "Ali's Inner Monologue Regarding The 'Secret Pizza Place' At The Cosmopolitan".

"Ok, drinking and searching for somewhere semi-hidden is NOT working out for me. I'm surrounded by trendy restaurants on the RESTAURANT level... where the hell is this pizza??
Oh, wait... is this a hallway? WAIT... I remember Yelpers talking about a hallway of album covers. This... might... be.... SCORE!
Even more SCORE... only two people in line. And these guys are about to get up... jeez, could they add maybe one or two seats in this place? Actually, probably not. 
I see cheesy White Pizza. That's for me. 
Hmm, pinball... sure, why not?
Sweet, pizza's ready. And there's actually a free seat... right next to the red pepper flakes, yessshhhh. Let's get me plenty of napkins, this looks like it has potential to be messy
Time to check this out.....  

{Ali's brain goes dark as she wants to make out with this slice of pizza and its gooey cheesy goodness}

I really hope I can find this place the next time I'm in town.
Did that guy really just take a header in the hallway???"

Good eats, awesome vibe, interesting people-watching, even for such a tiny spot. GO.

It's in a "relatively" easy place to find. The wait times are usually super long. But it's the cheapest\/best food you can probably find in Vegas. There's also a nice pool table outside, so if you come with friends, you can hang out for sometime.

Pretty solid pizza.  A good New York style slice. It's on the third floor tucked away down a hallway.  They use these new special pizza boxes that break down one half into 4 plates and the other half folds into a close-able half pizza box.

I learned about this place from a concierge at a hotel we were staying at.  It's a hidden pizza place in the Cosmopolitan.  My boyfriend and I looked for it when we were out one morning, but it was to early.  We actually found it but weren't positive.

The next day I was out shopping with my mom and was starving.  We popped in, had pizza and left.  It's a cheapish (for Las Vegas) greasy treat.

Long time eater, first time reviewer. This no-name pizza joint has some of the best pizza I've ever had the pleasure of eating. Excellent grab and go dining option at Cosmo. My number one tip would be to get the white pizza. I know, i know... it doesn't have any meat on it. Thats okay. It is, IMHO, better than any of the meat pizzas served up here.
