So basically every night after drinking, a group of us would bring back a few boxes for everyone to share.  The white pizza was my favorite.  They have legit toppings, especially the sausage.  GREAT LATE NIGHT DRUNK FOOD!
Came in at 1pm on a Sunday. If I wanted pre-made, reheated pizza I could have gone to Sabaros and not waited in line. There are too many great places in Vegas...don't waste your time here.

Some of the best slices in Vegas.

If you're looking for New York style pizza, this is the place to go.

The white pizza is fantastic, but they have an onslaught of other options for those that want sauce. Then, you can take it out into the Cosmo and enjoy it in a classy setting. There really is nothing like greasy cheese matched with a sleek hotel interior. 

Plus, it's just fun to walk down the unmarked hallway and get your slice for the first time.

Shhhh...it's a secret! This spot is easy to walk by, especially at 3am after a few adult beverages, as it is tucked away at the end of a hall, but if you are on a mission (as my friends and I definitely were), it is not so hard to find. The pizza here was fantastic, thin, cheesy, fresh, delicious! I am dreaming about it right now.The yelp reviews do not lie. If you are in Vegas, GO HERE NOW!!! :)

Didn't have a tough time looking for this place because I looked at all the yelp reviews LOL!

It's something about that cheese that makes me want to come back for me. I definitely like the pizzas with the pizza sauce more than the white pizza, but the white pizza is pretty good as well. Definitely coming back to try some more flavors :). 

Is it worth the price though? Mmmm not really since it's 5 dollars per slice, but what can you expect? It's Vegas.

If you're going to Marquee, this place will be on your way as you exit, just ask the bouncer at the end of the escalators which way to go. It's usually a long line with a bunch of drunk girls, but hey..it's vegas! Slice of pizza is $3-$5 and a whole pizza is $27-$30. The whole pizzas are a long wait, but it's worth it since it's fresh and you get to pick your toppings.  There's also no tables, the place is small where you just order, get your food and split. 

Secret Pizza will soon be the new Earls for late night vegas druncheis

secret pizza, thank you for being open late and located next to Marquee. 

The line sucks but the pizza is pretty damn good. My favorite was the white pizza hands down.

i have to come here every time i'm in Vegas because .....  white ricotta pizza.  white ricotta pizza.  white ricotta pizza.  white ricotta pizza.  white ricotta pizza.  white ricotta pizza. SOO GOOOD.

if you don't have time to pick up pizza later again during your trip, order a whole! Cost\/Time efficient :)

I've known about this not-so-secret establishment for about a year but was never afforded an opportunity to try it out until this last weekend.  After being bumped around and not being able to dance with my wife across the street at the Gallery Nightclub inside Planet Hollywood, we decided that we were at wits end and that pizza was the only thing that could make the night even better.  I suggested Secret Pizza to her and we started our trek.  We made a short jaunt to The Cosmopolitan and started our pizza pilgrimage.

The Yelpers before me did an excellent job at describing where the place was located and that helped a great deal because it would have taken me a while.   Secret Pizza is tricky to find because you're essentially looking for a hallway.  Once you get up the escalator on the third floor, you walk a little and turn to the left.  When you see the hallway, just walk toward the end and follow the incredible smell. 

I've had good pizza before as I've had it in just about any locale you can think of.  I've only been to NYC once and I remember how good it was there.  I can say with pure certainty that the "White Pizza" is quite possibly the best that I've had anywhere and that is monumental since I have this weird obsession with ranking EVERYTHING that I eat. 

If a long wait isn't too much of a deterrent then I can't recommend this place enough.

For every trip to Vegas, I make a stop to Secret Pizza. It's a pilgrimage that I partake in every time. White pizza and beef pizza are a must try. I still have not found another place that makes their beef pizza the same as that of Secret Pizza. 

It's probably time that I visit Vegas again.

This place is truly a secret!  Its so hidden that there are no signs in the directory of the restaurant itself except for the line of people waiting to enjoy a slice of the best pizza they ever had.  It is thin crust pizza, crispy crust and delicious toppings!  If you can go for lunch there is less of a line.
Their pepperoni was nice and oily just the way i like it

I hadn't been back to Secret Pizza since 2012 according to Swarm! I had to "re-find" my way. Hallway of album covers next to Jaleo in Cosmo? Actually pretty easy!

A pin ball table, several bar stools and mostly standing space fill the room (though not much). Super nice guys work there. Happy to chat it up. I brought an unopened Mexican Coke from the Coca Cola factory nearby and they uncapped it for me. 

The pizza is pretty thin crust. I love it that way. Toppings don't weigh it down. Just good pizza!

Although it's pretty much an open secret at this point, do not visit the cosmopolitan late at night without visiting secret pizza. It's greasy, delicious, and very satisfying. Just follow the drunk people up the escalator and look for the long hallway (and line).

I happen to adore the white pizza and anything with mushrooms, but honestly  all the flavors look awesome. Yes, the prices are higher than the flyover state you might call home, but you will likely be tipsy and exhausted by the time you make it over so you won't mind.

The very worst thing about this place is standing in line and watching what feels like an endless number of people walk past you with yummy slices. It will take a while if you are in the post club crowd. Don't expect a whole pizza either on a busy night- you could be looking at an hour wait or more (after you wait 30+ minutes in line).

I love the white pizza! But you have to be a cheese only pizza fan to really enjoy it. The spicy sausage and pepperoni pizzas were also awesome. It's the best pizza in Vegas, but not the best pizza I've ever had. 

The location they have really sucks though. Super tiny and only one register so the wait is really annoying and long. Plus there's like only 4 stools for seating inside and that's pretty much it. 

I usually come here on every Vegas trip cuz I'm a fatass and I love Dat cheezzzzz.

Crowded and queue system needs a little work. Sitting area wasn't clean when I went but the pizza was delicious. Good spot to check out after club hopping, great location if you're still up for a little wandering or a last minute show.

The pizza was great. I ordered 2 slices of regular pizza, they are amazing, the crust are thin and there are a lot topping. Highly recommend this place. It's hard to find the place because its not listed on the directory, it's located on the 3rd floor in the Cosmopolitan Hotel, next to Blue Ribbon.

Fun place open Super late or early depending on how u look at it. Good pizza slices couple beers on tap.  
Definitely a place to eat on the strip between midnight and 4am

WHO: Any one of you who are craving pizza past midnight! =)

WHERE: Inside the Cosmopolitan Hotel, on the 3rd floor. It is literally A HOLE IN THE WALL! I had to ask one of the front desk men where it was! There is no sign whatsoever, so asking is the safest way!

WHEN: I have no idea when it closes, but it closes late! We went at 2am, and there was still a line to order!

WHY: Thin-crust pizza is the way to go, THAT'S WHY!

WHAT: Standing in the line, I was looking for some sort of menu, but there actually wasn't one! I was somewhat confused because I am so used to there being a menu explaining it all!

When you get up to the counter, there are toppings you can choose from to make your slice of pizza to your liking, or there are also pre-made slices you can get! I just chose one of the pre-made slices that looked pretty interesting!

On my pizza, along with the mozzarella cheese, there was another type of cheese that I didn't get to remember, but it was REALLY GOOD! I also had mushrooms and green peppers.  I did get to try the White Pizza from my friend!! That was actually one of the most unique slices of pizza I have ever tried!! Instead of marinara sauce, there was some type of garlic sauce under CHEEESE, CHEESE, AND MORE CHEESE! =D

*NOTE: Try it out after all that partying one night! The line might scare you off, but it's okay- the line went by fairly fast!

I don't know what the fuss about this place is about...

We waited 1.5 hours for a couple slices of pizza. The line wasn't even long at all. We were maybe 15 people deep. This place is just extremely inefficiently set up. The guys are jumping around everywhere to grab a pizza, grab toppings, throw it in the oven, grab parmesan, etc...

The pizza itself was decent but waiting 1.5 hours for 2 slices...

Obviously not a secret but there still are no signs for this place. I took a guess when I got to the 3rd floor and just went with my nose and the line of people standing in an unidentified hallway. 

I tried the mushroom and pepperoni slice and the white pizza slice. Both were amazing, the mushroom and pepperoni may have been a tad too salty but still great. The cheese was melted on so gloriously but stayed intact enough to take clean(ish) bites, the mushrooms were just what I wanted to go with my meat. The white pizza isn't as greasy because there's no red sauce or meat, but it's still super tasty and probably the best white pizza I've had.

Prices are a bit high, $5.50-$6 for a slice. But hey, just do it.

OMG...i am wiping the drool of my keyboard as I write this review. The white pizza is the best. It soaks up all the alcohol you have consumed during the night or at least make a dent in it. It's foldable and so you dont have to worry about making a mess as you eat it. The herbs and the cheese on that perfectly crisp crust is literally a slice of heaven in your mouth.
Love love love me some Secret Pizza! Crispy crust, melty cheese, and such flavorful sauce! It is well worth the effort to find Secret Pizza! Can't wait to go back again!

Ok. So late night on the strip and you've thrown all your dam money away. All you got left is a couple of strippers to you cards a club pass some change and a few bills. So what do you do. Make your way to City Center. Ask an employee where the pizza shop is and get ready for some seriously good pizza. It's really hidden. That's why I say ask an employee. Very small and cramped but for the price and quality of the food. It is the best ever. Soda in walmart plastic cups and paper plates to set your 5$ a slice pizza on. PBR and IPA on tap. I've been looking for quality food on the strip and a cheap price for years. This is it. So if you only got a few straps left this is where you need to be.
This pizza is excellent. You will not be disappointed with your choice we stayed at Cosmopolitan and hit this joint 4 times in 3.5 days

After a long night at Edc, we came here for a snack before bed. I've never heard of a secret pizza place near marquee. It is very inconspicuous and I don't think you would see it unless someone pointed it out. The pizza was ok, the slices were large. The line is long if you go when people are coming from marquee. The place thing about it is you can go chill and eat in the massive seating areas just outside the entrance.

3.5 stars

We came here at 3 am on a Saturday night and ordered a whole pie with 5 toppings, which cost $36. We waited 30 minutes in line and another 30 minutes for our pizza to come out. Was it worth it...? Ehhhh, the pizza was good but I don't think it was quite worth the money or time. Sure, it was pretty satisfying as a late night snack and tasted even better in our hotel room the next morning. But I don't think I would wait another for it.

I had the white pizza with pepperoni. It was delicious. Got a full pie for 31 dollars, probably the most reasonably priced thing you are going to find that will be delicious, and keep you satisfied. Good chance I will visit again when I return to Vegas.

Stopped by on a Friday night ended up going to Eggslut instead. Came back the next day and waited in line to see what all the buzz is about. The pizza was OK.. I think this place is mainly hyped up on the whole secret spot. The price is high for the quality but then again I've had a lot of good pizza. Don't think I will be returning but will be back at Eggslut :D

The not-so secret spot at the Cosmopolitan because everyone is here. Located next to Jaleo on the top floor, you can't miss the crowds of people, so you won't be able to miss the hoards of people lined up either. 

Since we were mobbin' about 10 people deep with some more friends on the way, we decided to order two pizzas for the group. Unfortunately for the whole pies, options are a bit limited, so I was a bit saddened that I didn't get to go cray on toppings or white sauce. 

Our group settled for simplicity. Two large pepperoni pizzas that was an additional 1 hour wait after order was taken. LONGEST HOUR EVER, but I think the wait made the pizzas so much better than it really is. It was the greasiest two slices I've had, with pools of pepperoni juice sitting in each curl.

Didn't realize til after we had finished the pizzas, but the boxes can be deconstructed into 'plates' in case you didn't ask for plates. I'm sure that's only doable if someone was sober enough to figure out the instructions. There's pictures, but it may require some muscle ahah.

Secret pizza does not disappoint. The first time I was there I stumbled upon it, which is part of what makes it so cool\/ fun\/ quirky. Beyond those elements, the pizza is delicious & it's probably the cheapest grub on the Strip. I always get pizza by the slice (about $5) and usually opt for the cheese with added ricotta. Its thin crust with a good combination of crunchy to chewy. I usually don't order anything to drink here, but they have beer ($7-8) and wine ($6). If you're hungry and in the area, you can't go wrong with this place. Open late.

My friend and I were on a mission. The plan was perfect. Grab Fat Tuesdays then meander to the Cosmopolitan, where Secret Pizza is located. It made for a wonderful almost-drunk adventure. I had been here once before (many years ago) but I think back then I was too wasted to remember where it was. Actually, it's pretty easy to find, though describing the exact location in my Yelp review seems to defy the whole point of visiting Secret Pizza, so I won't divulge.

The staff who works here are super nice for people who have to deal with drunk hungry people all the time. Well, that's my assumption, but we were here on a Monday night so perhaps the crowd was more time. I ordered two slides, one of the white pizza and the other with pepperoni and mushrooms. It was too much for me to eat, but I knew one slide would be too little. I was satisfied by the hot and fresh pizza nevertheless! So glad that my friend and I decided to come here. Such a simple meal and a must-try in Vegas.

This pizza is really good greasy New York style pizza.  However, waiting almost an hour for pizza seems pretty ridic, doesn't it?  You might change your mind once it's 2am. It's located on the third floor across from the escalators.

Fun stop for some pizza! 

Service was quick and super friendly! That makes the experience so much more fun. 

Pizza's are well sized but a bit oily. I guess it works out for the drunks, but it made the pizza a bit messy and the cheese would easily slide off the bread. 

You could order single slices or full. There's some standing room inside and seating outdoors if you want to hang.
Order a fresh meatball ricotta pizza, and then thank me for changing your life in a positive way.

I was excited with the overwhelming yelp reviews and ratings. Nothing outstanding, nothing bad either. It's a regular pizza by the slice, direct from oven pizza restaurant. Menu options are limited. Wait time is long if you go during peak business hours. For health watchers - it's full of cheese. Slightly overpriced but hey, you are in Cosmo!!

Went here on Sunday afternoon with a friend and his daughter. What a great little find! 

Had a great slice of cheese pizza for only $3.50. 
I can't even get a slice that good for that little at home, nevermind anywhere in Las Vegas on The Strip! 

3rd floor.. that's all I'm saying.
Follow your nose!

As a native Chicagoan, I'm preeeetty picky about my pizza, and this place actually didn't disappoint me!  We came here around 2am on a Tuesday, and luckily there wasn't too much of a line.  The staff was friendly but...interesting.  The spent about 2 minutes "play arguing" with each other at the counter before they finally decided to take our order.  Once we were ready to pay one of them couldn't figure out how to use his cash register and had to call his coworker over for help, which prompted another couple minutes of them play arguing\/flirting.  Like I said, they were pretty friendly, just bizarre and they kinda seemed like they were on something!
    We got half pepperoni and have white pizza.  The wait was about 20 minutes, which isn't too bad for a fresh pizza.  Plus, we had the super wasted girls stumbling about in heels with their dates to entertain us while we waited!  The actual pizza was pretty tasty.  The pepperoni half had a good amount of pepperoni on it, and wasn't overly greasy.  The white half was absolutely fantastic!  It was nice and garlicky and had plenty of cheese(ricotta?).  I think if I come back here, I'd come back just for the white pizza.  Overall, not the best pizza I've ever had, but it was very very good!

2 AM drunk food at its finest. I think you're looking at $4.50+ a slice, but it's Vegas so no one cares. Located conveniently in the Cosmo on the 3rd floor, just above the Marquee entrance. 

It's good pizza too, I was kinda surprised. Greasy as hell, but I wouldn't have it any other way at 2 AM.

This was a hidden hideaway but while serving quality pizza with personality it has become quite famous.  I first stopped in due to pure rumor of deliciousness and was led there by its intoxicating aroma. 

When you first walk in you'll be greeted by a staff that makes the word gregarious seem modest but they have an obvious passion for pizza making and their quality ingredients.  What I was most impressed with is the made to order style and due to my dairy allergy they were able to make a "Red" pizza with all the toppings and still very satisfying.  

A key thing to remember is you better hit up the ATM after an evening out since this is cash only and be prepared to wait if you're asking for something fresh and made to order.  I can see myself and many others considering this place the "happy ending" to many future nights at the Cosmopolitan.

Shhh... It's a Secret!  Pizza joint you will find on the third floor at cosmo, why the 4 stars and not 5?  Maybe because the Pizza is good but not NYC good but don't get me wrong, if it is late at night and you are leaving the Marquee and need a bite this place gets 50 stars!

IEh.

Was not great.  Last time we were here they had cheese slices and would add whatever toppings were requested and then put it in the oven to warm it up for you.  We asked for this, and they said "no".  The slices we did get were room temp, not warm at all.  Two of them were burnt solid black on the bottom, so we took them back and they gave us two to replace them.  The two new ones were from the same pie, and just as burnt.  

Staff was semi friendly, but not exactly eager to please or overly happy to have you there.  But as I recall from our prior visits here this place isn't about fabulous pizza... It's about the "secret".  And it isn't even a secret anymore...
Love this place.  A go to after the club or pool.   It's so funny you can't find it unless you know about it

The dudes dishing slices behind the counter are so New York. It's all "Whatcha want?" and "Huh?" Don't expect a conversation or them to be remotely polite. But it's a pizza counter with drunks side-stepping just to keep their balance who are in line ordering. You'd probably have an attitude too. 

Come, get your slice, devour it with your friends and be on your way. You will enjoy it. The pizza ranges from decent (if sober) to "Holy crap, this is the best slice EVER!" (if you just left Marquee and it's 4am). To really appreciate it, go after the club.

First night back in Vegas and this was the spot to hit up! I didn't get to come here the past few times, so this time it was a must! 

We had the white pizza by the pie and it was absolutely DELICIOUS! It was a little more expensive than your conventional pizza but the taste was well worth it!

Decent pizza.. Nothing particularly special that'll make you want to come back. We ordered two large pizzas and had to wait 45min which may be fine if the pizza was awesome but it was just okay. Save yourself some time & just order what's already pre-made.

Great pizza. Make sure you go. Don't work too hard trying to find the secret location, just ask so you can get there fast. As simple as pizza is, many mess it up. Secret Pizza has it figured  out. My NY friend even loved it. Wait varies. Last time I went, I walked straight up and ordered. Nice staff.

Pizza is my favorite. And I love Secret Pizza. Yeah, it's pricey -- but it's good. There's nothing worse than paying for bad pizza, but this is totally worthwhile. Take the elevator by the chandelier up to the 3rd floor and hang a right down a hallway to find it. Pizza is available by the slice or as a whole pie. The slices are generous portions, especially the Sicilian. Hang out and eat at the counter or take it to go. Sodas are overpriced, but the water is free.

We waited in line for 45 minutes. the line in front if us got longer as people met up with their friends post pool session,   we started with 10 people ahead, and eventually had 30 ahead of us, who individually ordered . by the time we got to the front,  the pickings were so slim. they said it would be another 30 minutes for a SLICE of pepperoni. and we got a disgusting piece of mixed pizza toppings (some of which I couldn't identify)and split it. very disappointing.   will not be going back. better luck at a costco food court. The drinks were in Red Solo Cups, and I'm pretty sure they were $4-5 each for one fill up. We left hungry. We bought drinks at a downstairs shop, and made a note to never come back.
Eat there and it was so good, i came back next weekend.
I found it, so that was a plus! I went in and ordered a slice and was supremely pleased with the flavor as well as the perfect crunch on the crust! A must-eat in Vegas, for sure!
Probably the best pizza I've ever had.... Staff is friendly... Beer selection is terrible and over priced... But everything else makes up for it

What's this hidden dark hallway on the 3rd floor of the Cosmo? Look, there's a pinball machine at the end and drunk people waiting for something. There's not even a name anywhere.

Walking down the hallway, you suddenly smell pizza. Hungry barefooted girls in line and drunk guys talking to themselves. That pizza looks godsend when you're intoxicated. I wasn't even drunk and it looked good.

I opted for the sausage\/pepperoni slice. It was like $4! It was salty as ocean water man! I was gulping soda afterwards, good thing there were unlimited refills. It wasn't bad but this doesn't touch real NYC pizza at all. Nothing comes close. It's filling though.

The pizza was good, but it didn't blow me away like it did for some of the other yelpers on here.  The white pizza had a really good combination of flavors, but it was a bit greasy.  Don't get me wrong, I like a greasy slice of pizza every now and then.

Secret Pizza will be a lot easier to find if you just ask someone working at the hotel for directions.  Everyone is extremely friendly and they're all willing to help.  There are no seats, but you can place your pizza on the ledges and eat while you stand.  

All in all, I think Secret Pizza is great for a snack but I wouldn't make a meal out of it.  However, it'll probably be the cheapest meal you'll be able to find in the Cosmopolitan.

Is this place for real?????!?!? IMHO Pizzeria Mozza has the best pizza of all time, and it's a solid 10 in my book. My bf had told me that the secret pizza is "up there" and is about a 9.5. I was skeptical, but when I tasted the pizza, I was floored by the texture flavor, and chewiness of the crust. For me, the pizza is in the crust. I don't know what they put in their dough, but it is hands down the best here out of most places I've tried.

I tried both the red sauce meat lovers pizza and the white sauce. I generally like the red sauce pizza better, so preferred the red.  

I'm going to be a repeat customer for sure. Oh my gosh, it is SO good.

TOP 5 AFTER-THE-CLUB-MUNCHIES

Cheap, Fast, Greasy, ad Delicious. What more can you ask for? I heard this place gets pretty packed around 3-4am when everyone is being kicked out of the club. I went at 2AM (I specifically left Marquee early, on a mission to eat this pizza) and there was no line.  There isn't must variety to choose from (3-4 kinds of pizza) but who care when you have the after-the-club-munchies? Not me! Pizza is Pizza - but this pizza is to die for! Must try!

This is one of my favorite pizza place in Vegas, it looks pretty cool too. Definitely try  white pizza. I had my family with me so I bought a white pizza with meatball and tomatoes. Plus side it's open late so... perfect late night craving
One of the best stops I've made in Vegas or just in general. Definitely worth the quick trip if you're looking for good food at a good price.

if i could eat one pizza for the rest of my life - it's this one, hands down. THE best ive possibly ever tasted. They make it fresh and with quality ingredients. The long line is so worth the wait even in your 6-inch post clubbing shoes (dont take your shoes off....thats not cute ladies). I waited for appprrooooxxxx 25 mins but it goes by quick when chatting with the other people in line. You will be soooo glad you made that wait. Seriously considering just going to vegas for this meal alone. If LA had a spot like this (does it? yelp a sista out!!) i would go allll theeeee time! mm mmm

Fun, cheap, greasy. It's the perfect place to drop in after walking the Strip. You and all your fellow diners will share something intimate knowing you found both this place. It's anti-Vegas, and after a few days of non-stop extravagance and indulgence, finding a hole-in-the-wall run by locals is pretty awesome.

I love the pizza here. Every time my boyfriend and I go here there is a mile long line but definitely worth the wait. I think $40 for 5 slices of pizza is a bit much but it's definitely must do when we're down at Cosmo. The staff is always friendly also which is a huge plus!

Perfect place to bring out-of-towners because they can enjoy all the glitz of the hotel as they locate the Secret Pizza. Also, this is the only reasonably priced restaurant in the Cosmopolitan.

They serve large New York style slices - very greasy and delicious. Keep it mind, it's still not the authentic slices you'd expect in Manhattan. For Vegas standards, I'd give them 3.5 stars, but that's not an option here, so they get 4 stars.

This place is located in the Cosmopolitan hotel on the 3rd floor next to the Blue Ribbon. It's behind the pool table and retro chairs.  You have look for the dark hallway with records on the wall and enter in.  This place is such a secret that it's not even listed on the Cosmopolitan directory.  It's basically New York style pizza that you can order by the slice or by the whole. 

The menu is simple and you can ask them if they have any other flavors, since they have other pizzas hidden and not on display.  I went there twice and one night there was absolutely no line and the other night, there was a long line out the door. I would anticipate a line if you come here really late at night.  

The pizza is thinly sliced, crispy and the crust was delicious.  I personally think it's really good and I was sober, too.  I highly recommend you check this place  out if you're at Cosmo.

Always a local favorite. Drinks at the Chandelier bar followed by pizza at Secret Pizza is an amazing combination. The lines can be long but overall service is great, food is amazing and despite what some claim, pricing is more than reasonable for top notch pizza. P.S., not really a secret :) Most employees can tell you where to find it, just don't expect to see it on the maps.

Bonne adresse de pizza, de belles part a manger sur place ou de grandes pizza  emporter.

L'endroit se trouve au 2me tage du cosmopolitan (3me niveau !) au fond d'un couloir avec des affiches, pas facile  trouver mais il suffit de demander, il n'y a pas de pancartes et il n'apparat sur aucun plan.

On y va pour les pizzas, pas pour le lieu.

Best pizza in Vegas. Could be that I always come here late late at night and craving something greasy and fulfilling, but it could also be that crust. It's slightly sweet but also savory at the same time. Texture is perfect for a pizza.

Line moves a little slow, but at 3am, what doesn't? Definitely worth a 20 minute wait. Be sure to get 2 slices but 1 is never enough.

If you are on the Strip and in the mood for pizza, let me spoil a not-so-secret Secret Pizza: the food is good. No doubt about it.

But getting here was a chore, especially if you are a tourist and had no clue where it is located. This place is literary hidden, no signage and no directions. Located inside the swanky Cosmopolitan hotel, you need to take an escalator to the third floor and turn left! Look for the popin colored hallway decorated with famed record-plated and you are at the right spot! 

Once inside, you will be greeted with long lines, which move at a moderate pace. The space is real tiny with counter tables and no chairs... frenzied atmosphere and zero ambiance. For my pizza, I ordered their popular white pizza and it was pretty good. It consists of ricotta and mozzarella cheese - yep, nothing too creative with the toppings, but the flavors were spot on and I appreciate the simplicity in delivering everything I love in a single serving.

The pizza here cost around $5-6 per slice. Not exactly cheap, but after spending few days eating at the Strip, this place suddenly feels relatively affordable, lol. In All, Secret Pizza was a pretty decent experience; the service was friendly, food is quick and reliable and the best part is.. They are open 24 HOURS! :)

The crust was amazing.

I hesitate to call it NYC pizza, because the majority of NYC pizza I've had is crap compared to this.

get the white pizza - mozzarella cheese, feta, and garlic (no red sauce).  totally yum. all their pies have a thin, new york crust and you can easily (easily) eat three. i'd pretty much eat any of the pizza there.  It's a a great little spot that i love to stop by if i've had a couple of drinks, and even when i haven't.  get a whole pie because you might as well.  a whole pie is a little over $20, while a slice is about $3

What isn't overpriced in vegas.... maybe mcdonalds but i've never set foot in there.

Pizza is alright, i can see people glorifying this place after they've had one too many shots and their sense are a little bit inhibited but overall i had the same quality pizza for a whole lot less.  Unfortunately none of those places are in vegas therefore one would have to resort to this.

not sure what the hype and rave is all about... yes it's thin crust... and it's cheesy... but i dont think it's THAT good... but that's because i'm eating it with a sober tongue vs after drinks...

the pizza is greasy... toppings are salty... and nothing spectacular... is it a 5 stars? hmm... no.  i'm barely even a fan... but it's relatively cheap to what's available for a late night.... 

they close at 5am... so if i was drunk coming out of marquee... this could be a 4 stars... that may be the only time i'll give this place anything higher than a 3...

Um, I was sober and this was the best pizza I've ever had. Don't ask me why I was sober in Vegas, because I honestly don't know why, but this pizza was delicious. I can't even imagine how amazing it would be if I was under the influence of anything. It's decently priced, considering they do hook you up with a pretty big slice and you ARE paying Vegas prices. I have no complaints. Had it twice in our 15 hours of being there :)

Located "secretly" in the Cosmopolitan, the pizza that they make here is top notch. Not too doughy or saucy and they put a lot of cheese (which I love). Hearing about this place from a friend, we opted to call our pizza in and gamble while we waited for our order. They said an hour, but it was more like an hour and a half. But hey...you can't rush greatness! 

Another benefit of phoning in an order is that you don't have to wait in that obnoxiously long line. You just go to the front and tell them your name and the sales associate will ring you up. Simple. But if you want just a slice or two, you're gonna have to wait in line, but trust me...it's worth it. 

The hallway is decorated with framed record albums and you can pass the time waiting in line  looking at all of them or listening to other people in line talk about how drunk they are and need pizza to survive. Lol!

All in all my experience here was excellent. From the service to the pizza...top notch all the way. 

Go. You won't be disappointed.

I'm always drunk when I eat here, so I can't say how good it is SOBER, but I absoFREAKINlutely love this place.

Worth the wait? Hm...it's a close one, but I say yes.

Great pizza if you can sneak in without a line. The deep dish Sicilian pizza is $8 a slice but SO good! 

For sure the best price in the Cosmo for a late night snack.

I love this place because it's on the top floor and you can easily grab a quick bite after marquee! The pizza comes out super hot and the service is friendly. Line is always super long.

A slice is about $5. I really need to try this place when I'm not intoxicated and see if it's still just as good!

Not as big as a secret as they make it out to be.  Pizza is pretty good, but the line was pretty long.

Also, not as cheap as I would expect from this kind of pizzeria.  

I haven't been back since my first visit.  Definitely more of a tourist trap eatery than a place for locals.

Secret Pizza was one of the places we were looking forward to on our last trip because many people talk about it, and the reviews are awesome. It's located on the third floor of the Cosmo with other restaurants (I think it's the level with a pool table on it), down the hallway with all the pictures.

There was no line and we were able to get our pizza right away. Each slice is preheated, and one of the disappointing things is that both of our slices were overly salty.  The slices were good, but no where near the hype. And not anywhere near the quality of an authentic slice from NY.  I think the slices were $5-7 each, and beer was $7-8.

The service was OK and there is virtually no seating. The atmosphere is nice (arcade games, bar top seating, etc). But the pizza was just OK. We found the slice at Flour and Barley (at the Linq) was much better.

The Pizza place that is not much of a secret too most. After a night of people watching in their decked out costumes I needed a bite to eat. I have been here before so I know it's pizza that  I really enjoy. You never know if the line would be down the hall or be able to walk right up to the counter. Luckily there was no line and we got our order right away. Very flavorful with a  crispy-ish crust. Try it you'll love it!

Omigod, Secret Pizza.  I knew about this place through Yelp, and added to the "must-dos" for our trip last weekend.  Little did I know it really was a must-do, as the "fine dining' dinner we paid $200 for right next door left us hungry.  But, Secret Pizza was still really, really, really good pizza.

Okay, I think it's, what, $4-$5 for a slice of pizza.  So what?  Order a whole one for under $30 and you can split it with your friends and get the most of your money.

Their crust is SO GOOD.  Thinking about it now makes we want to go back, immediately.  If anyone here knows of a place in Los Angeles that has pizza similar to what Secret Pizza has going on, let me know!!!!!

No wait at around 10pm on a Saturday night.

I love that this place is hard to find! You have to go to the third floor, where all the restaurants are. Look around and find a long alleyway\/corridor that is lined with framed pictures. This is your tunnel to a pizza haven. I had to ask someone where exactly it was when I saw her sitting by the pool table with a large, delicious looking pizza (as a tip, this is where you can sit when the pizza joint is filled with customers). Thankfully, I came in the afternoon so there was no line to wait in. As it was my first time, I decided to ask the workers for recommendations. We ended up getting a white pizza with mushroom and sausage, and a traditional red pizza with sausage. Both were delicious and satisfying - sometimes you just need a good slice of pizza as a break from all the rich, fine-dining type of food in Vegas. At first, I thought just one slice wouldn't be enough. But wash it down with an ice cold beer and you have yourself a meal. 

Prices were decent, $4 - 5 a slice depending on the amount of toppings you add. They have beer on draft too, which made the whole experience remind me of my undergraduate days. Overall, an excellent pizza joint for your afternoon, evening, and post-club munchie needs.

Of course it's hidden, have to search for the entrance.  Solid slice for a pizza fix.  Not sure if it's the best NY slice I have had, but good enough.  Nice that there's a large area to bring your food and drink to if you want to hang out.

Awesome piece of meat ball pizza for 5 bucks.  Some of the best tasting and most affordable foot in the hotel.  If the line is too long... just go to the mall across the street.  Lots of good for there also.
I love the thin and nicely baked pizza craft... I saw long line of drunk clubbing people and was wondering if this place worth the wait. ..Yes!!!
Can't come to Vegas and not have a slice of pizza from here!!! Specially after a long night of partying! Sooo sooo sooo good! My favorite is the mushroom but everything is good!

I love pizza. So I had to check this place out. I'd say it's worth a visit.

The idea of a "secret" pizza place is cool. It's not really all that secret anymore though, just in a not so visible place. I expected and almost half-wanted to have to crawl through things to get there. BUT, I did appreciate the long, album-decorated corridor that leads to the parlor. 

Whether you're looking for a hangover snack, a re-fuel food, or simply want an escape from the crowded fast food on the strip, give it a shot. Prices aren't great, but it's Vegas we're talking about.

I think I haven't reviewed this because I didn't want to share.
2 words...white pizza. Ask for it, wait for it, get an entire WHITE PIZZA. I'm not typically a fan, but this pizza blows all the others out of the water. Best pizza tip OF MY LIFE.

You'll want to roll around with it, swish it in your mouth and then eat more. If you're worried about overdoing it, don't worry, just overdo it. Its WORTH ITTTTTT!

Looking for a quick bite or looking for a place to eat late at night?  Find this secret pizza place at the cosmopolitan!  It's next to the sushi restaurant with the pool table close by. You see a small entrance way and the hall takes you to the pizza place. It's really small. You can call in your order or order there. You can order by the slice or a whole pie. The pizza slices are pretty big. 

I was doing meatless Friday the day I tried it out. I ended up just getting a cheese pizza, but it was super good cheese pizza!  I wish I tried the mushrooms. 

The pizza boxes are nifty. If you have leftovers (like half a pie), you can tear off the top part of the box and fold the bottom of the box to save some room :)

I'll be back!

Incredibly light NY pizza,a great place to go late night or during the day.

Old fashioned Arcade games like Galaga make it nostalgic. 

If you are in town, check this place out !

Not really a secret...its clearly marked on the hotel property map - 3rd Floor, unmarked hallway with vinyl's on the wall.  Maybe if you're not a guest of the hotel its more of a secret ;)   Depending on what time you go, the line can be lengthy but it seems to move quickly.  Counter style ordering; very few seats inside, several pies to choose from (either full pie or slice).  Even PBR on draft!  Once you pick your flavor, the slice gets sent back in the oven for a few minutes... comes to you warm, crunchy and just delicious!  Pay the man and then either find a seat inside (unlikely) or take your slice outside into the main hotel area.   Along the back wall you can find hot pepper flakes and Parmesan to top your slice off - yum!

The pizza was thin crunchy crust just how I like it and had good flavor!   I was happy to try this spot, even if it was a late night snack!
Little overpriced for pizza but at least it was good. Nothing extraordinary about it. Just good pizza.

Well, I think I've had a lot of pizza in my life. Something about this place. Reminds me of a 90s arcade pizza joint I used to go to when I was a kid. I think it was called Pizza and Pipes, back in Cali. Shoutout? No? 
I love that you can get pizza by the slice and the location of course is HELLA cool. Crispy and the sauce is perfect. Had several kinds and they were all excellent. Plenty of kinds to choose from. I can't really think why they deserve 5 stars, but something about this place.

This place is located near the Marquee in the Cosmopolitan. Of course we came here at around 2 in the morning after clubbing. To be honest it wasn't the best pizza I've ever had. It was like garlic bread pizza dough which I did not care for. But I guess after a night of drinking and partying and starving this pizza hits the spot. I would not actively seek out this place had I not been drinking and partying and starving.

Best white pizza I have ever had.  

Great crispy crust.  
Delicious cheese.
Sweet roasted garlic.
Rich and Creamy ricotta cheese.  

Don't be afraid to ask for a free refill for your coke before you walk back out into the Vegas heat.

This place has excellent pizza!  I'm not sure how big a secret it is anymore, as the line was fairly long, but it moved fast. I think it's been there long enough that people know about it now. 

There's no signage outside and it's not listed in any directories at the hotel. We asked the manager about it and he told us it started out as a small kitchen just to provide room service, but just before they opened, they decided to open it to walk ins, but made the choice not to advertise or market it. They're doing $5 million\/year now. Pretty good for no marketing..... 

If you stop in, be prepared to take your slices or full pizza to go, as there is very minimal counter space set aside to eat in house. We loved it and I highly suggest stopping!

Pizza is more like 3.5 stars but I'll upgrade it to 4 stars for the "coolness" factor of having absolutely no signage or advertising.  You just gottan know where the place is...through word of mouth or yelp I guess?

The mushroom slice was just okay, although I did enjoy the cheese a lot.  It was the meat combo slice that won me over, however.  What a nice combination of flavors!  I would definitely get this again.

Slices were $4 apiece which is okay I guess but don't you dare order a soda.  It comes in a plastic red cup filled with ice and they charge you $3.25 for it.  No thanks!

The pizza is quite good but the selection is limited. Also, we went at "peak" hour which seems to be as the sun is going down and all the pool people are coming in for a quick bite.  Was it worth the 45 minute wait?  Eh.  I've waited longer for better pizza but it wasn't a waste of time.

I am not sure why I've not been here before, but I feel like stopping on has been long overdue. 

It was easy to find. 3rd floor of Cosmopolitan down the hall next Jaleo. It was a cute little place with a walk up to order slices or whole pizzas to go. There are counters to stand and eat, but no seating. The service was good. They make sure your slice is hot when you get it.

Slices are around $6 each depending on toppings. They are pretty big slices, too. The crust nice and chewy. I personally like greasy pizza, so I liked this. Good flavor.

My only complaint was the lack of seating. There was 3 arcade\/pinball machines taking up valuable eating real estate.

Great place for late night pizza.  Its pretty easy to find, just look for a small hallway with a bunch of pictures on the side walls.  If you can't find that, just go to the 2nd floor and if you hear a bunch of loud, drunk kids, or see long lines, you've found the spot.  

You could buy pizza by the slice, or buy a whole pizza.  Whole pies will take around 15 to 20 mins while slices take a few mins as sometimes they warm em for you.  They have cheese, pepperoni, and a garlic white cheese which was my favorite.  Price wise, for the strip you can't go wrong as everything is so expensive on the strip.  Taste wise, its thin sliced and was above average to me.  I'm sure there are better pizza options, but for its location and price its pretty darn good.  

There's no seats in the actual shop, but plenty of seating outside.  If your looking for a late night snack, definitely check this place out.

No signs to point you in the right direction so had to whip out the YELP app to get guidance.  3rd floor, down the hallway lined with records to the left of China Poblano.  Even at a random off hour of 4pm the wait was about 15 minutes and if you wanted a whole pizza we heard others in line get quoted 2 hours since you can phone head.  We went with  the only two options available, a bell pepper, pepperoni, onion, and 2 slices of mushroom.  The experience is what prevented me from giving this 4 stars but the pizza itself was definitely some of the best i have had. This is the Cosmopolitan after all; aka loud, full of drunk party-goers at all hours, and obnoxious groups still sporting their wristbands from the night before as if they just turned 21.  I felt bad for the workers but they gave back as much as they took.  You can tell they are used to the element that finds its way to Secret Pizza.  We saw people trying to hustle the workers by walking away without paying, people whining that they could not get what they wanted, and drunk fools in line; 4pm remember!, trying to become best friends with the guys behind the counter as they just rolled their eyes as if used to the nonsense.  I think it is a good thing there is no seating really, just four or 5 bar stools. If you could just get your slice and run out it is great!  We actually took our slices next door to Bellagio to enjoy.  Again the pizza is great, i guess if i was in college again i might have brushed off the hordes of drunken twenty-somethings.

OMG this place is amazing! I got a slice of "white" pizza which is basically a bunch of different cheeses... I'll definitely be be back for more! The restaurant is located down a hallway across the escalators on the third floor of the Cosmo in between Blue Ribbon and Jaleo (=

+ secret spot and has never been too crowded when I've been there
+ excellent New York pizza
+ affordable slices with free refills on pop
+ open all night
+ located up two escalators and next to a sushi restaurant and across from some pool tables
+ As far as decor, everyday is 1987

Standing in line I selfishly ordered the white pizza because there was one big slice paired with one little slice. I held my breath and the guy pulled *wait for it* the big AND little slice!! Scoreboard!!

The pizza is actually pretty good, in spite of all the hype. Nice crunchy crust and decent toppings. It tasted even better getting a twofer.

Not even a pizza person but they serve up some good pie! It's about $6 per slice (super big slice), which is still pretty pricey, but it's worth it. Highly recommend the white pie, which is very cheesy and garlicky. It can be crowded depending on the hour\/ date you go, but it's well worth it.

BEST PIZZA EVER!!!! 

Have to give props to the secret pizza parlor at the Cosmopolitan. Their white pizza is amazing, especially with a few pepperoncinis or basil. Everytime I go to Vegas I have to stop there. I hope they never go big and lose the charm!
AMAZING! Had a slice of pepperoni sausage and their veggie. Must try if you're visiting.

If I could only rate this place off the chart. BEST PIZZA on the strip!!!!! It's super fast paced so don't expect to sit. If your that kind of snob then don't bother reviewing. It's all about the pizza at this place. The pizza has this little crunch of perfection when you first bite it and it's orgasmic! It's so delicious!! I can't talk about it enough. I love coming here so, I never pass an opportunity to bring my out of town friends here... wish their was a local discount lol

New York style pizza! This is everything you could want in a pizza - the perfect dough, grease that drips down your arm, and big, foldable slices. 

What I loved most was that staple flavors, like pepperoni, cheese or veggie, were just what you'd expect but SO flavorful! 

The white pizza was amazing. No sauce - mozzarella dotted with heaps of herbed ricotta, slathered with a buttery garlic sauce. 

The sausage with onion and green peppers was perfect too. Spicy, thinly-sliced Italian sausage made for some perfect bites. 

Love this place. Highly recommended for any time of the day!

So, finding this place is really a fun adventure in itself.  I sort of like the mysterious theme, and the long walk down a record-cover filled hallway with the lingering smell of fresh pepperoni and mozzarella cheese wafting the whole way.

When you do finally find it, you might notice that the prices are a little absurd for a slice of pizza.  And toppings make it even more.  If you're with a group, and none of you are particularly addicted to meat or veggies, I'd suggest just getting a full cheese pie.  Your wallet will thank you.

Apart from the high prices, the pizza itself is really something special.  I'm originally from the Philadelphia area where, next to cheese steaks and soft pretzels, it's the pizza that we pride ourselves on.  Even in Los Angeles where I live now, I have yet to find a truly comparable pizza place.  But Secret Pizza absolutely delivers on that expectation.  Maybe that's the secret afterall.  In any case, totally worth the price of the pie.  The individual slices are a little small, so I can't say with confidence that if you bought by-the-slice, you'd be satisfied.  But it's definitely a tasty, east-coast-style pizza.

My only other reservation is in regards to the seating area.  There isn't a lot of it.  And if you're not staying in the Cosmo and planning to take the pizza to your room or something, you might be hard-pressed to find a place to rest your bum.

Finding a delicious regular slice has been very difficult for me now that I'm living on the West Coast, I'm an NY kind of girl! 

I recently was in Vegas for the Watch The Throne concert and met up with some friends during my trip. Late one night my friend took me Secret Pizza. I would have never known there was a pizzeria at the Cosmopolitan since there was no sign except a long line! I was a bit nervous waiting in such a long line for a slice I wasn't sure was going to meet my expectations of what pizza should taste like yet to my surprise the regular slice was to die for! The best NY style pizza on the west coast, LOL. The crust was thin and crisp, the sauce was savory sweet and the mozzarella was good quality. I was especially welcomed by the shaker seasonings offered i.e. salt, garlic, dried basil and oregano they had placed on the counter which is typical at a pizzeria in NYC. Lastly, the true test of a NY style pizza is the ability to fold the crust and take a delightful bite!

Amazing pizza!!! One of the best things I've ever eaten in Las Vegas. It's pizza, basic pizza, nothing crazy or insanely complicated like so many "fancy" Vegas meals can be but it's so delicious! It's perfect for a quick lunch or maybe a bite to eat after a night out.

Good pizza place in the cosmopolitan. Yes the pizza is very good, and you can eat it in a nice area, ( take your slice and walk down hall to the right)but it is 6.00 a slice pizza and similar but not as good as a New Jersey or Philly slice.  If you haven't had east coast pizza you will probably love this pizza.   Employees were pleasant enough, water is 4.00 (really?) . It's
Convenient, food is good , and if you don't want to have an expensive dinner it's a good option.

A must go to, when in Las Vegas. The pizza is always phenomenal! Don't let the long line deter from the deliciousness awaiting. Located in the Cosmopolitan hotel, I tell all my friends about this place.

Enjoyed the time walking around trying to find this place and seeing a lot of what the cosmopolitan has to offer. The line was very long but it wasn't too long before we got to the counter. Had the mushroom pizza which was good and meat lovers pizza that was good but the crust was a little too burnt to completely enjoy. We will be going back and hopefully round 2 will be even better

hm Yum. It really is kind of a secret, hard to find if you don't know where it is already. If you follow that hallway inside, you can get a slice or wait forever for a whole pizza. The only pizza that's worth it to me is their special white cheese pizza, mozzarella, ricotta cheese, and garlic. YUM. Awesome for a little bite but you  might need to buy 2 slices ($10 at least)

Excellent pizza.  A little pricey, but then so is Vegas.  It is by far some of the best pizza that I have had on the west coast.  Absolutely a must on the strip, and they are open super late.  Finding the place is part of the fun, but it's really not hard to find as plenty of people have blogged about the place, and you can find them on FB.  
Tip:  Get a slice of pizza and ask for water, and save $4.

Taste: 4
Creativity\/Authenticity: 3.5
Atmosphere: 3.5
Service: 4
Bang for your buck: 3

Ahh secret pizza i remember when i first stumbled into this gem drunk roaming cosmo wondering where everyone was getting this pizza. So after many failed attempts and countless run in's with people asking where i can get a hold of this pizza i found it down a long narrow hall way. Now if you have ever been to NYC this is as close as your gonna get to NYC pizza at least in Las Vegas, simple; thin crust and very flavorful! Atmosphere is normally drunk ass people wondering around outside the 3rd floor of the cosmo; this place is hidden in the back down a long narrow hallway by all the high end restaurants very hard to find unless you ask someone and even than it took me awhile. Service is fairly quick get in, get your pizza and get out but when its the end of the night 4-5am its packed so be warned !! Overall if your on the strip craving pizza late night snack this is the place to go if you can find it haha and well it reminds me of NY

Cannot wait to get back here!!! Love the slices and the college hangout vibe. It's laid back and casual and very very delicious. They get the crust and tomato sauce right, and that's 99% of a good pizza for me. They also use high quality toppings, but I'm very content with a slice of cheese or pepperoni. They made me and all those I was traveling with very happy!!

After a long night out, we made our way to Secret Pizza, and stood in the atrociously long line (my feet were killing me, so everything was painful that night). 

I only had a few bites of a slice -- while my one friend raved about it, my other friend said it's nothing compared to NY pizza at Joe's.

Not sure I understand the hype...

Literally, THE best pizza I have ever had in my entire life! When's used to live in Las Vegas- I worked at Marquee day club. I would try and come here after every shift (pizza is not the food to eat to be in bikini shape btw)
Sometimes there is a very long wait, and most of the time I would skip my way to the front of the line- and upset everyone. 
Every single pizza here is amazing. My favorite is the white pizza- but can never go wrong with a classic cheese or pepperoni. This is the must eat at place while in Vegas... If you can find it

Secret? No
Pizza? Aw hell yeah!

The pizza is bomb, the cheese pulls for days and the crust is perfectly cripsity crunchity! A must for every Vegas trip whether it be an afternoon snack or late night munchie!

The only sad part of this pizza place was that I was so close to it so many times and never went until the other night! If only I knew how empty my life was without it. 

Foldable, glorious, NY style pizza. If you handed me a slice on the street I would think it was straight from the big apple. Disclaimer: I'm from NY. The offerings are straightforward; pizza with assorted run of the mill toppings, soda, beer. The beer is even served in red plastic cups, which is awesome when you're nearby but might garner some dirty looks when you're walking around the ground floor. 

TV's are around if you can take your eyeballs off of your slice. I couldn't. There's also some pool tables and couches just outside their door which is convenient if your hooves are hurting. 

I thought about this pizza 2 days straight after eating it. Definitely swing through for a before or after drinking delight!
Fresh toppings and decent pizza dough.  Perfect when most other places are closed.  Beer is served too.

this place is cool because lore has you believe it's a hidden, magical pizza spot, for those in the know. Truthfully it's your average pizza stand. There are a few booths to sit at and some pinball games that were not working during our visit. 

I had a slice with peppers, pepperoni,red and green peppers and onions. It was good enough, but nothing to base your trip around. The bottom is crispy but it's not something you cannot find at a plethora of pizza places. That being said, I'll have to update this review should I ever eat her drunken late night. 

I liked my pizza more than my husband, who said it was "blah". I think the gimmick of the whole thing is the location - not that the pizza was too horrible, just not what it's built up to be.

In absolute love with this place. So, hauled ass from LA to Vegas for a trip with some friends, and my friend that lives in Vegas told me about this place once upon a time. This time, I'm eating here, damn it! I've heard so much about you, I'm coming in for some grub! =]

Literally, located in a hole in the middle of nowhere (well, next to the pool tables in the Cosmo), there is no sign, no nothing, but a long long hallway that seems to be perhaps a janitor closet or something. Walk in, it's officially a hidden pizza shoppe, like BAM!!!!!!! Simple, straight forward, and loaded with oils\/fats. This is definitely THEE perfect place to go to after drinking and partying your ass off at a club to sober up.

However, for my friends and I, this place was a tad too greasy (sorry, had to minus a star for that! XP) for our sober middle of the day breakfast\/lunch\/brunch. Yet I can see the appeal of such greasy goodness in the middle of the night, when you stumble drunk like no other out a club, and crave some hot, fresh out the oven pizza.

In essence, a good pit stop to try out for sure, better when you're drunk, but if you're sober, bring plenty of napkins to sop up the grease! =]

I have to say this is some of the best pizza I have ever had and the best I ever had in Vegas. make sure you try the white pizza with ricotta and meatball yummy, it is one of the affordable restaurants at the Cosmopolitan

The first rule of Secret Pizza is: YOU DO NOT TALK ABOUT SECRET PIZZA.

Seriously, guys, the wait is getting ridiculous.

Tips:
- For full pies, call in your order for pick up in 30 mins.
- It may smell irresistible, but do fight the urge to eat immediately. Otherwise, suffer from pizza palate.
- Best spot for drunk people watching.
Best pizza, i've ever had!!  We waited in line for almost an hour and it was well worth it!!  I will DEF be coming back!!!  I had white pizza and a slice of pep, both were delish!

I don't think this place is anything special. It's nice if you're looking for a quick slice of pizza late-night and you're in the vicinity of the Cosmopolitan hotel. It's a very small, secret area with two bars with stools to eat at after you order and a few arcade machines that take coins. That's pretty cool. However, it's not at the top of my list full of food options. The service is good but the pizza itself is only alright. It's really greasy and just not my thing. I didn't even finish my pizza but I tipped a few dollars because the cashier was really friendly.

With a four-and-a-half star rating, I was excited to try this place out.

Man, I wish I had saved my $25. 

The guy behind the counter prepping the pizzas was nice enough - explained how things worked without a condescending tone.  The girl helping out new to the operation, so there was a bit of a learning curve on keeping things going.  No problem; I've been in the same situation.    However, once the pizza went into the oven for re-heating and the money was in the register, that about ended an otherwise okay experience.

I swear it took like 20 minutes to get our 3 slices.  3 SLICES.  Another guy took over the pizza-making duties and made it his priority to only check up on the full pizza orders.  So when our slices finally came out, they were burnt at the crusts and essentially crackers at the base.  I told my fiance that I was not eating my ONE slice, he had to bring it back and ask for another slice (I told him to take his back too, but he was too nice to do so).  Another slice of margherita pizza that had been sitting there for quite some time that they could just throw into the oven for reheating.  I was really disappointed that they even gave us the pizza burnt - who serves burned pizza?!  That's already been cooked once?

We should've just gone down to Fashion Show Mall and had a few slices at Sbarro for a fraction of the price.  I guess if you want average pizza in a pretentious setting masquerading as hole-in-the-wall (literally) joint, this could be heaven.

Next time I'll check out their burger joint or that Chinese\/Mexican food fusion place down the way.

Cute spot located in the same area as all of the other restaurants in the Cosmo, but hidden...Ok, not really that hidden: it's just down the hallway. If you don't know what to look for, you won't know that it's there, but if you know to look for the pictures on the wall, it's straight down that hallway. 
We came in during the early evening for a quick snack. They actually had a decent selection of pizza slices and their vegetarian slice had a nice variety and amount of veggies. While it didn't blow me away, it's good for what it is: a good slice of no-fills pizza. It's one of the more affordable options in Vegas and good to grab a slice on the go (or after drinking, I'd imagine this is pretty clutch). No where really to eat it -- just standing room counters and a few bar stools.

A little difficult to find, but everyone seems to know it exists.  Inside the Cosmopolitan is this tiny pizza place with fantastic pizza.  They have a good variety of kinds.  They're constantly just baking them so if you're buying by the slice, your options will be whatever they have.  The toppings here are of a good quality so despite the Las Vegas prices, it's still not bad of a deal.  Perfect food for after partying (just hope you can find it if you're tipsy).

They really need to put a sign up, because this place is darn near impossible to find without asking someone.  Maybe it's their secret way of keeping the place hidden and away from all the tourists.   Just find the public billiard table in the open floor, and then look for a long dark hallway which seems like it's a private entrance for staff.  Once you walk the long dark hallway, you will walk into a small pizza shop, and the smell of fresh pizza will immediately engulf you!

My friends split a cheese pizza, white pizza, and a pepperoni, olive, and mushroom pizza.  The line can get long, so be prepared to wait!  Once you order, the server will take your slice of pizza and bake it in the oven for a few minutes to get it nice and melty.  I believe a pizza slice comes out to be around $4 per slice.  I thought the price was slightly high since it was a super thin crust, and the slices didn't seem all that big.   The pizza was pretty good, but definitely not as good as the stuff served in NY.  I did not care for the white pizza, but the cheese and pepperoni pizza was pretty good.   Also, the crust was slightly chewy, which I did not like, but I really liked the cheese and spices they topped on the pizza.  One slice of pizza is like an appetizer, so I would suggest you order 2-3 slices a person, if you want to actually get filled up or eat it as a dinner.    I'd come back for a late night snack or an afternoon appetizer if I'm in the area, but it's not something I would walk from Wynn to Cosmo to eat.  Pretty good pizza, but not good enough to crave, especially with all the other eats in Vegas.

For you in the know it's actually Nico's pizzeria.

This may be the best pizza I have ever head.  Yes it's oxygen filled Vega$, yes I just came from a dance floor table at the Marquee, yes it's 4, no 5, no something a.m. 

Regardless, I'm an eastcoaster from Scranton, PA and we have a small Italian town called Old Forge where New Yorkers flock to actually eat real, authentic Italian pizza, trust me it gets no better, AND THEN Nico's.

The Sunrise pizza great - even better- I asked them to put tomatoes on it- yum- both nights in Vega$ ended up here- not at some crappy craps table or seedy strip club.

Thanks Nico!

You guys Rock!

After a long night flight from the East Coast I was ready for a quick bit before bed. We decided to give this place a try, i have to say I almost walked out because of the long line and no where to sit... but the hunger overcame me!!  So the line went by quick, the pizza slices are made to order!! Finally I don't have to share with my husband, we both get what we want!!  Thank goodness I didn't walk out, this was delish!!
Hope to stay at City Center again, so I can have some yummy pizza

The secret is out, it (sadly) seems as if everyone knows about "Secret Pizza" and the proof is in the line. It took two tries during my last visit to Vegas to get my favorite slice because both times the line was all the way down the hall. That being said, it was totally worth the wait! If you are looking for delicious, New York style pizza this is the spot. The white pizza is absolutely outstanding but I'm also a fan of the traditional cheese pizza. There aren't tables here, so be prepared to eat standing at the little bar area or take your order with you. It's great for a "quick" (depending on the line situation) lunch or late night bite!

The SECRET is out.

Well, at least I'm not kept in the dark about the secret anymore.  Thanks to fellow yelper, Rod U, I was finally became aware of the secret location of this pizza mecca that everyone seemed to know of except me (at least until recently).

I think the "secret" is more the location versus the actual pizza itself.  You'll find this small pizza parlor\/station at the end of a very nondescript hallway in the Cosmopolitan Hotel.  After walking past pictures and portraits of various people, you will soon reach the secret pizza.

Order by the slice or the whole pizza.  Go big or go small, it's your choice.  For me personally, I chose a slice of pepperoni and that was it.  Was it the best pizza I've had?  Was it worth the all the wait to finally eat this slice of pizza from the mysterious and difficult-to-find pizza palor?  Well, let's just say when you're hungry any slice of pizza will satisfy your appetite.  

NOTE:  Slice of pepperoni was $5.25.  Absence of seating.  Stand and eat at the available counter space or go find some tables and eclectic chairs within the Cosmo.

SERVICE:  Quick, courteous, and efficient.

BOTTOM LINE:  Secret no more!  I'll be back!

Secret pizza. A secret no more?  The guy said the Food Network had just left shooting a segment the day we got there. I'm pretty sure in the near future, this amazing little place will be a packed house 24\/7. 

Secret pizza located in the Cosmopolitan hotel in vegas is truly one of those awesome places you wish existed everywhere else in the world. Simple and good food, quick, friendly service, and open from 10am - 5am (for those midnight pizza cravings!). The pizzas are hot and cheesy and crispy! Pretty much exactly how I like them. 

Prices are reasonable, about $5 or so a slice. You walk up and see what they have to offer, choose your slices, and they pop it in the oven to heat it and crisp it up for you. The meatball ricotta pizza they had was ridiculously yummy - dollops of ricotta mixture, yummy meatball. Mmm. It's a thin NY style pizza I'd say, but they sometimes also have these fluffy deep dish offerings that pretty much taste like huge crispy cheesy garlic breads. Very yummy! 

They also make a pretty mean cannoli and the guys there are super welcoming and friendly. Ooh, and free filtered water!! Gotta love that. Love it here! It's a must eat in vegas for sure :)
Best pizza in Vegas. Comparable to Bleecker Pizza in NYC.

After a night full of drinking and gambling in Sin City, where do you go to get some delicious food after midnight?  SECRET PIZZA.  Located in the Cosmopolitan, finding the little pizza parlor is an adventure in itself.  Secret Pizza is located at the end of the corridor by the pool tables.  There are no signs for the entrance which makes it a bit difficult to find.  I would definitely recommend the white slice, then adding a meat such as pepperoni.  They do offer pies as a whole for sale as well.  One big advice: avoid going to Secret Pizza around 3AM on a Friday or Saturday night.... All the club crawlers from Marquee want pizza too and there will be a long line.

I love pizza, and I effing love Secret Pizza. I got the white pizza. A thin, crispy crust was topped with mozzarella, Parmesan, dollops of ricotta, & an herb-garlic spread. I can't even describe how good it was. It's a bit on the pricey side, but well worth it. My slice was $5.

OH MY FREAKING GOODNESS... Did I say goodness....This little hidden jewel is located in the Cosmopolitan Hotel on the 3rd floor just off the elevator to the left and a quick right down what looks like a hall filled with records..... THE PIZZA....... expensive but damn good... best I've ever had!!!! I had the deep dish pepperoni & sausage...... my mouth was watering for more... only downfall theres only 3 seats.... so you have to stand or take your pizza out into the hotel lounging area right outside of there..... again did I say the pizza is BOMB..... YEP... GET SOME... ( a whole pizza is $28, good for maybe 4 ppl)

Stopped by for lunah and had a sausage and peppers pizza while my wife had the pepperoni. It was cheap, tasty, and quic which is exactly what we needed. The water machine was broken which was inconvenient but not a deal breaker. Staff was friendly and welcoming.

The only thing that would really make this place better is if I didn't have to go to the Strip for it. That said, sometimes I will because the pizza makes it worth it. White and meatball are my favorite picks here, but everything they have is delicious. The price is a steal considering the location. So if you're on the Strip and want something that's not going to bankrupt you and still leave you hungry, this is the place to go.

If I came here 8 months ago when this place really was a secret and all the Hipsters were rocking the joint, I would've given it 5 stars for every possible reason without trying a slice of pizza.

But since it's not 8 months ago, I happen to find myself craving pizza while on the Strip, so I figured this would be a perfect time to get me some not so secret pizza.

So my buddy and I go to Secret Pizza and there is no line, maybe 2 people in there.  So i guess all the hype for the place died.  Then I saw the prices, $5 for a fucking pepperoni slice?  If that slice of pepperoni pizza could actually fuck, then I'd pay $5 for it.  Not even all the concessions stands at carnivals would charge that much for a slice of pizza, and even then those slices were very good and worth it.

My buddy told me he paid around $3 or less for his slices when he went there, and I was sure that was the price 8 months ago.  Either way I asked for a pepperoni slice and the server looked pretty out of it\/didn't give a shit.  I know they just give you a slice and there isn't much customer service involved, but throw a fricken smile and be glad that i am paying you 10X the amount of what that pizza slice cost.  I'd be jumping for joy if I had that gig.

The pizza itself; Very good.  Digged the crust and the sauce, great texture, no complaints about the quality.  However, it's not $5\/slice good, but very good nonetheless.  But it wasn't very filling either.  

I dunno, I felt like the charm it once had that made me want to try it out for the longest time is gone.  This is not a "little gem", "neat place" or "hidden secret", or not anymore.  It's just "hidden".

#cynical

I haven't had pizza in the longest time ever because my diet's pretty low carb, but in vegas it completely went out the window! Anybody that personally knows me, knows that I'm one indecisive girl when it comes to food cause I wanna eat\/sample everything. We were staying at Aria and they have Five\/50 pizza bar there which I wanted to try, but I also wanted Secret pizza. Luckily, my bf was sweet enough to run to both places to buy slices and bring it back to the room at Aria for us :)

Normally the line is crazy packed out the door, but luckily my bf didn't have to wait long. We ended up getting the white pizza w\/ sausage and mushrooms. I was surprised the pizza was still nice and warm when he got back to the room. I was a bit scared at first because all the reviews kept saying it's super oily, but this definitely was NOT the case for us! Compared to Five\/50 pizza in Aria, Secret Pizza was way better!!

I've had really good pizza in NY and the pizza here was a NY style big slice (big, foldable, and not too much sauce). It held up the toppings and everything nicely. The crust had the perfect crunch and texture. They were also generous w\/ the toppings here especially the sausage. I mean you can see the whole sausage link on my pizza. I really liked the cheese on here too, it didn't have the stinky cheese smell. The roasted garlic spread smothered on the white pizza was sooo robust and good!! The white pizza consisted of various cheeses as well, the ricotta stood out and tasted fresh.

FYI: We came here once after clubbing and got lost trying to find it. No wonder it's called secret pizza lol.

-It's located at the very top floor of cosmo (3rd) where all the fancy restaurants are. Look for a hallway w\/ vinyl CD records and you'll find the hidden gem!
-It's more of a go in & grab a quick slice place, there aren't chairs for you to sit

This place is a true gem hidden on the 3rd floor of Cosmo.  The ridiculously long lines (especially after clubbing hours) are completely worth it. The pizza is so amazingly delicious. I have the dock off one star just because the service here can get very lousy when they get super busy and also, the place is usually filthy.

The wife and I went here for lunch one day. It's tough to find (hence the name), but worth the trip, especially if you're nearby the Cosmopolitan. 
She had the white pizza, and I had the sausage and banana pepper.  We want back for seconds. 

It's a walk-up counter to order, and you can either get the order to go, or they have a few bar-type seats there.  After you order, they warm your slice in the oven for a few minutes, and call you out when it's ready. 

It is affordable, of good quality, with friendly and efficient service.  I will definitely return on my next visit to Sin City.

Let's  be clear on what this is: it's a pizza-by-the-slice place, in a high-end Las Vegas casino.  For anyone coming from New York, the pizza will be no better or worse than your average local, while for anyone coming from anywhere else, it'll be pretty good (not great, but pretty good).  The price will be several times as high either way ($15.25 bought me a cheese slice, a veggie slice, and a diet coke), but again, you're in a high-end Las Vegas casino, and the extra $6-10 seems worth the hassle of not having to leave the strip.  Heck, compared to the $7 cup of Illy coffee and $16 sandwich you can have downstairs, or the $35 you'll spend on on a room service club sandwich (to say nothing of the $100 for mediocre sushi you can pay at Blue Ribbon next door), a satisfying, no-nonsense lunch for $10-$15 is the biggest bargain you're likely to find in CityCenter.

This not-so-secret pizzeria in the Cosmopolitan is pretty delish!

I suppose it was pretty easy to access this spot considering I was pretty sloshed after Marquee. Its on the 3rd floor near Comme Ca in a hallway...filled with people. So, just follow the crowds =)

What I ordered: 

- a slice of the NY style white pie! There were chunks of goat cheese and it tasted as though it was drenched with truffle oil (so yumz)

again, my senses were impaired but the flavors still shined through!

This place was good.  It's impossible to find but just ask somebody in Cosmo and they will direct you.  The price is better if you buy a whole pie.  We took back pieces and ate them later after a few drinks.  Not surprised that it tasted much better that night.  I'm guessing all these 5 stars are coming from ridiculous drunk people that would give taco bell 5 stars.  The guys working were super nice and if ya gotta feed your pizza craving, this place will do it.
I am definitely a fan! This place hits the spot and is there when you need it. Got to love great by the slice (or whole) NY style pizza!

This will always be my pizza place to come too whenever I'm in town. Doesn't compare for me to any other pizza in here. I'll still remember my first time around the time the place first opened up. After a late night of trying to get back to the hotel drunk, we suddenly find this hallway that led us to some place. We couldn't tell what it could be. I see a pinball machine and I immediately run to it with sheer joy. To our surprise we realize it's a pizza place. From there on, we never turned our backs to this fine pizza place. Thank you for existing.

Ok, this is indeed located in a secret place. I came here just when it opened so they didn't have all the options I wanted to try. I had the pepperoni and mushroom slice. If I had to pick, I'll eat the mushroom slice again. They were both good though. I like the crisp and thinness of the dough. It's not the most amazing pizza place that I have tried but it is ok.
